detailedDescription:
EPC band: C

An amazing sized one bedroom flat situated on the ground floor of a beautifully converted building. The property consists of a brilliant sized lounge perfect for entertaining guests, a great sized double bedroom with built in wardrobe space, separate bathroom and a neutrally decorated kitchen with plenty of storage.

This home further benefits from outside communal space which is perfect for the coming summer days and off street parking, with a dedicated parking space attached to the flat.

This flat is located moments away from Forest Hill station with links into London Bridge, Canada Water, Shoreditch, Whitechapel, Highbury & Islington and many other locations.

Other stations surrounding include Honor Oak Park Station and Catford stations that offer links into Waterloo and the city. The high street offers plenty of shops, a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, cafes, some amazing gastro pubs, as well as multiple parks and greenery to explore. This property is a must view, please call to confirm your viewing slot now.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Set on the iconic Shooters Hill Road is this superb two double bed ground floor period conversion with shared garden.

Spread over an impressive 839sqft, this stunning home offers two well sized double bedrooms with a great finish in both with the master bedroom accentuated with feature fireplace. The bright reception room boasts solid wooden flooring and plenty of space for entertaining and dining. The fully fitted kitchen has a stunning modern design and has a breakfast bar area.

The bathroom has a sleek finish with a modern two piece bathroom with separate WC. The property also offers a large storage room which has been used as a home office. There is also a large secure communal cellar ideal for storage.

The property is a share of Freehold with an impressively long lease in excess of 900 years!

With allocated off street parking, the property is perfectly situated equidistant from the ever popular Blackheath village with its mix of independent shops, traditional pubs and restaurants and Blackheath Royal Standard with its local shops, cafes and patisseries.

The property is within easy reach of 2 mainline stations with links to the City and Docklands (via the DLR at Greenwich), as well as bus services providing a regular connection to North Greenwich and the Jubilee line.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
Requiring internal updating, this spacious, 3 double bedroom period house offers ample living space and an opportunity to transform a property into the house of your dreams. No chain.
Ideally placed for Honor Oak Park station, the house boasts well-proportioned rooms and high ceilings. It comprises 3 reception rooms, a kitchen at the back, 3 double bedrooms upstairs along with a family bathroom and separate WC. The property has sash windows and central heating.
The neighbourhood is a vibrant and cosmopolitan one, popular among families and young professionals. It offers some great places to eat and socialise such as an award-winning Indian restaurant (Babur), a much-loved Italian (Le Querce), a hip pizzeria (Mama Dough), and a traditional Turkish (Hattush). For a post work drink, pop into The Chandos or the Brockley Jack. During the day you can grab a coffee and a bite to eat in Honor Oak Provender deli or Two Spoons coffee shop. For groceries, there's a Sainsbury's Local on the high street along with a number of other convenience stores. Transport links into central London could hardly be better.
Honor oak Park station provides fast and frequent services to London Bridge (in around 11mins) as well as London Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington. You can change at Canada Water for easy access to Canary Wharf.
If you're looking for outdoor activities, there are free tennis courts nearby as well as the open spaces of Peckham Rye Park and Blythe Hill Fields. There are a number of good schools in the area the nearest being Stillness primary school rated as 'Outstanding'

Chain free, double fronted, two double bedroom house with two reception rooms, kitchen / breakfast room and 51ft rear garden.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £400,000 to £450,000.

Please see our full HD video walk through and 360 degree interactive virtual tour – like and subscribe to our youtube channel for property updates

Positioned in a striking period building with its own access door on the ground floor.

The property offers almost 700 sq ft of space and a cellar. There is direct access to a private south east facing garden.

The garden is accessed via a door from the kitchen and is a blank canvass for buyers to personalise their space. Being South East facing the garden is a suntrap.

We consider all the rooms to be very generous in size particularly as the lounge spans almost 16ft.

The lounge is have a lovely bay which look on the front garden as well as the feature fireplace which is striking.

The property is also offered with the added benefit of a share of the freehold which is substantially more attractive than most flats which offer the leasehold only.

Some additional features not visible in the images but that buyers would consider beneficial include:

• The owners advise they have installed sound proofing in the ceilings between the ground and first floor flats – this is a substantial benefit to the new owner as older buildings can often lack sound insulation.

• The property had just undergone some refurbishment to include new floors, walls and paint work in most rooms.

• The bathroom has under floor heating – very comforting on colder days.

• The garden was previously decked and could have the same again or a mix of decking and lawn as preferred by the new owner.

Located on the Honor Oak side of Devonshire Road this property is located approximately 0.25 miles to the station.

Travels times from Honor Oak include:

London Bridge in approximately 15 minutes

London Victoria in approximately 35 minutes

And Canary Wharf in approximately 24 minutes

Honor Oak is known well locally for its boutique restaurants and shops.

Some of our favourites include Mama Dough (a sour dough pizza restaurant) and the award winning Babur Indian restaurant.

There's also the popular Le Querce which is run by a Sardinian family serving traditional dishes.

Alongside this you'll find a selection of cafés and a handful of popular local well regarded pubs.

Attractions include Blythe Hill Fields which is approximately 0.8 miles away and is known by the locals for its recreational facilities. One such facility is the Trim trail which is an exercise trail.

You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:



The Horniman gardens and museum is another well-known local point of interest also found approximately 0.8 miles away. With regular events such as a farmers market and live music, we believe this will be of interest to many buyers.

You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens via the below link:



Surrounding the property there are some well renowned local schools which include:

Fairlawn Primary school rated Outstanding by Ofsted and in the top 10% of Ofsted rated schools

Stillness Infant school also rated Outstanding by Ofsted

Horniman Primary school rated Good by Ofsted and also in the top 10% of Ofsted rated schools

Dalmain Primary school rated Good by Ofsted and also in the top 10% of Ofsted rated schools

Location

Nunhead sits next to hip Peckham and pretty East Dulwich. With a small high street and big historic cemetery, the area is unique among London neighborhoods.
Young families are drawn to Nunhead by the good schools and the village-style atmosphere, along with the green spaces of nearby Peckham Rye and the local nature reserve that is Nunhead Cemetery.
The neighborhood has its own eponymous train station conveniently located near the high street (with a great garden shop across from it). There are direct rail services from Victoria station to Nunhead.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £1,000,000 - £1,100,000**

An exceptional 1920's End of Terrace with garage conversion, outstanding rear garden with secluded home office/studio and 5 bedrooms. This much loved family home of over 20 years is decorated in a welcoming and contemporary style and boasts period features and modern fittings throughout.

The spacious and well-designed accommodation comprises an attractive open plan kitchen diner with fully fitted kitchen, ceramic tiled floor and French windows. The kitchen includes a Rangemaster cooker, integrated, fridge, dishwasher, freezer and microwave.
There is a good size lounge with gas coal fire, set in a tiled period fireplace, perfect for cosy family evenings.

Upstairs, the traditional layout applies; with two double bedrooms one single and family bathroom.
The top floor features a conversion created to accommodate a master bedroom with en suite and Juliette balcony, complete with stunning views.

Another jewel in the crown of this property is the fourth bedroom; a well-planned garage conversion. This room has a mezzanine bed platform with living space below. This easily accommodates a sofa and a desk; a perfect pad for a growing teenager or weekend guests. It also benefits from its own private access.

Outside, the front garden has been landscaped with parking for 2-3 cars.

To the rear, is a large, secluded, mature garden with lawn, large decked area and an ornamental pond. There's also a purpose built utility unit with plumbing for washing machine and dryer, a summerhouse and a storage shed. Another outstanding feature in the rear garden, is a very large, triple insulated home office/studio, which easily accommodates up to four desks.
Other features include stripped wood flooring throughout, a stunning, stained glass entrance door and handy side access. There is also an integrated electric car charging point on front of house.

Location

Located approx. 8 Minutes walk to Forest Hill or Honor Oak stations; Overground to London Bridge 12 mins – East London 20 minutes and just a 3 minute walk to main bus routes into Central London or to Catford/Catford Bridge Stations.

Forest Hill's vibrant local community has lots to offer, with shops, restaurants, cafes and bars in abundance. There is the Forest Hill Gym and Leisure Centre and the famous Horniman museum within easy walking distance.

This home really is a perfect option for an established or growing family, with the outstanding Kilmorie primary school nearby, as well as St Dunstans College, Alleyns and Dulwich College being within easy reach.

Parks and green spaces are in abundance within around a 15 minute walk including Horniman Gardens, Blythe Hill Fields, Mayow Park and One Tree Hill.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

Share of freehold and a long lease of 1000 years from 17th April 1975.

detailedDescription:
Propertyworld is delighted to present this stunning, two double bedroom, ground floor conversion with a share of a beautiful rear garden. Set within a handsome detached villa, the property has an exquisite blend of original period features and contemporary modern touches. High ceiling and large windows ensure the property has a bright, spacious and airy feel and it is blessed with an abundance of natural light. The accommodation is neutrally decorated to enhance the many period features in several rooms including original fireplaces, decorative cornicing and picture rails. The kitchen and bathroom were newly installed in the last few years and features a range of shaker style units and solid wooden worktops. The bathroom is equally impressive. A huge space with underfloor heating, tiled floor and walls plus modern bath and rainfall shower. It certainly has the wow factor and is a private oasis you will simply love! Both bedrooms are generous doubles and there is plenty of storage. To the rear is a beautiful manicured garden that is wonderful haven to relax and unwind. The property also benefits from a long lease and a smart thermostat with Hive active heating.

Location wise it is hard to beat. Lawrie Park Gardens is one of Sydenham's most sought after roads; nestled within the ever popular Lawrie Park Triangle, quiet and leafy and yet within easy walking distance of all local attractions. Crystal Palace Park (together with several other pretty green spaces) is easily walkable as is the centre of both Sydenham, Penge and Crystal Palace. You have an array of high quality restaurants, gastropubs, cafes and independent shops at your disposal.

We anticipate significant demand for this gem so please contact Propertyworld asap to register your interest.

Our vendor loves...
"As soon as we saw this flat over 6 years ago, we fell in love with its charm and history. Each room fills with natural light throughout different parts of the day - thanks to the enormous original windows- and with the high ceilings, you feel a real sense of space. We loved it as it felt unique and this is something we really tried to maintain as we renovated throughout. It was important for us to balance modern whilst still retaining the charm of the past in each room.
A ground floor at the front, but raised at the rear so there's privacy whilst still having nice views of the garden from the master bedroom, kitchen and bathroom.
We didn't know much about the area, but over time it's become the perfect location for us to enjoy the balance of city & suburban life with Sydenham station offering fantastic links to central London in under 20 minutes. With Crystal Palace park a short 5 minute walk away, and both Sydenham and Forest Hill high streets offering an abundance of restaurants (Mamma Dough, The Greyhound & Trattoria Raafaele) and the relaxed cafe culture we love, it will be hard to say goodbye to this thriving area."

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Propertyworld is delighted to present this stunning, two double bedroom, two bathroom period conversion flat with a share of a gorgeous rear garden and off-street parking. Having been completely renovated approximately 5 years ago, the specification is of an exacting standard, with high quality finishes throughout. The accommodation is almost 750 square feet, bright and airy with an abundance of natural light. The flat itself is located on the first floor of a handsome detached Victorian villa, nestled between Sydenham and Penge East. The reception room and kitchen are open plan, and at over 22 ft length, has ample space for a designated dining area as well as a generous living area. A large East facing window ensures the room receives a huge amount of natural light. The oak flooring runs throughout this room and extends through the hallway giving the property a stylish modern feel. The kitchen, naturally, is packed with all the integrated appliances you would expect including dishwasher, fridge freezer, oven, hob, extractor and even wine cooler. The design incorporates a useful breakfast bar for casual dining or home work space although the current owners also enjoy the use of a large dining table for more formal affairs. The main bedroom to the rear of the property has views over the extensive West facing garden that is shared with just a couple of flats and rarely used. As you would expect, it boasts an ensuite bathroom with a huge double width walk in shower with an integrated rainfall shower system. The second bedroom is also a generous double. Finally, the main bathroom, a stunning space with striking, designer floor tiles, separate walk in shower and bath. The property comes with share of freehold and a 990 plus lease, and off-street parking to the front. The rear garden is West facing, receiving direct sun throughout the day, with a manicured lawn, mature trees and shrubs and raised beds. Whilst shared with a couple of other flats, it is rarely used, and is most definitely a space you will feel at home in to entertain friends or simply relax.

The location is another huge plus. A stone throw from Penge East train station (fast, direct services to Victoria) and a short walk to Sydenham train (18 minutes to London Bridge and access via the Overgound line to all of London). The centres of both Sydenham and Penge and all easily walkable providing a huge array of restaurants, destination gastropubs, cafes and independent shops.

This gem certainly has the wow factor and we anticipate huge demand. Register your interest today!

Our vendor loves...

detailedDescription:
Propertyworld is delighted to present this pretty two double bedroom, two reception, mid terrace Victorian house in Champion Crescent. Sydenham which benefits from both a front and rear garden. On the ground floor you will find two reception rooms that have been opened up to create an open, free flowing space. The main reception to the front has two large double-glazed windows that provide lots of natural light. There are plenty of original features including a stunning fireplace, and cornicing, together with a sold wooden flooring. The second reception room has a tiled floor which extends onto the open kitchen. This is currently used as a spacious dining area though could easily be used as simply a second reception or as a large home working studio. The kitchen features a range of fitted wooden shaker style wall and base units, standalone oven and space for a washing machine. Access to the attractive rear garden is through a double-glazed patio off the second reception. The garden, is low maintenance, mainly paved with a curved border of plants and shrubs. Upstairs you will find two generous double bedrooms and a modern bathroom with a three-piece white bathroom suite, over bath shower and brick style blue contrasting wall tiles. There is also a large loft which can easily be converted to create a large third bedroom with ensuite. The garden to the front is a packed with mature plants and shrubs which provide a gorgeous green outlook from the front reception.

Champion Crescent is a quiet residential location within short walking distance of Sydenham Road and Sydenham train and Underground station. There is a range of restaurants, gastropubs, independent cafés and shops close by, as well as the award winning Mayow Park and a number of highly rated Primary schools.

Our vendor Loves...
"Our home and the local area has been the perfect sanctuary for us over the past year. The bright, airy rooms have provided us the space we both need to live and work from home and the gardens in particular have proven to be a godsend. The location has been perfect as well allowing us to enjoy the incredible local parks, cafés and pubs, easily commute into town or just as easily escape into the surrounding countryside. We couldn't have asked for more from a house and although we're tremendously sad to be leaving we do so with the fondest of memories for our perfect first home. Lucy & Chris."

The property comes with off street parking and use of a pretty communal garden to the rear of the building. It comes with a reasonable service charge. Location wise its spot on, literally opposite the park and a short walk into Sydenham mainline and overground station. The High Street is also close by with its array of independent shops, cafes and several cracking pubs including the newly opened Greyhound and The Dolphin. This is an ideal first time buyers flat. title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide price £900-925,000. This fabulous, 4-bedroom, 2-bathroom semi-detached family home with a south-facing garden is located on a much sought-after road moments from Honor Oak Park station.
The house offers light-filled living space and is beautifully finished throughout. It blends period features with all the conveniences of modern-day living. The extended kitchen-diner represent the heart of this home. There are bi-folding doors which lead seamlessly out to the south-facing garden making for a perfect in/out entertaining space. The kitchen itself has a sleek design and boasts integrated appliances, a range cooker and ample storage units. There's a handy utility room and a cloakroom downstairs as well. The front reception room has a feature fireplace, parquet flooring and in-built shelving and cupboards. Up to the first floor, there's a master bedroom (with in-built wardrobes), another double bedroom and a single. The bathroom has a crisp, white finish and comes with a bath and a free-standing shower. The loft has been converted creating a fantastic space with a shower room, a double bedroom, and a small study area. The garden is south-facing, has a lawn framed by mature borders and has the bonus of additional side access. Other points of interest include under floor heating in the kitchen and both bathrooms, the study area in the loft is Cat5e wired for internet connection, and there is BT Infinity "fibre to the home" providing high speed wireless internet coverage throughout the house
The area is much in demand due to its transport links into central and east London as well as the proximity of several good primary schools including Stillness and Beecroft. Honor Oak Park station provides direct mainline services to London Bridge in around 12 minutes. In addition, there are Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury & Islington. You can change at Canada Water for easy access to Canary Wharf. Crofton Park station is also within easy reach for services into Blackfriars and Paddington. For shopping and dining out, the area caters for most needs. There's a Sainsbury's Local and a Budgen's supermarket nearby. Restaurants of note include Mamma Dough (a trendy sough dough pizzeria), Babur (an award-winning Indian) and Hattush (a popular Turkish). For a post work drink, pop along to the Brockley Jack or the Chandos. For Sunday brunch or a coffee and a snack, there are a number of places to choose from including Two Spoons and Arlo and Moe.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Tucked away at the back of a well-maintained, private block within easy reach of either Crofton Park or Honor Oak Park stations, is this quiet 2-bedroom first floor flat with a long lease, allocated off street parking, and a communal garden.

It features a spacious 21', light and airy reception room, with a modern fitted kitchen just off the reception room, a family bathroom and 2 bedrooms, with the main bedroom having built in cupboards. There is further storage in the hallway and the flat also benefits from an allocated parking bay for easy off-street parking.

Getting into central London could hardly be easier. Honor Oak Park provides mainline services into London Bridge as well as Overground services towards Canada Water and Shoreditch; Crofton Park provides services into Blackfriars and St Pancras; Ladywell takes you into Charing Cross.

Honor Oak Park and Brockley boast numerous venues to enjoy an evening. For an evening meal out, pop along to Mama Dough (a hip sourdough pizzeria) or Babur (an award-winning Indian). For a post-work drink, enjoy a glass of wine at Grounds and Grapes (it's open during the day for coffee too), a cocktail at Brickfields or a pint at the Brockley Jack (a great local pub with a small theatre attached to it). And for a big night, the iconic Rivoli Ballroom is just 5 minutes' walk away.

As for groceries, you'll find numerous supermarkets and convenience stores in Honor Oak Park and Crofton Park. A local butcher's, the Proud Sow, is just around the corner.

For a Sunday afternoon stroll, head up the road to Blythe Hill Fields for sweeping views of London's skyline - it also plays host to an annual Summer Festival - or down to Ladywell Fields, where you'll find the River Ravensbourne and the Waterlink Way.

detailedDescription:
Basement Studio Flat, Flat 1,35 St Johns Park, London, SE3 7JW

Overview
Hammer Price Homes are delighted to present for sale by online auction this vacant & chain free lower ground floor studio flat located on the highly sought after St Johns Park.

The property, which has its own entrance, briefly comprises: There is an entrance hallway leading to a well sized living / bedroom, kitchen and bathroom with separate W.C. The gardens are not communal and parking is on street.

The property is in need of some enhancement throughout and would be suited to those looking for a modernisation project.

To view this property please visit the Hammer Price Homes website, register as a buyer and book your place on an open day.

Location

St Johns Park is extremely well located close to a host of local amenities and is within walking distance to the popular Greenwich Park. The property is also well placed for commuters, with access to the A2 closeby and Westcombe Park train station is within walking distance from here.

Other Information
Tenure – Leasehold (989 years remaining) – share of freehold

Ground rent: Peppercorn

Maintenance charges: £30 per month

Please note that the lease and land registry information is available for download from the hammer price homes website, please review the documents prior to bidding.

Boiler – Please be advised that the boiler for this flat is in a small communal store and will need to be moved into the actual by the new buyer post completion. Photo of the boiler is on the listing.

Auction Details
** Open to mortgage buyers also. 90 days to complete, no deposit payable**

Please note that there is a Reservation fee (2.4% Inc. VAT subject to a minimum of £3,000 Inc. VAT) payable by the buyer on winning the auction. The reservation fee does not constitute part of the sale price, this is the auctioneer's fee and is to be paid over & above the sale price paid to the Vendor.

Auction ends – Wednesday 28th July 2021 at 1pm

Bidding Window Opens – Monday 26th July 2021 (Bidding will not be possible until this time)

Starting price - £199,500 (Reserve price is higher & unpublished, typically the starting price will be 15 – 20% below the Reserve figure as per our Buyer Terms)

Viewings
We are working within government safety guidelines at all times, hosting tightly controlled open days. This property is vacant which means we should comfortably be able to follow social distancing guidelines.

We allow a maximum of 2 bookings per 15 minute time slot. Attendees are allowed to bring one other person with them to a viewing provided that they are within the same household /support bubble.

Viewers must to stick to their time precisely, and keep to the 2 metre rule if in the property at the same time as another viewer.

The wearing of face masks are required at this current time so viewers are asked to ensure they bring one with them, our host may have a small supply with them for those that have forgot to bring one. We will endeavour to supply hand sanitiser fluid at entrance and exit. Viewers are responsible for keeping up to date with local Government restrictions/guidelines and following them appropriately.

Property Details
Approx. Gross internal floor area – 480 sq ft / 44.6 sqm

Lower Ground Floor
Comprises of an entrance hallway leading to these rooms:
Living / Bedroom – 18'4 x 16'3 (5.60m x 4.96m)
Kitchen – 10'2 x 8'4 (3.10m x 2.54m)
Bathroom – 8'7 x 7'10 (2.62m x 2.40m)
W.C. – 4'6 x 2'11 (1.37m x 0.88m)

Parking
On street

How to make an offer
Offers can only be made via the online auction in the form of a bid once the bidding window has opened. No offers will be accepted outside of the auction process.
Once a sale has been agreed (STC) and a price agreed then no further price negotiation will take place. This sale price is fixed at the winning auction price and the buyer honoured to pay it. Any subsequent attempt by the buyer to contact the vendor direct to renegotiate on price would hold the buyer in breach of our terms. Should the buyer withdraw then they may have to forfeit the reservation fee. Please read the buyer terms and faq’s on the site for more details.

detailedDescription:
John Payne are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning two bedroom semi-detached house located in the popular Rectory Fields, which is perfectly placed for both Greenwich Park and Blackheath.

Built in the 1840s, the property has a wealth of original period features and has been upgraded and well-maintained by the current owners. The property offers ample living space, comprising two spacious reception rooms, a modern kitchen with conservatory dining area, and a downstairs shower room. As you ascend to the first floor you are welcomed by a large master bedroom and a second bedroom leading onto a family bathroom suite.

Further benefits include ample storage from a cellar and cloakroom and a well-kept rear garden with day-round sunlight.

Located on the Blackheath side of the Rectory Fields Conservation Area, it is only a short walk to the convenient M&S Simply Food and independent shops and cafés of Blackheath Royal Standard. Westcombe Park mainline train station is a 15 minute walk away and offers regular links to London Bridge and the City. There are frequent buses to Blackheath Village (for boutique shopping, restaurants and direct trains to Charing Cross), North Greenwich (for the Jubilee line) and Greenwich (for its markets and the DLR).

For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Blackheath Standard office today.

detailedDescription:
Always popular with first time buyers and buy to let investors are these first floor large two double bedroom Victorian conversions.
This particular one is offered chain free and share of freehold. Enter via a clean and tidy communal entrance stairs lead to the first floor to a large spacious landing with neutral décor running throughout the flat.

detailedDescription:
Located in a quiet cul de sac, this extended 1930's mid terrace family home, offers well designed and modern accommodation over three floors.

The interior of the home briefly comprises of an entrance hallway, lounge, open plan kitchen/dining room with modern units and integrated double oven and microwave fitted in 2019. Upstairs there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom and finally the loft has been converted to provide an additional bedroom/occasional room.
Outside there is off street parking for two cars to the front and a detached garden lodge (converted from the garage) complete with w.c., at the rear. This provides an ideal space for a home office or gym or as the current owners enjoy as an additional play room/living space.
Other features include double glazing, a new roof (2018), a gas Combi boiler system (installed 2019), neutral and inviting décor throughout and a beautiful low maintenance rear garden.
Located within an approx. Five minute walk of Grove Park station which provides fast and frequent trains to London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing X, or change at Lewisham for the DLR.
School options are in abundance so a perfect base for families and professionals alike. There are regular buses into Bromley and surrounding towns and shops within easy walking distance.

Viewings are strongly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Five Floor Property - Ideal For Investment - Beautiful Garden Terrace - Potential For Residential Above - Well Sought After Area - A Short Walk To Blackheath Rail Station - In Close Proximity To Greenwich Park - Located On A Busy High Street - Freehold Property

Durden & Hunt welcome to the market a five floor property in Montpelier Vale, a freehold property located in the delightful Village of Blackheath in South East London. The property is situated in a conservation area a stone's throw from the heath, Greenwich Park and the start of the London Marathon. The village boasts a host of restaurants, bars, shops and Blackheath Hall. The property is also in an ideal location, being situated a short walk from Blackheath Rail Station, which provides access to Central London.

The property is spread over five floors and was once two shops, which gives the future purchaser the potential of a substantial retail offering with a beautiful garden terrace with potential for residential above.

The property consists of:
A 633sq ft ground floor basement which was used as a night club which had a capacity of 100. There are also both female and male toilets in the basement with two exits.

The main floor on high street level which was used as a wine bar, and is glass fronted spanning the full front of the property, along with a kitchen area, which comes to a total of 1044 sq ft. The garden patio area is a hidden gem spread over 952 sq ft, with a service yard of 32 sq ft.

The second floor has both male and female toilets, with a VIP lounge bar spread over 737 sq ft.

The third floor has three rooms currently used as storage and office space with another kitchen area.

The roof space has velux windows and could easily be converted into a living accommodation and has four separate rooms.

The premises is licensed to sell on trade available on request.

The property has been owned by the current owner for 30 years and due to its location on the busy high street, is well sort after. This wonderful property must been seen to understand its true potential.

Offers in excess of £2,000,000

Beautifully presented two bedroom, ground floor apartment set within a popular purpose built development within easy access of excellent transport links to central London and local amenities. Representing an excellent first time or investment purchase, the property further benefits from gas central heating, ample inbuilt storage, allocated underground car park space and no onward chain.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, including utility space, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with wide double glazed windows, access onto the private terrace, and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The separate newly installed kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and stylish splash-back, incorporating inset sink unit, ceramic hob with overhead extractor, electric oven and built in microwave and further space for appliances. There are two well-sized double bedrooms, each with inbuilt storage, the ensuite bathroom is located off the master bedroom with a walk in shower and metro tiling, plus a brand new sleek family bathroom with modern white three piece suite and elegant metro tiling.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautiful two double bedroom apartment on the first floor of a substantial semi-detached Victorian villa overlooking Lewisham Park and set in the Lewisham Park conservation area.

From the moment you walk in you will love this apartment - the space, the light, the high ceilings, the original fireplaces, the balcony, the views over the park. If you want a home that has that extra sense of refinement, grandeur and luxury then this is the place for you.

To the front is the 18ft reception room with wood flooring, dining area and access to the balcony, which has space for table, chairs and plants, plus great views straight into Lewisham Park. The kitchen is off the main reception, over 14ft long and fully fitted.

To the rear are the two double bedrooms, both over 16ft in length, both with original fireplaces, both with tall sash windows to allow plenty of light. The second bedroom has a stunning full height frosted glass door. The family bathroom is off the hallway with white three piece suite including a shower over the bath.

The apartment also has a section of cellar with its own locked door, accessed from the communal hallway.

The current owners have loved the calm, quiet, airy feel of their apartment. They love the view of the park to the front and the olive tree to the rear, plus the glass door to the second bedroom. Their apartment is a great place to relax after a busy day at work. They love the convenient location, especially the park on their doorstep and having lovely neighbours.

The Conservation area is characterized by large semi-detached and detached Victorian and Edwardian houses curving around the park creating a grand setting for the beautiful houses. Developed in the 1800s by Lord Dartmouth, Viscount of Lewisham, as a prestigious rural retreat, Lewisham Park is still a wonderful tree lined oasis. The mature trees are wonderful and provide a habitat for many birds and insects. The park was originally set out as a town garden and still retains that feeling as well as a wild area of trees and shrubs. In springtime the cherry tree walk through the centre of the park is beautiful and the birds singing there are amazing.

Amenities
Ladywell 0.7 miles - coffee shops, cafés and the Ladywell Tavern
Lewisham Shopping Centre 0.7 miles
Rushey Green 0.4 miles with many shops, plus the Broadway Theatre, supermarkets, restaurants and pubs
Catford Mews 0.8 miles with 3 screen cinema complex, café and food market
Lewisham Hospital 0.2 miles

Transport
Ladywell station 0.6 miles with trains to London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross
Hither Green station 0.7 miles with trains as above
Lewisham DLR Station 1 mile with trains to Canary Wharf and Bank.

Parks
Lewisham Park across the road - trees, shrubs, floral borders, sunken garden and playground
Ladywell Fields 0.3 miles - 54 acres of green space, wooded areas, river, tennis courts, bowling green, cycle route and nature reserve.
Mountsfield Park 0.7 miles - open fields, flower gardens, playground, bandstand and café.

detailedDescription:
| Victorian Frontage | Sought After Road | No Onward Chain | 968 Year Lease |

Unveiled to the SE23 market is this in-demand, two bedroom Victorian conversion flat that is situated on a quiet yet centrally located street in one of South London's most sought after areas; Forest Hill.

The property itself is situated just 0.3 miles to Forest Hill Station, which forms part of the ever popular Overground Line, offering direct access into several main London terminals including London Bridge in just 20 minutes! Widely known as the 'Orange line', the convenience of this service has hugely increased the popularity of the areas which it passes through. You are also within a good distance from Forest Hill High Street, Mayow Park and Perry Vale Parade.

Internally the layout consists of two bedrooms, a storage cupboard to the hall, a well proportioned bathroom, and a semi-open plan reception room, with direct access to the kitchen and with the added benefit of a characterful bay window. There is also a large communal garden to the rear and off street parking to the front.

Offered to the market chain free and available to view now, this stunning period conversion flat will be in high demand so please contact our Acorn Forest Hill office at your earliest convenience, as all viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Lease Length: 968 years | Service Charge: £2,260 per annum | Ground Rent: £0 | Energy Efficiency Rating: D.

detailedDescription:
An excellent two bedroom new build apartment, offered chain free within Catford.

The property is superbly located near transportation links, as both Catford and Catford Bridge Stations (Thameslink and Southeastern) are on its doorstep. Fantastic bus connections are easily accessible from nearby Catford Bridge too, allowing for fuss-free travel throughout London.

Upon entry, the property’s hallway leads to the kitchen and reception area. The reception area is spacious, making it a great space for social gatherings and entertaining others. The area also doubles up as a gorgeous work from home space, as a desk has been set up in front of the room’s window. The reception area leads off to a balcony, the perfect area for savouring in the sunshine or relishing a meal, alongside a gorgeous view.

The modern open-plan kitchen has inbuilt appliances, including a ceramic hob. Worktop space is offered around the kitchen and there is plentiful storage space too. The choice of white finishing throughout creates a clean look and feel to the kitchen.

The two bedrooms are spacious, offering lots of light from the windows. Large wardrobes are on offer for both rooms, ideal for all your clothing needs.

The bathroom is exquisitely finished with stunning tiling, transporting you to your own personal spa. It features both a bathtub and shower and the spotlights on the ceiling ensure light in the bathroom is maximised.

The property is located near the mouth of the Ravensbourne River, which flows through the historic Ladywell Fields, a 7 minute walk away. Due to its close proximity, a stroll by the river or in the park can be effortlessly enjoyed for some relaxation time.

detailedDescription:
An attractive and well-proportioned Edwardian semi-detached property. This three bedroom home is situated on an elevated plot within the desirable Belmont Hill Conservation Area.

The current owners have lovingly kept this home, retaining much of its original splendour and character. The ground floor boasts a welcoming entrance hall with the original tiled flooring, turned staircase and ornate cornicing. The first of the three reception rooms is the beautiful bay fronted living room with period fireplace, picture rails and cornicing. Down the hall is a dining room with a fireplace and french doors to the rear garden and a well-designed kitchen that opens into a further living room. The first floor has three spacious bedrooms, two of which with feature fireplaces. The master bedroom span the width of the house with a large bay window. A modern tiled bathroom and additional shower room complete this floor.
The charming south facing rear garden has attractive stone paving surrounded by various trees and flower beds.

Boyne Road is conveniently located for access to both Blackheath Village and Lewisham Station. Blackheath Village provides an array of shops, bars and restaurants with the glorious open heath beyond. For transport, Lewisham Station is zone 2 and offers regular and fast services into Canary Wharf, Bank, London Bridge, Charing Cross and London Victoria, among others.

B&C Properties are delighted to present this luxury, bright, spacious two bedroom, two bathroom apartment located on the 2nd floor with parking in Campbell Court, Kidbrooke Village, the property also benefits from 2 balconies, Your earliest viewing is advised to avoid disappointment.

This apartment has been decorated to an extremely high standard throughout. The apartment comprises of a large open plan living, dining and kitchen area with floor to ceiling height windows opening onto a large balcony.

The kitchen is fully equipped to a very high standard including a dish washer, fridge/freezer. The master suite comes with built in wardrobes with ensuite bathroom, here is where you will access your second balcony, there is a further double bedroom and a luxury modern family shower room. Off of the hallway there is a utility cupboard to house the washing machine.

The apartment is situated right next to the beautiful Sutcliffe Park, with lake, children's playground and athletic track. Sainsbury's Local supermarket is onsite as well. The apartment benefits from 24hr Concierge and onsite residence only Gym access.

detailedDescription:
Conveniently located a short walk from Ladywell station, Ladywell Fields and Hilly Fields, is this beautifully-presented, compact 2-bedroom, ground floor flat with its own private entrance, off street parking, and also offered Chain Free.

Offering a spacious open plan living and kitchen area, 2 double bedrooms, and a stylish bathroom. It also benefits from off-street parking, its own front door, wooden flooring gas fired central heating and double glazing.

Ladywell is a vibrant, cosmopolitan area popular among young families and professionals. It has a village like feel with a high street made up of a variety of independent shops. There's a French bakery/patisserie which serves delicious cakes and lunchtime snacks. The deli is a great place to pick up groceries including organic fruit and vegetables. The popular local butcher's sells traditional and rare produce. Nearby restaurants of note include a hip sour dough pizzeria (Mama Dough) the Ladywell Tandoori, a family-run Indian, and the Ladywell Tavern, a trendy gastro-pub which serves craft beers. Oscars café is a great place for brunch or to grab a coffee.

Ladywell station is a 5-minute walk away from where there are fast and frequent services into Charing Cross and Cannon St. In addition, Lewisham DLR is 1 stop away for easy access to Canary Wharf. For motorists, there is on-street permit parking.

The area is surrounded by green spaces with Ladywell Fields at the end of the road and Hilly Fields nearby as well. At the end of the road is the scenic Water Link way, ideal for a Sunday afternoon bike ride or stroll.

The area also boasts various sporting facilities including an athletics track, tennis courts in Ladywell Fields and Hilly Fields, and a swimming pool and leisure centre near Lewisham station.

detailedDescription:
Set on an outstanding and huge corner plot is this four bedroom, three reception room double-fronted end of terrace Corbett house with fantastic potential for extensions or development.

Due to its privileged position on the corner the property benefits from a very large plot extending to approximately 109ft x 48ft, 5,232 sq.ft. There is access to the side from Sandhurst Road with the plot currently arranged in three sections.

The house - The accommodation comprises; entrance hall, two large reception rooms with bay windows, spacious kitchen, utility/shower room and a third rear reception into an extension with sliding glazed doors to a decked section of the garden. On the first floor there are four bedrooms including a huge master with bay window, extensive built in wardrobes and a shower, two further spacious doubles and a bathroom. The house itself is currently tenanted and would benefit from modernisation although does boast high ceilings, double glazed windows and gas fired central heating.

The yard – Boasts a huge large forecourt with two very large open garage spaces.

The garden – A 30ft x 30ft section of garden which is to the rear of the decked section of garden currently used by the house and the larger of the two garages.

We believe the site has excellent potential to create an additional dwelling/dwellings and at the very least lends itself to a huge side extension and loft conversion to the main house. Many similar houses locally have had this work done. This would be subject to relevant planning consents and all interested parties should make their own enquiries.
Early viewing is strongly recommended and there is no chain.

The property is located just 0.61 miles from Hither Green station with travel time to London Bridge just 9 minutes with trains also operating to Cannon Street, Charing Cross and Waterloo East. Canary Wharf is easily accessible via Lewisham DLR. The popular open spaces of Manor House Gardens and Mountsfield Park are close by. Catford is just 0.83 miles with plenty of shops and restaurants and is growing in popularity among commuters as journeys from its two mainline stations can take as little as 10 minutes to Central London. Blackheath Village with its array of boutiques, bars and restaurants is just 1.4 miles.

A two bedroom retirement apartment located on the first floor Stannard Court was built by McCarthy & Stone (Developments) Ltd and comprises 79 properties arranged over 4 floors each served by a lift. The Development Manager can be contacted from various points within each property in the case of an emergency. For periods when the Development Manager is off duty there is a 24 hour emergency call response system. Each property comprises an entrance hall, lounge, kitchen, one or two bedrooms and a bathroom. It is a condition of purchase that residents be over the age of 60 years, or in the event of a couple, one must be over the age of 60 years and the other over 55 years.
Please speak to our Property Consultant if you require information regarding Event Fees that may apply to this property. Draft details

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Key features

  • 50% Share Of Freehold
  • Victorian Mid Terrace
  • City views
  • Three Bedrooms, one en-suite
  • Two bathrooms
  • Bright And Spacious Kitchen Diner
  • Immaculately Presented Throughout
  • Ample storage
  • Lovely Period Features
  • Highly Sought After Road
  • Outstanding Schools
  • Close To Transport
  • 900 Sqf / 83.6 Sqm


Full Description
Tenure: Share Of Freehold

This classic period terrace has been extensively renovated with a loft conversion and an immaculate modern refitting. It is a first and second floor flat. The property feels spacious and is beautifully lit by natural light throughout. There are three bedrooms, including the loft with en-suite, a good sized kitchen diner and family bathroom.
The entrance hall has a classically tiled floor with original ceiling cornicing and neutral decor.
Throughout the property there is beautiful oak flooring and neutral decor that would allow any new owners to put their own stamp on the property.
The kitchen was fitted 5 years ago and has an integrated cooker, hob and dishwasher which are all all in excellent condition. There is generous kitchen storage with a large built in pantry in addition to the kitchen cupboards.
The kitchen leads on to the living room through an archway. There are built in cupboards aside a chimney breast with a decorative tile surround and integrated mood lighting. The chimney has potential to be opened and restored to the original fireplace if desired.
The rear bedroom overlooks gardens and has fitted double wardrobes. There is an additional loft space that runs the length of the room, accessed via a ceiling hatch with an extendable ladder, offering unusually large amounts of storage for a London property. A extra quirky feature of this room includes a cat flap which allows the owner’s cat to access the gardens behind the property. Due to the long terrace preventing access to the front road, this provides a cat with a sheltered area to roam away from vehicles.
A second bedroom, currently used as a child’s bedroom, could also be used as a home office if desired. Alternatively, the stud wall could easily be removed to increase the size of the living area further.
The family bathroom has been renovated to a high standard with traditional Burlington fittings and a newly installed ventilation fan. The bath is extra wide, has an overhead shower, and also an additional shower hose.
A second staircase leads up to the loft bedroom. There is a large under-stairs cupboard with fitted coat rail. Above the stairs a velux skylight window floods the hallway with natural light. The loft has been converted to a high standard, including wooden sash windows with city skyscraper views to the northern aspect, plentiful eaves storage and a tastefully fitted shower en-suite.

There is a mains wired fire alarm system throughout the property. The road outside the property has free parking 24/7 with a good availability of spaces.

The local area is highly sought after for its excellent amenities and transport links.
It is a 5 minute walk to Nunhead station with direct trains to Victoria, Blackfriars and E&C. Queens Road Peckham is less than 10 minutes walk which connects to London Bridge and the Overground trains. Both Brockley and New Cross Gate stations are 15 minutes walk away and there are tfl plans underway to connect the Bakerloo line to New Cross in the near future.
There are “Outstanding” Ofsted rated local school options, with Edmund Waller
and Hollydale Primaries and Aske's Secondary & Free school all
nearby.
Telegraph Hill is home to two brilliant parks, with a weekly farmer’s market, fabulous cityscape views (perfect view for the nye fireworks), tennis courts, a skate park, toddlers play area and a nature pond. There's also the Hill Station Community Cafe, which hosts to lots of pop-up events like restaurants and play groups. The Nunhead Cemetery offers a breathtaking woodland walk and nearby Peckham Rye is a popular space to exercise, socialise and has a newly built playground for children. The high street in Nunhead is packed with independent stores offering every amenity you can need: A grocer, bakery, butcher, fishmonger, hairdresser, dry cleaners, cycle repair shop and a green packaging-free home and food shop.

detailedDescription:
Viewings Sat 3rd July by appointment. Offering over 1600 sq ft of living space, this substantial and light-filled, 4-bedroom, 2-bathroom period house is ideally placed for transport links into town as well as good primary schools.
With its brick façade, iron railings, sash windows and period front door the property doesn't lack for kerb appeal. It was refurbished a couple of years ago (new kitchen and shower rooms) and has beautiful stripped wooden floorboards in most rooms. On the ground floor are 2 generously-proportioned reception rooms, a kitchen-diner which leads through to a conservatory, and a handy downstairs WC. On the first floor are 3 good-sized double bedrooms - one with an ensuite shower - a single bedroom and a smart shower room. At the rear is a low-maintenance, west-facing garden.
Honor Oak Park is a friendly area popular among young professional and families. The station provides fast and regular services to London Bridge (in around 12 mins) as well as London Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington and southwards to Croydon. Crofton Park station is also within easy reach for services into Blackfriars.
The area's amenities include coffee shops, a deli, a beauty salon and several high-rated restaurants including a hip Pizzeria (Mamma Dough), an award-winning Indian (Babur) and a popular Italian (Le Querce). For groceries there are a number of convenience shops and a Sainsbury's local. For an evening drink, there's the recently-refurbished Chandos or the Brockley Jack which also hosts a small theatre.
The nearest primary school is the highly-rated Stillness. For older children there are several state and independent schools locally including St Dunstan's College.
The area is dotted with green spaces including One Tree Hill and Blythe Hill Fields both of which boast panoramic views of the London skyline.

title: 5 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming three bed mid-terraced bay-fronted Victorian house of 1080 square feet, excluding generous cellar and loft spaces. A west-facing garden sits at the rear - directly accessed via your eat-in kitchen.

The location is a pretty residential street within Lewisham Borough’s Hatcham Conservation Area.

You’re just a 9 minute walk from New Cross Gate Station (Fare Zone 2, one stop to London Bridge, on the London Overground network, and next to a handy big Sainsbury’s!), and just 150 metres from an excellent primary school, with its impressive architectural treatment by jestico + whiles.

In your front door and to your left, two doors open into the double-reception room. Neat engineered wood floors flow through both spaces. In the front reception, of 14 feet by over 11 feet, welcome features include custom-made window shutters (to the lower panes in the pretty bay), alcove shelving, and an on-trend wood-burner. The second reception is an obvious formal dining room, with window to garden views and an opened-up fireplace.

At the foot of the hall, access your large cellar under the stairs to your right. Hatcham ca is famed for its big basements and this one doesn’t disappoint - storage goals sorted!

Straight ahead is the recently-renovated double-aspect eat-in kitchen, with a big ceramic double sink and timeless Shaker-style units topped with stone counters. A large modern-framed glazed door is a great focal feature, and provides your access to the paved area of the big garden - which is laid to lawn beyond. It’s a west-facer so you can bask in afternoon sun out here, and the orientation of the house (east/west) means you get great light throughout the house all the day through.

Upstairs and from the half-landing you’ve got a bright double-aspect double bedroom to the rear. The property’s windowed bathroom is adjacent - this is beautifully fitted-out, with a traditionally-styled suite and fittings, including an over bath shower. There is good under-basin storage.

Up to the landing proper and you have a sash-windowed double bedroom to your right. This is 11 feet by nearly 10 feet. Taking the width of the terrace is a large master bedroom of over 15 feet by over 11 feet. Stripped boards feature to the floor and you’ve got two double-glazed sash windows to street views.

Some area info… Hatcham ca is a cute and very-Victorian residential pocket of south London, little-known to most. From 1614, the land was owned by the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers. When the manor house here (named 'Hatcham Park’) was demolished circa 1840, terraced homes were permitted to be built. Rescued from proposed demolition in the seventies, Hatcham Conservation Area was designated by Lewisham Council in 1990.

‘Hatcham’ derives most likely from Anglo Saxon; meaning ‘a clearing in the woods’, and reputedly, Charles Dickens wrote ‘Our Mutual Friend’ in The Five Bells pub (1864-5).

Stroll - past more handsome Victorian housing stock - just nine minutes to New Cross Gate Station. There are also plenty of day and night bus routes within a short walk of the house to Elephant & Castle and beyond, or to Peckham, Deptford, Greenwich, Brockley and Lewisham.

Local eateries and drinkeries of note include The Rosemary (Hungarian, organic, delicious) and The Rose Inn (good pizzas and roasts here). And Smokey Jerkey is a local gem.

Nip down to neighbouring SE15 for others - including Peckham Bazaar, Kudu, Ganapati (who also deliver to New Cross - you need to know this), Artusi, Peckham Levels, Miss Tapas, Taco Queen and Mr Bao.

Deptford has an ace gastronomic offering too, with Marcella, Winemakers, The Tapas Room and a warm, European vibe, with a choice of hip hangouts in Deptford Market Yard and surrounds. Deptford also has a cool theatre: The Albany, and a modern leisure centre with lane pool.

New Cross is home to Goldsmiths University with a Curzon cinema and a contemporary gallery - both tucked off the main road on campus, but very much open to the public.

Local parks include Telegraph Hill (Upper and Lower, with Saturday Farmers’ Market, or pop in a bus down to Brockley Market) and Fordham Parks. Eckington Gardens is a small local one with playground.

Grab your fresh loaves from Blackbird Bakery by qrp station, or at Ayres on nearby Nunhead Lane. While you’re in Nunhead, Soper’s wet fish shop is great. El Vermut and Mother Superior are superior bottle-shops too.

Kids or they are on the horizon? Your most local primary schools are Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham Temple Grove (which feeds to the secondary based in New Cross’s other and local Conservation Area), Edmund Waller and Kender.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautiful mid-century modern home in Catford, positioned adjacently to the much sought after Corbett Estate in Catford.
This stunning house boasts over 828 sq. Ft of space and is positioned at the end of the terrace with handy side access to the rear garden.

On entering the house there is a sense of space and light, the hallway is roomy. The living room is exquisite and spacious at over 23 ft, featuring bespoke handcrafted cabinetry, solid oak French doors, there is hardwood oak flooring and the space is open plan with the kitchen. The kitchen includes tasteful and and simple white units, integrated appliances and it’s positioning with the living room makes it an ideal space for entertaining or easy family living. Beautiful bespoke doors lead to a magnificent westerly facing garden which is spectacularly large at over 74 ft. There are beautifully mature garden shrubs, a raised vegetable patch and different seating zones which can be enjoyed while taking in the garden and soaking up the sun at different times of day. At the rear of the garden is a fabulous bespoke outbuilding made from corrugated steel, the space has electricity and plumbing, the current owner uses it as a workshop studio/office.

There is double glazing throughout the house and the bright and light hallway leads upstairs to where there are three bedrooms. The master bedroom is calm and restful, it is spacious at over 13 ft and comfortably houses a king size bed.

The second bedroom is a generous size at over 12ft, the room is beautifully and comfortably finished. The third bedroom makes for an ideal study, guest room or children’s bedroom.

On the same floor as the bedrooms is the bathroom which feels like a sanctuary. The spa like space is immaculately finished with minimal white metro tiles, the sanitary wear is simply and tastefully designed and there is a counter basin complete with bespoke cabinetry.

Crutchley Road is located in Catford adjacent to the much sought after Corbett Estate. The neighbourhood has recently become a hotspot with first time buyers and families largely due to the beautiful choice of homes, superb choice of local primary schools and the spirit of the community.

The bustling town of Catford has seen a strong level of growth over recent years becoming a hot location for home buyers and investment. There are a number of sought after neighbourhoods in the area largely due to the housing stock, transport connections and thriving community. Significant regeneration plans for the area are anticipated with the ambition of making Catford one of the most vibrant and green town centres in London.

There is a strong choice of local independent shops, cafes, bars and restaurants, some of our favourites include Good Food, The Bottle Bar & Shop and La Pizzeria Italiana.

The two stations Catford and Catford Bridge allow easy connections including the Thameslink to the major London stations of Charing Cross, London Bridge, Victoria and Blackfriars with the Overground being accessible from Peckham Rye within a couple of stops.

Within approximately 0.5 miles of Crutchley Road Road is a super choice of local nursery and primary schools including Sandhurst, Torridon and Holy Cross. The sought after independent schools St Dunstan’s College and Colfe’s are also within the local vicinity.

There is a great choice of green spaces and parks locally for weekend strolls to tire out the kids and walk the dog, Mountfield Park and Forester Park are within an easy 10 minutes of the house.

Hither Green is popular largely due to the thriving community, popular schools, easy transport links and growing choice of independent shops. There are so many brilliant small businesses to mention but some of our favourites include You Don’t Bring Me Flowers, Three Sisters, Park Fever, Good Hope, Drink at Bob’s – we could go on.

These South East London pockets are also home to a choice of green spaces, conservation areas and local arts and community festivals.
Slightly further afield Blackheath, Brockley and Greenwich are also a weekend’s walking distance.

detailedDescription:
This 6th floor - 2 bedroom\ 2bathroom apartment (782 sq. Ft.) is located in Grayston House which is the new release apartments within Meridian Gate, Kidbrooke Village which is located in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and which comes with its own car parking space included in the price.

The apartment has a large bright open plan living/dining room with contemporary engineered timber flooring.

The designed kitchen has been fitted with high specification appliances and finished with composite stone effect worktops.

The Master bedroom has fitted wardrobes and a high specification en-suite and both bedrooms benefit from being laid with carpets. This stylish apartment also offers is a private corner balcony providing excellent views.

Kidbrooke Village is an integral part of the great city of London, with fast transport links into the City and West End (Kidbrooke station to London Bridge can be as fast as 15 minutes). title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Architect-designed purpose-built maisonette of 924 square feet, with two double bedrooms and balcony spaces to both its floors (from the reception room and master bedroom).

Find the large and light home over second and third floors, within the tucked-away residential and high-end commercial community that is Dragonfly Place, near Brockley Cross. Long leasehold with 118 years remaining.

Handily you are but a four minute walk from Brockley Station - Zone 2 and on the London Overground network.

It’s possible to rent a parking space within the development and there are four visitor bays. And multiple bike sheds offer free cycle storage.

The property has its own front door and views (from the deck area you find it on) are fine and far-reaching. You’re within the catchment area for two Ofsted-rated ‘Outstanding’ primary schools: John Stainer and Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham Temple Grove Free School (with secondary provision too). You can see the former’s smart Victorian building and rooftop from here.

The property is exceedingly energy-efficient; boasting triple-glazing, an air-filtering system, and great insulation. Stay cool when it’s hot and cosy when it’s cold.

Once through the front door (with cool porthole window) you land in a neat hall with a windowed w.c. Set to your right. Stairs lead up to your left.

Straight ahead and you open into the kitchen area of the large reception/dining room/kitchen which stretches 29 feet by nearly 14 feet. Built-in cupboards (two and large) offer brilliant storage. The fitted kitchen is a modern number, with plenty of cupboard and counter space. A glazed door at the foot of the room opens to private outdoor space number one - a cute balcony on which to enjoy a cup of tea (or something stronger) and to nurture potted plants.

Up to the first floor and on your left is a splendid spacious master bedroom with smashing ceilings and apex glazing following the roof line. It stretches 17 feet by nearly 14 feet. Open your glazed door here to your second balcony. As downstairs, views impress.

A good second double sits to the front of the building and is over 10 feet each way, with a large built-in closet. The bathroom is set between both bedrooms and has a white suite and over-bath shower.

Being part of this creative community you can benefit from such delights as fresh loaf deliveries from Cooper’s Bakehouse, and in the warm months, businesses and residents enjoy barbies on the communal green (found by the second entrance). Central Brockley is also close for coffee shops, restaurants and bars (independent in the main); we like The Orchard, Parlez, Brickfields, Brockley Brewery and Browns of Brockley as just some examples.

Nunhead with its high street and villagey feel is also fairly close - just follow Drakefell Road. Here we like Ayres bakery, Mother Superior wine store and deli and fc Soper wet fish shop, as well as El Vermut and The Old Nun’s Head.

We’re big fans of New Cross’s centre as well, with its pretty, historical buildings, and growing number of pubs and eateries - including The Rosemary (organic Hungarian fayre), The Rose Inn, The Telegraph at the Earl of Derby and The Amersham Arms. Thanks largely to Goldsmiths University, New Cross attracts a cool and smart crowd and even has its own contemporary art gallery and a Curzon cinema. A big Sainsbury’s store by nxg Station is on hand for ‘the big shop’.

Deptford High Street and Broadway are fairly local - for classy restaurants including Marcella and The Winemakers Club, and there are cute bars in Deptford Market Yard.

And trendy Peckham is also easily-reached for more options. Some of our favourite SE15 spots are Kudu, Peckham Bazaar, Levan, Forza Wine, Ganapati, Peckham Levels and The Bussey Building.

For park-life... You've got Telegraph Hill's pretty Victorian ones (with views) close by. Telegraph Hill Upper Park is the place to watch the sunset and is very popular on nye for the panoramic views of London and the fireworks. On weekends, you can get delicious wood-fired sourdough pizzas here from Dinner for One Hundred, and enjoy them in the park. Hilly Fields and Ladywell Fields are also close. Greenwich Park and Blackheath Common are but a short bus ride/cycle/drive too. You can also jump on the 484 just outside Dragonfly Place which takes you straight to Peckham Rye Park and Common in under 10 minutes.

A exceptional ground floor Edwardian two double bedroom maisonette with private west facing garden available within close proximity of Mayow Park.

The current owners have remodelled and modernised this inviting home injecting atmosphere, character and warmth by utilising a harmonious colour scheme, signature pieces and quality fittings. Arranged on the ground floor, this high specification property boasts a large reception with a beautiful fireplace, original floorboards and shutters, a contemporary fully integrated kitchen breakfast room with doors opening directly onto the beautifully landscaped garden, perfect for alfresco dining and entertaining. The wet room is contemporary and stylish, benefiting from underfloor heating and a heated mirror. Further benefits include a private entrance. The property is also being sold with a share of freehold

In summary, a property that really needs to be viewed to be fully appreciated.

Adamsrill Road is one of the most desirable roads in the area, pretty and tree lined, within close proximity of the high street, numerous coffee shops, restaurants and shopping facilities, as well as both Sydenham and Forest Hill stations. EPC - F (rating prior to refurbishment)

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
An extended three bedroom family home for sale that is set within the popular Corbett Estate. This brick fronted property has undergone extensive refurbishment throughout with just a few minor cosmetic changes left to finish by the owner. Offering approximately 1567 sq/ft of living space, this property comprises of; a reception room with a feature fireplace, a downstairs shower room and an extended fitted kitchen/diner equipped with bi-folding doors and plenty of windows that allow in a generous amount of sunlight. Upstairs are three well proportioned bedrooms and the family bathroom suite. The top floor has a fully boarded loft room, that would be ideal for a home office space. To the rear is a sizeable South facing garden. This chain free property benefits from being completely re-wired, re-plumbed and is double glazed throughout. Fordel Road is a popular tree lined street on the increasingly popular Corbett Estate and is within close proximity to two sought after primary schools. The house is located close to Hither Green mainline station with excellent connections into London. EPC Grade C<br /><br />

Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller.

address: Gilbert House, Mcmillan Street, Deptford, London SE8
detailedDescription:
We are pleased to offer this extremely well presented one bedroom flat, that is found on the ground floor and measures circa 475 square foot, located adjacent to the green space of Charlotte Turner Gardens, moments from Deptford High Street with mainline rail.

In excellent order the property has a good sized reception room, with hard wood flooring. There is a double bedroom and a lovely modern kictchen and bathroom. Added features include double glazing and gas central heating. There is also off street parking available, but worth noting that it is on a first come first serve basis.

Gilbert House is an impressive example of early 20th century architecture and is located just west of Greenwich Town centre, off McMillan Street and close to the river walkway. As mentioned, Deptford High Street is also close by which means there is a good coice of shops and restaurants to hand. There is no chain.

detailedDescription: An exciting opportunity to purchase this three storey, four bedroom Victorian house located in this popular residential road in zone 2. Visit Telegraph Hill parks with the weekly farmers market and the vibrant amenities to include independent stores, vintage clothes and record shops, galleries, charming pubs and an annual festival in Telegraph Hill. The property is comprising of entrance hall, reception, separate kitchen, four bedrooms and bathroom. To the rear is a well established garden. Although in need of some updating this fantastic property would make an ideal family home. Chain free.

detailedDescription:
Priced to sell - Two Bedroom Maisonette - Ideal for Investors or First Time Buyers - No Onward Chain - Spacious Living Room - Fitted Kitchen & Bathroom - Double Glazing & Central Heating - New Lifts & Private Access for Entry - Close to L

Fantastic opportunity to purchase this two bedroom maisonette with no onward chain, ideal for investors or first-time buyers. Located in the Grove Park area of London, the property is within easy reach of local schools and amenities along with direct rail links to the city centre.

The accommodation itself opens to the lower level which comprises an entrance hallway, a large bright and airy living room and a fitted kitchen. The hallway leads to the upper level which features two bedrooms and a bathroom.

The property also benefits from central heating, double glazing, new lifts and secure access with key fob entry. Permit parking is available for around £110 per year. Garage rental is also available - the current owners have had their garage for 10 years. Viewing comes highly recommended to appreciate the accommodation on offer.

Due to the government's guidelines on the Covid-19 pandemic, viewers must view properties alone and must wear a face covering.

For Sale by Springbok Properties' using our "Buyer-Friendly" Premium Fast Sale Plus, which puts you in the driving seat thanks to Springbok's fast and secure way of buying.

Our sellers are motivated and willing to price their properties competitively in order to ensure a fast and secure sale.

You can now secure the sale with a reservation deposit of £2,500, this forms part of the final purchase price. It is not an extra cost.

An administration fee of £396 draws up an exclusive legally binding contract between the buyer and seller giving the buyer exclusive rights to purchase within a given timeframe.

Paying the reservation deposit ensures that the seller takes their property off the market as soon as the sale is agreed and reserves it exclusively for you, eliminating gazumping and the helps you avoid losing money and wasting time which most buyers like you may face with the traditional estate agent's approach.

You get a fixed exclusivity period (approximately 4 weeks) in which you can arrange surveys and prepare to exchange contracts, safe in the knowledge that you will not be gazumped by another buyer.

Get the best of both worlds: You get to buy properties with a mortgage which are normally reserved for cash-rich investors and cash buyers and you get the security of an exclusive buying transaction with a much smaller deposit.

auction sale 27 July 2021 - This property will be sold at auction to the best bid (subject to reserve). Auctions are an exciting and the most certain way you can buy. We hold sales every month. If you are buying for your occupation, development or investment we have lots for you to see.

Description
Long leasehold ground and lower ground floor maisonette (requiring updating)
Full vacant possession

Location:
The property is situated on Sydenham Park, accessed via Sydenham Park Road. Public transport links include Sydenham and Forest Hill mainline rail stations together with a network of local bus services serving the surround vicinity. Nearby road communications include the A212 and A205 (South Circular Road) shopping amenities are available locally on Kirkdale or Sydenham Road with further amenities being found in Forest Hill to the north. Recreational facilities can be found at Mayow Park and Sydenham Wells Park (which are both conveniently located close by).

Accommodation:
Riased ground floor: Reception room, kitchen/diner, bathroom/WC

Outside: Front and rear gardens.

To be sold on a new lease for 999 years - Refer to Legal Documents

detailedDescription:
Summary

Thisconveniently located studio flat, just a 12 minute stroll from New Cross Gate station and moments from Fordham Park for recreational space.

The property is situated on the ground floor of this small block. Accommodation comprises a studio room with separate kitchen, tiled bathroom with shower over bath and storage cupboard.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.
