title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Part of the modern and much sought-after Catford Green development, this stunning, 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom 4th floor flat comes with its own park facing private balcony, and an impressive view across Ladywell Fields towards Central London and The City.

Catford Green is a collection of stylish flats backing onto the open spaces of Ladywell Fields, equidistant from the centres of both Catford and Ladywell. Boasting high spec fixtures and integrated appliances in the kitchen, the flat offers all the benefits of modern living in a great location for connections into town.

It comprises a light-filled reception room which opens out to a sleek, high-gloss kitchen. There are 2 bedrooms, both overlooking the park, an en-suite shower room and a family bathroom. The open private balcony is off the reception room with amazing views over Ladywell Fields and the City; a perfect place for a Sunday morning coffee.

The flat is flanked by 2 stations meaning that London's major stations are all easily accessible including 12 minutes to London Bridge, 17 minutes to the City and 20 minutes to Charing Cross. Lewisham DLR is just one stop away for services to Canary Wharf. There are also a number of bus routes to choose from as well.

The centres of Catford and Ladywell boast a range of amenities including independent coffee shops, a yoga studio, bottle shops and the Catford Mews – a newly developed cinema and street food venue.

There is also the Catford Broadway theatre, offering shows and a cocktail bar throughout the year.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price of £325,000 to £335,000*

Unveiled to the SE13 market is this incredibly tastefully designed Victorian conversion flat, which oozes character and sophistication, as well as benefitting from direct access onto a communal garden.

Lewisham Railway (Zone 2) & DLR is within a 0.3 mile walk with superb access into the City of London. Additionally you have Lewisham High Street and shopping centre nearby which offers boutique shops, restaurants, coffee shops and cafés as well as several choices of buses in case you need to commute elsewhere. To top it off, the Greenwich Park is only a 17 minute walk (approximately) away.

The accommodation itself is set within this grand old period building, providing a free flowing layout and stunning interior design. The layout comprises a main bedroom, a well-proportioned bathroom suite, a stylish open-plan reception room with custom made shelving and a separate yet in-trend kitchen design.

We envisage this conversion having a great deal of success on the market and would advise viewing at your earliest convenience by contacting our Acorn Lewisham office!

Lease Length: 98 years | Ground Rent: £200 Per Annum | Service Charge: £1750 Per Annum | Energy Efficiency Rating: D.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Enviably located in a popular residential area, close to transport links, excellent local schools and amenities, this beautiful four bedroom family home boasts expansive accommodation over four floors, elegantly finished to a high standard throughout whilst retaining a wealth of period appeal, including stripped floorboards, feature fireplaces, ornate cornicing and wood paneling.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall to the ground floor with access to a useful guest WC and utility room, leading into the bright and spacious front aspect reception room with attractive near full height feature windows, impressive space for relaxing and entertaining, and roll-up projector screen for those cosy movie nights with the family!

To the rear of the property, a further reception room enjoys a quiet rear aspect, as well as an open brick surround chimney recess. To the lower level, the superb open plan kitchen/diner, with two walk-in storage/cupboards/pantries, provides fantastic family living space, with stairs rising to a dual aspect sunroom, flooded with natural light from double doors opening onto the private garden. The garden has rear access to Halstow Road, making it a perfect place for storing bikes and scooters.
The kitchen area itself comprises a sleek range of matching white fronted units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances.

To the first floor, there are two well proportioned double bedrooms, each with inbuilt wardrobes and with a wonderful feature fireplace with marble mantel surround and tiled insert to the front aspect master bedroom. A stylish shower room completes the first-floor accommodation with a modern walk-in shower suite and elegant tiling. To the second floor, there are a further two double bedrooms, plus an inviting family bathroom with a free-standing roll-top bath and antique bathroom fittings.

The property is conveniently located with easy access to Westcombe Park station, with regular bus routes providing connections to North Greenwich for Jubilee line, and Greenwich for the DLR. The A2 is also easily accessible for vehicular routes out of London. The area is well served by local shops and amenities, with nearby Greenwich offering an array of fashionable shops, bars, restaurants and markets.

Additionally, the superb O2 complex, with its cinemas, concerts and shows, as well as a variety of restaurants, bars and eateries, is within easy reach, as is the Greenwich Centre, housing a leisure centre, gym and swimming pool, library and gp surgery. East Greenwich Pleasaunce is just a short stroll away, and is a delightful outside space with many community events, farmers markets, festivals, outdoor cinema, and under-fives play club. The property is also in the catchment area for excellent local schools.

Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
I love the uniqueness of our property - the versatility of the space and the combination of modern and original features. The front room-with its original wood-paneling, high ceilings and huge windows-and neighboring reception room, as well as the vast basement kitchen/diner and family room leading to the garden via a sunroom, means there is so much flexible living space. It's a great house for entertaining, and we have felt very fortunate to have so much adaptable working space during lockdown. There's also so much storage space, and it feels like we are yet to fully grow into the space available.

What do you love about the area?
It will be a huge wrench to leave the area. For us, it has been perfect - the outstanding primary school just around the corner and the proximity of the station means you can leave the house 2 minutes before you need to be at either! East Greenwich Pleasaunce is a real hidden gem - the cafe, playground and community center are a regular part of our lives. The house is also perfectly positioned near Greenwich Park, and both Greenwich and Blackheath Village, and we have the best neighbors!

detailedDescription:
Share of freehold! Stunning, bright & spacious 2 bedroom – 2 reception room maisonette featuring high ceilings & arranged over two floors. Positioned on a quiet residential street in Lee, backing onto Northbrook Park and walking distance to Lee Station.

The ground floor comprises of a spacious hallway, 2 reception rooms, a modern fitted kitchen and a WC:

The larger of the two receptions features a bay window which captures a wealth of natural light, which also features half height shutters for privacy, and provides a great daily living space. The second reception room features dual aspect windows and is currently used as a home office but is versatile and would in our opinion also suit being used as a dining room or a play room. The kitchen features modern gloss white units, a corian worktop, a brick effect tiled splashback, an integrated washer dryer and an integrated dishwasher. The WC features a compact wash hand basin, low level WC and an extractor fan.

The first floor comprises of a bright landing, 2 double bedrooms and a spacious bathroom:

The larger bedroom is a generous size, features built in storage, full height shutters to the windows and it overlooks Ronver Road. The second bedroom which is also a double bedroom, features light neutral décor and a window that overlooks greenery to the rear of the building. The bathroom features a four piece suite, a chrome towel radiator and also features a large window that overlooks Northbrook Park. The landing has a bright and airy feel which is a theme that we feel runs throughout the property.

Featuring a modern fitted kitchen and bathroom, attractive wood floors and two bedrooms. There is also double glazing and gas central heating throughout.

Location

Located in the heart of Forest Hill with a vast array of cafes, vibrant bars, independent restaurants, local boutiques and shops. Locally there is a superb range of independent primary and secondary schools in the area. Close by there is a choice of green spaces including Horniman Museum & Gardens, Mayow Park and Beckenham Place Park with its new outdoor swimming pool.
The property is also within close proximity to Forest Hill mainline and Overground station, which offer easy access to London Bridge and East London.
The property is also well connected to East Dulwich, Peckham and Camberwell by good regular bus routes.

detailedDescription:
Located a stone's throw from Honor Oak Park station, this light-filled, 1 bedroom ground floor flat, part of a well-maintained, low rise block, would make an ideal first time buy.
The flat is presented in great order throughout, has wooden flooring, double glazing and central heating throughout. The reception room has a large picture window allowing natural light to flood the room. The kitchen is bright and modern as is the bathroom, and the bedroom is a good size double.
Transport links into town could hardly be easier from Honor Oak Park station. There are 4 mainline services per hour into London Bridge in around 12 minutes. In addition, the London Overground provides services to north and east London meaning a night out in hip and happening Shoreditch is a mere 20 minutes away.
Of course, you don't have to leave the area for evening entertainment. There's a trendy sourdough pizzeria (Mama Dough), a well-loved Sardinian restaurant (le Querce), an award-winning Indian (Babur) and a family-run Turkish (Hattush). For a post work drink, pop along to Grapes and Grounds wine bar or the Chandos pub.
There are a number of convenience stores in the area including a Sainsbury's Local, ideal for picking up groceries on your way back from work.
As for green spaces, One Tree Hill is just round the corner at the top of which are commanding views of the London skyline. Peckham Rye Park and Blythe Hill Fields are also within easy reach.

A stunning 3 bedroom Semi Detached Townhouse located between Surrey Quays and Deptford, conveniently placed with easy access to Canada Water and Greenwich, Split across 3 levels with a balcony and private garden.

The house is decorated to a very high standard with dark wooden floors and beautiful furniture, Top master bedroom with en-suite bathroom at the top floor with a beautiful 172sq.ft balcony overlooking the park and the river Thames, a Jacuzzi is included in one of the 2 bathrooms, The property has off-street parking and is within walking distance of Surrey quays Shopping Centre.

Two double bedrooms (one en-suite in top floor) and one single located in the middle floor as well as a large living room, at the ground level you have a double bedroom that can be used as an office if preferred and a separate kitchen equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, gas hob, and ample space for kitchen appliances.

To the rear of the property is a large 260sq.ft garden with a standard shed and beautiful wood decking, BBQ and wooden chairs with parasol included for great outdoor entertainment

From the top balcony you can enjoy a beautiful view of the park and the river Thames where you can walk along its path and enjoy the view of Canary Wharf and Greenwich

In total this house is more than 1500sq.ft which make it a fantastic spacious property.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £400,000 - £425,000

A fabulous private westerly-aspect roof terrace is located to the rear of this hall-floor apartment, which also boasts a private entrance and a share of the freehold. Ideally placed for a choice of stations and the wonderful open spaces of Hilly Fields.

The Seller Says: "As I begin a new part of my life I know I am going to miss Brockley and my flat immensely. I’ve been in the area for more than a decade and in my property for nearly five years, and have always felt completely at home here in a way I never have elsewhere in London.

I consider myself enormously lucky to have had my flat, and especially the second bedroom and the outside space, through this pandemic year, when my home also suddenly became my workplace and much more besides.

I will remember the quiet drinks and the barbecues on my terrace stretching long into the summer evenings, (especially attending a Zoom wedding in Canada). I’ll remember the brilliant independent shops, cafes, bars and restaurants barely 30 seconds away from my door – l’Oculto, Brickfields, Brockley’s Rock, and, most important of all, the brewery. I will remember having the grandeur of maritime Greenwich and Blackheath, and the buzz and diversity of Deptford, New Cross and Peckham all within a good walk or a short bus ride.

I’ll remember the abundance of green spaces and spectacular views – Hilly Fields, One Tree Hill, Blythe Hill Fields, Forest Hill, and Telegraph Hill – and i’ll remember how I got into work in little more than half an hour and was within 10 minutes of two stations and 20 minutes of three more.

Anyone who moves in to my flat, or elsewhere in the area, I promise you, you won’t regret it."<br /><br />

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Presented in good order and boasting a light and airy feel throughout, is this 2 double bedroom period conversion flat, with Share of Freehold and its own private entrance.

The property is located on the first floor of this Victorian end of terraced house. It consists of a spacious lounge with 3 double glazed windows to the front that flood the room with natural light, a modern kitchen with integrated oven and hob, 2 double bedrooms and a stylish bathroom.

The neighbourhood is a friendly and vibrant one, popular among young professionals and families.

The nearest station is Ladywell, from where there are fast and frequent services into Charing Cross. Crofton Park station is also within easy reach for services into Blackfriars and St Pancras. If you need the London Overground you can pick this up from Brockley station and for access to Canary Wharf there's the DLR from Lewisham.

The centre of Ladywell has a village-like feel. There are coffee shops, a superb French bakery/patisserie, a deli for fresh groceries, a quality butcher's and a popular gastro pub, the Ladywell Tavern.

Further amenities can be found in the centre of Lewisham including most high street favourites. There's also a leisure centre and swimming pool opposite Lewisham station.

For a Sunday afternoon stroll or a game of tennis, there's either Hilly Fields or Ladywell fields both of which are nearby. There are number of good schools locally including Gordonbrock Primary school and Prendergast School for Girls.

detailedDescription:
JLL are delighted to present to market this fantastic 3rd floor two bedroom apartment in the popular New Capital Quay development, conveniently located within a short walk from the Cutty Sark DLR and Greenwich for both the DLR and mainline station both offering direct links to City, Westend and Canary Wharf.

Admirals Tower is a completely private development and is being catered for by its own concierge service which offers security and convenience for post and parcels and also a Waitrose supermarket on site.

The property comprises of a light spacious open plan living room to modern fitted kitchen, which opens onto a balcony which offers sweeping views across the river Thames which depicts many of London's Landmarks. Two good sized bedrooms, one which has been redesigned to cater a home office and a walk in wardrobe, a contemporary family bathroom and large hallway cupboard which offers ample storage space.

Located moments from the open expanses of Greenwich Park, this unique old town, famous for its maritime history, has an excellent selection of restaurants, pubs and shops, as well as a Picturehouse cinema and a theatre. The Old Royal Naval College, designed by Sir Christopher Wren in the 18th century, hosts a popular programme of events in the gardens, including concerts, an open-air theatre and a jazz festival.

The building has a clear EWS1 which will cause no issues on obtaining a mortgage and the property is also offered completely chain free. Early viewings are highly recommended

detailedDescription:
** With Parking ** This bright and spacious 3-bedroom, second floor, 932 square foot (approx.) apartment is situated in the sought after Marine Wharf development close to the amenities of Surrey Quays.

The stylish apartment features a bright and spacious reception great for both dining and entertaining. The living area is flooded with natural light and is open planned to a kitchen fully integrated with stainless steel appliances including a microwave oven and ceramic hob. The 3 bedrooms benefits from cream carpet fitted for the added touch of comfort, while the master has a fully tiled en-suite bathroom.

Marine Wharf features 24-hour concierge, residents' gym and landscaped communal garden. Surrey Quays is fast becoming a sought-after area in London, due to good transport links, popular shops, restaurants, cafes and open spaces. The Marine Wharf development itself is one of the Docklands most sought-after addresses, being close to transport links into central London, The City and Canary Wharf via Surrey Quays Overground and Canada Water (Jubilee line) station both within walking distance of the development and the Thames Clippers riverboats.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A well presented and larger than usual 3 double bedroom Victorian built terraced house in popular Engleheart Road.

Located close to Catford Broadway and Rushey Green, you're a short walk from Catford and Catford Bridge Stations and 11 minutes away from London Bridge. You can also get trains to Blackfriars, Cannon Street, Charing Cross and Kings Cross.

Locally there's a plethora of local buses a few minutes walk away, including routes 124,160,181,202 and 284. It's a 10 minute walk to catch 47,54,75,136,171,185,199,208 and 320.

Features of the house include a large through lounge with a period style feature fireplace (with ample space to dine), an extended kitchen with some integrated appliances, a modernised bathroom, three double bedrooms and a large loft space with the scope to extend into. The garden has been beautifully landscaped by the present owner.

Locally there are some popular and well reviewed schools and you can reach Rushey Green primary school (Ofsted rated good) within 5 minutes by foot. It's 10 minutes walk to Torridon Road primary school (rated by Ofsted as outstanding). It's also a short walk to Holy Cross Catholic Primary School (which has an ofsted 'Excellent' rating)

The much lauded St. Dunstans independent School is within walking distance.

The property is located near to Rushey Green shopping centre with three major supermarkets (Tescos, Aldi and Lidl), the Broadway theatre and a local Cinema with great drinking and eating spots.

It's 5 minutes walk to Mountsfield Park and a 15 minute walk to William Forster Park if you want some additional green spaces. Both of these are part of the se London Green Chain walk which connects up green spaces from the Thames Barrier to Crystal Palace. The Waterlink way and the Ravensbourne River runs by the two Catford stations

Lewisham Council has plans for a major regeneration of the Catford station and shopping areas and over the coming years we expect to see Catford gentrify in line with other parts of London.

Viewings recommended.

An opportunity to purchase this truly amazing three bedroom family home set within a private gated development across from Forest Hill station.

The accommodation on offer comprises, private entrance, a sizeable 17'2 reception room, a modern fitted kitchen and downstairs W.C.

To the first floor, there is a landing giving access to the master bedroom with the added benefit on an ensuite shower room, and two double bedrooms. There is also a family bathroom suite.

Externally there is a well kept garden to the rear aspect of the property

Internal viewing is highly recommended. Please call Winkworth on to arrange an appointment to view.

Located within a gated development just off of Dartmouth Road in the heart of Forest Hill, the property is within close proximity to Forest Hill mainline and Overground station, which offers easy access to London Bridge (19 mins approximately) and East London (Shoreditch High Street, around 22 mins). The property is also well connected to East Dulwich, Peckham and Camberwell by good regular bus routes.

Locally there is a vast array of cafes, vibrant bars, independent restaurants, local boutiques and shops. Forest Hill Swimming Pool and leisure centre is 5 minutes walk away.

Locally there is a superb range of independent primary and secondary schools in the area.

Close by there is also a choice of green spaces including Horniman Museum & Gardens, Mayow Park and Beckenham Place Park with its new outdoor swimming pond.

detailedDescription:
Approaching 4,000sqft and set in an elevated position, this exceptional Arts & Crafts house has been updated throughout to create a high specification family home that blends character charm with contemporary finishes.

An inviting grand entrance hall sets the scene with original cedar boards, leading to three versatile receptions and a beautiful Roundhouse kitchen entertaining area with a utility room and pantry.

The first floor comprises five well proportioned, bright and airy bedrooms with an impressive principal suite, a family bathroom, WC and separate study.

There is also an additional storage area on the lower ground floor and a sizeable loft with potential to create additional accommodation, subject to the usual consents.

Outside, there is ample off street parking, a detached garage and the garden wraps around the property.

Mount Gardens is a secluded cul-de-sac by Sydenham Hill. Forest Hill or Sydenham stations are both close by (approximately 0.8 miles) with London Overground services to Highbury & Islington, Clapham Junction, London Bridge and London Victoria. Easy access to Canary Wharf via Canada Water.

The wonderful Horniman Museum and grounds are very close, as are the delights of Dulwich Village and its exceptional schools and park.

An ultra-modern 1-bedroom apartment located on the 10th floor at the heart of Deptford’s landmark Distillery Tower. With both Deptford Bridge DLR station and a 6-minute train to London Bridge within walking distance, this property is in an ideal Zone 2 location for work and leisure.

The apartment is in superb condition throughout and benefits from modern stylish décor, a spacious living room area with breath-taking views the City and a separate fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, electric hob, fridge/freezer, as well as storage space for other kitchen appliances.

The private balcony is an extension of the spacious bedroom and living room and also offers more views of the City.

The property is EWS1 A1 Certified (no cladding issues), has gas central heating, double glazing, a utility storage room off the hallway and is located on this popular development in the heart of Deptford village with great transport links and convenient bars/restaurants within walking distance.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Roomy and high-ceilinged one bedroom ground floor Victorian conversion flat of 610 square feet - with a generous basement, private front garden, and a glorious exceptionally-well-stocked private rear garden; which extends nearly 40 feet and has direct access (from the kitchen) and side access too. Chain free. Leasehold.

The flat works great as-is but also has very obvious potential to extend and create a two bedroom flat.

Ladywell’s village-style high street area and station are really close, as are delightful public green spaces. Walk five minutes to Ladywell Station, 10 to Crofton Park Station, and 15 to Brockley Station. You’re also just a mile from Lewisham DLR.

In the main shared front door and your own is straight ahead. Once in, first on your left you’ll find the eat-in kitchen of over 9 feet by nearly 13. Induction hob features here. To your immediate left on entering the kitchen you’ve a door to the big basement. A back door leads out from the kitchen to the garden.

The large front reception is accessed via the kitchen (double doors here) and boasts a big bay window and a characterful wood-panelled wall. Smart engineered oak flooring runs through this room and the kitchen.

From the hall, next on your left is a windowed bathroom with white suite and over bath shower, and at the end of the hall you’ll find the large double bedroom of over 15 feet by over 11 feet, and with a bay window to garden vistas.

The current owners have flexed their green fingers extensively and beautifully in the private front and back gardens - you're inheriting many treats. Plants, trees, flowers and fruits here include magnolia, avacado, cherry, apple, dansom, fig, plum, strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, blackcurrants, bay, ferns, lavender, lilies, daffs, snow drops, peonies and more!

For a bigger green space, Hilly Fields is really close - just a four minute walk. You’ve cityscape views, tennis courts, park runs, a little cafe, even a stone circle! Just lovely. Ladywell Fields, Horniman Gardens, One Tree Hill, Telegraph Hill’s parks and even Greenwich Park are all close enough.

Ladywell Road is your closest high street area with successful little independent businesses such as The Larder deli (the fresh bread here from multiple amazing bakeries is a good tip) and Meat Jon. Mamma Dough is great for pizzas, and The Ladywell Tavern is a strong local. Central Lewisham is handy for market, high street and charity shopping, and (we think) the best chippy in London!

Crofton Park and Brockley’s high street areas (walk down Adelaide Avenue) both have great spots: We like Brickfields (cocktails), The London Beer Dispensary, Brockley Brewery, The Rivoli Ballroom (event nights, live music etc. In an amazing setting), The Brockley Jack Studio Theatre and Chandos, as well as newcomers Jerome’s and Joyce. And Babur (fine Indian dining) is also a lovely independent offering. As are The Orchard and The Gantry.

detailedDescription:
This charming one bedroom apartment is located within the heart of the Blackheath Royal Standard and boasts its own private rear garden.

Internally the property briefly comprises a bright and airy reception room, a kitchen, a bathroom and a double bedroom. The property also boast plenty of storage including a private storage cupboard located externally.

The property is located within the heart of the Royal Blackheath Standard which offers an array of local shops, pubs, restaurants and an M&S Food Hall. For a weekend stroll you are perfectly placed for both Greenwich park and the open heath at Blackheath and excellent transport links are found close by including Westcombe Park Station, North Greenwich for the Jubilee Line and Greenwich for the DLR.

For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Blackheath Standard office today.

detailedDescription:
Unveiled to the SE26 market and enviably placed on a popular road off Sydenham high street, is this stunning four bed, two bath period house. The property benefits from a loft conversion and is well presented throughout.

Internally the house offers in excess of 1200 SqFt living space! The ground floor boasts a 12'6 x 11'6 reception room with bay window and an impressive open plan kitchen/diner with an island (providing direct access to a well kept rear garden). The first floor has two large doubles (14'8 x 11'4 & 12'7 x 11'3 respectively), a single bedroom and a modern three piece bathroom. The loft conversion creates a super spacious 18'6 x 17'2 bedroom with a private shower room.

Sydenham's extensive amenities are nearby including an array of high street shops and cafe's just moments from the property. Sydenham Station is also just 0.3 miles away, offering direct access into several main London terminals, including London Bridge in less than 20 minutes!

Contact Acorn Sydenham to arrange your viewing by appointment only!

detailedDescription:
Situated in the quiet residential area of Bromley is this 2-bedroom shared ownership apartment. With Sundridge Park and Grove Park stations within proximity and excellent bus routes, this makes this property the ideal location for work and leisure.

The property consists of 2 spacious bedrooms, an open plan livening room and kitchen great for entertaining friends and family, and a Juliet balcony that can be accessed from the reception room. The kitchen is equipped with storage space for an in-kitchen pantry, an overhead extractor and oven, gas hob and fridge/freezer. The bathroom is well maintained with a modern bathroom suite.

Further benefits include allocated parking spaces for 2 cars, Bromley schools within close reach and easily accessible via public transport, local shops, and Bromley town centre, the Glades shopping centre and leisure facilities are all within walking distance. The apartment is also within proximity from Grove Park station which is a 15-minute train into Central London.

A fantastic one-bedroom ground floor flat located on the borders of Hither Green & Catford making it an ideal home for a first-time buyer. The property is equidistant to Hither Green, Catford and Catford Bridge Station which offer frequent and reliable travel links into central London and is close by to the popular local amenities of Catford Town centre including many shops, restaurants and coffee shops. Spread across one floor, this well-maintained property offers great living space, featuring an open plan lounge/dining area, a generous sized bedroom and a modern kitchen and bathroom with a three-piece suite. Due to its clever design, the property is flooded with natural light and each room offers bright and spacious accommodation making it ideal for entertaining guests with the added benefit of access to a communal garden.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning four-bedroom period style house located on Bargery Road, a quiet street in the Culverley Green Conservation Area. The Culverley Conservation Area is one of South-East London's most desirable areas with wide tree-lined avenues of c.1890-1910 built homes. This property offers spacious and versatile accommodation and has many character feature making it an ideal family home. This Period home retains many of the best features you would want to see in a late C19th home having ceiling coving, feature fireplaces, and architectural joinery throughout. Spread across two floors this property consists of a generous lounge and dining room space, a modern kitchen with an integrated oven and overhead extractor hood, a large family bathroom, three spacious double bedrooms and a further nursery/ study room. The house also benefits from a separate utility room and storage rooms well as a vast loft for storage.

The property overlooks an impressive, well-maintained rear garden with large lawn space, making it ideal for entertaining and has private off-street parking. The solid wood floor extends across the ground floor from the main entrance hall and beautiful french doors open from the bright lounge into the rear garden. Located in a family dominated area where friendly local groups hold events throughout the year for a thriving Community. Commuter links from the twin Stations of Catford & Catford Bridge provide regular services to The City and West End as well as Thameslink services to Farringdon, St Pancras and North London.

detailedDescription:
An opportunity to purchase this unique two-bedroom character property located less than 10 minutes from Sydenham Station and benefiting from two off-road parking spaces and two private outdoor areas. Viewings highly recommended!

This modern, fully electric property has an excellent finish throughout and boasts more than 73 square metres of internal living space. The property comprises of a large open plan living and dining area with plenty of storage space and direct access to a galley style outdoor area.

The living and dining area are part of a Victorian conversion within a small leasehold development of two other flats above; however, the rest of the property is detached and isolated from any direct neighbours, making this a unique opportunity for privacy in London.

As well as two recently decorated double bedrooms the property also benefits from a ‘reading nook’ area that could be used as a small home office space The master bedroom has French doors which open out onto the well-tended private garden which benefits from total isolation with no overlooking properties. Behind the garden is a parking area with two off road spaces specified for the property in a safe location.

The property also comes with additional extras such as in-built kitchen appliances / Fitted blinds / usb plug sockets and bed-lights in the Master bedroom.

Location

The property is within a 5-minute walk of Mayo Park, a green flag certified area. Sydenham station, with connections to Shoreditch and London Bridge, is within a 10-minute walk and Penge East, with connections to Brixton and Victoria, is within a 15-minute walk. There are also easy transport links to Forest Hill, Crystal Palace, and Dulwich.

Lease Information

Tenure: Leasehold

Lease Length: 122 Years Remaining

Service Charge: £1168.80

Ground Rent: £250

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £475,000-£500,000. Located conveniently for Blackheath Village and Lewisham Station & DLR is this well-proportioned two double bedroom apartment with direct access to a superb south facing private garden.

The property is located on the ground floor of this small purpose-built block. Benefits include double glazed windows, wood flooring and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation comprises; entrance hall, living room with fireplace, attractive modern kitchen, two double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobes, and a modern bathroom. To the rear and with direct access from the living room is a large south facing private garden with lawn, patio, shed and flower beds.

This is a wonderful apartment and your earliest viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at .

The property is in a very desirable location and is perfect for the commute into the city with Blackheath Station only 0.5 miles away, Lewisham Station and DLR is 0.7 miles and Hither Green is 0.5 miles and close proximity to local shops and Sainsbury's at Lee Green. The popular open spaces of Manor House Gardens, (0.25miles), Blackheath Common, (0.6miles), and Greenwich Park, (0.9 miles), are all within a short walk. The Ofsted rated "Outstanding" St Margaret's Primary School is extremely close and the property sits in the catchment area for Thomas Tallis secondary school.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Built around 6 years ago in a style in keeping with neighbouring properties, this fantastic, 4 double bedroom, 2-bathroom house offers space, light and, with an energy rating of B, is energy efficient.
Arranged over 3 floors, the house has well-proportioned rooms, high ceilings, wooden floorboards downstairs and double-glazed sash windows. On the ground floor is an eat-in kitchen with ample storage and built-in appliances. At the rear is a 20ft reception room with bi-folding doors that lead seamlessly out to a decked area in the south-facing garden. There's also a handy cloakroom on this floor. Upstairs, on the first floor, are 3 double bedrooms along with a smart family bathroom. On the top floor is another double bedroom with an ensuite shower room.
The neighbourhood is a vibrant and friendly one popular among young professionals and families. Forest Hill station is around a 10-12 minutes' walk from where there are regular national rail trains into London Bridge. In addition, you can pick up the Overground from here towards east and north London meaning you can be in hip Shoreditch or Hoxton in around 20 minutes. You can also get to Canary Wharf easily by changing at Canada Water.
There's no shortage of places to go for a drink or an evening meal. Take your pick: The impressive Dartmouth Arms, the uber-chic Sylvan Post or Canvas and Cream to name but three. For good quality coffee and a bite to eat, head to St David coffee shop. And to work off those excess pounds there's Forest Hill Pools and leisure centre. A large Sainsbury's caters for most of your food shopping needs. There's also a butcher's that serves high quality free-range meat.
There are a number of good primary schools in the area the nearest being the Outstanding rated Kilmorie school.
The delightful Horniman Museum and Gardens with its array of quirky exhibits is great place to while away a Sunday afternoon.
features: ['Built around 6 years ago', '4 bedrooms', '2 bathrooms plus a cloakroom', 'Eat-in kitchen', '20ft reception room', 'South-facing garden', 'Double glazed sash windows']
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located midway between Honor Oak Park and Crofton Park stations, this extended, 4-bedroom house with a garage, requires some updating but offers great potential.
You approach the house through a front garden. Inside, there's a front room, a dining room through to an extended kitchen-diner, and a downstairs shower room. On the first floor are 3 bedrooms (2 doubles and a single) along with a family bathroom. The loft has been converted providing another bedroom. At the rear is a private, low maintenance garden.
Transport links into town could hardly be easier. Brockley station is a short walk away from where there are fast and frequent services into London Bridge in around 10 mins. In addition, you can pick up the London Overground towards Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington meaning that Canary Wharf is a mere 30-minute commute changing at Canada Water. Crofton Park station is also within easy reach for Thameslink service into Blackfriars and St Pancras.
For evening entertainment, there's no shortage of bars and restaurants to choose from. A couple of places of note include the Orchard (a friendly restaurant with a wine bar) and Brockley's Rock (an award-winning fish and chip shop). Coffee shops are plentiful including Browns and The Broca. You can pick up groceries from various supermarkets nearby.
As for green spaces, Hilly Fields is close by where there is a children's playground, café, enclosed picnic area, cricket pitch and 3 tennis courts. On Saturdays, pop along to the award-winning Brockley Market on Lewisham Way for fresh groceries and a bite to eat.
features: ['4 bedrooms', '2 reception rooms', 'Kitchen-diner', 'Within easy reach of Honor Oak Park or Crofton Park station', 'Private garden', '2 bathrooms']
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market with no onwards chain is this bright, spacious and enviably located one double bedroom flat.

The property is suitable for a first time buyer or Investor looking to add to their portfolio as it comes fully equipped.

The current owners have maintained the property to an excellent standard throughout meaning there is sure to be a lot of interest.

The property has stunning views that look out over the River Thames and Canary Wharf.

Internally, the property benefits from being fully refurbished and is clean and tidy making this suitable for those looming to conclude the purchase quickly.

All rooms are bathed in natural light and the large bedroom has direct access to a private sunny balcony that is a peaceful haven in which to escape the stresses of the day.

This property is in excellent condition and with such good links to transport meaning you could be in central London in less than 15mins!

This really is a stunning property that has to be viewed to be fully appreciated.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented throughout, 550 sq. Ft 2-bedroom flat - occupying the first floor of this attractive period property - comes with a share of freehold, a shared communal front garden, and an underlying lease of approx. 999 years. There may be a possibility of a purchase with no onward chain (to be confirmed).

The flat is tastefully decorated throughout and has a warm and homely feel with double glazing and central heating. The property offers two bedrooms, a bright and spacious double room and a good size single bedroom. It also offers a stylish family bathroom, and a stunning large reception room with an open plan high quality kitchen, recently renovated, which boasts smart white units and an integrated oven and hob.

Montem Road is a residential road, in a sought-after area, within walking distance to both Honor Oak Park and Catford. It is situated within easy reach of 4 stations meaning transport links into town could hardly be easier: Honor Oak Park, Forest Hill, Catford and Catford Bridge stations all provide fast and regular mainline services into central London and the City. In addition, from either Honor Oak Park or Forest Hill, you can pick up the London Overground for services to Shoreditch, Canada Water and Highbury and Islington.

You'll find a range of amenities in the centre of Honor Oak Park, Forest Hill and Catford including coffee shops, restaurants, a deli, a butcher's, gastro-pubs and several supermarkets. Restaurants of note in Forest Hill include the Dartmouth Arms and the Sylvan Post (both popular gastro pubs). In Honor Oak Park there is an award-winning Indian (Babur) and a delicious sough dough pizzeria (Mama Dough). In Catford, there's the Catford Constitutional Club (a hip gastro pub). For a post work drink, the Blythe Hill Tavern - which is a camra award winning pub - is nearby.

Green spaces are dotted all around with Blythe Hill Fields just up the road at the top of which are sweeping views of London's skyline.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An excellent opportunity to acquire this rarely available, newly-refurbished, three-bedroom semi-detached house situated on Woolacombe Road. Conveniently placed with easy access to the shopping facilities and amenities in and around Blackheath Village, Greenwich and Eltham, this property is the ideal location for work and play.

The house recently underwent thorough refurbishment from top to bottom to a high and polished standard, and has new carpets throughout. The property consists of a family bathroom; two double and one single bedrooms; two spacious reception rooms, great for entertaining family and friends; a separate kitchen equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, electric hob, and ample space for kitchen appliances. To the rear of the property is a large garden backing onto playing fields: Great for outdoor entertaining in hotter weather. There is also a brick garage, suitable for conversion to a home office or garden room.

The property has off-street parking and is within walking distance of several primary and secondary schools. For recreation, Blackheath, Greenwich Park and Shooter's Hill Woods are all nearby. The house is also within walking distance of Kidbrooke and Blackheath stations, which have frequent and direct services into Central London.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Must-see 2-bed duplexes in New Cross - why not book a viewing at The Scene?

This charming, low-storey development boasts beautiful apartments with stylish interiors, fitted kitchens with quality appliances and built-in wardrobes to the main bedroom. Benefit from spacious living areas complete with underfloor heating that help maximise thoughtful layouts, and large windows that let natural daylight flow into the home.

Double-bedrooms make it hard to choose which room will be your main bedroom, but the convenient en-suite in addition to the main bathroom makes that choice slightly easier.

A collection of homes and private balconies overlook the newly landscaped Charlottenburg Park – a recently developed outdoor space in the area with play areas and hard-surfaces for impromptu sports games. Wheelchair accessible homes are also available - please enquire for further details.

Local Area

Found between Deptford and New Cross, The Scene is perfectly placed within the humble surrounding of residential streets and nearby great locations such as Deptford Market Yard and Greenwich Park, and even more options further afield on bike including Shoreditch High Street and London Bridge. Discover more of the area in are local area video.

Travelling & Getting Around

In a highly accessible area, The Scene is minutes from New Cross station and Deptford station, making your journey into central London a little easier. Reach London Bridge within 5 minutes, Cannon Street station within 9 minutes and Canary Wharf in 12 minutes from Deptford Bridge Station. And for further afield travels, King's Cross St Pancras can be reached by rail in 22 minutes.^

Find Out More About The Scene

Service charge and bills are not included. Service charges on example unit are currently estimated at £179.

Brooklyn Building is a delightful one-bedroom apartment located on the first floor of a seven storey apartment block benefiting from a Juliet balcony, concierge service and gym with swimming pool. Available in Greenwich, the lease remaining on the apartment is 106 years.

There are good transport links with Deptford Bridge DLR station 440ft away, served by Docklands Light Railway linking to Canary Wharf and Lewisham Station both great spots for shopping, restaurants and bars.

Local amenities are located right next to the development along Blackheath Hill. For leisure and enjoyment, Broadway Fields is 0.2 miles away and Brookmill Park is 0.4 miles away. Venture further afield to the centre of Greenwich for the Cutty Sark National Maritime Museum or Greenwich park.


  • Nearest DLR station: Deptford Bridge (Zone 2).
  • Nearest Station: St Johns (London), Deptford Station and Greenwich National Rail.
  • Bus routes nearby: Bus routes 53,177,453 & N89 from Deptford Bridge Station (stop T).


The property located on the first floor comprises:


  • Entrance Hallway with large utility cupboard (containing washer/dryer) and entry phone system.
  • Living Room: Spacious lounge with lots of natural light, open plan kitchen and patio doors onto Juliet balcony. Engineered oak flooring.
  • Kitchen: White base and wall units with Manhattan marble worktop and tiled splashback. Integrated Zanussi appliances in excellent condition. Engineered oak flooring.
  • Bedroom One: Double bedroom with large floor to ceiling window and beige carpet.
  • Bathroom: White suite comprising panelled bath with shower over and glass shower screen, WC and hand washbasin with mirror over. Full height tiling around the bath. Extractor fan. Heated towel rail. White tiled flooring.
  • Outside: Juliet balcony, communal garden, gym and swimming pool and full concierge service.


What happens after I register my interest?

After registering your interest for a Peabody home, you will receive an email confirmation from us. The email will confirm what you need to do next to secure a property viewing which includes completing a financial assessment with a mortgage advisor and completing the Shared Ownership Application Form.

If you don’t receive this email within an hour of your registration, please check your spam or junk folders and set your spam filter to allow incoming emails from Peabody. If you still haven’t received the email after checking here, please contact and our team will be able to help you.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Set back from the road and positioned behind a large gravel drive this property benefits from ample off street parking and offers an abundance of ‘curb appeal’. You enter into a spacious hall with high ceilings, ornate cornicing and wooden floors, a theme that runs throughout most of the house. To the left are the two main reception rooms that are joined by interconnecting doors. Both rooms have feature fireplaces, high skirting boards and incredible decorative ceilings and cornicing. Furthermore, these rooms have impressive arched sash windows with original wooden shutters. Across the hall is a great study with a fireplace and built in cabinetry. At the end of the hall is the modern kitchen breakfast room which is made up of contemporary units with a stone work surface and central island with breakfast bar. Off the kitchen is a lovely half brick conservatory with two sets of French doors out to the garden. A WC and garage complete this floor. There are stairs down to the basement where you find a large utility room and a further room that would make a great gym/cinema room. On the first floor are three large double bedrooms, all of which have original fireplaces. There is an en-suite shower room with the main bedrooms and a large family bathroom with a free standing bath. On the top floor are three further double bedrooms, a bathroom and another room that is being used as a gym/store room. The rear garden is over 120ft long and is mainly laid to lawn with a large stone patio and is surrounded by mature trees and shrubs.

Kidbrooke Grove is a particularly popular location. It takes just a stroll of a few hundred yards to bring you to the heath. Beyond the heath in one direction, Blackheath Village provides a wonderful array of shops, bars and restaurants. In terms of transport, Blackheath Station provides regular services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Victoria and Charing Cross. Alternatively, one stop down the line at Lewisham Station, the DLR has regular services into Bank and Canary Wharf. Looking north across the heath is Royal Greenwich Park with Greenwich’s historic town centre found through the north gates.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A magnificent four double bedroom period semi detached home boasting accommodation of over 1500 sq ft and retaining many of its original period features including several fireplaces. Situated on a popular residential road within easy reach of both Lee and Hither Green train stations.

This stunning family home offers well proportioned accommodation throughout and has been lovingly modernised by the current owners and briefly comprises entrance hall, sitting room with log burner, dining room, spacious fitted kitchen/breakfast room, utility room and shower room. On the first floor there are four double bedrooms and bathroom. Externally there is an 95ft rear garden and well kept front garden with off street parking.

Both Lee and Hither Green train stations are within easy reach and offer regular services to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street. Blackheath Village is within a mile distance and has a wide range of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, cafés and a choice of highly rated schools by Ofsted, also a number of private schools like Colfe's School, Riverston School and Eltham College. There is plenty of green space provided by numerous parks which include Manor House Gardens.

Internal viewing highly recommended.

A truly stunning, two bedroom period property in the highly sought-after Telegraph Hill conservation area.

There is direct access to a south-east facing garden which is bathed in sunlight most of the day and is split with one other property.

detailedDescription:
This gorgeous two-bedroom Victorian first-floor flat (545 Sq. Ft) benefits from large south facing double glazed sash windows across the entire frontage. It comes with a share of freehold, shared garden (which on the title deed also has a private section including a storage shed), dedicated off-street parking spot.

It is finished to an incredibly high standard throughout and offers sensational living and entertaining spaces. There are two large double bedrooms, both having the added advantage of high ceilings, giving the flat a real sense of space. The property offers newly laid wooden floors throughout. The master bedroom includes a nice featured exposed brick wall.

The kitchen has been lovingly renovated and has a vast array of wall and base units and comes with built-in appliances. The kitchen effortlessly flows into the reception room, which is large enough for a dining table to host 6-8 guests and this room is ideal for modern day living. The living room and main bedroom benefit from an abundance of natural light and overlook Mayow park entrance which is literally at your doorstep!

The shower room, too, has been recently redecorated to a high standard with a large walk-in shower.

Location

Recreation Road is situated less than 0.2 miles from Sydenham High St, Sydenham Rail Station (London Overground & National Rail) and 100 yards from the award winning Mayow Park with tennis courts, apple orchard and café. The Horniman museum and gardens are close by with good exhibits, as is Crystal Palace park with its numerous amenities.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Delightful raised ground floor two bedroom conversion pad of 588 square feet, within New Cross’s Telegraph Hill Conservation Area. You are equidistant from New Cross Gate and Queens Road Peckham stations - walk 10 minutes to each. Parking is unrestricted on-street. Long leasehold.

In the shared hall and your own front door is set to your left. You open into a split-level hall. To your left is our favourite room: A large formal front reception of over 14 feet by over 12 feet. A large bay window (east-facing; so fabulous morning light here), block parquet flooring, built-in alcove storage and ceiling rose snd cornicing detail all impress.

The independent kitchen is adjacent - straight ahead from the front door. Units and finishes are high-end. We love the quartz worktop. Appliances are included in the sale (gas hob, electric oven, high-level microwave and under-counter fridge).

The bright windowed bathroom’s next - with a free-standing bath and an independent shower too.

The second (sash-windowed) bedroom is the next room of the tour; it’s over 8 feet by over 7 feet and takes a double. Built-in storage features. It will also work well as a luxury home office.

The master bedroom is set at the back of the apartment with leafy vistas. It’s over 10 feet each way and has built-in closets. Both bedrooms have pale carpets.

Once home to Victorian poet Robert Browning, this smart neighbourhood with London skyline views and wide and tree-lined streets was developed in the late C19th, replacing market gardens - owned by the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers (who controlled the development) - with high-standard housing. As well as the attractive architecture and fancy street lamps, what stands here now is a lovely, leafy community with good connections to central London alongside great schools and parks.

You’re set up great for rail travel. Bus routes also run day and night from nearby New Cross and Queens Roads.

Telegraph Hill’s Victorian Parks (Upper and Lower) are delightful, as is The Hill Station community cafe. There’s a weekly Saturday market held in the Lower Park, or nip down to Brockley Market (held on Saturdays in the Lewisham College Car Park - smarter than it sounds!).

Nunhead with its high street village feel is close: We like Ayres bakery and fc Soper wet fish shop, as well as El Vermut, The Old Nun’s Head and a new Kudu restaurant is coming soon.

We’re big fans of New Cross’s town centre too, with its pretty, historical buildings and growing number of pubs and eateries, including The Rosemary (organic Hungarian fayre), The White Hart, The Rose Inn, The Telegraph at the Earl of Derby and The Amersham Arms. Thanks largely to Goldsmiths University, New Cross attracts a cool creative and annually-refreshed crowd, and has a contemporary gallery and Curzon cinema – both open to the public. A big Sainsbury’s store by nxg Station is on hand for ‘the big shop’.

Deptford High Street is fairly close too for classy restaurants including Marcella and The Winemakers Club. And of course Peckham is also close for more options and summer rooftop bars.

Local schools are extremely well-regarded and include Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham College (covering 3-18), St James's Hatcham Church of England Primary (3-11) and Edmund Waller Primary (3-11). There is also a popular nursery on Kitto Road.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Must-see 1-bed apartments in new cross at the scene

With so much on offer, why not choose to view at The Scene this weekend?

This charming, low-storey development boasts beautiful apartments with stylish interiors, fitted kitchens with quality appliances and built-in wardrobes to the main bedroom. Benefit from spacious living areas complete with underfloor heating that help maximise thoughtful layouts, and large windows that let natural daylight flow into the home.

Double-bedrooms make it hard to choose which room will be your main bedroom, but the convenient en-suite in addition to the main bathroom makes that choice slightly easier.

A collection of homes and private balconies overlook the newly landscaped Charlottenburg Park – a recently developed outdoor space in the area with play areas and hard-surfaces for impromptu sports games.

Wheelchair accessible homes also available - please enquire for further details.

Local Area

Found where between Deptford and New Cross, The Scene is perfectly placed within humble surrounding of residential streets and nearby great locations such as Deptford Market Yard and Greenwich Park, and even more options further afield on bike including Shoreditch High Street and London Bridge. Discover more of the area in are local area video.

Travelling & Getting Around

In a highly accessible area, The Scene is minutes from New Cross station and Deptford station, making your journey into central London a little easier. Reach London Bridge within 5 minutes, Cannon Street station within 9 minutes and Canary Wharf in 12 minutes from Deptford Bridge Station. And for further afield travels, King’s Cross St Pancras can be reached by rail in 22 minutes.^

Buying With Shared Ownership

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 30 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

Find Out More About The Scene

Built in partnership with Sherrygreen Homes, The Scene is a vibrant new collection of apartments, duplexes and houses in New Cross (Lewisham).

Register your interest or speak to our helpful sales team to find out more.

About The Scene So

This stylish development of thoughtfully designed homes sits beside the newly landscaped Charlottenburg Park, and will boast modern interiors and high quality finishes throughout. From conveniently modern 1-bed apartments with stylish specifications to spacious 3-bedroom apartments with balconies; homes at The Scene are the ideal backdrop to London-living in an exciting and inspiring part of south-east London.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
A significantly larger than average 645sqft modern apartment which boasts a south-west facing balcony as well as a huge secluded terrace. It has plenty of storage, an open-plan living area and a spacious bedroom with en-suite bathroom. The vibrant Greenland Place development offers a 24-hour concierge service, gym and a gated communal garden. Chain free.

This wonderful property has the space to live in comfort, work from home and relax in the outdoors. The balanced and bright dual-aspect living area benefits from a sizable kitchen with integrated appliances and direct access to the terrace and balcony. The luxurious bathroom has both a separate bath and shower, and there is a fitted mirrored wardrobe and addition built-in storage in the bedroom.

Additionally there is underfloor heating throughout, full double glazing and superfast broadband is available through Hyperoptic. The concierge and gym are handily positioned a few meters away, while the green and gated residents’ garden is easily accessible from the same floor.

The Barratt-built Greenland Place is a superbly designed modern development with tree-lined avenues and excellent local amenities. Apart from the gym and concierge, you will find cafés, an Italian deli, a barber, yoga places and beauty salons. There is also both a Co-Op and Tesco Express.

Conveniently located within walking distance to Canada Water Tube Station (Jubilee Line & London Overground, Zone 2) and Surrey Quays Tube Station (London Overground, Zone 2). It's also a short walk to peaceful South Dock Marina and Greenland Dock, together with the Thames Path where regular riverboat services run into the city and across to Canary Wharf.

This side of the docks has seen significant investment with numerous other developments including Marine Wharf and The Timberyard. The Canada Water Masterplan will also positively impact the area and includes the first new high street in London for over 100 years!

The service charge is £2,228.63 per annum. The ground rent is £300 per annum and the lease has 990 years remaining.

Important Notice:
For each Lot, a contract documentation fee of £1,150 (inclusive of VAT) is payable to Barnard Marcus Auctions by the buyer. The seller may charge additional fees payable upon completion. If applicable, such fees are detailed within the Special Conditions of Sale. Buyers are deemed to bid in full knowledge of this.

The Guide Price quoted must not be relied upon by prospective purchasers as a valuation or assessment of value of the property. It is intended to provide purchasers with an indication of the region at which the reserve may be set at the time of going to press. The guide price may be subject to variation and interested parties are advised to make regular checks for variations and should be aware that the reserve price may be either below or above the quoted guide price.

Prospective purchasers should also be aware that the eventual sale price may be above or below the guide level dependent upon competition, and should therefore not presume the guide to be indicative of the final expected sale price or the price the property is available at.

When setting the guide price, the auctioneers have given consideration to the seller’s instructions in respect of their indicated reserve price at the time of instruction. The reserve price, (the level below which the property will not be sold), remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer. The guide price therefore, is intended to indicate the region at which the reserve price is intended to be set. The seller will confirm their final reserve price close to the auction date and if appropriate the auctioneers may adjust the guide price to reflect this.

address: The Harp Or Erin, New King Street, Deptford SE8
detailedDescription:
This chain free one bedroom flat offers an excellent location in the heart of the popular Deptford area.

Situated on the second floor, this property comprises of a good sized open plan kitchen / reception room, a bathroom and one double bedroom. This property would be a fantastic first time purchase or an excellent addition to an investors portfolio.

The apartment offers an enviable location between historic Greenwich and the up and coming Deptford. The popular Deptford High Street with its selection of quirky cafes, bars, and restaurants is on your doorstep as well as the trendy new Deptford Market Yard. Also, Greenwich Town Centre is within close walking distance with a range of amenities such as Greenwich Picture house, Greenwich Park, Greenwich Market and a number of popular bars and restaurants. Your transport needs are easily taken care of by Deptford Station and Deptford Bridge DLR Station. These stations provide fast and regular services to Central London and Canary Wharf.

detailedDescription:
Unveiled to the SE14 market is this 'bright & airy' split-level conversion flat, situated in one of South London's most up and coming area; New Cross, and close to the station!

The accommodation itself is incredibly tasteful with a characterful ambience, which is set across two floors, sitting circa 675sqft/62.7sqm of internal floor space. The layout comprises two spacious bedrooms, with the main bedroom benefitting from custom made built wardrobes, a stunning separate fully fitted white high gloss kitchen design, a well-proportioned bathroom suite, ample storage and a cosy reception room.

Within 0.3 miles there is a choice of three stations with multiple access into London Cannon Street, Bank, Canary Wharf via the DLR, London Bridge, Blackfriars, London St Pancras, and East London via the Overground line - to name a few; making this flat an ideal 'hotspot' for commuters! You are also very close to Deptford Market Yard which offers a collection of independent shops, restaurants and market space.

This property most definitely has to be seen in person to fully appreciate what is on offer and take in the amazing interior design.

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

detailedDescription:
Virtual reality tour and full HD video walk through - like and subscribe to our youtube channel for property updates

Guide price £350,000 to £400,000

Offering three double bedrooms and a private balcony as well as being on the top floor of the building with no one above you, the property offers great value compared to many other properties in the local area.

The property is approximately 800 sq ft which is the size of some small houses. Whilst there are three double bedrooms the rest of the living space is not compromised. As an example, the lounge is approximately 16.5 ft in length and offers access to the private balcony.

Other features of the property include:

• A separate kitchen
• A separate toilet and bathroom
• Several built in storage cupboards
• Windows in all rooms
• An entrance door at the end of the building so no one has to walk past the flat door to get to their own property
• Low ground rent of £10 per year
• Low yearly service charges of approximately £1100 per year that include building insurance, window cleaning, grounds maintenance, waste removal and general upkeep of the grounds and communal parts

Located on the Forest Hill side of Devonshire Road this property is located approximately 0.25 miles to the station.

Travels times from the station include:

London Bridge in approximately 15 minutes

London Victoria in approximately 35 minutes

And Canary Wharf in approximately 24 minutes

Forest Hill and Honor Oak are known well locally for boutique restaurants and shops.

Some of our favourites include Mama Dough (a sour dough pizza restaurant) and the award winning Babur Indian restaurant, Bona (also serving sour dough pizza) and several popular pubs.

There's also the popular Le Querce which is run by a Sardinian family serving traditional dishes.

Alongside this you'll find a selection of cafés and several leisure facilities including Forest Hill pools, gyms and many green spaces.

Attractions include Blythe Hill Fields which is approximately 0.8 miles away and is known by the locals for its recreational facilities. One such facility is the Trim trail which is an exercise trail.

You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:



The Horniman gardens and museum is another well-known local point of interest also found approximately 0.8 miles away. With regular events such as a farmers market and live music, we believe this will be of interest to many buyers.

You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens via the below link:



Surrounding the property there are some well renowned local schools which include:

Fairlawn Primary school rated Outstanding by Ofsted and in the top 10% of Ofsted rated schools

Stillness Infant school also rated Outstanding by Ofsted

Horniman Primary school rated Good by Ofsted and also in the top 10% of Ofsted rated schools

Dalmain Primary school rated Good by Ofsted and also in the top 10% of Ofsted rated schools

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price: £750,000-£800,000**

An opportunity to purchase this beautifully elegant three bedroom period home set within the much sought after Hatcham Conservation area.

The well presented accommodation on offer comprises entrance hall, a sizeable 25'0 through lounge with beautiful feature fireplaces and wood floor, a stunning fitted kitchen to the ground floor.

To the first floor, there is a landing giving access to three double bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom.

Externally there is a large well kept garden to the rear aspect of the property and patio area.

Camplin Street is a beautiful house and one that is sure to move quickly. PLease call Winkworth on to arrange an appointment to view.

Location:
Camplin Street is located in the heart of the Hatcham Conservation area. Within moments of this charming Victorian house are a choice of beautiful parks, an Ofsted Outstanding primary school and several further Outstanding schools all located within 1 mile. With a vast choice of local amenities including a farmer's market, lively bars, cafes and restaurants and with well-connected transport links including mainline stations and Overground it is possible to access the city and west end within 30 minutes.
title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This property boasts high ceilings throughout, as well as an abundance of period charm. At the rear of the flat is an extremely impressive open plan kitchen/reception room with a large south facing feature bay window that overlooks the beautiful communal garden. There is a feature fireplace and a modern kitchen that runs along one wall. The main bedroom has room for a double bed and enjoys built-in storage and ample light courtesy of a large wooden sash window. There is a smaller second bedroom that would be ideal as an office or cot room and a fully tiled bathroom with a walk-in shower. The property benefits from private parking and is moments from Blackheath Village.

The Paragon is ideally situated to take advantage of all that Blackheath has to offer. A short stroll along the Heath will take you to the village where you will find an array of boutique shops, bars, cafes, and restaurants. A walk across the Heath will bring you to Royal Greenwich Park with the historical town centre beyond. For those looking at transport, Blackheath Station provides regular services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Charing Cross and London Victoria.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Owners Comments:

What do you love most about your home?
It ticked all the boxes for us: A contemporary house but retaining period features that add character, with very high ceilings and large windows which let in lots of light, plus all the bedrooms are double-sized, no box room here. The space to work from home easily and with access to a garden, two parks and the open spaces of Blackheath have been very welcome over the last year.

What do you love about the area?
The two nearby parks (Manor House Gardens & Manor Park) are great, especially for kids. Both contain cafés and playgrounds. Blackheath Village is easily accessed, within walking distance, and our children go to school and nursery there.

Our road has the most amazing community spirit. We know most of our neighbours on Abernethy, and are close to our direct neighbours who are lovely and incredibly welcoming. There's a street whatsapp group, and at Christmas an 'advent calendar' of neighbourhood homes decorated their front windows each night in Dec.

Property Details:

Boasting stunning original features throughout including high ceilings, cornicing and period fireplaces, this wonderful Victorian family home with 35ft south-west facing garden and further potential for extension, subject to the normal planning consents.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with stairs down to a 22ft under-hall basement, access to guest WC, inbuilt storage, and stairs rising to the first floor. A doorway leads into the bright and spacious double length through reception room with engineered wood flooring, attractive shuttered bay window, two feature fireplaces (including wood burning stove to the front area), and double doors to the rear out onto the delightful garden. To the rear of the property, the beautiful open plan kitchen/diner is flooded with natural light from side aspect windows and bi-folding doors opening out onto the private garden.

The kitchen area itself comprises a high-quality range of matching wall and base units with stunning stonework surfaces incorporating inset double sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, integrated washing machine and dishwasher and further space for appliances. To the first floor, there are three well-proportioned bedrooms, including a generous front aspect master with period fireplace, inbuilt wardrobes and shuttered front aspect windows, plus a large family bathroom with modern full-sized bath suite and separate shower unit. To the second floor, there is a further double bedroom, plus a modern shower room with rear aspect.

The property is very conveniently located in a quiet and sought after residential road close to Hither Green station, with Lewisham station and DLR connections also within easy reach. The area provides an array of local amenities, with nearby Lewisham offering a wider variety of shops, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities. The area is well served by excellent local schools, including some with Ofsted Outstanding ratings, and lovely open spaces including beautiful Manor House Gardens and Manor Park. Fashionable Blackheath Village is also within easy reach.
Viewings of this lovely family home in an excellent location with enormous community appeal, are highly recommended.

Ideally placed for the commuter being just a 15 minute walk or so from Blackheath Village with it station, shops, restaurants, boutiques and delicatessens, it is also equidistant for Lewisham DLR and Zone 2 mainline rail station with a planned Bakerloo line extension also anticipated.

The current owners have refurbished the flat including a recently fitted engineered wood floor throughout, energy efficient radiators, new cooker/stove & washer/dryer, double glazing, a new fuse board and high pressure hot water cylinder. The flat also has an allocated parking space.

This flat would make an ideal first buy, investment purchase or pied à terre.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
Exceptionally spacious Victorian house with many period features and offered chain free. Situated on a quiet and leafy residential road near to Peckham Rye Park, One Tree Hill Nature Reserve and Nunhead Cemetery, the property benefits from two reception rooms with original doors dividing the rooms. The second reception has a lovely period fireplace. You have a breakfast room leading to the kitchen which has potential to knock through and extend. Upstairs you have 3 double bedrooms with the main bedroom measuring 17' x 14'. The house has lots of natural light and you also have the benefit of a spacious loft. The garden is laid to lawn with mature flower beds and an abundance of flowers and climbers including Jasmine, roses and many other plants and trees.

Walk to Zone 2 trains at Nunhead (15 minutes) and London Overground links at Brockley (15 minutes) or Peckham Rye (25 minutes). This gives you direct routes to London Bridge, Victoria, Clapham Junction, Canada Water, Shoreditch, Hoxton, Dalston Junction and Highbury and Islington. Local schools include much loved Ivydale Primary and two ofsted 'outstanding' Harris academy at Peckham Rye. Nunhead high street has excellent independent shops (a fishmongers, bakery, butcher) and there are some great places to eat and drink.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £700,000-£735,000. In this exceptional Heath fronting location very close to Blackheath Village and Greenwich Park, is this huge two double bedroom apartment with a private terrace, fantastic communal garden and off street parking.

The property is in good decorative order yet still offers scope to enhance. Features include; very high ceilings, period features, cornicing, stripped floorboards, fireplaces, sash windows and gas fired central heating.

Found on the first floor of this grand semi-detached period house, the accommodation comprises; a large entrance hall with storage cupboard, a good size kitchen and a bathroom. There is a superb 19'1 x 14'8 reception room with feature fireplace and direct access to a private terrace overlooking a vast communal garden. There are two double bedrooms including a huge 17'2 x 14'10 master with built in wardrobes and both with outstanding views directly over the heath and towards Greenwich Park. The property has the added benefit of being sold with a share in the freehold, chain free and an off street parking space to the font.

This is a wonderful home and viewing is highly recommended. Video tours can be seen at

Vanbrugh Terrace is a highly prestigious location directly fronting the Heath. An outstanding location to take advantage of local amenities in almost all directions. Walking south, just 0.45 miles, you will arrive in Blackheath village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and farmers market giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. 0.55 miles to the northwest you will find the historic Greenwich town centre and Royal Greenwich Park is just 218 metres away. Finally, 0.39 miles to the east is Blackheath Standard, with daily conveniences including M&S Food Hall. Blackheath Station, Westcombe Park Station and Maze Hill Station are all just a short walk. With the DLR within easy reach from Greenwich.
