title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

If this large, 3/4 bedroom duplex apartment in Sydenham was nothing but an empty shell, it would still be a pretty interesting place, but it isn't; it's so much more than that.

Actually, it's the very definition of a unique property.

Over the past 17 years, Mark and Kate have transformed its interior into a captivating work of art. Scouring junk shops, jumble sales and even skips, they've amassed collections of almost every conceivable kind of domestic goods: From lockers to luggage, kitchen utensils to cabinets, nothing has escaped their critical, creative gaze. The result is an eclectic mix of periods and styles, unified by one simple rule: Nothing in here is new. After all, if everything you're ever going to need has already been made, why not?

The critical thing to highlight though is the size. It's Victoriana on a grand scale, four bedrooms, across first and second floor with a private ground floor entrance. Theres also a private, hidden garden backing allotments. And a small point but one worthy of a mention - parking. The building sits an a treelined avenue with no parking restriction, something of a rare treat in London these days.

Crucially, this is no mere time capsule or homage to recycling, but a series of carefully curated rooms where everything works - and works together.

"It's a bit like walking in to a three dimensional collage, " says Mark. "and people seem to love it. When we've opened the place up to visitors during Dulwich Festival, they stay for hours."

There's no doubt that such an idiosyncratic home isn't to everyone's taste, but for the visually aware and curious it's a feast for the eyes. Even the garden shed has been transformed into a space that part workshop, part showroom.

As estate agents love to say, viewing is essential. For once, they're absolutely right.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Big and beautiful four bedroom maisonette of 1515 square feet (not a typo - it’s massive!), with a private part-walled west-facing garden of circa 50 feet, a Freehold-share, a utility room, and its own front door.

Taking the upper floors - with your entrance at raised ground floor level - it’s one of just two homes within a tall Victorian townie on one of Brockley Conservation Area’s principal streets; the top part of which connects with gorgeous Hilly Fields.

Parking is currently unrestricted on this and neighbouring streets. Walk just a few minutes to St Johns Station (eight minutes to London Bridge), and 15 to Brockley Station (with Overground in addition to regular rail services). And Brockley Market - a fabulous foodie one which runs on Saturdays 10am-2pm - is but a three minute walk from your door.

Your front door is up a few steps at raised ground level. The wide original front door is a pleasingly-grand welcome to the high-celinged hall - which has plenty of space for coats, shoes, bicycles etc.

Follow the hall down and you reach a handy utility room (complete with pocket door to a neat windowed guest w.c.); from here the back door provides the route out to your dreamy, mature, pro-landscaped garden. The wisteria here over the natural al fresco dining area is amazing! The garden is surrounded by more gardens - giving you a great sense of space.

Up to the first floor and to the front of the building you have a really spacious pale-carpeted reception room of over 19 feet by over 12 feet. A central fireplace (with marble surround) and custom-made alcove bookshelves further impress. Two sash windows deliver delightful leafy vistas.

Adjacent is the wooden-floored eat-in kitchen - of over 13 feet by over 12 feet - with modern fitted units to three walls (loads of space for all your kitchen bits and food supplies) and a large west-facing sash window.

Up to the second floor and you’ve got two double bedrooms (of over 12 feet by over 10 feet, and over 12 feet by over 11 feet) and a large single bedroom (of over 10 feet by over 7 feet) - all with stripped floors - plus the property’s bathroom, which has ceramic wall-tiles and traditional-style sanitary ware and fittings; including an over-bath shower.

Up proper stairs to the third floor and you’ll find your fourth and final bedroom (developed under the property’s current ownership) with two skylight windows. The bright room works equally well as a home office, hobby room or home gym. Generous and easily-accessible eaves storage is up here too.

We’ve mentioned your two closest stations. It’s also an easy walk to New Cross, Lewisham and Deptford DLR stations. You’re well-placed for buses as well - with Lewisham Way at the foot of the street.

This is such a pretty, leafy, well-connected spot. You have a Brockley postcode (SE4) but you’re close to SE8, SE14 and SE13: You can enjoy all four therefore.

The Talbot pub is a nice local. Middleton coffee shop is a good tip for fantastic coffee, pastries and brunches, and do check out Chicha (serving vibrant Peruvian street food) and Le 5 Terre (offering fresh homemade pasta and sauces).

Brockley has strong independent restaurants such as The Orchard and l'Oculto Cocina and cool cocktail bars: Brickfields, Joyce, and you’ve got Brockley Brewery of course.

The Deptford High Street area - including Deptford Market Yard - is searingly-trendy these days, with bars, night spots, cafes, restaurants and breweries. We particularly rate Marcella, the Tapas Room, Isla Ray’s, Stockton and Villages. Deli X is great for fresh loaves, coffee and posh deli things.

Central New Cross is close, with Curzon cinema and contemporary art gallery within the Goldsmiths campus (both open to the public), plus a great variety of pubs; we like The Amersham Arms there opposite nx Station. Meze Mangal (further down Lewisham Way) serves up good value Turkish grub.

Central Lewisham’s handy (just over half a mile) for mall shopping and markets, plus Sparrow restaurant and The Model Market (street food heaven!).

Green space? Stroll to Hilly Fields in seven minutes, or walk about half an hour for Greenwich Royal Park. You’re also close to lovely Ladywell Fields.
title: 4 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Set in this delightful private gated mews, is this spacious three bedroom, three bathroom, two reception room modern townhouse with a garage, conservatory and pretty garden, located close to the heath and Blackheath Royal Standard and sold chain free.

The property is in good decorative with sound proofed double glazed sash windows, solid oak flooring, air ventilation system, ample storage and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation is arranged over three floors and comprises; a large kitchen, dining room, conservatory and downstairs WC to the ground floor. The first floor boasts a large second reception room, (which could serve as a fourth bedroom if required), and a double bedroom with built in wardrobe and ensuite shower room. The top floor offers a fantastic master suite with large bedroom, built in wardrobes and a modern ensuite shower room, a third bedroom, that takes a double bed, and a modern family bathroom. To the rear of the property is a lovely 30ft garden with feature rear wall and timber framed greenhouse. The property also has a generous garage and an off street parking space in front.

This is a superb and versatile home and your immediate viewing is essential. There is no chain. Virtual tour can be seen at .

Belvedere Mews is a private gated development comprising of just 15 homes and located at the end of Langton Way, a sought after private lane just off the Heath. It is very convenient for transport links being 0.89 miles from Blackheath Station and Westcombe Park stations 0.62miles, buses for Greenwich (DLR) and North Greenwich (Jubilee Line), 1.7 miles. Blackheath Common (0.3 miles) and Greenwich Park (0.58 miles) are both just a short walk away, and the array of independent shops at Blackheath Standard are within 200 yards. Blackheath Village with its large range of restaurants, bars and boutique shops is only 0.8 miles. The property is within walking distance of several sought-after schools including Halstow, Blackheath High, Blackheath Prep and Pointers.

The popular open spaces of Blackheath Common, Greenwich Park and Manor House gardens are all within a short walk.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Boasting a sought-after location on the prestigious Dulwich Estate, this beautiful townhouse property offers bright and spacious accommodation with modern interiors throughout. Accommodation comprises an entrance hall with access to a guest cloakroom and stairs rising to the first floor, leading into an inviting open plan kitchen/diner with access onto the delightful private garden, and ample space for relaxing, dining and entertaining. The kitchen area, with access to a useful utility room which also links the front aspect garage, comprises a comprehensive range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces and central island/breakfast bar, incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for
appliances. On the first floor, there is a beautiful full-width reception room with doors out onto a private terrace with views over the garden, the communal parkland beyond, and Dulwich Woods. The first floor also accommodates a generous double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobes and a family bathroom. To the second floor, there are a further three bedrooms. The master bedroom enjoys wonderful views to the rear, as well as a dressing room and an en-suite bathroom. The property is enviably located within easy access of local bus routes connecting Sydenham Hill, Sydenham, Forest Hill and Gypsy Hill stations with fast and frequent services to Victoria and London Bridge. Nearby Sydenham, Crystal Palace and East Dulwich offer a wide range of shops, restaurants, cafés and amenities. The wonderful open spaces of Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham Woods and Dulwich Woods are all also within easy reach, as well as, slightly further afield, beautiful Dulwich Park in the heart of Dulwich Village.
Viewings are highly recommended.

What do you love most about your home?
I love the kitchen - it has a great inclusive feel about it which makes it a very social space. I love the living room with its balcony and great views of London. The house is a well-designed space with a fairly plain exterior and a few surprises on the inside!

Why are you moving?
We're moving to Wales as I want to go home to live after nearly 40 years in London and also to be near our daughter & her family.

What do you love about the area?
Great area - near Crystal Palace Park & Horniman Museum & Gardens - some good eating places in both Crystal Palace & Forest Hill, all within walking distance. Our road - Woodsyre - is a good community - friendly and supportive and we are part of a communal Green area owned by the Dulwich Estate and next to Sydenham/Dulwich Woods. Good parking space outside our house, useful bus routes & 10 minutes walk to Sydenham Hill station.

The Modern Way To Move
Estate agency is stuck in the past, Nested's mission is to empower people to make the move they want, when they want. We're the first estate agent using live data to keep you informed about your performance so you can achieve the best sale price for your home. We even offer a cash advance so you can move when you want, even before you sell. Nested put you in the position of a chain-free buyer, giving you the power to negotiate a better price on your new home. Along with our excellent agents who help with your negotiations, we typically help save up to 5% on your new home. With over 450 homeowners helped since 2016, get in touch to find out how we can help you sell smarter.

detailedDescription:
A stunning three double bedroom, Edwardian home with west facing garden, located within close proximity of good transport links, green open spaces and a wealth of shopping facilities.

Offering 1,237 sqft of accommodation over two floors, the property comprises a through reception, a charming bespoke kitchen dining room opening onto the rear garden with reclaimed brick patio area, well maintained lawn and beds. Upstairs are three double bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is potential to extend further. (stpc)

Homecroft Road is an attractive road, benefiting from excellent transport links including Penge East and Sydenham with services to London Bridge and London Victoria, close proximity to green open spaces including Crystal Palace Park and Alexandra Recreation ground, as well as a variety of restaurants, coffee shops and pubs. Unveiled to the SE4 market is this unique first floor studio conversion flat, that is housed within this stunning Victorian brick façade building and benefitting from no onward chain!

Geoffrey Road itself is an incredibly well known road within the local community and connects you from SE4 to SE14. Brockley Station is under a four minute walk away (according to Google maps) and offers superb links into London Victoria & London Bridge. The station also serves the East London Overground Line which has four trains per hour linking you to Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington via Shoreditch High Street.

The accommodation for a studio is very spacious, surpassing 550sqft/51.2sqm of floor space, all of which has been freshly redecorated throughout. The first floor comprises a spacious studio room, with a separate kitchen and a well-proportioned bathroom. The upper floor consists of a loft room.

Sure to attract a wide variety of buyers, be quick to view as if history is anything to go by in this pocket of SE4, these highly requested period residences do perform very well.

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: Launching Saturday 19th June. Sat proudly on this popular residential street is this charming 3 -bedroom, 1930s mid terrace family home with a well maintained private rear garden. The house boasts plenty of well-proportioned living accommodation with double glazing throughout and offers potential to convert the loft (subject to consent). Parbury Road is located moments from all the convenient amenities the high street has to offer and Honor Oak Park station (within 210 metres!) offering excellent connections to London Bridge and on the Overground. The front of the house has an appealing façade with traditional curved bay windows on the first and second floor and a lovely front door that still retains the original stain glass. A walled front garden shields the house from the street with a path leading to the front porch. Upon entry you are welcomed by wooden framed stain glass double doors that lead into the entrance hall which has tiled floors. The staircase leads upward with storage cupboard underneath. The front reception room is a cosy formal sitting area which has carpeted floors. There is a feature fireplace with a wooden surround, high ceilings and the room is illuminated with natural light from the curved bay window. This front lounge area has been opened to the rear reception room which is being used as a dining room. This room has wood effect flooring and offers direct access to the garden through double glazed French doors. The kitchen is at the back of the house, adjacent to the dining room with an open hatch connecting the two rooms. It has Terracotta tiled floors and a good amount of base units with a Terracotta tiled worktop and splash back to match the floors. The hob is within the worktop with an extractor above it and the sink sits neatly under a window looking out to the garden. There is a patio door to the side which offers direct access to the garden. The garden is a good size, approximately 38ft long (11.58m) and has been well maintained by the current owner. There is a patio area nearest to the house which is perfect for al fresco dining on a summers evening, beyond this is a step up to a lawn which is surrounded by borders of mature plants and shrubs. At the far end of the garden is a shed. Upstairs on the first floor are three bedrooms, all of which have carpeted flooring. The two larger rooms are similar sized doubles, both have nice feature fireplaces. The third bedroom is a smaller double located at the front of the house above the hallway. The family bathroom on this floor is well proportioned, there is a bathtub with a shower above and a toilet accompanied by a wash hand basin. There are two frosted windows that allow for natural light and ventilation. The loft has potential to be converted subject to the necessary consents but for the time being is very useful storage. Parbury Road is located in the heart of Honor Oak Park and very popular among young families, it is a quiet residential street made up of similar family homes, close to some highly rated primary schools such as Stillness School which is the nearest within 260 metres. The local train station is very convenient with regular services to London Bridge and Overground connections. The area’s amenities include an array of excellent cafes, bars and restaurants as well as good places for local shopping offered by Sainsburys and a local deli. Green open spaces surround the area such as One Tree Hill, Blythe Hill Fields and the popular Horniman gardens with its famous Museum.
title: 3 bed property for sale

detailedDescription: Launching Saturday 19th June. Beautifully styled 3 bedroom Victorian half house, refurbished to a high standard throughout with plenty of period features, located on this very popular, quiet residential street close to Honor Oak Park station. The house has a fashionable dark blue/grey façade, complimented by detailed white masonry around the sash windows and arched front doorway. The property is set back from the street protected by a walled front garden that shields it from the street. Upon entry, the ground floor has a front reception room which retains many period features such as high ceilings with cornicing, original exposed wooden floorboards, a feature fireplace and a square bay with sash windows, furnished with plantation shutters. The original timber flooring runs seamlessly through the entrance hall and into the dining room at the rear. The staircase leads upward from here and there is also a handy storage cupboard under the stairs that houses the utility meters. The dining area has a patio door at the back that offers direct access to the garden. The kitchen is located off the dining area and has been fitted with plenty of white wall and base mounted units on either side of the room, with a white metro tiled splash back and a solid wood worktop. On one side of the room there is a 4-ring gas range cooker with an extractor above, on the opposite side of the room is a butler sink with mixer tap that sits neatly under the window looking out to the garden. Underfoot are black slate floor tiles. The charming garden has been beautifully landscaped to create a nice low maintenance space. There is a grey tiled pathway surrounded by slate shingle closest to the house. The pathway leads to a decked area at the back which is perfect for al fresco dining. The whole garden is bordered by horizontal slatted fencing and raised planters that are full of mature plants and shrubs. There is also a good size garden shed that has electricity connected and where the current vendors keep their dryer. Upstairs on the first floor is a family bathroom which has been decorated in fashionable white metro tiles surrounding the bath with shower above. There is a contemporary style wash hand basin with vanity unit, a toilet and a heated towel rail. There are two bedrooms on this floor, the larger double occupies the whole front width of the house, it offers has high ceilings, a feature fireplace and two sash windows in a square bay that is furnished with plantation shutters. The other bedroom is at the back of the house overlooking the garden. This is a very interesting room as its divided into two areas, a raised area as you enter and a lower area for sleeping. Both of these areas have windows looking out the garden and are furnished with shutters. The room is well set up for a child’s bedroom, as its currently being used, but it could also make a good study. It also has the added benefit of extra loft storage above the lower level.Upstairs the loft has been cleverly converted to maximise space. There is a large double bedroom which has skylights at the front of the house and a window to the rear offering plenty of natural light. The luxurious family bathroom has been elegantly fitted, sympathetic to the Victorian style of the house. There is a lovely roll top bathtub that sits on painted exposed floorboards, accompanied by a Victorian style toilet and a contemporary wash hand basin that sits on a wooden table with shelving beneath. A double glazed window offers natural light and ventilation. Bovill Road is approximately 7 mins walk to Honor Oak Park station where there are regular services to London Bridge (around 15mins) as well as London Overground services to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington. The trendy high street boasts a range of independent shops, cafes, bars, a deli and several highly-recommended restaurants. Nearby green leafy open spaces can be found at Blythe Hill Fields, One Tree Hill and Horniman gardens all offering fantastic views of the London Skyline.

address: Woolstone Road, Forest Hill, London SE23
detailedDescription:
An attractive 1930's 4 bedroom family house located on Woolstone road, approximately 0.6 miles from Forest Hill town centre. Conveniently located in a quiet residential area with plenty of amnesties close by such as cafes, shops and a great school. This semi-detached home benefits from a rear extension and garage, as well as a converted loft space. The extended garden offers a generous patio, raised flower beds and grass lawn. At the rear of the garden there is a single car garage which can be accessed from the roadside.

It has been lovingly modernised with a spacious open plan kitchen /diner and reception room, with beautiful bi-fold doors that opens the kitchen out into the extended garden. The kitchen has extensive worktop space for food preparation, as well as a large kitchen island complete with a hob, overhead extractor fan and integrated wine fridge. There is plentiful space for dining alongside the workspace, the skylights and bi-fold doors amplify and elevate the space. To the front of the ground floor is a welcoming reception room, with a stunning fireplace fitted with a wood burner, this is a modern yet cosy room ideal for lounging.

Upstairs are 2 generously sized double bedrooms, and a third single bedroom. The master bedroom has 2x built in alcove wardrobes which provides ample storage space. All bedrooms have large double glazed windows. The stunning modern bathroom is tiled throughout, with a large heated towel rack, vanity mirror and floating base unit with sink basin. There is a very large bathtub with a grand showerhead and glass shower curtain.

On the second floor is a spacious 4th bedroom complete with shower room. The double bedroom is brought to life with the sloping ceilings and Velux windows, providing fantastic views of the local area. The shower room has beautiful white marble tiling and a wonderfully sized walk-in shower.

**Guide Price: £425,000-£450,000**

An opportunity to purchase this beautiful, two bedroom Victorian conversion, set within a highly sought-after location in Upper Sydenham.

Located on the first floor of a period mansion block, with a well-kept lawn area at the front, the well-presented accommodation on offer comprises, communal entrance, private entrance, leading to a 14'4 ft lounge with cast-iron fireplace, separate fitted kitchen and a three-piece bathroom, as well as two good-size bedrooms.

This flat is offered in exceptional condition, with wooden floors and sash windows throughout and viewing is highly recommended.

The property is also offered as a share of the freehold.

Please contact Winkworth on to arrange an appointment to view.

Location:
Within a few moments of this property is an abundance of independent shops, bars, cafes and restaurants in Kirkdale and Forest Hill high streets; both a short walk away.

Neighbouring Sydenham is also a short distance, with a further array of shops and amenities.

Nearby there is a great choice of green spaces and parks, with the beautiful Sydenham Wells Park just a short walk away and the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens also nearby. Sydenham Woods, with its abundance of walking trails is within the vicinity, and a short bus ride will take you to the vast Crystal Palace park.

There are great connections for commuters across the capital, with the Overground approximately 10 minutes' walk away, connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away, as well as regular London Bridge and London Victoria services. You also have the main line service to London Victoria from Sydenham Hill in approximately 18 minutes.

As well as being highly desirable for young professionals, the area is popular with families due to a superb choice of Ofsted Outstanding schools, including Eliot Bank Primary and Kelvin Grove just a short walk away.

detailedDescription:
This 1-bedroom second floor modern flat is ideally placed for Ladywell station, local amenities and 2 lovely parks.
Located on a no-through road that leads onto Ladywell Fields, the flat is part of a well-maintained, private apartment block with allocated parking at the front and a communal garden at the rear. It comprises of a double bedroom, bathroom, a large reception room, opening onto the kitchen area which includes an integrated oven and hob.
Ladywell is a vibrant, cosmopolitan area popular among young families and professionals. It has a village-like feel with a high street made up of a variety of independent shops. There's a French bakery/patisserie which serves delicious cakes and lunchtime snacks. The deli is great place to pick up groceries including organic fruit and vegetables. The popular local butcher's sells traditional and rare produce. Nearby restaurants of note include Mama Dough, a hip sour dough pizzeria, and the Ladywell Tavern, a gastro-pub which serves craft beers.
Ladywell station is a 5-minute walk with fast and frequent services into central London. In addition, Lewisham DLR is 1 stop away with access to Canary Wharf and the City. Ladywell Fields at the end of the road and this leads onto the scenic Water Link way, ideal for a Sunday afternoon bike ride or stroll. Hilly Fields is also nearby and plays host to a regular farmers' market. The area also boasts various sporting facilities including an athletics track, tennis courts in Ladywell Fields and Hilly Fields, and a swimming pool and leisure centre near Lewisham station.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Viewings from Saturday 19th June 2021.

With an impressive architectural treatment (by excellent local practice; Gruff), this three bed, two bath bay-fronted Victorian terrace packs a mighty punch and measures in at 1459 square feet - excluding the large and useful cellar (there's London-roof loft storage too). The accompanying pro-landscaped garden is well-established and extends over 50 feet.

Find the handsome home on a quiet residential side street within Hatcham Conservation Area, really close to Haberdashers' Aske's htg Primary School, and within east walking distance of ha Secondary.

Walk just seven minutes to New Cross Gate Station: Fare Zone 2, one stop to London Bridge, on the London Overground network, and next to a big Sainsbury’s store. Parking is currently unrestricted on the street.

A neat front garden with well-tended hedging sets the house back from the pavement. Once in your front door, you’ve got the traditional double reception situation happening to your right. These rooms are over 14 feet by over 11 feet, and over 11 feet by over 10 feet. Stripped floors, fireplaces and custom-made alcove storage tick boxes from the off. (Should it suit your setup better, either or both of these rooms could work as full-time or occasional guest bedrooms instead.) Bespoke double-glazed French doors open from the second reception to a small courtyard space, where you’ll note a door opens to here from the kitchen too.

At the end of the hall you’ve got a custom-made built-in shoe and coat storage system, plus cellar access - to your left, and a pocket-doored and windowed shower room to your right. This has brick-style tiling and contemporary sanitary ware and fittings.

The main event awaits at the foot of the hall: The huge kitchen/dining room/rear reception - which stretches over 27 feet by over 15. Wall-spanning folding doors deliver you to the paved area of the gorgeous garden (and also provide a delightful and private view from the house). To the floor you’ve got high-grade and hardest-quality Italian designer porcelain floor tiles by Settecento (and underfloor heating). The fitted kitchen is a smart German-made affair with Quartz silestone worktops. Neo-conservation rooflights are from the Rooflight Company. It's all very classy as well as practical.

Up to the first floor and from the half-landing you’ll first find a modern skylit bathroom (with contemporary sanitary ware, lots of fixed storage, and an over bath shower), and a large stripped-floored double bedroom to garden views; of over 9 feet by nearly 14 feet.

From the main landing you’ve got a good second double bedroom to your left - with painted boards to the floor, a slim alcove closet plus built-in bookshelves, and a big sash window onto garden vistas. Finally you have the twin-sashed stripped-floored master bedroom to the front of the house. This is over 16 feet by over 11 feet. Both of these bedrooms have pretty Victorian feature fireplaces.

The area? Hatcham ca is a calm residential pocket of south London, little-known to most. From 1614, the land was owned by the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers. When the manor house (named 'Hatcham Park’) was demolished circa 1840, terraced homes were permitted to be built. Rescued from proposed demolition in the seventies(!), Hatcham Conservation Area was designated by Lewisham Council in 1990.

Some more local history... ‘Hatcham’ derives most likely from Anglo Saxon; meaning ‘a clearing in the woods’, and reputedly, Charles Dickens wrote ‘Our Mutual Friend’ in The Five Bells pub (1864-5). And house-specific history: The building once ran as a printing press in the early C20th. It was known as 'The Billington Press'.

Stroll (past further handsome Victorian housing stock) just eight minutes to New Cross Gate Station. There are also plenty of day and night bus routes within a short walk of the house to Elephant & Castle and beyond, or to Peckham, Deptford, Greenwich, Brockley and Lewisham.

Local eateries and drinkeries of note include The Rosemary (Hungarian, organic, delicious), and The Rose Inn. And Smokey Jerky is a must-know-about.

Nip down to neighbouring SE15 for others - including Kudu, Peckham Cellars, Peckham Bazaar, Ganapati (who also deliver), Artusi, Peckham Levels, Miss Tapas, Forza Wine, Levan, The Coal Rooms and Mr Bao.

Deptford has quite the gastronomic offering now too - with Marcella, Winemakers, The Tapas Room and a warm European vibe, with a choice of hip hangouts in Deptford Market Yard and surrounds. Deptford also has a cool theatre: The Albany.

New Cross is home to Goldsmiths University with a Curzon cinema and a contemporary art gallery - both tucked off the main road on campus, but very much open to the public.

Local parks include Telegraph Hill (Upper and Lower, with Saturday Farmers’ Market, or hop on a bus down to Brockley Market) and Fordham Parks. Grab your fresh loaves from Blackbird Bakery by qrp station, or at Ayres on nearby Nunhead Lane. While you’re in Nunhead, check out Soper’s wet fish shop and El Vermut and Mother Superior bottle shops.

Kids or thinking of? Your most local primary schools are Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham Temple Grove (which feeds to the secondary school based in New Cross’s other Conservation Area), Edmund Waller and Kender. Deptford Green is a second well-regarded local secondary.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
The current owners have thoughtfully renovated and reconfigured the property to the highest of standards to create a wonderfully versatile space. Stairs take you up to a spectacular open plan living space. The room is steeped in light from the windows, floor to ceiling sliding doors and the large atrium roof light. At one end is the bespoke shaker style kitchen with central island, breakfast bar and utility area. Attractive wood block flooring runs through to a dining area where there is an original fireplace and a freestanding column radiator. Finally, is the large living room with doors out to a great private roof terrace.

A contemporary staircase brings you up to the next floor where you will find two double bedrooms and a jack and jill bathroom with a roll top bath and walk-in shower. The principle suite is on the top floor and consists a double bedroom, dressing area and a modern en-suite shower room.

Blackheath Village is within very close proximity and offers an array of shops, bars and restaurants. Beyond the village you will find the open expanse of the heath itself, which is a jewel of South East London. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting into town with regular services in to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR service provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located in the heart of the Brockley Conservation area, this 2-double bedroom split level second & third floor flat maisonette, which is well presented, has its own private entrance and provides ample living accommodation. Offered for sale with the benefit of no chain.

The property offers a large reception room with doors leading to a private balcony, a separate modern fitted kitchen with integrated oven, hob and extractor fan, 2 double bedrooms and a family bathroom. It also benefits from gas fired central heating and double glazing.

Wickham Road is a broad, tree-lined street in the heart of the Brockley Conservation area. The area itself is a vibrant, cosmopolitan one, popular among young professionals and families.

Transport links into town couldn't be easier. Brockley station is a short walk away from where there are fast and frequent services into London Bridge in around 10 mins. In addition, you can pick up the London Overground towards Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington meaning that Canary Wharf is a mere 30-minute commute changing at Canada Water. You also have Crofton Park station for Thameslink service into Blackfriars and St Pancras.

For evening entertainment, there's no shortage of bars and restaurants to choose from. A few of places of note include the Orchard (a friendly restaurant with a wine bar) and Brockley's Rock (an award-winning fish and chip shop). Coffee shops are plentiful including Arlo & Moe, Fred's and Browns of Brockley.

Hilly Fields is close by where there is a children's playground, cafe, enclosed picnic area, cricket pitch, and 3 tennis courts. It also hosts a regular farmers' market as well as various events throughout the year.

detailedDescription:
Simply Stunning! This spacious and well-designed premium apartment is offered with a Share of Freehold and boasts beautiful decor which cannot fail to impress. Set in established gardens in the leafy area of Upper Sydenham, this immaculate purpose-built block is close to the local amenities and transport links, and a stone’s throw to Crystal Palace Park.

This apartment is an outstanding example of design at its best, with great attention to detail. Features include a large 16'9" reception room which leads to a contemporary kitchen with granite worktops and top spec appliances, Neff Microwave / oven combination, Neff Slide & Hide oven, integrated fridge freezer & dishwasher plus an electric waste disposal.

There is also ample clever storage and a separate utility area with white storage cupboards and a solid oak countertop. Oak hardwood flooring is laid throughout the property, and there is a generous luxury bathroom. Here you will find a stunning large walk-in shower with rainfall shower head, under floor heating, granite countertop and a heated mirror. Other benefits in this apartment include high end LED lighting & concealed lighting, a Nest thermostat, garage en bloc. This building has also benefited with recently fitted aluminium grey & white window frames and double glazing.

This property will suit a buyer looking for an apartment in excellent condition with no work to do, set in a very secure building with great outside space.

Location

Located on one of Sydenham's most desirable roads, within the Lawrie Park Triangle, moments from Sydenham and Penge West Stations, Crystal Palace Park and Sydenham High Street.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Virtual reality tour and full HD video walk through - like and subscribe to our youtube channel for property updates

Guide price - £375,000 to £400,000.

Positioned on the second floor, this two double bedroom flat offers approximately 667 sq ft of living space and a location which is great for the transport and amenities available in Forest Hill town centre.

The property has multiple storage cupboards including bespoke built-in storage in the bedrooms and hallway. There is another store cupboard located in hallway great for shoes and coats etc which doesn’t intrude on the living space.

One of the striking features of this flat are the panoramic windows. The lounge and both bedrooms benefit from windows that are almost the entire width of the rooms and in addition are almost floor to ceiling in height (please take not in the video, 360 tour and images). It feels very much like you have a wall of glass in each room offering views to the outside that are private and not very overlooked.

These windows flood each room with natural light which is a very desirable feature to many buyers, however due to the layout of the property the lounge is southerly facing and gains substantial benefit from the feature window, and whilst the bedrooms enjoy the same benefit, they are not southerly facing resulting in a comfortable sleeping environment.

Some of the added benefits not visible in the advert but buyers will be interested to know are:

• The lease was 999 years from 24th June 1966 leaving approximately 944 years remaining
• The residents manage the building themselves hence it is so well presented
• Ground rent is only £12 per year
• Sink fund included in service charges
• chain free sale

Forest Hill is the closest train station and offers some of the following travel times to central London:

London Bridge in approximately 13 minutes.

Shoreditch High Street in approximately 22 minutes.

Canary Wharf in approximately 23 minutes.

Victoria station in approximately 40 minutes.

In the town centre, you can enjoy an array of boutique shops, independent stores as well as a number of trendy cafes, restaurants, gastro pubs and a couple well known high street names such as Sainbury’s and Boots. Some of our favourites include Bona the sour dough pizza restaurant and Canvas and Cream a trendy café which also offers therapies, art studios and artist gallery.

Forest Hill has some great local recreation on offer too. Off the high street in the town centre you'll find Forest Hill pools and library both of which have undergone refurbishment. Forest Hill pools is known for its swimming pool facilities but is also a local leisure centre with a gym and fitness classes.

The Horniman Museum and Gardens is a well-known local point of interest and can be found just beyond the town centre. It’s recognized as popular family entertainment venue and has been featured in "Time Out". With regular events such as a farmer’s market, live music and seasonal festivals to name a few, there is always something to enjoy at the Horniman.

You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens here:



Blythe Hill Fields is also located in the local area and offers recreational facilities such as the "Trim trails" which is an exercise trail. It also hosts local events where the residents of SE23 get to know each other better and enjoy the community spirit. You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:



Other great parts of Forest Hill to explore include One Tree Hill with its wonderful panoramic views of the city landscape and Mayow Park which has a café, sports facilities and is very popular with the locals.

Please contact Hunters to obtain more information and to book in a viewing.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
** Guide Price £825,000-£850,000 ** Words cannot describe this simply stunning three bedroom house within this very quiet and highly sought after riverside development.

Recently refurbished to the highest of standards and with no expense spared, the list of improvements is endless – but some of these include opening up the ground floor and replacing the kitchen with oak worktops and a custom fitted kitchen/bar, a full redesign of both bathrooms and cloakroom with Italian Marazzi tiles and Italian fixtures, a full rewire of the whole house by an niceic approved electrician, a full replumb by a gas safe engineer, new Vaillant combination boiler and radiators, rebuilt stairs, improved joists and sound insulation and even custom-built bedroom wardrobes. This just gives a small example to any potential buyer of the quality and attention to detail.

The property also has further potential to extend on the ground floor and loft conversion subject to planning permission.

Currently the accommodation offers a ground floor cloakroom, a very sociable open plan kitchen/living/dining room with access to an easily maintained level garden, and to the first floor is a landing with access to a useful boarded loft space, three good size bedrooms – one of which has an ensuite shower room – and family bathroom. To the front of the property is easy residents parking.

Location wise it is a commuters dream – a short walk over the bridge at the creek takes you past Waitrose and through to the DLR at the Cutty Sark for swift access to Canary Wharf, here too are all the amenities of Greenwich village and the beautiful open space of the royal park. All in all this is a wonderful house and as the original selling agents we can appreciate all the improvements made and would thoroughly recommend an early viewing.

What The Seller Says -

“It’s one of the very few freeholds in Greenwich West Ward that is on the river, and it has incredible potential to expand and increase the value of the house further by extending both in the loft and in the garden.

We love spending time in our garden, and we actually grow most of the veggies we eat ourselves. It’s like living a countryside lifestyle in Zone 2 London – brilliant! The area here is also a traffic-free zone, and particularly on the riverside it’s very, very quiet.

The area is safe, thanks to a gate and the CCTV managed by the management company and we also get up to two parking spaces in front of our home, concierge for packages when we are not home, well-tended gardens and lovely green areas.

It takes us around 10 minutes to walk to both Cutty Sark DLR or Greenwich DLR. Greenwich DLR station also has a train station next to it that takes us to Cannon Street and Bank in 10 minutes by train, and it costs as much as the tube because it’s within Zone 2 London.

We can be in Canary Wharf in 7 minutes by DLR and Bank in 10 minutes by train (or around 25 by DLR too).

Greenwich is the only place in this area of London where you can cross to the other side of the river without needing a car or having to take the tube, and we are 7 minutes away from the tunnel. It’s great that we can walk to Canary wharf in around 30 minutes from our doorstep. To top it off, Waitrose is nearby, as well as Asda on the other side of the river.

The riverside walk can take you straight to the O2 Arena as well – it’s around a 40 minute walk – or 20 minutes by bike. Between the Cutty Sark, O2, and Canary Wharf, we have everything we need very close by! The views over both Canary Wharf and the City are stunning, and of course Greenwich Park is beautiful; it’s great for picnics, running and playing tennis. We hope that the next owner(s) of this flat appreciate it as much as I have.”<br /><br />

Description

Entering the property via the side access into the entrance hall. Leading into the living room, with a feature fireplace & good use of space with shelving in the alcoves & a cupboard for media/storage. This opens out to the rear garden via French doors which have been fitted with colonial shutters. Moving onto the well-equipped kitchen fitted with integrated appliances including a dishwasher, Neff washing machine, Bosch fridge/freezer, Miele oven and induction hob.

There are 2 bedrooms in the property, the master room is bay fronted again with fitted colonial shutters, retaining the original fireplace and twin built-in wardrobes. The 2nd room is also a good size, ideal for a guest room, kids room or even a home office.

The bathroom is fitted with a heat recovery extactor, bath with an overhead shower, low-level WC, washbasin and chrome heated towel rail.

The property benefits from having a stunning private rear garden. Thru the double doors off the living room it offers a decked area bound by a Strawberry bed, perfect for enjoying alfresco dining. Leading to a lawn edged by borders planted with Roses, Lavender, Clematis & Heather, ending with a raised bed for vegetables & a handy shed.

The property is also fitted with an alarm, super fast broadband and Hive heating system.

A truly stunning property throughout, viewing is highly recommended to really appreciate the location and what the property has to offer.

detailedDescription: An exceptional 4 bedroom Victorian, end of terrace half house, stylishly extended and refurbished to a very high specification throughout located on this very popular, quiet residential street close to Honor Oak Park station. The house has an imposing red brick facade and a small front garden shielding it from the street where there is space for a bike store. As you enter, the ground floor has a nice front reception room which retains many period features such as a cornicing, a good ceiling height and a square bay window with double glazing. The rear of the house has been completely extended to create an amazing kitchen dining room with bi fold doors leading to the South facing rear garden. The kitchen has been stylishly fitted with a contemporary kitchen with all the mod cons one could ask for, including integrated oven, a large central island which houses a 5 ring gas hob and a breakfast bar. The South facing room is flooded with natural light from the bifold doors and skylights above. The garden has been landscaped to create a nice low maintenance space with a decked patio area as you step out, perfect for al fresco dining. There is also a lawn area with planters at the rear for your herbs or shrubs. Attached to the property is an external cupboard which houses the boiler.Upstairs on the first floor is a large family bathroom which has been luxuriously decorated in fashionable grey tiles. There is a trendy wash hand basin, toilet, storage shelves for towels and an enclosed bath with shower overhead. A double-glazed frosted window fills the room with natural light. There are two bedrooms on this floor, the larger double is at the front of the house, had high ceilings, a feature fire place and two double glazed windows in a square bay. The smaller double is adjacent and faces the rear side return. Upstairs the loft has been cleverly converted to maximise space, a further two bedrooms and a shower room as been created! All of which has been finished in the same lavish style of the rest of the house. Ebsworth St is approximately 5 mins walk to Honor Oak Park station where there are regular services to London Bridge (around 15mins) as well as London Overground services to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington.The trendy high street boasts a range of independent shops, cafes, bars, a deli and several highly-recommended restaurants.Nearby green leafy open spaces can be found at Blythe Hill Fields, One Tree Hill and Horniman gardens all offering fantastic views of the London Skyline.

The area is very popular among young families, it is a quiet residential street made up of similar family homes, close to some very good schools such as Stillness School. The local train stations are very convenient with Honor Oak Park offering regular services to London Bridge and Overground connections and Crofton Park offering services to Blackfrairs and Victoria. The areas amenities include an array of excellent cafes, bars and restaurants as well as good places for local shopping offered by Sainsbury’s and a local open spaces surround the area such as One Tree Hill, Blythe Hill Fields, Hilly Fields and the popular Horniman gardens with its Museum.

***Guide Price £300,000 to £325,000***

This three bedroom flat is brilliant value for money and is situated on Kirkdale, Sydenham on the second floor in a 1930's built Art Deco inspired building with large communal gardens.

Offering a larger than usual 56.1 sqm/604 sq ft of living space, it's a short 12 minute walk away from Sydenham Station where you can commute into London Bridge or in the opposite direction West Croydon. The Overground Line also runs through Sydenham and Forest Hill where you can hop on a train to North London destinations such as Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington via Shoreditch.

Both Sydenham and Forest Hill Town Centre are within walking distance and offer a full range of trendy boutiques, bistros and bars and gastro pubs as well as your every day stores and supermarkets.

Kirkdale is right on your doorstep, and offers a few convenience shops. There's a medium sized Sainburys on London Road in Forest Hill, or a large Sainsbury's Sava Centre at the bottom of Sydenham Road, which is a 10 minute drive away. Forest Hill has a popular Butchers, some great coffee shops, a brilliant Thai restaurant and the popular gastro pubs the Dartmouth Arms, The Sylvan Post and The Signal.

If you want even more choice, the Crystal Palace Triangle or Lordship Lane in East Dulwich are a cheap cab fare away.

Parks are plentiful in this neck of the woods as you have Dulwich Woods, Dulwich Park, Crystal Palace Park and the local Sydenham parks including the beautiful Wells Park, Mayow Park and Cator Park, all within a short distance away.

Chain free sale.

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £300,000 to £325,000** A superb top floor purpose built apartment situated on the edge of Lee Manor Conservation Area. The property is within a short walk to Lee train station and local shops.

Inside you will find a generous size lounge, with large windows allowing the room to be filled with plenty of light, fitted kitchen, two generous double size bedrooms and a modern bathroom.

Location is ideal for transport links and there are also several outstanding primary schools in the area, and Blackheath Village offers a variety of cafes, bars and restaurants, all within a short walk.

Tenure: Leasehold (106 Years Remaining)
Service Charge Approximately £1100 per annum
Ground Rent £10.00 Per Annum

The Seller Says: "I have lived in my apartment for 18 years and am only leaving to move in with my partner. It’s been a fabulous apartment all round; the space is generous, and the windows are amazing – I have been truly spoilt by the amount of light!

Being on the top floor means i’m away from the traffic; with the windows closed you wouldn’t know you were on the corner of a main road. The way the apartments are configured means I only have one neighbour downstairs who is lovely and very quiet, so not once have I had a noise issue. There are 48 steps up to the apartment (they’ve kept me fit!) plus an entry phone system which you can mute.

The surrounding area is great; there is a lovely park nearby plus you are 10-15 minutes’ walk from Blackheath with all its cafes, restaurants, shops, and of course the Heath. Lee is the nearest train station a few minutes’ walk away and it’s a very safe walk from Lee at night as it’s just one straight main road to the apartment. I’m also near Hither Green and Blackheath stations. Lewisham station is s a short bus ride away which has lots of trains into London plus the DLR. Sainsbury’s is next door so practically you have everything you need within a very short walk.

Parking is residents only between 10am-12noon and is £70 a year and you can get visitor passes too. Overall it’s been a great place to live and i’m sorry to be leaving but time to move on!"<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
A spacious period conversion property, set over 3 floors with a large private garden. Close to Forest Hill and Sydenham Overground and National Rail stations and the amenities and green spaces of the local area such as the popular Riverview Walk Park.

The property boasts a large reception room with bay windows allowing in plenty of natural light. The open-plan kitchen/dining room provides a great space for entertaining with modern kitchen units, and bi-fold access to the garden. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An impressive four double bedroom (three with dressing rooms), three-bathroom, three reception room semi-detached early Victorian home. Located just 415 metres from Blackheath Village with a 60ft garden, and features a stunning Belvedere (sunroom) and roof terrace.

The property is in very good decorative order with features including; high ceilings, sash windows (partially double glazed), Amtico and wood flooring, original panelling, period fireplaces, cornicing, partial underfloor heating and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation is arranged over five floors and comprises; an entrance hall, two good sized reception rooms opened to a large dual aspect through reception. On the half landing there is a utility room, whilst downstairs is a large kitchen (including a separate larder) with double doors leading to a garden terrace. In addition, a large open plan dining room creates a dual aspect room.

The first floor offers a bathroom on a half landing, a 16'5 x 14'1 master bedroom with dressing room and ensuite shower room, and a second double bedroom again with ensuite shower room. There are two further double bedrooms, both with dressing rooms or studies on the second floor, and finally a feature double glazed belvedere with glass balustrading and double doors onto a large timber decked roof terrace with ornate wrought iron railings and superb views. Outside, a well-stocked garden extends to approximately 60ft which is accessible from both the kitchen, and from a generous storeroom which runs along the entire length of the house.

This is a wonderful and versatile family home, and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

The property is in a very desirable location and is just 415 metres from Blackheath Village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and farmers market, giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. Close by, you will find the historic Greenwich town centre and Royal Greenwich Park. Locally, there are several sought-after schools, including Heath House, Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School, John Ball, St Margaret's and the Pointer School. It is perfect for the commute into the city with Blackheath Station only 0.3 miles away, Lewisham Station and DLR is 0.6 miles and Hither Green is 0.7 miles. The popular open spaces of Blackheath Common, (0.4 miles), Greenwich Park, (0.8 miles), and Manor House Gardens, (0.4 miles), are all within a short walk.

detailedDescription:
We are excited to market this immaculate 1 bedroom apartment in Noble House, located in the very modern development plot in Kidbrooke Village. This popular development is conveniently situated 3 minutes away from Kidbrooke train station and local amenities, making this property the ideal location for work and play. The property also benefits from a brand new on-site gym and 24hr concierge service inclusive within the property development.

The apartment consists of a spacious entrance with ample inbuilt storage facilities that accommodates the washing/dryer machine, clothing storage and additional space to keep the property neatly organised. The double bedroom space is very-generous with a very modern and elegant interior décor. The kitchen area comprises an ultra-modern and sleek range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and ample storage space for appliances. The kitchen is also fully equipped to a very high standard including dishwasher & fridge/freezer.

A benefit of this property is the private balcony that can be accessed from the living room. The apartment also offers bright and airy open plan living/reception space upon entrance to the property that is ideal for entertaining friends and family.

In addition, Kidbrooke train station runs regular trains directly to the main stations of Lewisham, London Bridge station, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and London Victoria, all of which are positioned on the main London Underground lines.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Noble House, Ottley Drive, Kidbrooke Village, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
We love the large floor to ceiling windows throughout the whole apartment, keeping the flat light all day long. We also love the open plan kitchen/living area so one of us can do the cooking whilst the other can keep them company from the sofa! As well as the large wraparound balcony that gives us privacy and somewhere to relax with a drink after a long day.

What do you love about the area?
We just love that Kidbrooke Village actually feels like a village, despite being 15 minutes from Central London. Everyone is incredibly friendly - whether it's your neighbours who become friends or the guys we run into every Saturday in the park with their sausage dogs, you feel like part of a community.

We love the local Pub, The Depot found inside the Village Square, where at the weekends we also have a wander to see the pop up food market and walk down into Blackheath. One of the great things about living here is that you can walk to everything you need! The gym we have access to, the local Sainsburys, the Pub, nice restaurants, lots of parks and free Tennis courts too!

I've always felt incredibly safe in Kidbrooke Village too - with round the clock security; communal gardens for the kids to play in and secure entrances to the buildings and floors, it's never been a place i've felt uncomfortable and not necessarily what you'd expect so close to London!

Property Details:

Offering beautifully presented, bright and spacious accommodation with high quality interiors and excellent inbuilt storage space, this superb fourth floor apartment in a fantastic central location.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage and wood effect flooring (evident through the majority of the property), leading into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen, flooded with natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows and doorway leading out onto the wrap-around private balcony.

The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are three well sized bedrooms with ample space for free-standing furniture and modern en-suite to the master, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Kidbrooke station, as well as numerous regular bus routes all providing excellent links into Central London, the City and the surrounding area. There are a variety of shops and amenities nearby, with nearby Blackheath, just a short distance away, offering a fashionable array of boutique shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. The area is well served by good local schools, as well as lovely open spaces.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Part of an imposing period property and located in the heart of the Brockley Conservation area, this 2-double bedroom second floor flat provides ample living accommodation.
The property offers a large reception room with 2 sash windows to front allowing lots of natural light, a modern fitted kitchen with integrated oven, hob and extractor fan, 2 double bedrooms and a family bathroom.
Wickham Road is a broad, tree-lined street in the heart of the Brockley Conservation area. The area itself is a vibrant, cosmopolitan one, popular among young professionals and families.
Transport links into town couldn't be easier. Brockley station is a short walk away from where there are fast and frequent services into London Bridge in around 10 mins. In addition, you can pick up the London Overground towards Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington meaning that Canary Wharf is a mere 30 minute commute changing at Canada Water. You also have Crofton Park station for Thameslink service into Blackfriars and St Pancras.
For evening entertainment, there's no shortage of bars and restaurants to choose from. A few of places of note include The Gantry (a rustic, French-style restaurant), the Orchard (a friendly restaurant with a wine bar) and Brockley's Rock (an award-winning fish and chip shop). Coffee shops are plentiful including Arlo & Moe, Fred's and Browns of Brockley.
Hilly Fields is close by where there is a children's playground, cafe, enclosed picnic area, cricket pitch, and 3 tennis courts. It also hosts a regular farmers' market as well as various events throughout the year.

detailedDescription:
This beautifully modern one-bedroom apartment is an absolute delight! On the second floor, enter the property through the wood grain panelled door and the apartment is bright and inviting. Nestled within the well planned Kidbrooke Village development, is our stunning apartment, where consideration for beauty and sustainable development go hand in hand.

As you enter immediately to your right is the spacious, classy bathroom; truly modern with contemporary tiles, wall mounted seamless W/C, shower and bath. The bedroom is well sized, with large wall to wall built in, fitted storage, complete with sliding doors. The feature windows run from ceiling to floor and has a door which opens onto a Juliet balcony. The lounge is spacious and opens out onto a balcony. The kitchen and lounge are open planned, and the kitchen is crisp and modern with fitted oven, hob, and fridge-freezer.

Property suitable for an investor 5% yield, available with tenant in-situ or with for a first time buyer with vacant possession.

Kidbrooke Village has a peaceful and serene ambiance, built within parkland and serviced by planned recreation and leisure amenities; including a residents only gym, a swimming pool, a movie room, as well as 24-hour concierge and a Zipcar car share club. Conveniently a new Sainsburys Local is now open.

Trains leave from Kidbrooke station for London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria, connecting with the London Underground at these mainline Stations. Trains also connect to Lewisham providing links to the DLR to Greenwich, Canary Wharf and Stratford

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
We love the large sash windows throughout, the flat is South facing so we have light streaming into the flat at all times of the day which gives it a lovely bright feel. The open plan design also means you're not cut off in the kitchen which we love for entertaining.

What do you love about the area?
We didn't realise at first just how great a location the flat is in. We are spoilt for choice when it comes to lovely pubs and restaurants in both Greenwich and Blackheath. Our top picks for people new to the area are - Richard I a local's favourite with a cosy interior, The Cutty Sark for a great sunny spot overlooking the Thames, The Hare and Billet in Blackheath for the best Sunday Roast & The Pelton Arms for live music and a proper pub feel.

We're both runners, and love being only a few moments away from Blackheath Common and Greenwich park (the best park in London in our humble opinion) - in the summer we'll often head straight to the park as soon as we've finished work for a picnic dinner in the evening sunshine and a view over the Queen's house and the Thames. Royal Hill which has the loveliest of local butchers, greengrocers, fishmongers and cheese shop is just around the corner and Greenwich market is great for a bite to eat from the many market stall options at the weekend. For a change of scene, Deptford is also only a 10 minute walk for great cafes and bars along the buzzy railway arches.

The transport links are a definite bonus, we are a 10 minute walk to Deptford Bridge and Greenwich station where you can get a train to London Bridge in under 15 minutes or the DLR to Canary Wharf (15 mins) and Bank (30 mins). We are also only a 15 minute walk to Lewisham train station for trains into Waterloo and Charing Cross.

If you have a car the flat is perfectly positioned for escaping to the Kent coast at the weekends - you can reach Broadstairs and Whitstable in under an hour and a half.

Property Details:

Enjoying a sunny south facing aspect, as well as enormous character appeal with high ceilings and large sash windows, this beautiful period conversion flat set on the first floor of an attractive townhouse style property.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with wood flooring (evident through the majority of the property, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen with dual shuttered windows and ample space for both relaxing and dining.

The kitchen area, with side aspect, comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a generously sized double bedroom with full height inbuilt wardrobes, plus a modern family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is enviably located within easy access of Greenwich station providing excellent overground and DLR connections into Central London and the City. Greenwich itself provides a vibrant array of shops, fashionable bars, cafes and restaurants, as well as a selection of regular markets, the iconic site of the Cutty Sark, beautiful Greenwich Park (just a short walk away) and the Royal Observatory.

Nearby Deptford, also with a railway station and DLR connections, offers a further eclectic mix of shops, bars, restaurants and artisan coffee shops, and Blackheath is also within easy reach with further fashionable amenities and beautiful open spaces.

detailedDescription:
You enter via a porch into a central entrance hall that gives access to all rooms. Lovely wooden flooring runs through to a fantastic open plan reception space. This room has three distinct seating areas and enjoys triple aspect views through a bay window to the front, windows to the side and French doors out to the garden. This room also flows through to the dining area with another French door out to the garden, then onto the kitchen. The bespoke kitchen is made up of attractive wooden base units with a white stone work top and white gloss wall units. It is fully integrated with appliances and has a separate utility area and a door out to the side. Off the hall is a WC and a further reception room with parquet flooring that would make an ideal study or guest bedroom. An impressive floating staircase is a real feature to the living room and takes you up to the first floor where you will find three double bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite shower room and built in wardrobes, a further single bedroom and a shower room. The principle suite is at the end of the landing and boasts a stylish en-suite with a freestanding bath and a walk-in shower and has a separate dressing room with fitted wardrobes. Two sets of doors lead you out to from the main reception to a large, raised stone patio. Steps take you down to the beautiful landscaped garden, mainly laid to lawn with a stone path and surrounded by mature trees and shrubs. To the front is a stone drive and pretty front lawn.

Parkgate is a picturesque street on the prestigious Cator Estate. Blackheath Village with its array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants is a short walk away. On the north side of the village is the open heath with Greenwich Park beyond. Blackheath station is ideal for commuters with regular services in to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham where the DLR takes you to Canary Wharf and Bank. Local schools include the hugely popular and Ofsted Outstanding Brooklands Primary School, Heath House, Blackheath Preparatory School and The Pointers School.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
This newly refurbished 3-bedroom, purpose-built maisonette with a kitchen-diner, 2 shower rooms and a westerly-facing garden offers ample living accommodation (gia 936 sq ft).
Located with easy reach of either Honor Oak Park or Crofton Park station, the property has a sense of space and light that you don't ordinarily find with flats. You enter the property through its own front door. Heading upstairs, there's an expansive landing area off which all the rooms are to be found. At the front is a reception room with a large arch-shaped window. At the rear is a fantastic kitchen-diner - a perfect place to entertain family and friends. The kitchen is sleek and is finished off with a stone work surface. Stairs at the back lead down to a secluded west-facing garden with additional rear access. There are 3 bedrooms one of which would make an ideal office - a real bonus in these times. The flat is tastefully refurbished and decorated to a high standard and includes double glazed sash windows and new flooring throughout. Both shower room are finished off to a tee with walk in showers and tiled walls.
Transport links into town and other parts of London could hardly be easier. Honor Oak Park station provides direct mainline service to London Bridge in around 12 minutes. In addition, there are London Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury & Islington. You can change at Canada Water for easy access to Canary Wharf. Crofton Park station is also within easy reach for services into Blackfriars and Paddington.
For shopping and dining out, the area caters for most needs. There's a Sainsbury's Local and a Budgen's supermarket nearby. Restaurants of note include Mama Dough (a trendy soughdough pizzeria), Babur (an award-winning Indian) and Hattush (a popular Turkish). For a post work drink, pop along to the Brockley Jack or the Chandos. For Sunday brunch or a coffee and a snack, there are a number of places to choose from including Two Spoons and Arlo and Moe.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £3,950,000- £4,250,000

“A rare opportunity to acquire this imposing Regency family home on one of the area’s finest roads complimented by a stunning parkland style garden”

Located in an excellent position only a short walk from the Village, the house sits back from the road with an ample gravelled, horseshoe drive providing good off-street parking as well as access to a double garage. The stunning South facing, garden extends to approximately 0.3 of an acre with an expansive paved terrace and extensive landscaped lawns and beautifully planted borders. Cleverly hidden from view is a well screened swimming pool with changing and shower facilities.

The house has been very well maintained by its current, longstanding owners and boasts a host of period features including period fireplaces, original ceiling cornice work and corbels, working shutters, original ceiling cornice work and corbels.

The main entrance is on the hall floor and opens onto a welcoming reception hall which in turn provides access to the two principle reception rooms, the rear of which offers lovely views over the stunning rear garden. Also on the hall floor level there is a spacious study, a rear room (currently used as a gym) and also a guest WC. On the garden floor there is a well fitted kitchen, a generous utility room, a walk-in store, a separated WC and access (via a door to the side) to the garage and garden.

On the first floor, off the spacious landing, there are three double bedrooms, a large, well-appointed family bathroom, a separated WC
and a further double bedroom on the mezzanine level. The attic level of the house is of good size and offers the potential to create two additional bedrooms along with ample eaves storage space.

At the rear of the house there is a stunning, parkland style, south facing garden which is beautifully landscaped with well stocked, mature planting complimented with the immaculate formal lawn. At the side of the house there is a 27’ x 16’ garage with a very useful equally sized first floor. The gravelled drive at the front of the house offers ample off street parking.

The property is well situated for London commuters with fast services from Blackheath Station to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Waterloo, Charing Cross and Victoria and DLR links to Canary Wharf and Bank one stop away at Lewisham. Blackheath Village with its restaurants, shops and station is 5 minutes’ walk away. The Heath and Greenwich Park are close by and shopping facilities at Bluewater and Canary Wharf are within easy reach.

Investing in London based property remains a great opportunity for international investors to benefit from the cities continued position as the worlds leading financial centre, a position backed up by its low tax regime for international buyers and its stable political, economic and legal systems.

Best European City for Business London has long been recognised as the leading European city for business as well as being a cultural and educational capital with large numbers of museums, theatres and other cultural attractions that brings visitors from around the world in their millions each year.

Investment - potential London based property continues to offer great potential due to the shortage in supply of new homes and an increasing demand for high-quality rental accommodation., a situation that shows no sign of improving any time soon, making investment in this sector hugely attractive.

London property (residential and commercial) is one of the largest and historically best performing in its asset class, providing excellent diversification benefits, particularly in a high-inflation economic environment.

detailedDescription:
Please see our 360 degree virtual tour and full HD video walk through - like and subscribe to our youtube channel for property updates

Guide price £290,000 to £325,000.

Positioned on the top floor, this one double bedroom flat offers A private section of rear garden that measures approx. 40ft by 35 ft, a living space approaching 500 sq ft and a location which is great for the transport and amenities available in Forest Hill town centre.

The road is great for those who have cars as are there isn't any parking restrictions. You'll note from Google Street View and your viewing, the amount of parking that is available currently. We consider this is a great asset for the property.

Located approximately 0.2 miles from Forest Hill town centre, is a well-kept purpose-built block set back from the road with mature, well-presented communal gardens. There are gardens to the front of the development which create a welcoming entrance whilst the private garden to the rear is ideal for growing veg, BBQs and socialising outdoors.

As the property is located on the top floor, there is no neighbouring property above which is ideal for those buyers who are concerned about noise from above.

We must make particular note of the over dimensions of the property. Many two bedroom properties offer a similar size accommodation, making this a very attractive one bedroom property. You notice the healthy dimensions in all the rooms but in addition to this you’ll not many built in store cupboards which is quite rare to find in many other properties.

The lounge can accommodate a dedicated dining table and chairs without feeling cramped and the bathroom feels like it has more floor space than many. You will also note from the floor plan and images that the bedroom can fit a large bed with large storage cupboards.

Its should also be noted that all the rooms have their own window unlike many other flats which can suffer from lack of natural light in some rooms.

The property has multiple storage cupboards including built-in storage in the bedroom. Another three store cupboards are in the kitchen. None of the built in store areas intrude on the living space which is comforting.

Forest Hill is the closest train station and offers some of the following travel times to central London:

London Bridge in approximately 13 minutes.

Shoreditch High Street in approximately 22 minutes.

Canary Wharf in approximately 23 minutes.

Victoria station in approximately 40 minutes.

In the town centre, you can enjoy an array of boutique shops, independent stores as well as a number of trendy cafes, restaurants, gastro pubs and a couple well-known high-street names such as Sainbury’s and Boots. Some of our favourites include Bona the sour dough pizza restaurant and Canvas and Cream a trendy café which also offers therapies, art studios and artist gallery.

Forest Hill has some great local recreation on offer too. Off the high street in the town centre you'll find Forest Hill pools and library both of which have undergone refurbishment. Forest Hill pools is known for its swimming pool facilities but is also a local leisure centre with a gym and fitness classes.

The Horniman Museum and Gardens is a well-known local point of interest and can be found just beyond the town centre. It’s recognized as popular family entertainment venue and has been featured in "Time Out". With regular events such as a farmer’s market, live music and seasonal festivals to name a few, there is always something to enjoy at the Horniman.

You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens here:



Blythe Hill Fields is also located in to local area and offers recreational facilities such as the "Trim trails" which is an exercise trail. It also hosts local events where the residents of SE23 get to know each other better and enjoy the community spirit. You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:



Other great parts of Forest Hill to explore include One Tree Hill with its wonderful panoramic views of the city landscape and Mayow Park which has a café, sports facilities and is very popular with the locals.

Please contact Hunters to obtain more information and to book in a viewing.
