detailedDescription:
Guide Price £450,000 - £500,000

Beautifully presented end of terrace home featuring a bright 17' lounge opening onto a low maintenance rear garden with fantastic views over attractive sports fields.

Located in this mews style secure gated development, these homes always prove popular with first time buyers.

Brockley Overground and Nunhead Stations are found equidistant for the busy commuter, whilst for those thinking of schools will find Outstanding & Good schools nearby according to Ofsted.

What The Seller Says

Pincott Place is a great place to live! Tucked away from the main road, it’s 2 minutes away from buses to New Cross, Lewisham, Peckham and beyond. It is also well served by trains from Nunhead, Crofton Park and Brockley.

The playing field at the rear of the property provides a welcome bit of tranquillity in what is a bustling, vibrant area. Great food and drink options are close by, and we are surrounded by beautiful green spaces (my favourite being Blythe Hill, the view of the city skyline is incomparable!).

Telegraph Hill and Brockley Markets both provide delicious brunch options on a Saturday morning, and fish and chips from Brockley’s Rock while enjoying another great view from Hilly Fields is a must.

We will be sad to leave our lovely neighbours and have been very happy in our house. It is ideal for a couple to start out in! The added security of being situated within a gated estate provides peace of mind, plus having an off-street parking space is very convenient.<br /><br />

detailedDescription: Launching Saturday 12th June. Sat proudly on the sunny south facing garden side of this popular residential street is this is a superb 4-bedroom, 1930’s mid terrace family home offering plenty of well-proportioned living accommodation of 1403 sqft (130.4sqm). Parbury Road is located moments from all the convenient amenities the high street has to offer and Honor Oak Park station (within 210 meters!) offering excellent connections to London Bridge and on the Overground. The front of the house has an appealing façade with traditional curved bay windows on the first and second floor that still retain the original stain glass. A walled front garden shields the house from the street with a path leading to the front porch. Upon entry you are welcomed by amazing original features of stain glass double doors into the entrance hall which is clad in the original black and white floor tiles that are in excellent condition. The front reception room is cosy formal sitting area which has exposed original floorboards. There is a beautiful centre piece fireplace, high ceilings and the room is illuminated with natural light from the curved bay window. The kitchen dining room at the back of the house is open plan to create a good size family, entertaining space. The kitchen has tiled floors and a good amount of wall and base mounted units with integrated appliances. There are black granite worktops housing the hob with oven and extractor above and the sink that sits neatly under a window looking out to the garden. There is a patio door to the side which offers access to the garden. The dining area has original exposed floorboards, a feature fireplace and South facing French doors that offer access to the garden and fill this room with plenty of direct sunlight all day. The garden is a good size, approximately 38ft long (11.58m) and is a sun trap in the summer thanks to its Southerly facing aspect. There is a patio area nearest to the house which is perfect for al fresco dining on a summers evening, beyond this is a step up to a lawn which is surrounded by borders of mature plants and shrubs. Upstairs on the first floor are three bedrooms, all of which have stripped original floorboards. Two are large similar sized doubles with fitted cupboards and the other bedroom is a smaller double located at the front of the house above the hallway. The family bathroom on this floor is well proportioned with grey floor and wall tiles, there is a bathtub with a shower above, a contemporary style toilet accompanied by a wash hand basin. There are two frosted windows that allow for natural light and ventilation.The loft has been extended to create a good size double bedroom with an en-suite shower room. This bedroom has carpeted flooring, storage in the eaves, and a large double-glazed window that has views over the garden below. The en-suite shower room has tiled floors and walls, a toilet, wash hand basin and a glass shower enclosure. A frosted window allows for natural light and ventilation. Parbury Road is located in the heart of Honor Oak Park and very popular among young families, it is a quiet residential street made up of similar family homes, close to some highly rated primary schools such as Stillness School which is the nearest within 260 meters. The local train station is very convenient with regular services to London Bridge and Overground connections. The areas amenities include an array of excellent cafes, bars and restaurants as well as good places for local shopping offered by Sainsbury’s and a local deli. Green open spaces surround the area such as One Tree Hill, Blythe Hill Fields and the popular Horniman gardens with its famous Museum..

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This fantastic, chain free newly refurbished 1-bed ground floor apartment is ideally placed for Brockley station.
Boasting wall-to-ceiling windows, the flat has a light and airy feel throughout. The open-plan reception room/kitchen area makes for a great entertaining space, particularly with the private balcony. There is a generous double bedroom and a high-spec bathroom. The flat also benefits from integrated appliances and granite work surfaces in the kitchen, wooden flooring, heated towel rail and power shower in the bathroom, and ample storage space.
The area itself is a vibrant, cosmopolitan one, popular among young professionals and families. Transport links into town couldn't be easier. Brockley station is a short walk away from where there are fast and frequent services into London Bridge in around 10 mins. In addition, you can pick up the London Overground towards Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington meaning that Canary Wharf is a mere 30-minute commute changing at Canada Water. You also have Crofton Park station for Thameslink service into Blackfriars and St Pancras.
For evening entertainment, there's no shortage of bars and restaurants to choose from. A few of places of note include Masala Wala (a family run 'home cooked style' Pakistani restaurant), the Orchard (a friendly restaurant with a wine bar) and Brockley's Rock (an award-winning fish and chip shop). Coffee shops are plentiful including Arlo & Moe and Fred's.
Hilly Fields is close by where there is a children's playground, cafe, enclosed picnic area, cricket pitch, and 3 tennis courts. It also hosts a regular farmers' market as well as various events throughout the year.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: New Cross Road, New Cross SE14
detailedDescription:
Who doesn’t love a mansion flat? This particularly-bright one (it's not overlooked by any other properties) has three sash-windowed double bedrooms, a huge bay-windowed reception room, loads of built-in storage, an independent kitchen, and both bath and shower rooms. It's been sensitively enhanced by the current owners - you’ll need not lift a paintbrush! Long leasehold (156 years remaining).

The pleasing penthouse pad - on the second floor of the smart red-brick Victorian building - measures in at a whopping 1149 square feet (that’s the size of your average Victorian house - you're looking at a lot of square feet for your dosh). And a generous communal garden completes matters; access to this is from your kitchen via metal stairs.

Within Telegraph Hill Conservation Area, and directly opposite Hatcham Conservation Area, ‘Fairlawn Mansions’ was built in the eighteen eighties by The Haberdashers’ Company (one of the Great Twelve Livery Companies with a long history closely connected to the development of the City of London).

Walk just four minutes to New Cross Gate Station for Overground and regular train services. Fare Zone 2. It’s just one stop to London Bridge.

In the main front door and take the stairs to the second floor (we love top floor flats = best for sound, warmth and security) and your own front door. Cross the hall for your massive reception room of over 20 feet by 14 feet, with perfect proportions for dinner parties, in a dreamy F&B hue. Welcome features here include a feature fireplace, alcove book-shelving, picture rail, ceiling rose and coving detail.

The largest bedroom is adjacent - it’s over 15 feet by over 13 feet, with a big south-facing sash window to leafy vistas.

Next along the hall you’ve got a neat windowed shower room, and next door the main slate-floored windowed bathroom. White contemporary sanitary ware graces both.

The kitchen is next on your left - smart white wall and base units sit on two walls, and these are teamed with wooden counters and cool hexagonal and rectangular wall tiles. A part-glazed back door opens onto fire-escape stairs with space for a bistro table and chairs, before you reach the massive shared mature garden. This is a really nice spot for lunch/ after work drinks; your neighbours are a friendly mix of young professionals, families and students.

The flat, it continues! Beyond the kitchen you’ve got two carpeted double bedrooms - of over 11 feet by over 10 feet, and over 13 feet each way, and with east-facing and south-facing sash windows.

For rail travel, you are close to two Fare Zone 2 stations which both offer Overground as well as regular services (nxg and Queens Road Peckham are yours in four and 10 minutes). Or take a short bus ride from New Cross or Old Kent Roads to Elephant & Castle tube and beyond. Gorgeous Greenwich and hip Deptford beckon in the other direction.

Your most local primary schools are Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham Temple Grove, Kender, and Edmund Waller. And all have good nurseries, from 3 years.

Central New Cross has wonderful historical buildings (even Daniel Craig as James Bond has passed through, in 2012’s Skyfall), a Curzon cinema and contemporary art gallery: Goldsmiths Centre for Contemporary Art, plus an increasing number of pubs and eateries such as The Rosemary, The Rose Inn, Fat Slice, The New Cross House, The Telegraph at the Earl of Derby and The Amersham Arms.

The nearby area around qrp Station has a scene of its own now too - we love Kudu, Smokey Kudu, Peckham Cellars, Brickhouse Bakery and Mamma Dough.

Telegraph Hill's Lower Park is a short stroll and has a delightful Saturday market. Nunhead - with its high street village vibe - is close too: We like Ayres bakery and fc Soper wet fish shop, as well as El Vermut, Mother Superior, The Old Nun’s Head and Goodcup.

Peckham Rye Park and Common is fairly local too, as is Peckham's Rye Lane - for markets and high street shops, plus trendy bars and restaurants (like Forza Wine, Frank’s Cafe, Peckham Springs and The Coal Rooms). For the regular ‘big shop’, the big Sainsbury's that's just by New Cross Gate Station will serve you well, or it's a short drive to all the others. More shopping and social options are found in Brockley and Dulwich.
title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located a stone's throw from Honor Oak Park station, this light-filled, 3-double bedroom, 2-bathroom, split-level maisonette offers over 1100 sq ft of accommodation, the bonus of a private patio garden and no onward chain.
Arranged over the entire top two floors, the property has its own front door accessed from a mews street at the back. Heading upstairs, you enter into a wide hallway. At the front is a 16'11 reception room with 3 windows that allow natural light to fill the room. Behind this is an eat-in kitchen, then a family bathroom and a double bedroom at the back. Upstairs, the master bedroom mirrors the size of the reception below. There's another double bedroom and a shower room on this floor as well.
The area is much sought after due to is great transport links into all parts of London and range of on-hand amenities. Honor Oak Park station is a mere 3-minute walk from this quiet tree lined street. There are fast and regular services into London Bridge (in around 12 minutes) as well as Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington, and southwards to Croydon.
The area's amenities include coffee shops (Ground & Grapes / Two Spoons), a deli, a beauty salon, and several highly-rated restaurants including a hip pizzeria (Mamma Dough), an award-winning Indian (Babur), a popular Italian (Le Querce) and a traditional Turkish (Hattush). For groceries, there are a number of convenience shops and a Sainsbury's local along the high street. For an evening drink, there's the recently-refurbished Chandos or the Brockley Jack which also hosts a small theatre. The nearest primary school is the highly-rated Stillness.
The area is dotted with green spaces including One Tree Hill and Blythe Hill Fields at the top of which are panoramic views of the London skyline.

detailedDescription:
Occupying the hall floor of a three-storey semi-detached period home is this bijou apartment which has been well looked after and carefully designed. Although the space is only 300sqft the present owner has managed to create a lovely home by enhancing the features of the building. The lounge/kitchen has modern plantation shutters fitted to the bright bay and the fitted kitchen has been well designed and laid out. There is a separate bedroom and a wardrobe in the hall for storage and hanging space. The property has recently been professionally fitted with high-quality internal oak doors.

Externally, the property does benefit from a communal garden which has been informally fenced into sections to provide a well proportioned and tranquil private space, making it ideal for entertaining. The property features free on-street parking. Close to the twin stations of Catford & Catford Bridge with the benefits of Ladywell Fields and walks down the River Pool. Ideal as a town flat, buy to let investor or for a professional person needing great transport connections to London and the City.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £600,000-£630,000. Spanning 1,045 sq ft. Is this rarely available two bedroom, two bathroom, split level apartment with private patio area and large communal garden.

This property is in good decorative order throughout, the hall floor comprising a large 19'7x14'8 kitchen/reception area with shower room and large double bedroom.

On the lower ground floor is an enormous 14'1x12'11 master bedroom with ensuite bathroom. There is also direct access to the garden through the private patio.

Being one of the largest flats within the Woodlands Estate the property is responsible for 9% of the total communal outgoings, which is typically around £4,000 per year. The property also specifically benefits from a private driveway and garage.

The property is located within a few minutes' walk from Hilly Fields with its tennis and basketball courts and children's playground and the popular Brockley Farmers Market and weekly Street Food Market. Located in Zone 2 the transport links are excellent and there are services to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Charing Cross and Victoria and easy access to the City and Canary Wharf. Brockley Station and the Overground Line are just 0.35 miles, St John's Station is 0.4 miles and Lewisham Station and the DLR are 0.67 miles.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Re/max estate agents are proud to present this attractive, two-bedroom top floor flat. The property is located at the heart of Catford in the midst of a quiet neighbourhood. Internally, this unique property spans over 626.45 sq ft of well-proportioned living space throughout - making it a great first time buy.

To the front of the property, there-s a small garden, giving you the opportunity to add some greenery to make it a more inviting space. As you enter, there are a set of stairs that takes you up to the hallway of the flat where you-ll find a small area to set up a work from home space. The layout encompasses of an open-plan living area, two immaculate bedrooms and a modern family bathroom.

Positioned to the left, the hallway leads to a spacious open-plan living space, which comprises of a living room, kitchen and dining area. The living room which also doubles up as a dining area is well-lit, absorbing masses of natural light from the large, double-glazed windows. The light grey walls coupled with the brown wooden flooring adds extra warmth to this space.

The contemporary kitchen is fully fitted with integrated appliances, timeless wooden worktops and wall-based units to give you plenty of storage space. The seamless open-plan layout makes this the perfect space for entertaining and bringing together family and friends.

There are two bedrooms, one being an impressive primary bedroom with ample space to add wardrobes and a chest of draws in order to give you the storage space you need. The large, double-glazed windows and multiple ceiling lights make the room exceptionally bright whilst the light grey walls and carpets make it super cosy to relax in. The second double bedroom has a similar design oozing simplicity in every element. A luxurious bathroom with marble style tiling, classic wooden panelling and a three-piece suite completes the property.

This remarkable flat has been impeccably maintained and modernised by its current owners with an elegant interior that really resonates a blank canvas with crisp, neutral walls running through out, giving you the opportunity to add your personal touch. Whether it be getting artistic and adding a splash of colour to bring the flat to life or keeping the interior neutral to give it a tranquil feel – the choice is yours.

The property is situated in an area that has so much to offer – it-s just under a mile from Ladywell, Catford Bridge and Catford train stations, providing you with an easy commute into Central London. There is an also an excellent network of local bus services connecting to the surrounding vicinity. The ever-popular Mountsfield Park and Ladywell Fields are conveniently located along with other local amenities such a wide range of shops, bars and restaurants of several different cuisines. Lewisham town centre is also nearby. The property is also centrally located for excellent local schools.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated within the highly sought after Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village is this impressive and large three bedroom, two bathroom corner apartment with parking.

Found on the fifth floor the property is in good decorative order throughout with floor to ceiling, dual aspect double glazed windows, wood flooring and under floor heating.

The accommodation briefly comprises a very large entrance hall with storage and utility cupboards and a superb 21'8x16'10 open plan lounge diner with an attractive modern kitchen with integrated appliances. The large master bedroom boasts a luxury modern ensuite bathroom and dressing area with extensive built in wardrobes, there are two further double bedrooms and a modern shower room.

The living room allows access onto the large, wrap around corner balcony and there is also a second balcony via the master bedroom. There is also a large, and rarely seen in Kidbrooke Village, terrace area for which the apartment has exclusive access, and the flat boasts 180 degree panoramic views over leafy South London.

The property also has the benefit of a secure underground car parking and access to an on-site concierge service, gym, swimming pool and business centre.

This property is a wonderful apartment and your immediate viewing is highly recommended. Virtual tours can be seen at

Wallace court is located in the prestigious Blackheath Quarter of the modern Kidbrooke Village – an award winning Berkeley Homes development. This is a completely new and vibrant London community offering an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as new homes, it will offer new parks, sports facilities, shops, bars & restaurants, schools, healthcare and community facilities.

Transport links to central London are very close via Kidbrooke station with regular trains to London Bridge (16 minutes), Waterloo East (22 minutes), Charing Cross (26 minutes), Cannon Street (25 minutes) and Victoria (31 minutes). Blackheath Village with its open green spaces offers an array of boutiques, daily conveniences, bars and restaurants and is only moments away.
features: ['Three bedrooms', 'Two bathrooms', 'Two balconies', 'Fifth floor', 'Underground parking', 'Concierge', 'Sole access to large rare terrace', 'Moments from Kidbrooke Station']
title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Set along the Quaggy river, this stunning 1 bed apartment is located within easy reach of Blackheath Park and a vibrant range of amenities on Lee Road. It offers contemporary interiors and an open plan living space.

Osborn House is set moments from Blackheath village to take advantage of excellent transport links to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria. Canary Wharf is within easy reach, offering fantastic amenities and shops.

detailedDescription:
****guide price £450,000 - £475,000**** Situated so conveniently with Horn park just a few hundred yards distant, Cooper's Lane and Horn Park primary schools about half a mile or so and both Lee and Grove Park stations about a mile away, this deceptively spacious and well presented two bedroom end terrace, has the benefit of two sizeable living rooms and a 15' master bedroom. With a well tended rear garden with gated rear access and small greens surrounding, this is a super first home/investment purchase, Take a look!

entrance hall Upvc front door, radiator, understairs cupboards, laminate flooring

bedroom 1 15' 0" to fitted wardrobe x 9' 6" (4.57m x 2.9m) Two double glazed leaded light windows to front, radiator, fitted wardrobe with mirror doors, fitted carpet

bathroom 6' 6" x 6' 5" (1.98m x 1.96m) Double glazed leaded light window to rear, white suite comprising shower bath with shower and glass shower screen, wash basin with fitted storage, w.c, heated towel rail, part tiled walls, tiled flooring

outside Well tended rear garden measuring approximately 28', mainly laid to lawn with flower borders, patio area with outside light and tap, shed, gated rear access.

address: Crystal Palace Park Road SE26, London
detailedDescription:
Galloways are delighted to have the opportunity to market this beautiful two bedroom apartment that has been completely renovated by the current owners. Set within a beautiful Victorian semi - detached house, this property is full of characteristic features and charm and would be ideal for those looking for an impressive home in a very convenient location. Positioned between Anerley, Penge high street and the famous Crystal Palace Triangle with an array of local shops, restaurants, bars, boutiques and leisure facilities, along with being just 0.1 mile from Penge West Station, 0.4 miles from Penge East station, 0.7 miles from Anerley Station and 0.7 miles from Crystal Palace Station all giving flexible access into Central London (distances estimated via Google Maps). The property also benefits from being on the door step of the ever so popular Crystal Palace Park, well known for its brand new 'Brown and Green' Cafe, its giant dinosaurs and maze attractions as well as Crystal Palace National sports centre and arena.

Boasting over 1060 sqft of spacious accommodation, this property comprises upon entering via the properties own front door; generous bright and airy entrance hall with built in storage cupboard, shaker style fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, reception room with splay bay window and plantation shutters, master bedroom with built in storage and views overlooking the communal gardens, further double bedroom, modern bathroom with roll top bath and separate shower. The property benefits from having been completely modernised, access to the communal garden and off street parking. Immediate viewing is recommended to truly appreciate what the property has to offer.

Safeguarding Your Information
Important information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or pc, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. Just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.

The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991
These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. We have not carried out a structural survey and the services, appliances and specific fittings have not been tested. All photographs, measurements, floor plans, and distances referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon for the purchase of carpets or any other fixtures or fittings. Gardens, roof terraces, balconies as well as tenure and lease details cannot have their accuracy guaranteed for intending purchasers. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. No person in the employment of Galloways has any authority to make any representation or warranty in relation to this property. Purchase prices, rents, or other prices quoted are correct at the date of publication and, unless otherwise stated, exclusive of VAT.

Data Protection
We retain the copyright in all advertising material used to market this Property.

Disclosure of Referral Fees
As well as your obligation to pay Galloway's commission or fees where applicable we may also receive a commission, payment, fee, or other reward or other benefits (known as a Referral Fee) from ancillary service providers for recommending their service to you. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and map Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. Galloways routinely refer to all potential purchasers and vendors to Hawke Financial Services. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with Hawke Financial Services. In making that decision, you should know that we receive benefits from Hawke Financial Services. The amount depends on the property value and level of mortgage. A share of this fee is received by Galloways, the details of which are available upon request.
Galloways offer all of our customers the opportunity to use the services of map surveyors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with map surveyors. You should know that Galloways receive a referral fee of £50.00 inc VAT from map Surveyors for recommending you to them. You are not under any obligation to use the services of any of the recommended providers, though should you accept our recommendation the provider is expected to pay us the corresponding Referral Fee. The Referral fee is separate from your obligation to pay our own fees or commission.

detailedDescription:

Unveiled to the SE23 market is this rare-to-find duplex-apartment, that comes with its very own private garden (including side access), a 994 year leasehold tenure, and being positioned on a quiet street in Forest Hill.

Forest Hill station is your closest station offering superb connections into London Bridge and London Victoria, as well as having access into East London via the highly rated Overground line. Apart from a local parade of shops at the end of your road, Forest Hill High Street provides a selection of boutiques, bars and eateries. The accommodation itself is set across two floors, surpassing 788sqft/73sqm of internal floor space, all of which providing a house like feel for an apartment value. The layout consists of two double bedrooms, one which having two built in storage cupboards, a spacious front reception room with a bay-window, a well-proportioned modern bathroom suite, and a bespoke designed 'L' shaped kitchen. Additional benefits include your very own private garden with AstroTurf, side access and a 994 year leasehold tenure.

Please note that due to the high-demand expected, viewings are strictly via appointment only.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Drakefell Road, Telegraph Hill, London SE14
detailedDescription:
Charming and beautiful two-bedroom period conversion on this desirable street between New Cross, Nunhead and Brockley.
Drakefell Road benefits from being almost opposite the glorious Telegraph Hill park, with local shops and amenities nearby as well as excellent transport links into The City and Canary Wharf from Nunhead station (0.4 miles) and Brockley station (0.4 miles). There are also useful bus connections into the neighbouring Peckham, Dulwich and Greenwich for their additional bars, restaurants and eateries.
Located on the first floor with sole-use of the loft – the property boasts over 700 Sq Ft of internal space with a separate kitchen, 17x14-ft reception room and two decent bedrooms to the rear of the apartment. The property would benefit from gentle modernisation and the current owner is prepared to start the lease extension process – to be completed after exchange.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
The street entrance introduces you to Lamington Mews set in a sought after creative gated development in the very heart of the buzzing SE6.
Boasting super slick interior styling an abundance of bespoke fixtures and fittings, you’ll be the envy of your friends when you’re entertaining. The property is strikingly spacious, the accommodation comprises huge open plan living/dining space area with white contemporary kitchen benefitting Bosch appliances.
Outside is a landscaped space that is a pretty walled front courtyard accessed via bi folding doors from your reception room, 'a real sun trap!' Back inside and upstairs to the naturally light bedroom with Juliet balcony and contemporary bespoke bathroom.
Other great benefits include; wet system underfloor heating to kitchen, living and bedroom floors with independent controllable temperature and timings for ground and first floor. Real oak and oiled engineered flooring throughout, entry phone system, secure cycle storage and much more.
I’m sure you and your neighbours will all build a great friendship in the mews.
As locations go Lamington Mews really is in the heart of Catford with an array of great local shops and restaurants surrounding a number of bus routes will whizz you to almost anywhere!.
Catford and Catford Bridge are a smart distance with superb rail links into central London via London Bridge, Charing Cross, Blackfriars and St Pancras to name a few. Nearby is Catford Mews Cinema and some lovely local parks just a five minute stroll.

Tenure: Freehold | Energy Efficiency Rating: E

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: Spanning an impressive 128.7sqm (1,386sqft) across two floors, this spacious garden-maisonette offers versatile accommodation in a rapidly gentrifying corner of riverside Deptford. Pelican House sits moments from the banks of the Thames surrounded by the green open spaces of Pepys Park and the leafy Aragon Gardens. The nearby Grand Canal Avenue hosts a plethora of new retailers including bars, eateries, salons a Tesco and a Co-Op, which have dramatically increased the popularity of this little known neighbourhood in recent years. This property enjoys five double bedrooms, a south facing living room and a separate kitchen diner. The private south-west facing garden offers an afternoon sun-trap in the summer months, while a riverside stroll will take you to Surrey Quays one way and Greenwich in the other.

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented to a very high standard this four bedroom Span house is located on the sought after private Cator Estate in Blackheath.
This stunning house has been renovated throughout offering a spacious open plan reception room with wooden floors and a newly fitted kitchen including dishwasher, fridge/freezer and new smeg hob, oven and microwave. This is a new Worcester Bosch combination boiler, controlled by a new Nest thermostat.

Downstairs there is a fourth/study room, plus newly fitted modern shower room. Upstairs two double bedrooms plus a large single bedroom and family bathroom including separate shower cubicle, bath, W.C and wash hand basin with unique skylight window. All fixtures and fittings throughout are to a very high specification. To the rear of the property is a low maintenance garden and patio area. Energy Efficiency Rating C.

agency_name: Winkworth - Forest Hill and New Cross
detailedDescription:
**Guide Price: £750,000 - £800,000**

An opportunity to purchase this amazing three bedroom period home set within the highly sought after Hatcham conservation area.

The well presented accommodation on offer comprises, private entrance, a large through reception room and a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and a huge 20'2 cellar.

To the first floor, there is a landing giving access to three bedrooms, with the master at a generous 14x11 ft and two further doubles, as well as a contemporary bathroom suite.

Externally there is a beautiful, west-facing garden with a patio and lawn area with a lovely mature herb garden and grape vine, to the rear aspect of the property.

Monson Road has an array of period features that is beautifully complimented with contemporary design. Viewing highly recommended

Location:
Located on Monson Road in a highly sought after road, in the heart of New Cross. Locally there is a vast choice of independent restaurants, bars and lively cafes all within an easy distance with the neighbourhoods of Telegraph Hill, Brockley, Nunhead and Peckham all close by. New Cross Road is central to a choice of mainline and Overground stations including New Cross Gate, New Cross, Queens Road Peckham and Nunhead which are all a short walk away and offer an easy commute to the City and central London. The area is also well serviced by the London Bus network with links across the capital.

detailedDescription:
2 bed apartments in Lewisham starting from £435,000

In partnership with Knight Frank, we’re delighted to offer the final collection of apartments at Arden, SE10. Lying at the southern point of the landscaping and gardens of Parkside, Arden will provide a selection of tranquil homes whilst surrounded by nature and boasting magnificent views of the capital.

Combining the historic charm of Greenwich, with open spaces of Blackheath and the energy of Lewisham, Arden is a place to call home in the heart of a growing neighbourhood. This stylish development of thoughtfully designed homes will boast modern interiors and high quality finishes throughout.

Arden integrates home life, work and wellness under one roof as residents can benefit from the generous amenities available at this stunning development. Experience a concierge service, co-working hub, the exclusive snug room which is a great place to unwind and enjoy. Encouraging a sense of wellness and wellbeing, Arden residents have access to a comprehensive fitness suite which includes a free weights room, spinning and yoga studios with a complimentary water station.

Help To Buy launching at Arden in Autumn 2021

Located in a quiet popular cul-de-sac development with excellent transport links from New Cross Gate br/Overground Station and Queen’s Road Peckham. New Cross Gate and neighbouring New Cross is seen as one of the hottest areas of London, due to its up-and-coming status and lively urban vibe. This fantastic property would make an ideal first time buy with accommodation comprising of large living room with dining area, modern fitted kitchen, two good size bedrooms and bathroom. The neutral décor further compliment this bright and spacious property. Further benefits include residence allocated parking, south-facing communal garden, communal bike shed, and newly fitted app-controlled electric heaters throughout.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £600,000-£620,000. With a 75ft garden and superb potential to extend and enhance, is this spacious three bedroom semi-detached 1930's home in this popular location very close to Kidbrooke mainline station and sold chain free.

The property is in need of modernisation throughout although does benefit from gas fired central heating and double glazed windows.

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with understairs storage, downstaris WC and double doors to a good size front reception room, spacious rear reception room with patio doors to garden, kitchen and a lean too to the rear. Upstairs are two large double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobes, generous single bedroom, bathroom with separate shower and bath and a separate WC. To the rear is a 75ft ft garden with lawn, mature shrubs and two sheds. There with a garage to the side with both front and rear access and off street parking to the front.

Many neighbouring properties have had significant extensions and loft conversions. Any interest parties should satisfy themselves to any relevant planning consents.

This is a great family home with excellent potential and viewing is strongly recommended. There is no chain. Video tour can be seen at

Broad Walk is a popular residential road conveniently located just 540 metres from Kidbrooke Mainline station, (rebuilt in 2021) and is just 17 minutes to London Bridge with trains also running to Charing Cross, Victoria and Cannon Street. The property is located just 800 metres from the new and prestigious Kidbrooke Village and 1.1 miles to Blackheath Village (one stop on train) with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park (with the Charlton Lido, cafe, tennis courts and bmx track within its bounds), Charlton House (gardens, play area and skate park), Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.

The property is also being sold with no onward chain.

Peak Hill is a lovely residential road close to a wealth of shopping and leisure facilities, as well as a selection of coffee shops and restaurants in Sydenham. EPC - D

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Chain free! John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this substantial, immaculately presented, four storey, four bedroom, two bathroom, Georgian family home located in West Greenwich.

This beautiful property offers over 2,200 square feet of accommodation, it has been refurbished throughout by its current owners but retaining many of its original period features including stripped floorboards, sash windows, exposed brickwork, feature fireplaces and corniced ceilings.

To the lower ground floor you will find a beautiful open plan family area comprising a living area, dining area, fully integrated kitchen with island, walk in larder, separate utility space and separate WC.

On the ground floor you will find a large hallway leading onto a grand, dual aspect through reception room featuring a wealth of period features and a separate WC.

To the first floor there is a beautiful master suite, a large master bedroom with a bespoke fitted walk in wardrobe and four piece bathroom with his and hers sinks. On the second floor you will find a further three double bedrooms and a modern newly fitted shower room.

Externally to the rear and accessed from the lower ground floor and ground floor there is access to a private 77 foot garden which has patio, lawned and decked areas and benefits from tonnes of sunlight.

Further benefits include; additional storage in the loft & in the vaults at the front of the house, secondary glazing at the front of the property and air conditioning in the front two bedrooms.

Residents permit parking available on surrounding residential streets.

The property is well located in West Greenwich on the edge of the popular Ashburnham Triangle. Deptford Bridge DLR is moments away and Greenwich mainline rail, along with the town centre is just a short walk. All local amenities are within a short walk which include Greenwich Park and Observatory, Blackheath Village, Deptford Bridge and Greenwich DLR stations for easy access to Canary Wharf, Greenwich mainline station, historic village and Royal Park, including regular bus routes to the West End and Central London.

A viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the full beauty of this Georgian property, contact us now to reserve your slot.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

Purplebricks are delighted to present this beautiful four bedroom family home in a popular and quiet residential road in Brockley.

This home will largely suit young families that will look to take advantage of the excellent local amenities and the fantastic transport links whist looking for a home to put your own stamp on.

The well proportioned home comprises of a generous entrance hallway with a practical downstairs shower room, a large living room with beautiful bay windows, open plan kitchen / dining room to the rear with direct access onto the private garden. Upstairs, there are four good size bedrooms and a large family sized bathroom.

The home is located in a quiet residential road within walking distance to Ladywell station which provides excellent links into Central London and the ever popular Ladywell High Street that includes an array of beautiful independents.

detailedDescription:
A rarely-available, chain free, substantial six bedroom Edwardian semi detached family home with versatile accommodation arranged over three floors, oozing charm and character throughout and situated within easy reach of Grove Park train station, local schools and shops.

This beautiful home offers spacious accommodation measuring in excess of 2300 sq ft and many stunning original features, briefly comprises an impressive entrance hall, spacious front reception room, dining room opening to a fantastic kitchen/breakfast room with marble worktops, ground floor WC and family laundry room, six bedrooms and two bathrooms. Externally there is a delightful East facing rear garden and a good size front garden.

The area is well served by good local schools and conveniently located for both Grove Park & Lee Stations with frequent trains into the city. Grove Park Station is the closest & is London Zone 4 with direct links into London Bridge, Charing Cross, Blackfriars, Waterloo East & Cannon Street in as little as 14 minutes. Parallel Burnt Ash Hill hosts the freshly refurbished ‘The Crown’ gastro pub (), a large Sainsbury’s is available in Lee (Grove Park also offers Sainsburys & Tescos local) & finally you are only a 3.5km (approx.) equidistant walk from Blackheath Village (North) or Bromley Town Centre (South).

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
You enter into a spacious hall with the original exposed floor boards that run through to the two main reception rooms. Both reception rooms are over 20ft long with large bay windows and original fireplaces. Across the hall is a great study and the kitchen diner. The shaker style kitchen is made up of light coloured units with a contrasting stone work top. Bi-folding doors lead to out to a raised patio. There is a shower room off the hall and stairs down to a handy basement.

On the first floor are four bedrooms and a fantastic family bathroom with a freestanding bath and separate walk-in shower. The top floor has been opened up into one large bedroom with a living area. There is also a small kitchen and ample eaves storage so would make an ideal space for an Au pair. The stunning west facing garden is over 100ft in length and is mainly laid to lawn with a raised patio out from the house. The whole garden is surrounded by an array of mature trees and shrubs. To the front is a black paved drive and a handy garage that is used as storage.

Beaconsfield Road runs through the middle of the ever popular Westcombe Park Conservation Area. The house is conveniently located for access to various local amenities, only a short walk away from Westcombe Park station. Blackheath Standard and Greenwich Royal Park are both within easy reach. At Blackheath Standard you will find a Marks & Spencer Food Hall amongst a variety of independent shops and cafés. A stroll through Greenwich Royal Park will bring you into Greenwich town centre and transport to the City by road, rail or riverboat. Finally, Westcombe Park train station provides regular services into London Bridge and Cannon Street.

Located in the sought after Culverley Conservation Area, this 4 bedroom Edwardian property would be ideal for a family wanting a spacious home that has been lovingly modernised and extended throughout. Internally on the ground floor the property boasts a rear extension, 3 reception rooms and a modern fitted kitchen. The garage has also been converted and now houses a utility room, downstairs shower room as well as another reception room. The double doors to the rear flow onto a vast landscaped garden which also houses a summer house.

On the first floor which has also been extended to the rear, is the impressive 15'10" x 14'5" master bedroom, 3 further double bedrooms and a recently upgraded family bathroom. Externally the property benefits from off street parking, large back garden.

A family dominated area where passionate local groups create events throughout the year for a thriving Community. Commuter links from the twin Stations of Catford & Catford Bridge provide regular services to The City and West End as well as Thameslink services to Farringdon, St Pancras and North London.

detailedDescription:
** Guide Price : £349,995 - £375,00 **

re/max estate agents are proud to present this spacious, three-bedroom maisonette situated on the second and third floor of the building. The property is located at the heart of Lewisham, amongst a delightful community.

This home represents an ideal first-time purchase or investment opportunity - it truly has huge potential to add value through renovation. After striping back all the furniture in this property, your left with a blank canvas ready to be spruced up with unlimited creativity. Whether it be aligning the colour palette of the interior throughout or adding a burst of colour to the walls to bring it to life or updating the family bathroom – the choices are endless.

As you enter, you will find yourself in the hallway, which connects you to the rest of the house. To the right is a well-sized kitchen fitted with timeless wooden cupboards giving you all the storage space you need. An added bonus is the integrated appliances such as a cooker, oven and washing machine. There-s additional space for other utility appliances like a fridge freezer. If you want to update the kitchen, it just needs a lick of paint and you could even change the tiling to match the rest of the aesthetics.

Next to the kitchen, you will find a spacious living room with an array of large, double-glazed windows bringing in an influx of natural light, creating a bright and airy feel. The living room is the heart of this home – the perfect space to gather up after a long day to unwind and get cosy. You can leave this space as it is with it-s calming neutral colour palette or you can be bold with colour by creating an accent wall to give it a stylish look.

Up the stairs, the living accommodation comprises of three bedrooms. There is an outstanding primary bedroom, which has huge custom built-in wardrobes, providing you with ample storage space. The second double room is spacious, with room to add wardrobes and a chest of draws in order to give you the storage space you need. The smallest bedroom can be converted into a study room, which would be an excellent space to work from home.

All rooms are characterised by their bright feel, coming from the windows, which flood the rooms with sunlight. You can always be experimental adding warm shades to transform the rooms with a comforting mood, or cool colours to provide a soothing feel.

There is a separate toilet and a family bathroom featuring a sink basin and bath, which completes this floor. You can always combine the toilet, making it one large family bathroom and give it a little design boost with small updates to make it ultra-modern.

The property is situated within easy reach of Elverson Road DLR, just 140 metres away as well Lewisham Station which provides frequent and fast services into London Bridge, Waterloo East, Cannon Street and Charing Cross. There is an also an excellent network of local bus services connecting to the surrounding vicinity.

Lewisham town centre is nearby, and you will also find a diverse range of restaurants and cafes, including locals- favourite Sparrow restaurant. Blackheath Common is also around one mile away by foot and offers a picturesque green setting to relax in and to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Greenwich Park being also a mile away, overlooks the River Thames and home to some of London-s most iconic views. Greenwich Park is an amazing mix of 17th century landscape, stunning gardens and a rich history that dates back to Roman times. The property is centrally located for excellent local schools. The location of this property is perfect for a small family or first-time buyer looking to get on the ladder.

**Edited photos are intended for illustrative purposes and should be treated as general guidance only.**

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £425-450K**

An opportunity to purchase this amazing two double bedroom period apartment set within a highly desirable location in New Cross.

The well presented accommodation on offer comprises communal entrance, private entrance, a huge 17'0 x 14'4 lounge, modern fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms and a beautiful bathroom suite.

Externally the property benefits from access to a communal garden to the rear aspect of the property.

This Victorian conversion is offered in superb condition throughout and viewing is highly recommended.

Location:
The surrounding area is residential, with wide, tree-lined roads and is renowned for its community, with the annual Telegraph Hill Festival showcasing local arts, theatre, film, food, open gardens and music. There are two parks on the Hill, the Lower Park affording space to children's play areas, a wildlife pond and a weekly farmer's market. The Upper Park is an urban green space with City views and public tennis courts.
Besides local corner shops, dry cleaners and Post Office, there is a full range of supermarkets close by: Sainsbury's at New Cross Gate, Aldi, Lidl and Tesco's on the Old Kent Road, Morrisons in Peckham. Likewise, some of London's best hospital facilities at Lewisham, London Bridge and Denmark Hill are all within 30 minutes' reach.
Telegraph Hill is particularly popular among families as there is an extensive choice of local schools at nursery, primary and secondary levels, with further options in Ladywell, Blackheath, and Dulwich.
Situated in Zone 2, the area offers a wide choice of public transport options to many destinations: The DLR from Deptford Bridge to the City's Financial District; the Overground from New Cross Gate and New Cross to Canada Water, Shoreditch High Street and Highbury & Islington. The mainline services from these stations connect to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Blackfriars Waterloo East & Charing Cross. Nunhead is a short walk away and trains run to Victoria, Farringdon and St. Pancras International. The bus station on New Cross road runs frequent services to local areas and central London.

detailedDescription:
In this popular location very close to Manor House Gardens, Blackheath Village and Hither Green Station, is this impressive four bedroom, two bathroom, period home offered to the market chain free.

The property is in excellent decorative order with features including; double glazed sash windows, ornate cornicing, high ceilings, stripped floorboards, fireplaces and gas fired central heating.

Arranged over three floors the accommodation comprises; entrance hall with storage cupboard, a superb 29'3 through reception room with bay window to the front, a good size kitchen and access to the cellar. Upstairs to the first floor are three bedrooms, two of which are large double bedrooms and a modern shower room. Bathroom. The loft has been converted to form a fantastic master suite with a 20'6 x 12'5 (max) bedroom with extensive built in wardrobes, Juliette balcony to the rear, Velux windows, ample eaves storage and a stylish ensuite bathroom with freestanding bath. To the rear of the property is a lovely decked west facing garden.

This is a wonderful home and is sold chain free. Your immediate viewing is essential. Video Tours can be seen at .

The property is in a popular location for families and very close to Manor House Gardens as well as Manor Park, Blackheath Common and Greenwich. Lee, Hither Green, Lewisham (DLR) stations are within a short walk as is Blackheath Village and Station. Travel time from Lewisham station to London Bridge is 7 minutes with trains also operating to Cannon Street, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Victoria. Canary Wharf is easily accessible via Lewisham DLR. There are several Ofsted rated "Outstanding" primary schools and excellent children's day nursery options close by in Lee and Blackheath.

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price of £700,000 to £725,000*

Victorian | End of Terrace | Masses of Potential

Unveiled to the SE4 market is this incredibly sought after Victorian family home situated in central Brockley, just moments away from the highly rated London Overground line.

The accommodation itself is set over two floors, all of which providing a free flowing layout and potential to increase the number of bedrooms by way of a loft conversion (subject to planning permission or building regulation approval). The ground floor layout boasts a stunning open plan through-lounge, with direct access onto the separate fully fitted kitchen. The houses further comprises three bedrooms, a well-proportioned bathroom and a low maintenance rear garden.

Brockley Station is 0.2 miles away (according to Google maps) and offers links into London Victoria & London Bridge. The station also serves the highly rated East London Overground Line which has four trains per hour linking you to Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington via Shoreditch High Street. Nunhead Station is within a 10 minute walk away (according to Google maps) which serves London Victoria, and London Blackfriars via Elephant and Castle.

Sure to attract a wide variety of buyers, be quick to view as if history is anything to go by in this pocket of SE4, these highly requested Victorian homes do sell extremely quickly! Feel free to call our Acorn Brockley office at your earliest convenience.

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Energy Efficiency Rating: D.

detailedDescription:
Immaculate two bedroom, two bathroom apartment available in the Marine Wharf Development. This modern, high spec apartment is built by Berkeley Homes and comes with 24hr concierge facilities, a communal garden area with a water feature, and an on-site residents' gym.

The apartment opens to a spacious hallway which leads to the property's two double bedrooms, two modern bathrooms, one of which is an en-suite, and open plan kitchen and living space. The bright south facing balcony, which spans the length of the property, opens from the living space and overlooks the landscaped linear garden.

The development is surrounded by a number of local amenities including restaurants, a deli, supermarkets and independent coffee shops. South Dock Marina and the Thames Clipper ferry port are also both within walking distance.

For more information, please contact the Living in London Sales Team.

A strong reason for Telegraph Hill’s popularity is its excellent transport links from New Cross Gate (6 mins to London Bridge and 16 mins to Canary Wharf), Nunhead (18 mins to Blackfriars and 19 mins to Victoria) and Queen’s Road Peckham on the London Overground accessing Clapham and sw London as well as Shoreditch, Hackney and Islington. This stunning property overlooks the beautiful Telegraph Hill Upper Park, with its free-to-use tennis courts, boasting superb views over central London, or visit the lower park Saturday farmers market. Accommodation is comprising of entrance hall, large reception with feature fireplace, modern fitted kitchen, three good size bedrooms with en-suite WC to master bedroom and family bathroom. The neutral décor further compliments this beautiful home.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderful three-bedroom house extends over 910 sq ft and lies in a perennially popular enclave of southeast London, equidistant from Brockley, St Johns and New Cross. It has a terraced garden, which is a veritable sun-trap, and the current owners have recently renovated throughout to create an open, light-filled home spread over the two storeys. The typically 1920s façade on Shardeloes Road belies the extensive contemporary renovations within.

The Tour

The house presents a smart façade to the street, painted in a contemporary palette of neutrals; all of the windows and the front door have either been replaced or refurbished. Entrance is to a large hallway, which extends through the footprint of the house, all the way to the kitchen at the rear. A living room lies to the right of the hall; this is illuminated throughout the day by light that streams in through the south-westerly aspect. Many original features have been retained, including a glazed-brick, art deco fireplace.

The rear of the ground floor contains a spacious, open-plan kitchen and dining room. This has been thoughtfully realised by the current owner, who has laid hardwood floors and utilised a neutral palette to create a considered, contemporary space. The kitchen is L-shaped in plan and has extensive storage. Large sliding doors open onto a small patio where decked steps lead up to the garden; light entering through the doors bathes the interior space with light and blurs the boundary between indoor and out. A guest bathroom adjoins the kitchen at the rear.

An original staircase leads up to the first floor, where three bedrooms can be found; one of these is currently used as an office. There is a family bathroom fitted with white porcelain tiles; the neutral palette found downstairs continues across this floor.

Outdoor Space

The garden has been recently refurbished; all wooden elements were installed this year. The elevated seating area is a true sun-trap and a lovely spot for alfresco dining, with flagstones underfoot that ensure the space is suitably versatile and low-maintenance. Mature bamboo at the rear adds texture and a dash of greenery.

The Area

Shardeloes Road lies in a thriving London neighbourhood with a growing cultural profile. A short walk from St Johns, New Cross and Nunhead, with Deptford, Greenwich and Peckham slightly further afield, it is swiftly becoming one of the most fashionable parts of southeast London. The area surrounding Shardeloes Road has a range of cafes, pubs and restaurants including Good as Gold, Sparrow, Joyce and Marcella. There are plenty of green spaces nearby, including Nunhead Cemetery, Peckham Rye and Hilly Fields.

There is a renowned farmers’ market every Saturday at Brockley Market, offering a wide range of organic produce, alongside food trucks and wine merchants. Deptford Market Yard, a recently launched collection of independent shops and restaurants set within and around Deptford’s refurbished railway arches, is nearby. Goldsmiths University is within walking distance, and will soon open the doors to its new gallery, designed by Turner-prize winning architects Assemble.

The house is an eight-minute walk from Brockley Station, which runs services to London Bridge in 12 minutes. Frequent Overground services also run from Brockley for connections to Peckham, Shoreditch and Highbury & Islington. St John’s station is a 15-minute walk with trains to Cannon Street in 14 minutes.

detailedDescription:
Located a few minutes walk from Lewisham Station and the local amenities of Lewisham Road, this two bedroom, second floor flat, has been tastefully refurbished using a neutral palette and boasts plenty of natural light.

The flat benefits from a semi open plan, fully fitted kitchen with incorporated stainless steel electric fan oven, four ring gas hob and extractor fan, a full size fridge freezer, dishwasher and integrated washing machine.

The spacious living area boasts engineered oak wood floors, a skylight and windows towards the rear of the flat. There are also two carpeted double bedrooms and a family bathroom with shower cubicle and bath tub.

No Chain!

detailedDescription:
This beautifully modern one-bedroom apartment is an absolute delight! On the second floor, enter the property through the wood grain panelled door and the apartment is bright and inviting. Nestled within the well planned Kidbrooke Village development, is our stunning apartment, where consideration for beauty and sustainable development go hand in hand.

As you enter immediately to your right is the spacious, classy bathroom; truly modern with contemporary tiles, wall mounted seamless W/C, shower and bath. The bedroom is well sized, with large wall to wall built in, fitted storage, complete with sliding doors. The feature windows run from ceiling to floor and has a door which opens onto a Juliet balcony. The lounge is spacious and opens out onto a balcony. The kitchen and lounge are open planned, and the kitchen is crisp and modern with fitted oven, hob, and fridge-freezer.

Property suitable for an investor 5% yield, available with tenant in-situ or with for a first time buyer with vacant possession

Kidbrooke Village has a peaceful and serene ambiance, built within parkland and serviced by planned recreation and leisure amenities; including a residents only gym, a swimming pool, a movie room, as well as 24-hour concierge and a Zipcar car share club. Conveniently a new Sainsbury's Local is now open.

Trains leave from Kidbrooke station for London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria, connecting with the London Underground at these mainline Stations. Trains also connect to Lewisham providing links to the DLR to Greenwich, Canary Wharf and Stratford.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Must-see 1-bed apartments in new cross at the scene

With so much on offer, why not choose to view at The Scene this weekend?

This charming, low-storey development boasts beautiful apartments with stylish interiors, fitted kitchens with quality appliances and built-in wardrobes to the main bedroom. Benefit from spacious living areas complete with underfloor heating that help maximise thoughtful layouts, and large windows that let natural daylight flow into the home.

Double-bedrooms make it hard to choose which room will be your main bedroom, but the convenient en-suite in addition to the main bathroom makes that choice slightly easier.

A collection of homes and private balconies overlook the newly landscaped Charlottenburg Park – a recently developed outdoor space in the area with play areas and hard-surfaces for impromptu sports games.

Wheelchair accessible homes also available - please enquire for further details.

Local area

Found where between Deptford and New Cross, The Scene is perfectly placed within humble surrounding of residential streets and nearby great locations such as Deptford Market Yard and Greenwich Park, and even more options further afield on bike including Shoreditch High Street and London Bridge. Discover more of the area in are local area video.

Travelling & getting around

In a highly accessible area, The Scene is minutes from New Cross station and Deptford station, making your journey into central London a little easier. Reach London Bridge within 5 minutes, Cannon Street station within 9 minutes and Canary Wharf in 12 minutes from Deptford Bridge Station. And for further afield travels, King’s Cross St Pancras can be reached by rail in 22 minutes.^

Buying with shared ownership

Available to purchase through Shared Ownership, purchasers are able to buy as much of the property as they can afford, from 30 - 75%, paying a low cost rent on the remaining unpurchased 'share' of the home. What's more, your mortgage deposit is based on the value of the share you buy, not the full market value, making these high-spec homes even more affordable in such a sought after location.

Find out more about the scene

Built in partnership with Sherrygreen Homes, The Scene is a vibrant new collection of apartments, duplexes and houses in New Cross (Lewisham).

Register your interest or speak to our helpful sales team to find out more.

About The Scene So

This stylish development of thoughtfully designed homes sits beside the newly landscaped Charlottenburg Park, and will boast modern interiors and high quality finishes throughout. From conveniently modern 1-bed apartments with stylish specifications to spacious 3-bedroom apartments with balconies; homes at The Scene are the ideal backdrop to London-living in an exciting and inspiring part of south-east London.

detailedDescription:
Must-see 2-bed apartments in new cross at the scene

With so much on offer, why not choose to view at The Scene this weekend?

This charming, low-storey development boasts beautiful apartments with stylish interiors, fitted kitchens with quality appliances and built-in wardrobes to the main bedroom. Benefit from spacious living areas complete with underfloor heating that help maximise thoughtful layouts, and large windows that let natural daylight flow into the home.

Double-bedrooms make it hard to choose which room will be your main bedroom, but the convenient en-suite in addition to the main bathroom makes that choice slightly easier.

A collection of homes and private balconies overlook the newly landscaped Charlottenburg Park – a recently developed outdoor space in the area with play areas and hard-surfaces for impromptu sports games.

There is also another beautiful family sized bathroom.

The development is moments away from Ladywell Playing Fields where you could cut through to reach Ladywell High Street & Ladywell Station.

This apartment is larger than average and boasts near 1000 sq ft of living space. It also benefits from allocated parking.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Property Ref: 9254

Very rare penthouse loft with wow factor in zone 2!
Made of a unique design, this is the only penthouse with private south-facing roof terrace in a small, residential building.

One of the brightest top floor flats in London, this penthouse is flooded with natural light even on gloomy winter days thanks to its triple exposure and vaulted ceilings. You won't have to switch the lights on until it's dark outside (very low bills!)..

The flat is located on the third and fourth floor of a small private building with a lift and it comprises of:
- entrance hall
- separate kitchen with washing machine, dishwasher, hob/oven, fridge/freezer
- bathroom with 3 piece suite
- spacious living/dining room with separate office area and direct access to 2 terraces
- spacious and airy bedroom with built-in wardrobe

The highlight of this unique penthouse is its massive south-facing private roof terrace, perfect for entertaining and sunbathing all day in complete privacy on all sides (not overlooked by neighbours). This outdoor space was such a godsend during the pandemic!
Another balcony is on the western side, to enjoy incredible sunsets.

Extra features: 5+ meters vaulted ceilings, glass interiors, separate kitchen, double glazing, high-security door, CCTV and lift service.

The location provides excellent transport links with a bus stop right outside the building, a new Overground station due to open 5 mins walk away and the Jubilee Line a few minutes away by bus.

The property is a stone's throw from a park with pond, ducks and a cafe for that mid-morning latte and pastry or 10 mins walk to the grocery store. Canary Wharf with its trendy restaurants and bars is only 1 stop away on the Jubilee Line or you can easily walk or cycle to Greenwich for a Sunday roast.

You won't find another penthouse of this kind for under £500k in zone 2!
It will go fast, schedule your viewing today!

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
***! 35% shared ownership purchase !***

A stunning one bedroom, third floor apartment set in the ever popular Kidbrooke Village Development, just 0.3 miles from Kidbrooke Station. Having been maintained to a high standard by the current owner, this property would make an ideal first time purchase.

The apartment comprises of entrance hall with utility/storage cupboard, a bright and airy open plan kitchen/living area with integrated appliances and access to a large private balcony, double bedroom with full length windows and a 3 piece suite with shower over bath.

The development benefits from an on-site concierge, gym, secure right to park parking, bike storage and a lift.
Shared ownership information

Share: 35%
Purchase Price: £122,500
Monthly Rent; £564.48
Please note, there is the option to purchase 35% or more up to full outright purchase (100%). *
Location

Kidbrooke is located in one of London's most popular locations, the Royal Borough of Greenwich and comprises of four distinct neighbourhoods, integrated seamlessly into one community.
Kidbrooke enjoys all the benefits of this culturally rich area, including the beautiful Greenwich Park, the Royal Observatory and Maritime Greenwich. Greenwich is a lively hub with something for everyone. In addition to the popular Greenwich Market there are high street brands and independent boutiques too. All tastes and budgets are catered for by a fine selection of restaurants and pubs, many of which are housed in historic buildings often with park or river views. Convenient public transport is an important part of the sustainability for Kidbrooke. Good train and bus connections are key elements of its sustainability. Trains leave from Kidbrooke station for London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria, connecting with the London Underground at these mainline stations. Trains also run to Lewisham providing links via DLR to Greenwich, Canary Wharf and Stratford. A regular bus service provides connections for onward travels across London and there are safe pedestrian and cycle routes running through and from Kidbrooke Village.
Just around the corner from Kidbrooke is Blackheath. The heath itself is a wonderful place for walking, being one of the largest areas of open land in London. It supports many species of rare plants and wildlife and from its highest point you can see the towers of Canary Wharf.
Leasehold information

Lease Term: 120 years*
Service Charge and Ground Rent: £2,760 per year*
Please note this property has a 10 year build Premier Guarantee
(*to be verified by Vendors Solicitor)
Other information

Local Authority: Royal Borough of Greenwich
Council Tax: Band C (£1,457.77 pa)

Entrance Hall

Entrance door, wood floor, built in storage, access to all rooms.

Reception Room / Kitchen (26' 1" x 12' 0" (7.95m x 3.66m))

Double glazed window and door to balcony, wood floor, double panel radiator, range of white modern wall and base units, integrated hob and oven, stainless steel sink unit with mixer tap, integrated fridge freezer, plumbed for washing machine, integrated dishwasher.

Bedroom (13' 1" x 7' 10" (3.99m x 2.39m))

Double glazed window, fully fitted carpet, radiator.

Bathroom

Panel enclosed bath with shower attachment and glass shower screen, wash hand basin, low level WC, heated towel rail, vinyl flooring, partly tiled walls, spot lights.

Balcony

Decked.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Nestled on the edge of the heath and in the heart of Blackheath Village, with outstanding views, is this four double bedroom Grade II listed Georgian home with a 70ft rear garden (with rear access) and a large front garden.

The current owners have carefully and sympathetically refurbished the house to a very high standard throughout. In addition to practical updates (the central heating system was replaced in 2014, for example, and the roof was replaced in 2011), their attention to detail has included reinstating architraves, skirtings and wooden panelled doors - using templates from originals. Features include; sash windows, solid wood flooring, Lefroy Brooks sanitaryware in the bathrooms, feature radiators, fireplaces and bespoke Chamber Furniture joinery.

Arranged over four floors, the accommodation comprises; an entrance porch and hallway leading to a 24'9 dual aspect through-reception with arched alcoves and bespoke solid wood cabinets. On a half landing is the utility room with modern fitted units, and back door out to the garden. The lower ground floor is home to a bespoke Greenwich Woodworks beech shaker kitchen, a 15'6 x 12'10 second reception room with built in alcove storage and access to the front door and a large dry storeroom sitting under the front garden.

Moving up, off the half landing, a stylish shower room with double walk in shower. On the first floor, a large bedroom spans the width of the house and is currently enjoyed as an additional reception room with built-in book shelving and superb views over the heath. Adjacent is a second double bedroom with alcove wardrobes and garden views. A second bathroom with bespoke panelling is found on the half landing up to the top floor. There is a large full width master bedroom which again boasts wonderful views and a fourth double bedroom to the rear. Both rooms have built-in alcove wardrobes.

To the rear is an East-facing garden extending to approximately 70 ft. It's paved in the main with well-established shrubs, plants and climbers, and is a really private retreat. Natural seating areas are by the house and at the foot of the garden. From the rear of the garden there is access onto Paragon Place where there is ample parking (residents permits) and the current owners rent a garage. You have gated access to your beautifully-bordered and lawned front garden.

This is an outstanding home in a fantastic location and viewing is an absolute must. Video tours can be seen at

Montpelier Row is a prestigious and sought after address nestled on the edge and directly facing the heath. Blackheath Village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and farmers market, giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. Close by you will find the historic Greenwich town centre and Royal Greenwich Park can be seen from the house. There are several sought-after schools within a few minutes walk including Heath House, Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School and the Pointer School. Blackheath Station gives access to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria amongst others.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
New to the market. Living in London are proud to present this two bedroom, two bathroom apartment situated in the highly sought after Greenland Place development. Located on the 3rd floor, this stylish, contemporary apartment offers over 800 sq ft of premium living space as well as a good size private balcony. The apartment also benefits from a 24 hour concierge service, fully equipped resident-only fitness suite, secure bike storage and access to the rooftop garden with 360° views of the City and Canary Wharf skyline.

The well-proportioned open plan living, kitchen and dining area is beaming with natural light and leads out onto a spacious, private balcony. The kitchen itself is finished to the highest standard and incorporates state-of-the-art integrated appliances, with ample storage cupboards, boasting a seamless, handle-less design.

The master bedroom is generously sized, with a timeless neutral decor and floor to ceiling windows, flooding it with natural light. The luxurious en-suite bathroom is finished to a very high standard. The property boasts a good sized second bedroom and an additional family bathroom. The entire apartment itself benefits from underfloor heating and generous storage space.

This bustling development in Zone 2 has a range of cafes, restaurants, beauty salons, convenience stores and excellent transport connections: Canada Water Tube Station (Jubilee Line & London Overground, Zone 2) is just a scenic walk along Greenland Dock away, and from there you are just two minutes to Canary Wharf, three minutes to London Bridge, nine minutes to Shoreditch, 10 minutes to Bank and 13 minutes to Bond Street. Or if you fancy travelling by boat, Greenland Pier is also just 0.5 miles away and only one stop away from Canary Wharf.

This stunning apartment must be at the top of your viewing list!

For more information, please contact the Living in London Sales Team
