address: Lewisham Exchange, Asquith Court, 1 Thurston Road, Lewisham SE13
detailedDescription:
One bedroom Wheelchair Adaptable/Accessible apartment for Shared Ownership in Lewisham.

1 bedroom apartment available at Lewisham Exchange for £149,000!

Lewisham Exchange - Apartment A42
12th floor apartment offering 61.19 sq.m of internal floor area.

£149,000 for a 40% share of £372,500 full market value and a deposit as low as £7,450 and a minimum household income of £46,337.
£186,250 for a 50% share of £372,500 and a deposit as low as £9,312.50
£279,375 for a 75% share of £372,500 and a deposit as low as £13,968,75

There are certain conditions to be eligible for a Shared Ownership accessible/adaptable property:

" You must have a need for a wheelchair-adaptable home in order to apply.
" You must be at least 18 years old.
" You must be unable to buy a home suitable for your needs on the open market.
" Priority will be given to persons who work or live in the local area.
" You will need sufficient savings for a mortgage deposit (generally a minimum of 5% of your share) and a clean credit history to qualify for a mortgage.
" Your annual household income must be less than £90,000.
" You must be a first-time buyer or existing shared owner. If you already own a home, and need to move but cannot afford to, then please discuss your situation with us. There are some circumstances under which you could be eligible.
" In line with government priorities, priority for Shared Ownership homes is awarded to serving military personnel and former members of the British Armed Forces honourably discharged in the last two years. People who live or work in the local area also receive priority. We welcome applications from everyone and will try and help if we can.

Wheelchair Adaptable Throughout.
These properties have been designed to meet latest wheelchair accessible housing design standards and building regulations, offering extra space and full access to all rooms and facilities. This standard provides more space than previous wheelchair housing design guidance and also ensures that all rooms are accessible.

Description
Lewisham Exchange offers high end finishes and is conveniently located for the DLR and other great London transport links. Close to the leafy open green spaces of Blackheath and Greenwich and only 10 minutes by train to London Bridge from Lewisham Station, Lewisham Exchange is exceptionally well connected.
This exciting new development offers contemporary new one, two & three bedroom apartments. The apartments are modern and spacious, with welcoming communal areas.
With their quality specification, your home will boast a well proportioned fitted kitchen with ample work surfaces and integrated oven, fridge freezer, dishwasher and washer/dryer discretely tucked away. Bathrooms are tiled with chrome fixtures and bold, modern fittings.
Lewisham is one of London's most welcoming neighbourhoods. Straddling, Blackheath and Greenwich, the area is well connected and has everything you need close at hand.

Roads
Whether you're on the bus, in the car or on your bike, Lewisham is a central road hub. The A2 and A20 both go through this part of London, linking you to the motorway network, Kent countryside, south coast and Channel Tunnel. There are numerous night buses running to Lewisham from Central London including the N21, N199, N89 and the N136.

Planes
There is a swift, efficient DLR link to London City Airport in 36 minutes from Lewisham DLR station and you can reach Gatwick Airport in under an hour via London Bridge. For Heathrow Airport your journey will take 65 minutes via Paddington on the Heathrow Express and Crossrail will offer a faster service from Canary Wharf in under 40 minutes and is anticipated to be fully operational by the end of 2021.

Rail
Lewisham Station is right next door, offering quick, frequent Overground and DLR services to the centre of London.

Cable Car
When you want to cross the river you could take a bridge or tunnel. Or you could choose the Emirates Air Line with its spectacular views. No wonder more and more people are choosing this part of town.

Boats
What better way of commuting to the West End on a summer's morning than taking the boat from Greenwich Pier?

About Lewisham Exchange
Located between the Lewisham Retail Park and the town centre, the site benefits from proximity to excellent public transport links with nearby access to national rail services and the DLR. Lewisham Exchange offers the best of urban London living.

The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you'd expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright. At Lewisham Exchange you can buy a minimum 40% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you're ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home.
To be eligible for shared ownership you would need to meet the following criteria:
O Your household income does not exceed £80,000 (outside of London) and £90,000 (inside of London)
o You have a deposit of at least 5% of the share value
o You do not own another property or have your name on the deeds or a mortgage for a property worldwide.
O This will be your only residence.
O You are a permanent UK resident or have indefinite right to remain.

To register your interest or for any other enquiries please contact our sales team

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A thoughtfully extended three bedroom terraced family home offering over 1,200 sq ft of living space. This property is located in close proximity to Bellingham Station and other excellent transport links as well great local amenities.

The property comprises of a generous entrance hallway leading to a good sized front living room with access through to a second lounge . There is a separate kitchen and an extension providing extra dining/living space. To the rear, there is a practical and convenient shower room. There is a garage to the rear which is reached from the rear access road. Upstairs, there are three good sized bedrooms and a large family bathroom.

The property is in neutral condition and offers buyers a blank canvas to put their own stamp on.

Viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
As a brand new destination in the heart of E13, Upton Gardens includes a range of contemporary 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments designed by Barratt, one of the market-leading developers in the Capital with over 30 years of experience.

Upton Gardens is constructed on the site of the former stadium of West Ham Football Club. Situated in Upton Park in the London borough of Newham, East London, this historic location was home to the club from 1904, before it relocated to Stratford Olympic Park in 2016. With its impressive football heritage, owning a property in Upton Gardens is a once in a lifetime opportunity to secure your piece of British sporting history.

The design of Upton Gardens strongly identifies with the former football ground it is built on, with the layout of the buildings shadowing the layout of the old stadium and a small circus exactly where the centre circle of the pitch was.

As an Upton Gardens resident, you will enjoy facilities such as a concierge, a fully equipped gym and underground car parking including storage for over 1,000 bikes. There are also 64 electric vehicle charge points and eight car club vehicles for your use. In addition, a number of new community amenities such as a large public library and cafes are being built as part of the site.

The development has been designed to maximise green areas - all homes will include private outdoor space, as well as access to communal gardens and landscaping, including a direct walkway to Priory Park behind the development.

*Please note that any CGIs used are for indicative purposes only

Owing to our commitment to keeping both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many virtual viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Conveniently located in Zone 3, Upton Gardens is a 6-minute walk from Upton Park underground station, which operates on the District and Hammersmith & City lines with direct links into central London.

Stratford - 11 Minutes
Liverpool Street - 15 Minutes
Canary Wharf - 16 Minutes
West End - 31 Minutes

Crossrail is due to arrive at nearby Forest Gate, which will reduce journey times to Canary Wharf to 8 minutes and Tottenham Court Road to 17 Minutes.

detailedDescription:
Located in the highly sought after Upper Sydenham, is this extended, mid century, terraced home which boasts over 1000 sq ft of accommodation.

The ground floor consists of a generous reception room to the front (which could be used a further bedroom if preferred) and to the rear of the property the extended dining area is open plan to the lounge and fitted kitchen and leads to an attractive patio area over looking the garden. Upstairs you will find three bedrooms and a contemporary bathroom with electric shower.
Other features include parking to the front, double glazing throughout, gas central heating and Solar Panels with feed-in-tariff (money back from energy supplier quarterly, free electricity during the day).

This would be a perfect home for growing families given the close proximity of several popular schools and Parks nearby.

Location

Situated in a quiet cul de sac with Sydenham and Forest Hill Stations approximately 10-12 minutes walk away which provides an excellent commute into both East and Central London, connecting you to stations such as London Bridge, Dalston, Shoreditch, Highbury & Islington and London Victoria via Clapham Junction.
Local high street shops and amenities are within easy reach and there is a good choice of green space with Crystal Palace Park, the award winning Mayow Park and Wells Park nearby.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Really dishy three double bedroom period end of terrace house of 1450 square feet, near to Ladywell Conservation Area. The house has been carefully and sympathetically refurbished under its current ownership - with loads of great features; including custom-made storage, bespoke shutters and a wood-burning stove (in the front formal reception). Both the kitchen and bathroom are beautifully-appointed.

If you want more space and to do some work yourselves once-in - you’re in luck - as the house boasts brilliant side-return and loft extension potential (pp for side-return is in place and pp for loft is expected shortly). Parking is unrestricted on the street.

Brookbank Road is a residential one on nice high ground (think driving lesson territory), really close to Hilly Fields - yours in just two minutes, and to Ladywell, Lewisham and Brockley town centres. Walk to their respective high streets and stations in 10,11 and 15 minutes.

A neat and walled front garden (complete with bin store) and tiled path put on a pleasing welcome. In the smart front door - leaded lights here - and from the neat and high-ceilinged hall, your double reception rests to your right. The front room is over 14 feet by over 12 feet. The second reception - the natural dining room - is over 12 feet by over 11 feet, with double-glazed sliding doors onto the side-return area of the garden. Solid wood floors flow through both rooms.

At the end of the hall you access the handy cellar to your left, and the double-aspect eat-in kitchen is straight ahead - this is 20 feet by 10 feet. At the foot of this room you have a handy windowed downstairs w.c. The fitted kitchen is a timeless Shaker-style (in on-trend navy), teamed with stone counters, brick-style tiling, and a big ceramic Butler sink. The low-maintenance garden has modern-style timber fencing, and a generous paved area (perfect for al fresco dining) beyond the astro-turf.

Up to the half-landing and you’ve got a double bedroom of over 11 feet by over 10 feet to garden views, with pale grey carpet and walls. Adjacent is the delightful bathroom with traditional style sanitary ware and fittings including an over-bath shower, and ceramic brick-style tiling.

Up to the landing proper and you’ve got a fab built-in cupboard (great for linen and the like). The master bedroom takes the width of the terrace - it’s over 17 feet by over 14 feet. Deep built-in closets feature to each alcove, and you’ve got three shuttered windows. Lastly is the third double bedroom, of 13 feet by 11 feet.

We’ve mentioned your three closest stations (which cover you for regular, Overground and DLR journeys). You’re well-placed for buses as well - from Lewisham Way.

Your local high street area is in Ladywell. Here the offerings include a lovely deli (The Larder), a good butcher (Meat Jon) and a Mamma Dough (for great sourdough pizzas). Also local, Loampit Hill has a fair bit going on these days too; Middleton coffee shop is a good tip for fantastic local coffee, pastries and brunches, and check out Chicha (serving vibrant Peruvian street food) and Le 5 Terre (offering fresh homemade pasta and sauces), and don't miss Brockley Market - a foodie Saturday one held in Lewisham College's walled car park.

Brockley has nice independent restaurants such as The Orchard and l'Oculto Cocina and cool bars: Brickfields, Joyce, and Brockley Brewery of course - who deliver.

The Deptford High Street area including Deptford Market Yard is searingly-cool with bars, night spots, cafes, restaurants and breweries. We particularly rate Tila, Marcella, The Tapas Room, Isla Ray’s, Stockton and Villages.

Central New Cross is close, for Curzon cinema and contemporary art gallery within the Goldsmiths campus (both open to the public), plus a great variety of pubs; we like The Amersham Arms there opposite nx Station. Meze Mangal (further down Lewisham Way) serves up good value Turkish grub.

Central Lewisham’s handy for mall shopping and markets, plus Sparrow restaurant and The Model Market (summer-months street food heaven!). You’ve also got the best fish and chip shop in London (we think!).

Green space? Stroll to Hilly Fields in two minutes - there's a sweet cafe here and woods too, or walk around half an hour for Greenwich Royal Park. Ladywell Fields is also close.

Local schools include Prendergast Ladywell Primary and Secondary Schools, and Lewisham tlg Primary.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A substantially extended, semi-detached 1930’s home on one of SE12’s most desired roads with further potential to extend STPP.

Many fond memories have been made by the current owners of this adored family home over 30 years of ownership, the time has come for a rural move out in to the countryside now that all of the children have grown up, although if it was possible to pick up a house and take it with you, this property wouldn’t be for sale!

This substantial home with an abundance of living space on the ground floor would perfectly suit a growing family looking to place themselves within reasonable reach of a variety of renowned primary schools and transport links in to the city.

Accommodation comprises; Entrance porch, spacious hallway with access to a ground floor W/C and under stairs storage, a through lounge that opens out in to a large extended kitchen/diner that was completed in 2020 with Velux windows and a modern grey shaker kitchen kitted out with fitted appliances, a breakfast bar and bundles of storage.

To the first floor you will find three very good size double bedrooms, a family bathroom with separate W/C and the stairs that lead up to the fourth bedroom in the loft that benefits from its very own shower!

The homes garden is completely secluded and is accessible via French doors off of the Kitchen/diner, there is a large patio area which is ideal for entertaining in the warmer months and a spacious lawn area with mature shrubs and landscaping.

The property also has side access which also provides access to a detached garage that has the potential to be used for a multitude of different options. Further benefits include Central heating, double glazing, off street parking and a front garden.

Positioned on a quiet residential street in SE12, within a short walk of a variety of different green spaces and sought after local primary schools, as well as Colfes School.

Lee station is just 0.7 miles away and provides direct access to London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross & Cannon Street. Changes are available at Lewisham for the DLR & New Cross for the East London Line. Grove Park station is just over a mile away and can get you in to London Bridge in as little as 14 minutes!

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

detailedDescription:
Zone 2 location and a short walk from the River Thames. Range of 1,2 and 3 bedroom homes in a new build development close to vibrant Deptford and historic Greenwich. Help to buy is available with select apartments. The development will provide stylishly designed interiors to suit modern day living with all homes benefitting from private outdoor space. This contemporary development is in an enviable location that offers a creative hub for City dwellers. Local amenities include trendy shops, a public library, art gallery, leisure facilities and a variety of pubs, restaurants and cafes. Excellent transport links for commuters. Surrey Quays, Canada Water and Deptford stations are within walking distance, offering great commuting options to Canary Wharf, The City and West End. Parking is available at an additional cost.

Development & property features:

• 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments
• Zone 2
• Select homes available on Help to Buy scheme
• Each apartment benefits from having a balcony or terrace
• Parking available at an additional cost
• Private landscaped gardens
• Excellent, fast transport links to Canary Wharf and The City
• Short walk to the River

Photos for illustration purposes only.

Apartments will be completed to a high specification.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

address: Cameron Terrace, Chinbrook Road, London SE12
detailedDescription:
Overview is stunning combination of tradition and modernity blending the character and charm of the Victorian era with cutting edge building techniques to create a most attractive and characterful new build offering. The façade of the original detached house is retained meaning high ceilings and spaces / features not often associated with new build offerings. This is a two bedrooms first floor Apartment with a loggia/balcony available with Help to Buy.

Features: Include high ceilings, double glazed sash windows, fully integrated kitchen, fully tiled bathroom/shower rooms (underfloor heating), efficient electric heating and outside space in the form of patio/loggia/balconies and gardens for the lower ground floor units. There is a frontage with bicycle and refuse storage.

Travel: Grove Park is a Zone 4 commute with connections to London Cannon Street and Charing Cross (via London Bridge). Bus routes connect you with neighboring towns for shopping at The Glades (Bromley) and Lewisham shopping Centre. Easy access to the M25 (via A20) or into London via A2 Blackwall Tunnel (and various other).

Local: Sainsbury's Local, Tesco Express, news agents, various news agents, take aways and The Baring Hall Hotel (Antic pub chain)

Schooling: Various well regarded schools are situated within one mile of the properties.

Tenure – new 125 year lease with service charge of £1,441.80 per annum and zero ground rent.

Tenure 125 years lease with nil Ground Rent, Service charge is approx £1,441.80 per annum

help to buy Help to Buy (htb)



Precis of htb

5% deposit required
Up to 40% Government backed Equity Loan – Interest free for first 5 years
Remainder funded by a 55% mortgage (or less if smaller Equity Loan taken out subject to a minimum mortgage of 25%)
Equity loan amount is linked to the home value and not the original amount borrowed
Eligibility – First Time Buyers only able to afford repayments
Homebuilders will provide a New Home Warranty and are held to rigorous quality standards in order to be able to provide homes for Help To Buy (including Consumer Code for Home Builders and New Homes Ombudsman)
Leases offered must be fair and meet Help To Buy requirements

Process:
Get Financial Advice to check your affordability
Find and Reserve your home (Reservation Fee capped at £500)
Complete a Property Information Form and Return with the Homebuilder's signed reservation form to your Help to Buy agent (Your mortgage broker may assist you in this).
Your htb agent will review the paperwork and if approved will give you atp (Authority to Proceed)
Liaise with your conveyancer and mortgage broker to complete the process.

The whole process takes approximately 2-3 months (note you have 3 months to reach exchange of contracts from when your atp is given).

Note: To expedite matters you can make your mortgage application at the beginning of this processbut be aware that any payments you make for applications/surveys will be lost should your htb application not be approved

Buy to let investors only.

Offered in excellent condition and approximately 110 years left on the lease this split level flat is a must see. Currently rented with a monthly income of £1,450.

title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Welcome to Belmont Place, Blackheath

This exciting new development offers contemporary new two bedroom apartments, exclusively for those wanting to downsize and who are aged over 57.

The apartments are modern and spacious, with welcoming communal areas, a large garden complete with shared vegetable growing space and wheelchair accessibility throughout.

Belmont Place has been designed to facilitate residents' changing needs, a wide range of interests and to encourage community spirit.

Purchasing Options

The homes at Belmont Place are available to purchase through Private Sale, Shared Ownership or Shared Equity.

Private Sale

You will own 100% of the property outright, and you can take out a mortgage in order to do this.

Shared Ownership

You purchase a share between 35% and 75% of the property using a deposit and mortgage. You will then pay rent on the unsold share at 2.75%.

Shared Equity

You can purchase a 75% share of the full market value of the property and will not be required to pay rent on the unsold equity. However, you will be able to purchase the remaining share in the future.

To find out more information about the purchasing options available, please speak to a member of our Sales Team.

Live life your way

Close to the leafy open green spaces of Blackheath and Greenwich and only 10 minutes by train to London Bridge from Lewisham Station, Belmont Place is exceptionally well connected.

Set within a secure gated development and designed around your contemporary lifestyle, these stylish new homes, border a central landscaped courtyard and gardens for residents to enjoy. Self-contained facilities include a residents lounge, summer room and communal laundry room.

Attention to detail

With their quality specification, your home will boast a well proportioned fitted kitchen with ample work surfaces and integrated oven, fridge freezer, dishwasher and washer/dryer discretely tucked away. Bathrooms are tiled with chrome fixtures and bold, modern fittings.

Generously sized windows and high ceilings ensure rooms are light and airy to enhance the open plan living area. All apartments have the use of private gardens to make the most of the British summer.

Spoilt for choice

With picture postcard charm, Blackheath is one of London's prettiest and most welcoming neighbourhoods. Straddling, Lewisham and Greenwich, the area is well connected and has everything you need close at hand.

Urban living with a rural feel

Blackheath has a distinct village feel with little boutiques, restaurants and bars, while traditional pubs look out onto the magnificent heath. The heath itself is the focal point of the area and provides a genuine sense of detachment from the bustle of the urban environment.

Well Connected

Roads

Whether you're on the bus, in the car or on your bike, Lewisham is a central road hub. The A2 and A20 both go through this part of London, linking you to the motorway network, Kent countryside, south coast and Channel Tunnel. There are numerous night buses running to Lewisham from Central London including the N21, N199, N89 and the N136.

Planes

There is a swift, efficient DLR link to London City Airport in 36 minutes from Lewisham DLR station and you can reach Gatwick Airport in under an hour via London Bridge. For Heathrow Airport your journey will take 65 minutes via Paddington on the Heathrow Express and Crossrail will offer a faster service from Canary Wharf in under 40 minutes and is anticipated to be fully operational by the end of 2021.

Rail

Lewisham and Blackheath Stations are less than a mile away, offering quick, frequent Overground and DLR services to the centre of London.

Cable Car

When you want to cross the river you could take a bridge or tunnel. Or you could choose the Emirates Air Line with its spectacular views. No wonder more and more people are choosing this part of town.

Boats

What better way of commuting to the West End on a summer's morning than taking the boat from Greenwich Pier?

To register your interest, please contact our Sales Team today.

This 3 bedroom link detached house has a beautiful 16m wide rear garden perfect for those summer months, and is located down a quiet and secluded close (away from any busy roads). title: 3 bed link-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Set within an elegant and imposing detached Victorian mansion, an attractive studio apartment situated on the ground floor and offering very well-presented accommodation.

The property has a spacious main reception room with a fitted kitchen to one side. There is also a recess area where there is ample space for a double bed and wardrobes. In addition there is a modern shower room.

Located on a popular residential road opposite Dulwich and Sydenham Hill Woods, this beautiful building is within a gated development with off-street parking and a communal garden area at the rear of the property. The property is well located for access to both East Dulwich and Crystal Palace which offer a large variety of shopping facilities, cafes and bars. Dulwich Village is also easily accessible with its cafes, restaurants, Picture Gallery and golf course. The nearest railway stations are Sydenham Hill and Crystal Palace with links into central London.
Offered with no onward chain.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price - £625,000 - £650,000. John Payne are delighted to welcome to the market this stunning two bedroom, two bathroom house forming part of the Vanbrugh Park Estate development designed by the world renowned architects Chamberlain, Powell and Bon, who were pioneers of the Brutalist movement, most notably the development at the Barbican.

Internally the entire property has been refurbished and upgraded to a very high standard throughout by the current owners. As you enter the property you are welcomed by a large contemporary open-plan kitchen/reception room leading through patio doors to a south/west facing landscaped rear garden with outside storage. To complete the ground floor you have a large storage cupboard. As you ascend to the first floor via a wrap around staircase you are welcomed by two sizeable double bedrooms. Both bedrooms boast built in wardrobes and one of the two rooms boasts its very own private en-suite shower room. To complete the first floor you will find a modern bathroom suite.

Located only a short distance to the beautiful Greenwich Park, the open heath and Blackheath Village for boutique shopping, independent cafés, bars and established eateries. You will find Maze Hill and Blackheath mainline stations close by, which will make this home ideal for commuters.

Virtual viewings available upon request.

For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Blackheath Standard office today!

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located within Blackheath's prestigious and private Cator Estate, Parkgate remains one of SE3's most secluded and desirable turnings.

This stunning property has been exquisitely finished and boasts a recent
architecturally designed rear family space and converted third floor and is offered with no onward chain and early access.

The superb architecturally designed detached residence spans three levels providing versatile living options for the growing family. An appealing neutral finish showcases extensive bright accommodation and includes a modern kitchen, living areas with the back opening up to reveal the stunning landscaped and sizeable rear gardens and the adjoining entertainment deck.

Principally, the property offers a downstairs cloakroom and under stairs storage cupboard, reception room and larger open plan reception room with underfloor heating, stunning kitchen and utility with a range of high quality integrated and fitted appliances and further space for dining. Large bi folding doors open onto a pretty patio and landscaped garden. On the first floor the master ensuite, a further three bedrooms, along with the family bathroom. On the second floor a large bright room with extensive storage in the eaves and existing planning permission for further dormer windows, services for an additional bathroom.

To the front of the property you will find ample parking and a garage to the side. Located within walking distance (0.4 miles) to Blackheath Village shops, restaurants and coffee shops. EER: D.

title: 5 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Very unique three bed Coach House available in a no through road on the Lewisham & Blackheath borders. The property has been designed to a very high standard throughout and is offered for sale chain free.

This beautiful house offers a bespoke handmade kitchen, a large open planned living area with a wood burner feature. The property offers off street gated parking and a large landscaped garden with pond. The upper level comprises master en suite bedroom with bespoke integrated storage and an additional two double bedrooms that can be converted into one large bedroom via a moveable wall.

There are excellent travel links into London & Canary Wharf with the property being nearby Lewisham DLR station as well as Blackheath & Lewisham mainline stations. This property really is not one to be missed so please call to arrange your viewing!

Energy Efficiency Rating C.

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautifully kept three-bedroom end of terrace maisonette has been well maintained, with neutral tones and a bright and spacious feel throughout. The property also boasts a front garden, a balcony, a large communal garden and off-street parking.

The property is comprised of three well-proportioned double bedrooms with big windows that allow for lots of light and a contemporary bathroom with modern fixtures and separate bath and shower. Two of the bedrooms have an amazing 20 mile view across south London and Kent. The bedrooms, landing and hallway have built in storage.

Downstairs is a good-sized kitchen with enough space to add a breakfast bar if so desired. There are wall and base units and space for washing machine, fridge freezer and dishwasher. The kitchen is flooded with natural light from the large double glazed windows.

The living room is spacious and bright with a separate dining area that leads onto a private balcony. It has wall-to-wall double glazed windows that overlook the large and well maintained communal garden. There is a lovely community of local residents who have their own WhatsApp group, outdoor table tennis, child swings, and a gardening group.

***Owing to Government guidelines and the safety of our clients and potential buyers we have amended the way we carry out open days and have a strict one in one out policy. Please arrive with ppe and be respectful of social distancing whilst waiting your turn to view. We endeavor to give everyone fair and ample time to view and would welcome a second viewing if you feel you need more time.***

Location

Haseley End can be found tucked away off the Honor Oak Road, with both Forest Hill and Honor Oak Park a short walk away. Both have a village feel, with a number of independent cafes, restaurants, boutique shops, libraries, pubs, a large supermarket, and a modern leisure centre with swimming pool.

Both Honor Oak Park and Forest Hill stations provide direct links to London Bridge (in around 12 mins), London Victoria (via Clapham Junction), as well as Overground services to Shoreditch, Highbury and Islington, and Crystal Palace.

This is one of south London's most trending hot spots and the neighbourhood is a friendly one, popular among young families and professionals, with the 'Outstanding' Fairlawn primary school within 500 metres of the property.

There are many green spaces and playgrounds nearby, including Dulwich Woods, One Tree Hill, Honor Oak Rec, The Horniman museum and gardens, and Devonshire Nature reserve which is at the end of the street.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

address: Cameron Terrace, Chinbrook Road, London SE12
detailedDescription:
Overview Glenview Court is stunning combination of tradition and modernity blending the character and charm of the Victorian era with cutting edge building techniques to create a most attractive and characterful new build offering. The façade of the original detached house is retained meaning high ceilings and spaces / features not often associated with new build offerings. This is a one bedrooms first floor Apartment with a loggia/balcony available with Help to Buy.

Features: Include high ceilings, double glazed sash windows, fully integrated kitchen, fully tiled bathroom/shower rooms (underfloor heating), efficient electric heating and outside space in the form of patio/loggia/balconies and gardens for the lower ground floor units. There is a frontage with parking spaces available for purchasing, bicycle and refuse storage..

Travel: Grove Park is a Zone 4 commute with connections to London Cannon Street and Charing Cross (via London Bridge). Bus routes connect you with neighboring towns for shopping at The Glades (Bromley) and Lewisham shopping Centre. Easy access to the M25 (via A20) or into London via A2 Blackwall Tunnel (and various other).

Local: Sainsbury's Local, Tesco Express, news agents, various news agents, take aways and The Baring Hall Hotel (Antic pub chain)

Schooling: Various well regarded schools are situated within one mile of the properties.

Tenure – new 125 year lease with service charge of £1,273.68 per annum and zero ground rent.

Tenure 125 years lease with nil Ground Rent and Service Charge estimated at £1,273.68 per annum.

Help to buy Help to Buy (htb)



Precis of htb

5% deposit required
Up to 40% Government backed Equity Loan – Interest free for first 5 years
Remainder funded by a 55% mortgage (or less if smaller Equity Loan taken out subject to a minimum mortgage of 25%)
Equity loan amount is linked to the home value and not the original amount borrowed
Eligibility – First Time Buyers only able to afford repayments
Homebuilders will provide a New Home Warranty and are held to rigorous quality standards in order to be able to provide homes for Help To Buy (including Consumer Code for Home Builders and New Homes Ombudsman)
Leases offered must be fair and meet Help To Buy requirements

Process:
Get Financial Advice to check your affordability
Find and Reserve your home (Reservation Fee capped at £500)
Complete a Property Information Form and Return with the Homebuilder's signed reservation form to your Help to Buy agent (Your mortgage broker may assist you in this).
Your htb agent will review the paperwork and if approved will give you atp (Authority to Proceed)
Liaise with your conveyancer and mortgage broker to complete the process.

The whole process takes approximately 2-3 months (note you have 3 months to reach exchange of contracts from when your atp is given).

Note: To expedite matters you can make your mortgage application at the beginning of this processbut be aware that any payments you make for applications/surveys will be lost should your htb application not be approved

Further benefits include a share of the freehold and a private garden.

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: Chain free and being sold share of freehold and offering 739 sqft (68.62 sqm) of floor space, set in this stunning Victorian period conversion, is this generously proportioned, newly refurbished, one bedroom garden maisonette. Located in the heart of Forest Hill, moments away from all the local amenities the area has to offer and Forest Hill station, approx 300 meters! (London Bridge & Overgound connections). The maisonette has its own entrance at street the ground floor street level and the flat occupies the whole of the lower ground floor of this imposing Victorian period conversion which is set well back from the street by a private front garden. It also benefits from a private courtyard patio and double glazing throughout. Upon entry there is a wide hallway that leads to the main double bedroom located at the front of the building. The room offers generous proportions with good ceiling height and a large East facing bay sash window that fills the room with natural light. The bathroom has been fully tiled with white metro tiled walls and black slate flooring, there is a bath tub with shower above which is accompanied by a toilet, wash hand basin with mirrored vanity unit above, a heated towel rail and a frosted double glazed window for natural light and the centre of the property, occupying the whole width of the house is a very spacious living room with a feature fireplace and a window to the rear over looking the garden. The separate kitchen breakfast room is located at the back of the house, again offering very generous proportions with enough space for a large dining room table and chairs. There are plenty of wall and base mounted units offering plenty of storage and a long worktop housing the hob and oven with extractor above and the sink that sits neatly under a window looking out to the patio. The courtyard patio can be accessed directly from the kitchen. It has a Westerly facing aspect that catches the afternoon sunshine. The property is only a few minutes' walk to the independent shops and cafés found nearby and Sainsbury's around the corner! The station is just 3-minutes away, has services to London Bridge, Victoria and London Overground links to Canada Water, Shoreditch, Hoxton, Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington. At the end of the street is St David's which is the prettiest coffee shop you could wish for, there are superb comedy nights at The Signal and The Sylvan Post does excellent food along with some great pizza places. You'll also find a, Post Office, wh Smiths, Boots, delicatessens and modern swimming pool/leisure centre. Horniman Museum and Gardens is very close and holds regular farmers' markets, great summer events and a butterfly sanctuary, while Sydenham Woods is also within walking distance. This is a great property in a superb location.

The property comprises a spacious open-plan reception kitchen leading out to a south-facing communal garden, contemporary three-piece bathroom suite, and two double bedrooms. The property is bathed in natural sunlight and offers ample built-in storage throughout. Conveniently located close to Deptford Market with an array of trendy cafes, bars and delicatessens. Superb transport links into London Bridge, Cannon Street and Canary Wharf. The historic Greenwich Park and Town Centre are only a short commute away.

detailedDescription:
Fabulous internal size offering two large bedrooms and two bathrooms with a spacious open plan kitchen living room. The property also benefits from a private wrap around terrace.
Deptford Landings, built by award winning developer, Lendlease. Nestled in between two stations, Deptford and Surrey Quays, both within a 0.8 mile radius from the development. Trains to Cannon Street (15 mins) go via London Bridge (9 mins). The London Overground links Surrey Quays with Canada Water, Highbury & Islington and Croydon. A short walk away is Canada Water Underground station serviced by Jubilee line trains to Canary Wharf.
Deptford is a vibrant historical district set along the south bank of the Thames and bordering with Surrey Quays, Greenwich and Blackheath. Deptford’s High Street is a short walk away from these new homes, with an attractive mix of shops, cafés, restaurants, arts & crafts workshops and markets.

detailedDescription:
An impressive, much improved and extended, three bedroom end of terrace period home set on this sought after road close to Manor House gardens, Blackheath village and Hither Green Station. Sold chain free.

The property has been refurbished by the current vendors to a very high standard and is in excellent decorative order throughout. Features include high ceilings, period features, cornicing, double glazed sash windows, partial under floor heating and Nest controlled gas fired central heating.

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with under stairs storage, living room with built in storage in the alcove and a utility room and downstairs WC. The rear has been extended and opened up to a offer a stunning kitchen diner. The modern, open plan kitchen has integrated appliances, range style oven, granite worktops, island with breakfast bar, wood effect ceramic tiled floor, skylight and bi-folding doors to a beautiful landscaped garden with flower beds, feature hedging and lawn. Upstairs are three double bedrooms, all with built in wardrobes and one with walk in wardrobe and built in shelving. The two rear bedrooms benefit from a lovely "green" outlook. There is and an attractive modern bathroom with separate shower and sunken bath.

This is an impressive home and sold chain fee. Your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

The property is a few hundred yards from the popular Manor House Gardens and close to Manor Park. Hither Green and Lewisham (DLR) stations are within a short walk, as is Blackheath Station. Travel time from Lewisham station to London Bridge is 7 minutes with trains also operating to Cannon Street, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Victoria. Canary Wharf is easily accessible via Lewisham DLR. There are several Ofsted rated 'outstanding' primary schools and excellent children's day nursery options close by in Lee and Blackheath. Colfes is just a 15 minute walk and there are school bus pickups locally for both Eltham College and Farringtons. Blackheath village, with its array of bars, restaurants and boutiques is also close by.
title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
You can have it all! A little bit of country in the city. Rare to market Ladywell Road is an outstanding and unique double fronted detached Victorian villa dating back to 1857 set on a large and secluded plot very close to Ladywell station. The position is beautiful, set with 23 trees and lots of privacy and wildlife. With a superb annex/outbuilding and planning permission for a stunning ground floor pavilion extension with feature glazing.

The project to transform this wonderful home to its full potential has already started and offers a fantastic opportunity for a new family to take over the reins.
Features include; high ceilings, sash windows, period features and fireplaces. The accommodation is very versatile and currently provides; a large entrance hall, two large reception rooms and a double bedroom to the rear. The remainder of the ground floor has more recently been used as self-contained accommodation with a private side entrance and which offers a kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom and shower room. Upstairs is currently a very large reception room, two large double bedrooms, a kitchen and bathroom.

The main house currently boasts over 1,800 sq.ft of living space (2,263sq.ft including the outbuilding) and planning permission has been granted to replace the existing ground floor extension providing an additional 500 sq.ft (approx.). The stunning ground floor pavilion extension to the side will offer a huge living/dining/family space connected to the to the house via a feature glazed link.

The house itself is set on a very large plot with a large private drive, garage and a superb outbuilding known as "The Foundry". The Foundry, a former workshop, provides a large studio room with open plan kitchen, exposed brick work, wood burner and glazed doors onto two terraces with views onto the river. There is also a modern shower room. The beautiful gardens wrap around the front, side and rear of the house with rear access also.

The property is located on a secluded plot just 100 metres from Ladywell Village renowned for its quirky range of independent shops, gastro pub, deli and patisserie. Brockley farmers market is close by, a great place to visit Saturday mornings. Lewisham has extensive shopping choices and is being enhanced by new investment, attracting new restaurants and amenities. Blackheath Village and Greenwich with its array of boutiques, bars and restaurants are also close by.

For the commute, Ladywell Train Station is less than a minute's walk, which has regular connections to the City and Charing Cross and only 9 minutes from London Bridge. Lewisham Station and DLR is also a short walk. The promise of the Bakerloo Line tube coming into the location offers more attraction.

The popular open spaces of Ladywell Fields (100 metres) with its river walks and cafe, Hilly Fields, (285 metres), with its stunning views of London and a café, Manor House Gardens, (0.75 miles), Blackheath Common, (1.2 miles), and Greenwich Park, (1.28 miles), are all within easy reach.

There are popular primary schools close by including the "Outstanding" Prendergast Hilly Fields as well as several sought-after private schools.

This is an impressive home with incredible charm and character and is extremely rare to the market. Video tours can be seen at

Your earliest viewing is recommended.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Re/max estate agents are delighted to present this exceptional, three-story, end of terrace townhouse, that is located on a quiet residential road of similarly elegant properties. Internally, this remarkable property spans over 1588 sq ft of well-proportioned living space throughout.

Set over three floors, this property has been immaculately maintained by its current owners with a beautiful contemporary interior that is bold and beautiful, complementing its original character. There is a real balance between a modern and a cosy feel – making it the ideal family home.

To the front of the property, there is off-street parking in the driveway - making everyday activities much easier, such as bringing in the shopping. As you enter, you will find yourself at the entrance hall, a generous space that presents you with a flavour of the interior design that awaits.

The entrance hall leads to a spacious open plan living room and dining area. The open plan layout is the focal point of this property. It not only creates a more comfortable space that is clear and spacious, it also increases the masses of natural sunlight coming through the large double-glazed windows. It truly is the ideal spot where you can shake off the stress of the day and spend some quality time with family.

To the rear of the property, there is a newly built custom kitchen that is fully fitted with integrated appliances, classy worktops and wall-based units. There is no shortage of storage space in this kitchen with cupboard units flowing throughout. The kitchen also doubles up as a utility room with an in-built washing machine. The ground floor layout really sets the tone for a real social hub and gives the ultimate entertaining experience with each room interconnecting and thoughtfully placed next to each other.

There is direct access to a leafy private back garden via the dining room and kitchen. Outside, the spacious lawn is a haven of peace and the perfect space to enjoy with the family. A large outdoor shed gives you further storage space.

The first-floor accommodation is very impressive with two large bedrooms, comprising a remarkable interior. The warm colour palette of both rooms really enhances the space further. There is plenty of space to add wardrobes or clothing rails to the rooms to meet your storage needs. An immaculate family bathroom suite with neutral marble style tiling and a heated towel rail completes this floor.

Up the stairs, there are two further double bedrooms, again with abundance of space for storage needs. There is also a smaller third bedroom which can be converted into a study room if required, which would be an excellent space to work from home. This floor also has a large family bathroom.

All rooms are characterised by their bright feel, coming from the windows, which flood the rooms with natural sunlight. The layout of this property does not end there, there is an added bonus of a cellar on the lower ground floor. Whether you want to use it to store wine or convert it into a family games room – the options are endless.

Location
Located within easy access of Lewisham station (DLR and rail services) as well as Hither Green and Ladywell stations providing great transport links to London Bridge and Cannon Street. The nearby high street provides an array of local shops, bars and restaurants. The property is centrally located for excellent local primary and secondary schools.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Neat Victorian three double bed terrace of 1090 square feet (excluding the massive cellar), with an east-facing garden of over 26 feet. Parking on the street is unrestricted.

The location is a quiet residential street within Hatcham Conservation Area - just an eight minute walk from New Cross Gate Station (Fare Zone 2, one stop to London Bridge and on the Overground line), and you’re just a short walk from Haberdashers' Aske's Temple Grove Primary School. You're also within easy walking distance of ha Secondary School.

A paved front garden sets the house back from the pavement. From the hall you have your stripped-floored double-reception to your left. White walls, a feature fireplace, bay and sash windows here.

At the end of the hall your cellar is accessed to your right; it’s huge - 23 feet by over 12. Currently it’s used for storage but you could do more with it if you fancied.

A lobby area has a handy built-in cupboard and the back door out to the side return area of the garden.

The large and double-aspect kitchen/dining room is accessed beyond; it stretches over 18 feet and has a generous number of units (modern in style) to three walls.

Up the stairs and at half-landing level you’ve got a long double bedroom to garden views, and a smart tiled bathroom, with white sanitary ware and over bath shower.

From the landing proper you’ve got a large master bedroom across the front (over 15 feet by over 11 feet) - with a bank of closets to one wall, and another double - of 10 feet by over 9 feet. Useful loft storage is accessed from the landing.

The area? Hatcham ca is a quiet residential pocket of south London, little-known to most. From 1614, the land was owned by the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers. When the manor house (named 'Hatcham Park’) was demolished circa 1840, terraced homes were permitted to be built.

Rescued from proposed demolition in the seventies(!), Hatcham Conservation Area was designated by Lewisham Council in 1990. ‘Hatcham’ derives most likely from Anglo Saxon; meaning ‘a clearing in the woods’, and reputedly, Charles Dickens wrote ‘Our Mutual Friend’ in The Five Bells pub (1864-5).

Saunter - past other handsome Victorian housing stock - just eight minutes to New Cross Gate Station. There are also plenty of day and night bus routes within a short walk of the house - to Elephant & Castle and beyond, or to Peckham, Deptford, Greenwich, Brockley and Lewisham.

Local eateries and drinkeries of note include The Rosemary (Hungarian, organic, delicious), and The Rose Inn.

Nip down to neighbouring SE15 for others, including Kudu, Peckham Bazaar, Ganapati (who also deliver to New Cross - you need to know this!), Artusi, Levan, Peckham Levels, Miss Tapas and Mr Bao.

Deptford has quite the gastronomic offering now too, with Marcella, Winemakers, The Tapas Room and a warm European vibe - with a choice of hip hangouts in Deptford Market Yard and surrounds. Deptford also has a cool theatre: The Albany, and a modern leisure centre with lane pool, next door to the library.

New Cross is home to Goldsmiths University with a Curzon cinema and a contemporary gallery - both tucked off the main road on campus, but very much open to the public.

Local parks include Telegraph Hill (Upper and Lower, with Saturday Farmers’ Market, or pop in a bus down to Brockley Market) and Fordham Parks. Grab your fresh loaves from Blackbird Bakery by qrp station, or at Ayres on nearby Nunhead Lane. While you’re in Nunhead, Bambuni deli and Soper’s wet fish shop are established can’t-live-without staples. El Vermut (bottle shop) and Goodcup (coffee shop) are worth a look too.

Kids or thinking of? Your most local primary schools are Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham Temple Grove (with impressive architectural treatment by Jestico + Whiles, and which feeds to the secondary school based in New Cross’s other Conservation Area), Edmund Waller and Kender. Deptford Green is a second well-regarded local secondary school.

agency_name: Winkworth - Forest Hill and New Cross
detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £575,000 - £600,000**

An opportunity to purchase this truly stunning, three bedroom garden flat set within a highly sought after location in Canonbie Road.

The well presented accommodation on offer comprises, private entrance hall opening to a gorgeous fitted kitchen, 16'11 reception room, a beautiful bathroom and three double bedrooms.

From one of the bedrooms you have direct access to a private terrace which then leads into a huge communal garden. To the front of the property there is a large storage area.

The apartment is offered in excellent condition throughout offering a high specification that needs to be seen. Please call Winkworth on to arrange an appointment to view.

Location:
Located on the sought after Canonbie Road with spectacular panoramic views across London. Within less than one mile is a superb choice of schools including Fairlawn Primary School, Honor Oak Pre-school, St Francesca Cabrini and Horniman, within less than 1.5 miles is Dulwich College, St. Dunstan's and Alleyn's.

Within close proximity to this apartment is an abundance of boutique shops, local bars, cafes and restaurants including sourdough pizzeria Mamma Dough, Grounds & Grapes and the Watson Telegraph Pub, to name a few of the local offerings. Furthermore there are handy high street stores including Sainsbury's and Boots.

Locally there is a great choice of green spaces and parks with the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away. If looking for extracurricular activities you can enjoy Forest Hill Pools or a choice of the local gyms or therapy and beauty rooms.

The neighbourhoods of Dulwich and Peckham Rye are also within walking distance, similarly offering a choice independent boutiques, restaurants and useful amenities.

There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground approximately 10 minutes' walk away connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away. Furthermore mainline connections enable easy access to the major stations of the capital including Victoria, Charing Cross, London Bridge to name a few.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A meticulously designed and finished house, upon entering you are struck by the abundance of natural light that flows into all of the rooms, every detail has been carefully considered in order to make Venner the perfect family home. What isn't apparent from the front of the property is the loft conversion that now boasts an extra two bedrooms and second bathroom.

The ground floor, boasts a through lounge with dual aspect windows, a feature fireplace which is focal point of the room and wood block flooring which has been lovingly restored to its formal glory. The kitchen is newly appointed and has many integrated appliances that will stay.

The first floor comprises of three bedrooms, one being the principal room, boasting a large bay window allowing lots of light to flood into the room. The bathroom is modern and fresh and the other two bedrooms are both of double standard. The third floor benefits from a further two bedrooms and another family bathroom.

The South West garden is haven to relax in after a long day at work and enjoy alfresco dining, the grassed area has lots of space to erect a trampoline and swing of your choice to let the little ones play. To the front of this beautiful home is a driveway with dropped kerb, allowing off street parking.

You will never be late for the train to work, as the property is situated within minutes walk of Penge East station which has excellent links to London Victoria, weekday trains depart four times an hour, with fastest journey times of 18 minutes. Local schools and nurseries are of an abundance plus the ever popular Crystal Place park South entrance is a few minutes walk away. Alexandra recreation ground, is one of the seven Penge parks, like Penge recreation ground it answers the late Victorian social ideal of recreation and good health.

Penge has become an area which is attracting, young professionals, investors and first time buyers, with an ever growing high street, great schools, great train links and fast commutes.

If you are looking for something a bit different in this popular development then this sixth floor two bedder could be the one.

All appliances are integrated oven, hob, extractor, fridge/freezer, dishwasher and microwave. Back out into the hall with two large storage cupboards, a very smart integral bathroom just like something out of a hotel, bedroom two is a good size double, bright and a large window bathing the room with natural light, lastly bedroom one has built in wardrobes and another balcony with panoramic views.
Grosvenor Court is the newest of the court on Catford Green development meaning it’s the closest to the rail stations, shops and amenities ideal for the commuter who heads up to Central London. Have just about all you need on your door step.

address: New Cross Road, New Cross SE14
detailedDescription:
**Guide Price: £525,000 - £550,000**

An opportunity to purchase this huge split level, three bedroom Victorian conversion set within a central location in New Cross.

The accommodation on offer comprises, private entrance, 21'0 reception room, 13'9 kitchen/diner to the first floor. To the second floor there is a landing giving access to three bedrooms and a bathroom.

Externally there is a private garden to the rear aspect of the property and has side access that could be used for off street parking / development subject to planning permission.

The property can be offered chain free for a quick sale. Please contact Winkworth on to arrange an appointment to view.

Location:
The surrounding area is residential, with wide, tree-lined roads and is renowned for its community, with the annual Telegraph Hill Festival showcasing local arts, theatre, film, food, open gardens and music. There are two parks on the Hill, the Lower Park affording space to children's play areas, a wildlife pond and a weekly farmer's market. The Upper Park is an urban green space with City views and public tennis courts.
Besides local corner shops, dry cleaners and Post Office, there is a full range of supermarkets close by: Sainsbury's at New Cross Gate, Aldi, Lidl and Tesco's on the Old Kent Road, Morrisons in Peckham. Likewise, some of London's best hospital facilities at Lewisham, London Bridge and Denmark Hill are all within 30 minutes' reach.
Telegraph Hill is particularly popular among families as there is an extensive choice of local schools at nursery, primary and secondary levels, with further options in Ladywell, Blackheath, and Dulwich.
Situated in Zone 2, the area offers a wide choice of public transport options to many destinations: The DLR from Deptford Bridge to the City's Financial District; the Overground from New Cross Gate and New Cross to Canada Water, Shoreditch High Street and Highbury & Islington. The mainline services from these stations connect to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Blackfriars Waterloo East & Charing Cross. Nunhead is a short walk away and trains run to Victoria, Farringdon and St. Pancras International. The bus station on New Cross road runs frequent services to local areas and central London.

Walking south east, just 0.92 miles, you will arrive in Blackheath village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. 0.57 miles to the west you will find the historic Greenwich town centre, University of Greenwich, National Maritime Museum and Royal Greenwich Park is just 475 metres away. 0.61 miles to the southeast is Blackheath Standard, with daily conveniences including M&S Food Hall as well as many shops and restaurants. Turning north down Vanbrugh Hill you will reach Woolwich Road where you will find Greenwich Square Library and Leisure Centre which has a swimming pool. There is also range of Artisan coffee shops and bakeries as well as a Co-op, Sainsbury's and Tesco local. Other amenities such as the Cinema, Ikea and other large stores can be found at Greenwich Peninsula which is a 4 minutes' drive. Maze Hill Station are all just a short walk. With the DLR within easy reach from Greenwich along with the river boat and Jubilee Line at North Greenwich is just 1.23 miles away.
title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: Merlin Court, 26 Handley Drive, Kidbrooke Village, London SE3
detailedDescription:
A fantastic one bedroom apartment with a huge privtae terrrace situated within the highly sought after Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village with concierge, gym and swimming pool. Easy access to Blackheath Village and Kidbrooke station.

The property is in excellent condition and has a modern, clean, and contemporary finish with floor-to-ceiling double glazed windows and wood flooring.

Located on the ground floor. The accommodation comprises; an open plan lounge/diner with an attractive modern kitchen (complete with integrated appliances), a good size master bedroom with built-in wardrobes and a luxurious modern bathroom. There is also a very large private terrace a large utility cupboard and secure bike storage located in the underground car park.

The property also has the benefit of access to an on-site concierge service, gym, swimming pool, cinema room, business centre and dry-cleaning service.

Merlin Court is located in the prestigious Blackheath Quarter of the modern Kidbrooke Village – an award winning Berkeley Homes development. This is a completely new and vibrant London community offering an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as new homes, it will offer new parks, sports facilities, shops, bars & restaurants, schools, healthcare and community facilities.

Transport links to central London are very close via Kidbrooke station with regular trains to London Bridge (16 minutes), Waterloo East (22 minutes), Charing Cross (26 minutes), Cannon Street (25 minutes) and Victoria (31 minutes). Blackheath Village with its open green spaces offers an array of boutiques, daily conveniences, bars and restaurants and is only moments away.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A gorgeous five bedroom end of terrace that has been recently renovated.

This period home is a real stunner - Bright rooms, a modern finish and accommodation that measures in excess of 1875 square feet.

Downstairs, the property has been extended and reconfigured to create a sociable and open plan feel. This is emphasised in the kitchen family room that benefits from a glossy kitchen fitted with quartz work surfaces.

On the first floor, you are greeted by three double bedrooms and a family bathroom. A recently converted loft space leads you to a further two bedrooms and beautiful shower room.

Further features include detailed tiling to the entrance hall, a front reception that boasts a large bay window, dining room, gas central heating, eaves storage and a rear garden that measures approximately 30ft.

Brockley Grove is well positioned for local shopping with Crofton Park high street virtually on your doorstep and Honor Oak or Ladywell just a short walk away. Crofton Park rail station (Blackfriars and Farringdon) and Honor Oak Overground (London Bridge & Dalston) are located less than half a mile away and offer excellent links into the city.

Viewings highly recommended.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
***available to move in now***

33 Cobalt Tower is a modern and contemporary 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment located on the 12th floor of Cobalt Tower at our Deptford Foundry development. This large and spacious home is spread across approximately 1,141 sq ft of open-plan living space, and features two private South and West facing balconies, proving fantastic City views. Additionally, this superb apartment has an abundance of storage space and a large kitchen with fully integrated Siemens appliances.

With New Cross, Deptford and Deptford Bridge DLR all within walking distance, and a 6 minute train to London Bridge, this makes Anthology Deptford Foundry the ideal location for work and play, in a Zone 2 location.

In keeping with the local area, Rolfe Judd Architects has harnessed some of the artistic, creative flare which flows throughout the community and designed an exciting range of 1,2 & 3 bedroom homes inspired by the area's industrial and cultural history. Anthology Deptford Foundry comprises of eight apartment buildings and one tower framing the communal landscaped courtyard areas, and a new public pedestrian and cycle route.

The commercial space at Deptford Foundry has been occupied by Second Floor Studios & Arts who rent affordable studios to emerging artists; providing the whole of Deptford Foundry with a creative and artistic flair, in keeping with the local area.

All homes are on a 999-year lease, have a 12-hour concierge and cycle storage available.

*All images shown are indicative and for illustrative purposes only.

With such a central location in the heart of Brockley, these apartments always prove popular and this ground floor apartment won't disappoint, with a great private terrace to watch the world go by and allocated off street parking.

Found moments from Zone 2 Brockley Overground station along with a good choice of independent bars, cafes and bistros.

What The Seller Says

Brockley is such a lovely place to live, with great coffee shops and restaurants close by. With areas such as Peckham, Honor Oak and New Cross in close proximity there are loads of options for a post Sunday lunch walk.

My quality of life substantially improved moving here, particularly the short and pleasant commute to my office in Shoredtich (via Broca of Brockley for the best coffee in town!). detailedDescription:
The accommodation comprises; entrance hall with entry phone and storage cupboard, a large living room with space for a dining table, a feature fireplace and two double glazed sash windows, a modern kitchen with a tiled floor and walls, a lovely bathroom with brick style tiling and a double bedroom with built in wardrobes. To the rear is an impressive landscaped communal garden and resident parking.

Kidbrooke Grove is a particularly popular location. It takes just a stroll of a few hundred yards to bring you to the heath. This vast green expanse is a true gem of South East London and provides a spectacular recreation area. Beyond the heath in one direction, Blackheath Village provides a wonderful array of shops, bars and restaurants. In terms of transport, Blackheath Station provides regular services into London Bridge, Cannon Street, London Victoria and Charing Cross. Alternatively, one stop down the line at Lewisham Station, the DLR has regular services into Bank and Canary Wharf. Looking north across the heath is Royal Greenwich Park with Greenwich’s historic town centre found through the north gates.

address: Hudson Building, Deals Gateway, Greenwich, London SE10 8Ea
detailedDescription:
Accommodation comprises entrance hall with ample inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a well sized double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe, plus a stylish bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is superbly located moments' from Deptford Bridge DLR station with services into Canary Wharf within 12 mins and connections to the Jubilee line. Greenwich station is also just a short walk away with links to London Bridge (10 mins) and Cannon Street (15 mins), as well as Thameslink services into Central London and the City. Conveniently located on the corner of four districts, with just a short walk taking you into Greenwich and along the river to Greenwich Park and Blackheath Common, or to neighbouring Deptford and New Cross which offer a huge variety of bars, restaurants and artisan coffee shops, the property also enjoys easy access to local shops and amenities literally on the doorstep.
Ideal as a first time or investment purchase.

Owners Comments:

1) What do you love most about your home?
It has good storage space. It is well insulated and soundproofed, we can hardly hear our neighbours which is amazing during Covid when both of us are working from home.

2) What do you love about the area?
We particularly like the parks nearby in which we have spent most of our time during Covid. Brookmill Park is next to the development and we are within walking distance to Greenwich Park and Blackheath. We also like the small coffee shop across the road and we have become regulars. The flat is also very conveniently located, we have DLR, trains (Greenwich, St Johns, Deptford and New Cross) and overground all within walking distance. There are a lot of independent cafes and restaurants around Deptford and Greenwich, we are so lucky to have so many choices nearby.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Located close to Hilly Fields, this charming 1-bedroom flat, which occupies the ground floor of an attractive period property, boasts a private garden and a share of the freehold. No chain.

The flat has a light and airy feel throughout. The bedroom is at the front and has a bay window and original tiled working fireplace. The reception room has a feature fireplace and French doors out into the garden. Off the reception room is a lovely kitchen-diner, an unusual bonus for a 1-bedroom flat. The way the kitchen and reception room connect allow for a great space for entertaining family and friends. There is a pretty, sunny west-facing garden at the back of the property.

Marsala Road runs between Ladywell and Lewisham meaning transport links to all parts of London could hardly be easier. Fast and frequent mainline services from either station take you into London Bridge and Charing Cross. The DLR from Lewisham provides quick and easy access into Canary Wharf. There are also several bus routes to choose from.

Ladywell village has a range of amenities including a deli, a bakery/patisserie, a butcher's and a popular gastro-pub (the Ladywell Tavern). The centre of Lewisham has a shopping centre where you'll find familiar high street favourites including department stores.

For an evening out, check out the seasonal Street Feast Model market or Sparrow, a trendy restaurant which has recently been opened up by 2 acclaimed chefs. For fresh food and groceries, pop along to the award-winning Farmers' market along Loampit Hill.

For outdoor activities, both Ladywell Fields and Hilly Fields are nearby where there are free tennis courts. There's also a leisure centre and swimming pool opposite Lewisham station.

Eltham and Kidbrooke village both have a vast array of restaurants, shopping centres and amenities making it easier to access variety of family needs.

The house consists of 4 separate bedrooms, one family bathroom upstairs with separate WC, a downstairs WC and a separate reception room and dinning room. Towards the rear of the property, the conservatory is great for friends and family entertainment and the kitchen is equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, gas hob, fridge/freezer, integrated dishwasher and ample storage space for kitchen appliances.

Rear garden is easy to maintain mainly laid to lawn.

Benefits to the property includes the off-street parking and garage also the property is within walking distance of the prestigious and Ofsted approved Kidbrooke Park Primary school and The Halley Academy, Kidbrooke playing fields, Shooters Hill sports and social club, Eltham Common and Oxleas Wood making it a fantastic location for family leisure and entertainment. The house is also within proximity from the following train stations, Eltham, Kidbrooke, Charlton as well as Woolwich Arsenal DLR which all have direct links into Central London.

The property, which is set back off New Cross Road, offers over 1300sq ft of living space and benefits from a share of the freehold. The apartment comprises three double bedrooms, reception room, separate kitchen and two bathrooms.

The ceiling height is immediately noticeable and there is space for a lounge area as well as dining table if desired. The three bedrooms to the rear have ample space for large double beds, stylish storage units have been fitted which are in keeping with the industrial feel and there a stripped original floor boards. The shower room that is sat at the end of the corridor is a tiled suite and has shower, WC, basin and heated towel rail.

The lower floor accommodation is where the main bathroom and kitchen are situated. The main bathroom is massive! There is a, with shower above, WC and heated towel rail. The kitchen has clean white units and there is plenty of worktop and storage space. There is space and plumbing for a washer and dryer.

detailedDescription:
The street entrance introduces you to Lamington Mews set in a sought after creative gated development in the very heart of the buzzing SE6.
Boasting super slick interior styling an abundance of bespoke fixtures and fittings, you’ll be the envy of your friends when you’re entertaining. The property is strikingly spacious, the accommodation comprises huge open plan living/dining space area with white contemporary kitchen.
Upstairs to the spacious bedroom and contemporary bespoke bathroom. Other great benefits include; wet system underfloor heating to kitchen, living and bedroom floors with independent controllable temperature and timings for ground and first floor. Real oak and oiled engineered flooring throughout, entry phone system, secure cycle storage and much more. I’m sure you and your neighbours will all build a great friendship in the mews.
As locations go Lamington Mews really is in the heart of Catford with an array of great local shops and restaurants surrounding a number of bus routes will whizz you to almost anywhere!.
Catford and Catford Bridge are a short distance with superb rail links into central London via London Bridge, Charing Cross, Blackfriars and St Pancras to name a few. Nearby is Catford Mews Cinema and some lovely local parks just a five minute stroll.

address: Honor Oak Road, Forest Hill, London SE23
detailedDescription:
A wonderful two double bedroom, ground floor apartment set over a generous 830 Sq Ft, which is located in a quiet, leafy, and desirable part of Forest Hill between Forest Hill station and the incredibly popular Horniman Gardens.

The property is set in a popular private development with a strong community feel. It comprises a bright and spacious reception room, separate fitted kitchen, modern bathroom suite and two large double bedrooms. The property also benefits from a secure private garage (which, with off-street parking generally, is hard to find so close to the station) and immaculately landscaped communal gardens both at the front and back which are easily and readily accessible. The apartment also looks out over the historic and picturesque Ashberry Cottage and Hill House.

The property is situated approximately just 0.3 miles (7 minutes walk) to Forest Hill station offering excellent transport links into London Bridge, Victoria, Canary Wharf, Shoreditch, the City, and many other locations. It is also very well placed for access to local green spaces including Horniman Gardens (less than 5 minute walk), but also Dulwich & Sydenham Woods, One Tree Hill, Dulwich Park, Peckham Rye Park just to name a few.

The heart of Forest Hill is also a short walk away which includes an extensive variety of restaurants, supermarkets, independent cafes, boutique shops and gastro pubs. The popular dining and socialising destinations of East Dulwich, Peckham, and Brixton are also a short bus journey away.

The property is available as Share of Freehold.

EPC: C
