address: Hill House, 82-84 Montacute Road, London SE6
detailedDescription:
Beautiful one-bedroom apartment within a grand Victorian period mansion round the corner from Blythe Hill Fields.

The apartment has a beautiful reception room, with real wood flooring, a cast iron radiator and a feeling of classic grandeur. The reception overlooks the communal gardens to the rear with stunning views over the roof tops towards Forest Hill, Crystal Palace and the North Downs in the distance. The kitchen is off the reception, with a tasteful cream wall and base units, granite worktop, integrated oven and induction hob, plus Vaillant boiler that is 4-5 years old.

The double bedroom fits a super king bed, plus plenty of space for a large wardrobe and chest of drawers. A lovely feature is the lacquered metal cast iron radiator. The bathroom is ensuite to the bedroom with shower over bath and white basin over a wood vanity unit.

The gardens to the rear of the building are shared with the other apartments and well maintained. In the summer there is plenty of space to relax on the lawn or to enjoy the beautiful plants.

Transport
Catford station 700m, with trains to Denmark Hill (for Kings), Blackfriars and City Thameslink
Catford Bridge station 750m, with trains to London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross.
Honor Oak Park station and Overground 0.7 miles, with trains to London Bridge, East Croydon, and Shoreditch.

Amenities
Catford town centre has Catford Mews 3 screen cinema, the Broadway Theatre, supermarkets and shops plus plenty of options for food and drink - – Italian (La Pizzeria Italiana), Turkish (EaTurkish, Mekan, Pide), Portuguese, Japanese (Sapporo Ichiban), Chinese, Thai, Lebanese Street Food restaurant (Fayrooz), Catford Bridge Tavern, Ninth Life and Bottle Bar.

The Blythe Hill Tavern is 400 metres away at the bottom of Blythe Hill Lane - a popular, classic pub.

Honor Oak has great café and takeaway options as well as Babur Indian restaurant.

Parks
It is 150 metres to Blythe Hill Fields, where you will find open spaces, a playground, trim trail and panoramic views towards central London and Canary Wharf to the north, and Kent and Surrey to the south.

Ladywell Fields (450m walk) has 54 acres of green space, with tennis courts, bowling green, cycle route and nature reserve, plus the Ravensbourne River flowing through it.

With a tasteful feel and stunning views, this apartment will make a great home for first time buyers. Call the Sales Team at Hunters to arrange your viewing.

The apartment consists of a large open-plan kitchen/reception room with beautiful laminated wooden floors. The kitchen is modern and offers plenty of storage and worktop space. The bedroom is spacious, has been tastefully decorated and benefits from two large sash windows which allow in plenty of natural light. The bathroom is spacious and has been beautifully decorated.

The apartment is within the heart of Ladywell, directly opposite Ladywell Station which has regular 17 minute trains into London Bridge. shared ownership (Advertised price represents 50% share. Full market value £485,000). The reception room has access to a balcony and is open-plan to a spacious kitchen area featuring a mix of sleek white and walnut style units. There is a large bedroom with Juliette balcony and en-suite shower room plus a second, comfortable, double bedroom and an attractive main bathroom. Useful storage cupboards have been provided in the entrance hallway and modern insulation standards, high performance glazing and gas central heating make for a very good energy-efficiency rating.
St Johns is the nearest station and provides a frequent service into London Bridge/Cannon Street. New Cross and Deptford Bridge are also within easy reach for London Overground and DLR respectively. The shops, bars and restaurants of Deptford High Street are only a short walk away and Deptford Railway Station provides additional Thameslink services via Farringdon and St Pancras.

* over 2,200 sq, ft.
* exceptional living space
* five bedrooms

* south facing rear garden
* garden with outbuilding

This five bedroom detached property must be viewed to appreciate the exceptional living space on offer.

The layout of this family home flows beautifully and is flooded with natural light.

The accommodation comprises; a welcoming hallway leading to a spacious lounge with feature fireplace with gas coal effect fire and window seating, a further reception room currently utilised as a dining room with doors onto the rear garden. In addition to the well-appointed reception rooms is a fantastic open plan kitchen/living area with three sets of French patio door onto the rear garden. There is also a utility/study room with further access to the garden and a downstairs shower room which completes the accommodation to this floor.

Upstairs offers a master bedroom with en-suite bathroom and walk in wardrobe, there are four further good size bedrooms and a modern family bathroom.

Externally there is a good size south facing rear garden which is perfectly suited to modern family living with a patio area and a courtyard area perfect for those summer evenings and a mature lawned area with flowering shrub borders and a newly constructed outbuilding.

The front of the property has a private drive offering parking for several cars.

Winn Road is situated in a great location for commuters with both Lee Green and Grove Park stations just a short distance away offering direct access into central London.

There are several highly sought after schools within walking distance including Eltham College, Eltham College Junior School and Colfe’s.

Also perfectly located for Bromley town centre which offers an array of shops, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities.

This property is convenient for those wanting the perfect balance of commuter convenience and family life.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £315,000 - £325,000** "My neighbours have always been brilliant and we have become friends."

Love the excellent location - easy reach of Greenwich park, the market and centre.

The location is really well positioned for transport directly into Canary Wharf and the City, and is quick and easy to get into Blackheath, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and Victoria.

There is a lot of buzz in the surrounding areas with restaurants, bars, pubs and the farmers markets available on foot. There is the convenience of everything you would need within a very short walk.

Living alone as a woman I felt that location and safety were really important and being within 30 seconds of the DLR and bus routes is great.

There is a little community within the development which adds to the feeling of security and the onsite facilities such as the gym, pool, concierge and restaurant were a real bonus to have on my door step."

What The Agent Says -

Spacious first floor modern flat, situated within the popular OneSE8 development, which is located towards the prestigious West Greenwich.

The building itself is less than ten years old, has a lift which services all floors and has an EWS1 certificate in place.

Inside you will find a spacious living room, offering direct access to a private balcony, so you have some garden space and an open plan kitchen diner, benefiting from some integrated appliances.

Double size bedroom and a modern bathroom suite, with shower over bath.

Added benefits include storage cupboard and a further storage/utility cupboard, wood flooring, video entry phone system, bicycle storage and use of the on-site facilities, which includes the concierge, gym and lap pool.

Deptford Bridge DLR station is just moments away on foot and Greenwich mainline station (and DLR) is a further five minutes walk away.

Detailed Description

Brown & Brooke are delighted to bring to market, this stunning, recently refurbished two double bedroom apartment with garage, situated within the popular, sought-after Parkside development, adjacent to Greenwich park. The apartment occupies a unique position on the estate, set back from the roads, and with garden views and plenty of natural light in every room.

Located on the top floor, the property comprises two double bedrooms, boasting modern, neutral décor, stylish solid wooden flooring and dual aspect windows. The bright and airy south-facing living room provides broad views over the well-maintained communal gardens. The spacious kitchen diner, with integrated appliances also enjoys great views and natural light. The large contemporary family suite completes this home, and a walk-in utility cupboard provides for plenty of storage.

Further benefits include gas fired central heating, large communal gardens, garage and share of freehold.

A short walk to Blackheath Village, Blackheath Royal Standard and Greenwich, the property is also well situated for transport links in and around the City, with Maze Hill and Blackheath stations giving homeowners easy access to a choice of London stations. Proximity to the A2 provides further options by car.

Reception - 17'11" x 16'10" (5.47m x 5.13m):
Spacious, bright and airy living room with open views over communal gardens. Original parquet flooring has recently been professionally restored and the room is very well decorated throughout.
On the top floor and set back from the road, this room provides great peace and a sense of calm.

Kitchen Diner - 12'3" x 10'4" (3.73m x 3.15m):
Contemporary kitchen, with fitted appliances and ample space for dining.

Master bedroom - 14'8" x 11'4" (4.48m x 3.45m):
Dual aspect windows flood this large double room with a vast amount of light. Two modern double-door fitted wardrobes provide plenty of storage.

Second bedroom - 11'4" x 10'4" (3.45m x 3.15m):
Second double room provides an ideal home office or guest bedroom. Dual aspect windows look out over the rear communal gardens and across to Canary Wharf.

Bathroom:
Well sized contemporary family suite with bath and shower.

What the owner says :
"We have loved living in this flat because… it's so bright and spacious and has lovely views over the gardens"
"We particularly like the location because… it's an idyllic spot with a village feel but easy access to the city and west end"

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderfully bright two-bedroom apartment lies on Pendrell Road, a quiet, tree-lined street within Brockley’s Telegraph Hill conservation area. Extending over 670 sq ft, the apartment has been extensively renovated in recent years under the current ownership to marry its classic Victorian features with sensitive contemporary additions. Original elements such as high ceilings, bay windows and typically grand Victorian proportions have been paired with natural materials and neutral tones to create a sense of tranquillity throughout.

The Tour

Entrance to the apartment is on the ground floor, where a staircase leads up to a bright hallway. A south-facing kitchen/living area lies to the front of the apartment’s footprint; this generously proportioned space features original floorboards and a large bay window that frames expansive views over Sydenham Hill. The kitchen has been installed within the last year and has been completed in a simple, white palette, with Formica work surfaces and grouting that contrasts with the tiling.

The main bedroom lies to the rear of the apartment. This is a sizable space, with ample room for a king-size bed, which overlooks verdant views of the rear gardens below. There is also a large loft with the potential for conversion; this has precedent on the street and within the conservation area more broadly.

The second double bedroom occupies the centre of the apartment’s footprint and is currently laid out as a nursery. It has bespoke fitted cabinetry, providing plenty of storage space; there is also a walk-in wardrobe to the rear, which could easily be configured as a third bedroom. A bathroom lies beyond, fitted with chrome Edwardian-style hardware, simple white tiling and pared-back sanitary ware.

The Area

The Telegraph Hill conservation area lies a short distance to the west of Brockley, a thriving London neighbourhood with a growing cultural profile. A short walk from St Johns, New Cross and Nunhead, with Deptford, Greenwich and Peckham slightly further afield, it is swiftly becoming one of the most fashionable parts of south-east London. The area surrounding Pendrell Road has a range of cafes, pubs and restaurants including Good as Gold, Sparrow, Joyce and Marcella. There are plenty of green spaces nearby, including Nunhead Cemetery, Peckham Rye and Hilly Fields

There is a renowned farmers’ market every Saturday at Brockley Market, offering a wide range of organic produce, alongside food trucks and wine merchants. Deptford Market Yard, a recently launched collection of independent shops and restaurants set within and around Deptford’s refurbished railway arches, is nearby. Goldsmiths University is within walking distance, and will soon open the doors to its new gallery, designed by Turner-prize winning architects Assemble.

The house is a nine-minute walk from Brockley Station, which runs services to London Bridge in 12 minutes. Frequent Overground services also run from Brockley for connections to Peckham, Shoreditch and Highbury & Islington.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: 92 years remaining Service Charge: £1,498
Ground Rent: £350
Council Tax: Band B

detailedDescription:
Revelon Road is a quiet residential street within close walking distance to Brockley Overground Station, with trains to London Bridge (two stops) and the Overground. It's a very quick commute to Canary Wharf. Nunhead Station (for Thameslink trains) is also half a mile away. The shops and local amenities to the area are all also close by.

The local schools are extremely well-regarded, including John Stainer Primary, Ivydale, Edmund Waller, and within the catchment area of Haberdasher Askes secondary school.

This property flows naturally, from the recently decorated exterior and front garden, to the open through reception room on to the generously sized kitchen/diner, which opens out onto the low maintenance garden allowing superb entertaining options in the warmer months. On the first and top floor you will find four double bedrooms, including a loft conversion which has been converted into a fantastic double bedroom with a modern fitted en-suite bathroom. Along with this comes a second kitchen; this can all ways be converted to form a fifth bedroom. The family bathroom and a separate cloakroom are on the first floor.

Overall, this property would make a perfect family home in an excellent location.<br /><br />

address: 2.D.06 Ap1, Cedarwood Mansions, Deptford Landings, 121-123 Evelyn Street, London SE8
detailedDescription:
As a brand new destination in the heart of E13, Upton Gardens includes a range of contemporary 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments designed by Barratt, one of the market-leading developers in the Capital with over 30 years of experience.

Upton Gardens is constructed on the site of the former stadium of West Ham Football Club. Situated in Upton Park in the London borough of Newham, East London, this historic location was home to the club from 1904, before it relocated to Stratford Olympic Park in 2016. With its impressive football heritage, owning a property in Upton Gardens is a once in a lifetime opportunity to secure your piece of British sporting history.

The design of Upton Gardens strongly identifies with the former football ground it is built on, with the layout of the buildings shadowing the layout of the old stadium and a small circus exactly where the centre circle of the pitch was.

As an Upton Gardens resident, you will enjoy facilities such as a concierge, a fully equipped gym and underground car parking including storage for over 1,000 bikes. There are also 64 electric vehicle charge points and eight car club vehicles for your use. In addition, a number of new community amenities such as a large public library and cafes are being built as part of the site.

The development has been designed to maximise green areas - all homes will include private outdoor space, as well as access to communal gardens and landscaping, including a direct walkway to Priory Park behind the development.

*Please note that any CGIs used are for indicative purposes only

Owing to our commitment to keeping both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many virtual viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Conveniently located in Zone 3, Upton Gardens is a 6-minute walk from Upton Park underground station, which operates on the District and Hammersmith & City lines with direct links into central London.

Stratford - 11 Minutes
Liverpool Street - 15 Minutes
Canary Wharf - 16 Minutes
West End - 31 Minutes

Crossrail is due to arrive at nearby Forest Gate, which will reduce journey times to Canary Wharf to 8 minutes and Tottenham Court Road to 17 Minutes.

detailedDescription:
Set to the top floor of a converted period public house, this share of freehold apartment has a loft style feel and a wonderful balcony with far reaching views.

One of 11 contemporary style flats, Indigo House was converted around 12 years ago and this home offers fabulous modern style living with a 19’ open plan lounge. There is an abundance of natural light with floor to ceiling patio doors onto the Southerly aspect balcony.

There is an added bonus of a very useful communal basement area for storage along with a small communal rear garden.

For the busy commuter, there is a choice of Overground Stations whilst there is an ample offering of independent bars, cafés and bistros nearby.

Offered chain free, your earliest attention to view is highly recommended to appreciate this fine home.

What The Seller Says

This flat has been a great living space for me since I moved to Brockley and I will be sad to leave it behind. The lounge/kitchen area is fantastic for watching the sunrise and the large patio doors really bring the outside in. The balcony is great for sitting out with a coffee and reading a book in the sunshine as well as having the odd BBQ. The building is managed by two of the residents who are very good at organising any repairs/maintenance and always keep everyone well informed. There is a large basement which is great for storing bikes etc.

The location of the flat is brilliant for public transport. I work in the City and my door to door commute is just over 30 minutes, it is also very easy to get to London Bridge and Canary Wharf. With three stations close by and a good bus service it is always easy to get around. The tfl weekend night service has also recently been extended to the Overground and this now includes New Cross Gate station. I have found Brockley to be a lovely quiet and peaceful area to live. There is a farmers market on the weekend and a number of nice coffee shops, deli's and restaurants. Brockley even has its own brewery! New Cross is also very close by where there are more restaurants and some great bars.<br /><br />
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £250,000 - £275,000 "I moved into this flat and could not have asked for a better new home. Secure, high end and self-contained, with a generous outside space right in the heart of London."

What The Seller Says -

"Situated between Lewisham and Greenwich it is just a short walk to the shops, markets and restaurants giving me the best of what both “villages” have to offer.

The 24-hour concierge is an added bonus; I certainly never worry about when parcels are being delivered and making Saturday morning post office trips are certainly a thing of the past.

The gym, right next door, has also added convenience, allowing me to exercise easily at whatever time works for me.

This development has excellent transport links; Elverson Road DLR is a 1-minute walk, with Lewisham Mainline, DLR and bus station only 5 minutes away. The large Lewisham Tesco's is 3-4 minutes-walk away with both the main shopping centre and Glassmill Leisure centre a few minutes further on.

Historic Greenwich, the Thames path cycle path and social scene is also only two short DLR stops away.

Whilst I have decided that it is time to move closer to family, over the decade I have spent here, I could not have asked for a better place better suited to meet my needs.

This flat is excellent for anyone working in the centre, the city of London, or further south east."

What The Agent Says -

Excellent purchase for a first time buyer or investor, with the flat nicely positioned in the Silkworks development, on the ground floor and within the gated section, so going out onto your private patio section feels very safe and secure.

The interior briefly comprises a lounge diner, open plan fitted kitchen, ample storage, double size bedroom and modern bathroom suite.<br /><br />
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:

Freehold

A beautiful two bedroom, Eric Lyons Span house, ideally situated on the corner of Lee Road & Priory Park, only moments away from Blackheath Village. This freehold property on the edge of the Cator Estate, offers two great sized bedrooms each with in-built storage and large windows, allowing lots of light throughout. title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
*guide price £550,000-£570,000*

This modern and spacious two-bedroom flat is set within a charming development off Sydenham Hill. Situated at one of London's highest points, the property features stunning views of South East London and Kent.

The property is presented in fantastic decorative order throughout comprising a light and spacious open plan reception room with a stylish fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms, bathroom, and master bedroom with fitted wardrobe, dressing area, an en-suite shower room. Benefits include ample storage and a private balcony, allocated secure underground parking space, and communal gardens.

Sydenham Hill and its surrounding areas boast the best of both worlds. Easy access into central London and a village lifestyle surrounded by leafy parks, woods and green walking trails. Dane House is set within easy reach of Sydenham Road, Dulwich Village and Crystal Palace Triangle which combined offer a plethora of bars, shops, restaurants, and transport links providing easy access to the city and surrounding areas. Wells Park and Crystal Palace Park are also close by providing a range of activities to include the National Sports Centre and Boating Lake. Transport links can be found close by at Sydenham Hill (southeastern, direct access into London Victoria in 14 minutes) and Crystal Palace (London overground Highbury and Islington via Canada Water and southern railway, direct access into London Bridge and London Victoria).

address: Willow House, Dragonfly Place, Brockley SE4
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £450,000 - £500,000

A wonderful split level apartment with incredible vaulted ceilings in the top floor bedrooms and huge windows, making this a super bright home in this unique development found moments from Zone 2 Brockley Overground.

The 20' open plan lounge is sure to please with floor to ceiling windows, perfect for people watching as the world goes by!

There is a great choice of independent bars cafes and bistros found nearby.

The Seller says -

This flat has been a happy home for us for over seven years, and we've been here since it was originally built. What initially drew us to it was the colourful exterior and its surprisingly large windows, which bring a light and airy feel and allow for stunning sunsets towards Crystal Palace. Being split over two floors has really helped to make it feel like a home.

The street has a sense of community with a mix of residents and workers from the ground floor units, including photographers and architects — meeting up at barbecues and get-togethers in the communal grass area over Summer. It’s a real convenience having Brockley station a four minute walk away and a great selection of local coffee shops and restaurants nearby. We also love being close to the Telegraph Hill parks, with their views over London.

We've really enjoyed living in the area and hope to move to a house nearby.<br /><br />

agency_name: Winkworth - Forest Hill and New Cross
address: Julian Tayler Path, School Lane SE23
detailedDescription:
An opportunity to purchase this beautiful three bedroom house set within a quiet leafy location in Forest Hill.

The well presented accommodation on offer comprises, entrance hall, 16'1 reception room, a huge 18'5 kitchen / breakfast room and downstairs W.C.

To the first floor, there is a landing giving access to three good size bedrooms and a family bathroom.

Externally, there is a well kept garden to the rear aspect with a pergola and patio area.

Additionally, there is the possibility, subject to planning, to convert the loft and extend to the rear.

Julian Tayler Path is an amazing property in a sought after area. Viewing is highly recommended.

Location:
Located in a very quiet and leafy spot, within a few moments of this property is an abundance of local independent shops, bars, cafes and restaurants including sourdough pizzeria Bona and St. David's Coffee House.

Furthermore, there are handy high street stores including Sainsbury's and Boots in Forest Hill's high street, as well as Lordship Lane to the Dulwich side, with plenty of choice of shops and restaurants.

Locally there is a great choice of green spaces and parks with the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away. The bucolic and hidden Sydenham Woods is just five minutes away.

Eliot Bank Primary school is just a stones-throw away, and other recommended schools, such as Kelvin Grove and Horniman Primary, are within close proximity.

There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground approximately 5 minutes' walk away connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away.
title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

address: Hindsleys Place, Unit 3, Forest Hill SE23
detailedDescription:
** Guide £975,000 - £1,000,000 **

Winkworth are delighted to welcome to the market this truly stunning, architect-designed, Warehouse conversion in the centre of Forest Hill.

The property offers 1,691 Sq of contemporary living on two levels. It has live / work use and a versatile layout that will appeal to a host of buyers.

The ground floor consists of a 40ft open plan kitchen/ reception room, three bedrooms, a shower room and a separate utility area.

Two of the existing bedrooms on the ground floor are currently used as a study and walk-in wardrobe.

The first floor is home to the principal bedroom measuring over 17ft with a further walk-in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom.

The property benefits from high ceilings with built-in roof lights allowing natural light to flood the property.

Early viewing highly recommended to avoid disappointment.

Location:

The property is also well connected to East Dulwich, Peckham and Camberwell by good regular bus routes.

Locally there is a vast array of cafes, vibrant bars, independent restaurants, local boutiques and shops. Locally there is a superb range of independent primary and secondary schools in the area. Close by there is a choice of green spaces including Horniman Museum & Gardens, Mayow Park and Beckenham Place Park with its new outdoor swimming pool.

Blackheath Village with its array of restaurants and bars is only 0.7 miles away and the daily conveniences of Blackheath Standard only 110 metres away.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £750,000 - £800,000

Four double bedroom Victorian home, with two bathrooms, arranged over three levels, 25' bright double reception room and lovely 40' Westerly aspect garden.

The Seller Says -

We’ve loved living on Salehurst Road for the last 10 years; it’s the quietest road we’ve ever
lived on with no through traffic and there’s a real sense of community. We know pretty much
everyone who lives here and have lovely neighbours on either side.

There are great transport links, shops, restaurants, local parks, and the local primary school our kids attend is truly outstanding. (Not just an Ofsted review…)

The house holds many happy memories and we’ve lovingly added our stamp over the years.
We’ll miss the high ceilings, palatial bathroom, wood burner, the whole thing, in fact we
sometimes wonder why we’re selling!<br /><br />

detailedDescription:

Downstairs to the building you'll find an Artisan pizza and cocktails restaurant, but also Lewisham High Street is a short walk away and offers plenty of the local amenities, as well as a major supermarket and street market.

detailedDescription:
Chain Free! Located on the ground floor of this mid century, purpose built apartment complex is this well presented two double bedroom flat which has it's very own entrance.
Ideally located for easy access to Forest Hill station, the High streets shops and restaurants.
The well presented accommodation consists of two good size double bedrooms a generous lounge/dining room, a fitted kitchen and modern bathroom. Other features include double glazing, gas Combi central heating and residents parking. There is currently upgrades to the surrounding area taking place which will provide additional parking bays and attractive landscaping and is due to complete in 2022.

An ideal starter home, downsizer or sharers option this home really is one to consider, book early to avoid disappointment.

Location

Within easy access to Forest Hill and the broader Dulwich area. Forest Hill station is just a few minutes walk away and the popular and reputable Eliot Bank is quick to reach on foot.
For food and drink Dartmouth Road and Lordship Lane are nearby, and you are spoilt for choice when it comes to green spaces with Horniman Gardens and Sydenham Woods just moments away, and Dulwich Park just beyond.
A quiet and leafy location set back away from traffic with quick links into Zone One from Forest Hill for numerous Central London destinations.

address: Cameron Terrace, Chinbrook Road, London SE12
detailedDescription:
Overview Glenview Court is a stunning combination of tradition and modernity blending the character and charm of the Victorian era with cutting edge building techniques to create an imposing, characterful and most attractive new build offering. The façade of the original detached house is retained meaning high ceilings and spaces / features not often associated with new build. This is a two bedrooms, first floor apartment with a loggia/balcony - available with Help to Buy.

Features: Include high ceilings, double glazed sash windows, fully integrated kitchen, fully tiled bathroom/shower rooms (underfloor heating), efficient electric heating and outside space in the form of patio/loggia/balconies and gardens for the lower ground floor units. There is a frontage with parking spaces available to purchase, bicycle and refuse storage.

Travel: Grove Park is a Zone 4 commute with connections to London Cannon Street and Charing Cross (via London Bridge). Bus routes connect you with neighboring towns for shopping at The Glades (Bromley) and Lewisham shopping Centre. Easy access to the M25 (via A20) or into London via A2 Blackwall Tunnel (and various other).

Local: Sainsbury's Local, Tesco Express, news agents, various news agents, take aways and The Baring Hall Hotel (Antic pub chain)

Schooling: Various well regarded schools are situated within one mile of the properties.

Tenure – new 125 year lease with service charge is £1,273.68 per annum and zero ground rent.

Example two bedrooms first floor follows - more coming soon!

tenure 125 Years lease with nil Ground Rent and Service Charge is £1,273.68 pa

help to buy Help to Buy (htb)



Precis of htb

5% deposit required
Up to 40% Government backed Equity Loan – Interest free for first 5 years
Remainder funded by a 55% mortgage (or less if smaller Equity Loan taken out subject to a minimum mortgage of 25%)
Equity loan amount is linked to the home value and not the original amount borrowed
Eligibility – First Time Buyers only able to afford repayments
Homebuilders will provide a New Home Warranty and are held to rigorous quality standards in order to be able to provide homes for Help To Buy (including Consumer Code for Home Builders and New Homes Ombudsman)
Leases offered must be fair and meet Help To Buy requirements

Process:
Get Financial Advice to check your affordability
Find and Reserve your home (Reservation Fee capped at £500)
Complete a Property Information Form and Return with the Homebuilder's signed reservation form to your Help to Buy agent (Your mortgage broker may assist you in this).
Your htb agent will review the paperwork and if approved will give you atp (Authority to Proceed)
Liaise with your conveyancer and mortgage broker to complete the process.

The whole process takes approximately 2-3 months (note you have 3 months to reach exchange of contracts from when your atp is given).

Note: To expedite matters you can make your mortgage application at the beginning of this processbut be aware that any payments you make for applications/surveys will be lost should your htb application not be approved.

detailedDescription:
| Stunning Interior Design | Sought After Road | Victorian Era |

Unveiled to the SE23 market is this premium Victorian conversion flat that is situated in arguably one of Forest Hill's most recognised roads; Manor Mount.

The accommodation itself is set on the top floor of this period building with the internal floor space surpassing a mammoth 660sqft/61.3sqm, all of which providing stunning views and producing masses of natural light via the tall windows. The layout comprises a large main bedroom, a stylish shower room, spacious entrance hall, an in-trend navy blue themed kitchen design with brass handles and a beautiful enormous reception room, which is complimented with the 'Farrow & Ball' paintwork. Additional benefits include tall ceilings, a characterful ambiance, kerb appeal with stunning frontage, off street parking and access to a communal garden.

Located within only a 6 minute walk away from Forest Hill Station which boasts superb connections into London Bridge via the Metro Line, London Victoria and the highly rated Overground Line offering fast and easy access into East London via Shoreditch High Street. Locally you are well served with Forest Hill High Street which offers an extensive selection of trendy boutiques, cafes, supermarkets and bistros. The Horniman Museum & Gardens are moments away as well as Dulwich Park being a 23 minute walk away (according to Google Maps).

With the recent success we have had on similar properties within the immediate location, we envisage this stunning conversion having great success on the open market and highly recommend a viewing asap!

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

detailedDescription:
Virtual tour available

Presented to the market is this truly impeccable example of a three bedroom terraced house on the sought after Hillcrest Road Bromley!

Internal space comprises of; Welcoming entrance hall leading into the sprawling open plan reception room complemented by a sleek bay window offering an abundance of natural light, the home is laid out in an open plan, yet practical style, with the 9’11 by 9’10 reception flowing through into the homes full width 16’5 by 7’8 dining room which offers direct access via French doors to the 60’ east facing garden. The kitchen has been extended to the rear adding more space and a new unique layout, the kitchen also offers access to the mature garden.

Heading upstairs you will find what was three well-proportioned bedrooms now merged into two to create and large walk in wardrobe for the master bedroom, but with very little work can be turned back into a third room, the master has wardrobes running the full way across the rear maximizing the space available, the second bedroom also measures in at a respectable 10’6 by 9’11, on this floor you will also find the modern family bathroom.

Further benefits include, double glazing, gas central heating, potential to extend to the loft and to the rear (subject to necessary planning consents) and a large 18’ by 9’6 detached garage that is also accessible from a through round leading to the back of the property.

Hillcrest Road is a picturesque and highly desirable street, extremely popular with families and city bound professionals due to the proximity to the station. It’s just 0.9 of a mile from Grove Park station (London Zone 4), which offers high speed direct trains into London Bridge, Waterloo East, Cannon Street & Charing Cross in as little as 13 minutes.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

The property is in excellent decorative order with sash windows, plantation shutters and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation comprises: A large central entrance hall, a huge 24'9 x 14'11 open plan lounge diner with bay window and an attractive modern kitchen with island and breakfast bar. There is a huge 17'0 x 14'10 master bedroom with bay window and stylish modern ensuite shower room, a very large 14'10 x 12'8 second double bedroom and a modern bathroom. There is also a separate utility/laundry room. To the rear is a superb and vast landscape communal garden.

The property is sold with a share of the freehold
This is an impressive apartment and is sold chain free. Immediate viewing is essential.

The property is very convenient for transport links with Blackheath train station (0.7 miles) and Westcombe Park station (0.62 miles) nearby and buses stopping for North Greenwich tube station (1.8 miles). Blackheath Common, (100 yards miles), and Royal Greenwich Park (500 metres) are both just a short walk. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This spacious apartment has been completely renovated by the current owner and features an impressive reception room with attractive parquet flooring and original period features including a fireplace and a large sash window that overlooks the stunning communal gardens. Down the hall is the stylish shaker style kitchen with integrated AEG appliances and a white stone worktop. There are two double bedrooms and a modern tiled bathroom. Upstairs is the third double bedroom, a beautiful en-suite with a bath and walk-in shower and two large store rooms that would be ideal as a utility room and walk-in wardrobe. There is use of an amazing south facing communal garden, off street parking, a garage and a handy private store cupboard in the basement.

Blackheath Park is a picturesque, tree lined street found on the prestigious Cator Estate. Quite literally at the end of the road you will find Blackheath Village with its array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. In addition to these amenities, the Conservatoire is a family friendly hub of the local community offering art, drama and music classes as well as hosting various events. On the north side of the village is the open heath which is a jewel of South East London and makes an idyllic recreation area with Greenwich Royal Park beyond. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting into town with regular services in to London Bridge (13 minutes), Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank. Those who are considering schools will have a number of options for both state and public education. Local schools include the hugely popular and Ofsted Outstanding Brooklands Primary School, Heath House, Blackheath Preparatory School and The Pointers School. Further afield, Eltham and Dulwich Colleges run a bus service directly from Blackheath Village

detailedDescription:
This wonderful two bedroom apartment is located on the third floor of Augustine House, forming part of the stunning Silkworks Development.

Boasting 620 Sq. Ft. Of internal living space, you have a nicely proportioned flat, with an open plan kitchen and integrated appliances, mirrored splashback, and under lighting. There are two double bedrooms both offering carpet and storage, and a spacious chic three piece bathroom. The apartment also benefits from having a spacious balcony, 24 hour concierge service and residents' gymnasium included.

The apartment is located in a great spot for commuters, being only a short walk from either Elverson Road DLR or Lewisham Station, as well having easy access to the A20 offering roads into Central London & beyond. The development is moments from the busy Lewisham High Street offering a vast amount of restaurants, cafes and the famous Lewisham Open Market.

Located approximately just 0.3 miles from Crofton Park Station and 0.6 miles from Honor Oak Park Station offering excellent transport links into London Bridge, Blackfriars and many other locations. detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are proud to present this beautiful four bedroom family home in a quiet residential road in Brockley.

The property comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with a large front reception room, good sized dining room that leads onto a bright conservatory. There is a modern galley kitchen that leads onto the beautifully kept rear garden. To the rear there is a good sized garage that is served through an access road. Upstairs, there are four good sized bedrooms and a family sized bathroom.

To the front there is a driveway and a garage to the rear. The property is presented in excellent condition and is ready for a growing family to move straight into. Buyers have the ability to put their stamp on the property by opening up the kitchen onto the dining room / the potential for a rear extension.

The property is in close proximity to Crofton Park, Ladywell, Catford Bridge, and Honor Oak stations. There is also an array of green space nearby with Ladywell Fields and Blythe Hill Fields just a short walk away.

Viewing is highly recommended.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
904 square feet of purpose-built flat over two floors within a low-rise block. It’s set over the third and fourth floors and comes with a private garden too (it's not direct access but does have street access). The flat has three bedrooms upstairs and downstairs you’ve got an independent kitchen and two reception rooms - or use one of these as a fourth bedroom - depending on how you want to set things up.

On-street parking is unrestricted, and Lee Station is just a 12 minute walk; it’s a 14 minute journey-time from here to London Bridge. You're also close to Northbrook Park.

Up to your own front door and you open into the hall with the kitchen to your left. This is a basic affair and will welcome renovation - get that Pinterest board going! Ahead from the hall is a natural sitting room - of over 11 feet each way, with a big built-in cupboard. Off the kitchen is another room of over 10 feet by 10 feet.

Upstairs and you’ve got a simple bathroom with white sanitary ware, and three bedrooms - these are all good doubles and have double-glazed windows (the flat’s double-glazed throughout).

The garden is fenced and gated with paved areas, and is set to the rear of the small block. All the flats have their own demised garden section. Handily, a gate from the street makes gardening or wheeling in bikes and the like easy.

You’re 6.5 miles south-east of central London here, with Lee Station being your closest (Charing Cross and Cannon Street trains). Local parks include Northbrook and Horn Parks. Plus Grove Park Nature Reserve. Jump on a bus or bicycle for Blackheath and Greenwich Royal Park.

Catford and Lewisham centres offer high street shopping and markets. Locally you have a handy Co-Op, and several cool places to eat and drink including The Caspian (Persian restaurant) and The Crown (gastropub with large garden) on Burnt Ash Hill.

The end of terrace location means the garden is not overlooked by any neighbours, creating the perfect spot to enjoy the warm summer evenings.

This property would make the perfect home for first-time buyers or young families alike. Call now to arrange a viewing!

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: Offered to the market chain free is a unique opportunity to purchase this lovely 4 double bedroom semi-detached family home with a large south facing rear garden, located on this pretty treelined residential street in the heart of SE23. Dunoon Road is one of SE23’s premier residential streets that is very quiet, with a lovely local community, it very close to Honor Oak Park station and Fairlawn Primary School.The house is located on a large plot of land, sitting well back from the street with a 60ft front garden and a driveway for at least three cars. The sunny South facing private rear garden is approximately 56ft and at the far end is a gate providing access to a private road where there are two garages that belong to this property. Internally, the house offers well-proportioned living accommodation, double glazing throughout and plenty of potential as the house has already been extended to the rear and the loft has been converted but it does require some cosmetic updating throughout. Perfect for someone to come in and add their own signature to this impressive home. Upon entry to the house there is a wide hallway with high ceilings and the staircase leads upwards, offering storage underneath. At the end of the hallway is a shower room and guest toilet. At the front of the house there is a generous reception room which has a large square bay window that fills the room with natural light and offers views over the front garden. The ceilings are high and there is also a nice fireplace as a centre piece. The rear reception room has wood effect flooring and a nice feature fireplace, the rear of the room has been opened up to the kitchen extension making this a versatile room that could be used for dining, or a lounge or even a play area for small kids. The rear of the house has been extended to create a kitchen breakfast room that occupied the whole width of the house and offers direct access with views over the private rear garden. The ceilings above a valuated with two large skylights that illuminate this space with direct sunlight thanks to its Southerly facing aspect. The kitchen sits on one side of the room with plenty of wall and base mounted bespoke units and a solid wood worktop that wraps around to create a breakfast bar. The worktop houses a 5-ring gas hob with oven below and extractor above and the sink sits nicely under a window overlooking the garden. One the other side of the room there is plenty of space for a dining table and chairs. The garden is a lovely space and is an all year round South facing sun trap! There is a patio area closest to the house, beyond this is a large lawn surrounded by boarders of mature plants and shrubs. The garden extends to 56ft and at the far end is a gate leading to a private no entry road accessible for the residents of this terrace where there are private garages, two of which belong to the title of this property. This is currently a great space for storage, would be very useful for anyone looking for a workshop or even a studio space. Upstairs on the first floor there are 3 bedroom and a family bathroom. At the front of the house is the biggest double bedroom which has fitted cupboards in the alcoves of the chimney and an arched bay double- glazed window looking out over the front garden. Adjacent is the smallest double bedroom which also has a double-glazed window looking out to the front. At the back of the house is another very good size double, almost equivalent to the largest bedroom at the front. This room offers lovely views over the rear garden and beyond.The family bathroom has a bath with shower above, accompanied by a toilet and wash a hand basin. There is also an airing cupboard and two frosted windows for natural night and ventilation. At the top of the house is the loft room that has been converted to create a large double bedroom with an en-suite shower room. The bedroom has two Velux windows at the front of the house, with additional storage in the eaves and a large double glazed window to the rear offering far reaching views. Dunoon Road is conveniently located twixt Devonshire Road and Honor Oak Road providing easy access to the amenities of both Honor Oak Park and Forest Hill. This home is at the Honor Oak end, only a few minutes' walk to the independent shops and cafés found nearby and the magical Devonshire Road Nature Reserve. The highly rated Fairlawn Primary school is literally at the top of the road (209 meters), Francesca Cabrini catholic school is only 241 meters and Horniman Primary is close by too (0.36 miles). Honor Oak Park station, just five minutes away (approx. 579 meters), has services to London Bridge and London Overground links to Canada Water, Shoreditch, Hoxton, Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington. Forest Hill station is on the same line but also offers a connection to London Victoria. At the other end of Devonshire Road is Forest Hill where you will find a large Sainsbury's, Post Office, wh Smiths, Boots, delicatessens and modern swimming pool/leisure centre. Horniman Museum and Gardens is very close and holds regular farmers' markets, great summer events and a butterfly sanctuary, while Sydenham Woods is also within walking distance. Forest Hill Road leads down to the open green spaces of Benchley Gardens and Peckham Rye as well as offering plenty of amenities including a couple of great pubs, restaurants and a gp surgery.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautifully-presented throughout, this fabulous 1-bedroom ground floor garden flat has its own front door and comes with the added bonus of a garage.
The current owners have transformed the property to create a stylish yet practical home. It has been finished to a high standard with good quality fixtures and fittings. A recently-laid black and white chequerboard tiled path leads up to the front door. Inside, the accommodation features a sunny reception room with a seating area and space for a dining room table and chairs. Off this room is a sleek high gloss kitchen with integrated appliances. The bedroom extends to 19ft and has fitted wardrobes. The shower room is a particular highlight with a large walk-in shower with Crittall style shower screen. There is a private garden, (new artificial to be laid down) with a detached garage that can also be accessed from the street. (Ideal for storage or potential home working)
The neighbourhood is a friendly and cosmopolitan one, popular among families and young professionals. It offers some great places to eat and socialise such as an award-winning Indian restaurant (Babur), a much-loved Italian (Le Querce), a hip pizzeria (Mamma Dough), and a traditional Turkish (Hattush). For a post work drink, pop into The Chandos or the Brockley Jack where there is also a small theatre. During the day you can grab a coffee and a bite to eat in Honor Oak Provender deli or Two Spoons coffee shop. For groceries, there's a Sainsbury's Local on the high street along with a number of other convenience stores.
Transport links into central London could hardly be better. Honor Oak Park station provides fast and frequent services to London Bridge (in around 11mins) as well as Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington. You can change at Canada Water for easy access to Canary Wharf.
There's no shortage of green spaces locally including Blythe Hill Fields, Peckham Rye Park and Horniman Gardens. There are a number of highly-rated schools in the area the nearest being Dalmain Primary school.

An exceptional four bedroom, three bathroom contemporary freehold townhouse originally constructed by Berkeley Homes located within a quiet landscaped square with parking, access to concierge and residents gym. Mary Rose Square is located moments from Surrey Quays for local shopping, Canada Water [Jubilee & Overground] Station and Surrey Quays Pier for river taxis to Canary Wharf and Central London.

This beautifully presented contemporary freehold townhouse originally constructed by Berkeley Homes further enhanced by the current owners comprises entrance hall with storage cupboards, impressive family room with double doors leading to enclosed rear Zen garden with water feature designed by Jonathan Mark Garden Design, open plan bespoke fitted kitchen with stone work tops and integrated appliances, ground floor cloakroom/WC with storage, stairs lead to first floor landing with doors leading to walk in storage cupboard, formal reception room with feature fireplace, master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite bathroom, stairs lead to second floor landing with storage cupboard, double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room, two further bedrooms and family bathroom. The property has been extensively enhanced to provide the ultimate luxury living experience including Silent Gliss curtains, bespoke fireplaces, rako intelligent lighting system, pre-wired speakers to the main rooms, CCTV and adt alarm system. There is parking, access to landscaped communal gardens within the square, concierge and gym facilities.

A beautifully presented four bedroom semi-detached house located on a quiet residential road on the outskirts of Grove Park. This 1930's freehold house benefits from two reception rooms with a large living space which opens out onto a great-sized family garden. In good condition, this family home offers almost 130sqm of space with a modern fitted kitchen and fully tiled three piece bathroom suite. The first floor comprises of two bedrooms, the master with en-suite shower room and further guest bedroom. On the top floor the loft conversion has two further bedrooms and plenty of eve storage.

Great for entertaining in the summer months; the garden has well-maintained decking, a lovely lawn and stone paved area so you are sure to catch the sun at anytime of the day. To the rear of the garden there is an electrically supplied and fully plumbed, self contained outbuilding in excellent condition that could be used for a multitude of purposes: Home office, studio, work shop.

Grove Park Station is the nearest, and there is a footpath at the end of Jevington Way which cuts through to Exford Road. The local shops are just a three minute walk away and the location is perfect for families with schools such as Cooper's Lane Primary School, Horn Park Primary School and Eltham College less than half a mile away. In a really peaceful and quiet location, this property would be ideal for a growing family looking for that extra space.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented, rarely available, double-fronted Victorian townhouse situated on this pretty tree-lined road, close to Blackheath Village and within the Blackheath Conservation area. This stunning home has been tastefully and sympathetically renovated by the current owners.
The central hall gives access to a Dining room/library to the right and a lovely living room to the left, both fitted with solid oak flooring. The stylish and spacious bespoke, hand made kitchen enjoys direct access to the secluded and welcoming courtyard style garden. The kitchen also has access to the large wine cellar.

There is a WC on the half landing with marble tiling and a door out to a south west facing private roof terrace. Upstairs are two double bedrooms, both with attractive built in wardrobes and a luxuriously remodelled marble tiled bathroom and freestanding iron bath. Two further double bedrooms are found on the top floor along with a modern marble tiled shower room.

Quentin Road is a quiet road, tucked away in a pretty area conveniently located for Blackheath station. Blackheath Village, where you will find an array of shops, independent cafes and restaurants is just a few hundred metres away. Beyond the village you will find the open expanse of the heath itself, and Greenwich Park, which are jewels of South East London. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting into town with regular services in to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. One stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank. Energy Efficiency Rating E.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are proud to present this beautiful two bedroom first floor apartment located in close proximity to Lewisham Centre and Lewisham Station/DLR. This home benefits from a share of freehold and will largely suit first time buyers and professional couples.

This property provides flexible accommodation and provides the option to easily convert the apartment into a large one bedroom flat or keep as two bedrooms.

The property comprises of open plan kitchen / reception room, spacious and modern bathroom and two good sized bedrooms.

The property has access to a large garden at the rear and there is a host of green spaces nearby including Lewisham Park, Blackheath and Greenwich Park. There are a number of excellent schools nearby to choose for both Primary and Secondary.

Viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Spacious one bedroom apartment in a Victorian pub conversion – formerly the Rose of Kent pub – dating back to 1869. Bright, modern interior with lots of living space, the property is nestled between Canada Water and New Cross and boasts excellent transport links to central London via train, tube or bus, with the Jubilee line at your fingertips, and just one stop to London Bridge via New Cross / New Cross Gate.

This ground floor flat features a private entrance with double-height lobby area, and stairs that lead to a raised living space which can be zoned into separate lounge / dining areas. Off the living space is a separate galley kitchen with full fittings and ample storage space. The bathroom features full-size bathtub and shower, and a heated towel rack. The bedroom is a super plus size with plenty of room for storage and furnishings.

Deptford Park is less than two minutes from the front door, and provides a beautiful green outdoor space with running track, football field, exercise equipment and play area for children. The nearby Surrey Quays Shopping Centre offers a full range of amenities and services, including restaurants, shops, banks, a cinema & bowling alley, and a huge Tesco Extra.

address: Kidbrooke Park Road, Blackheath, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £950,000-£980,000. A stunning and spacious four bedroom semi-detached family home with an outstanding 120ft garden and garage, located close to Blackheath Village, mainline station and the heath and sold chain free.

The property is in excellent decorative order with solid oak flooring, fireplaces, ceiling recessed speakers, halogen lighting, double glazed window, gas fired central heating and partial underfloor heating.

The accommodation briefly comprises; entrance hall with downstairs cloakroom (WC), a 14'11 x 14'6 living room with bay window and feature fireplace with brick surround and a superb 12'5 kitchen diner to the rear. The attractive modern kitchen has wooden worktops, breakfast bar and integrated appliances including wine cooler. Upstairs are four bedrooms including a large 14'7 x 10'6 master with built in wardrobes and a modern family bathroom with jacuzzi bath. To the rear and with side access is, is a huge 120ft garden with large terrace, extensive lawn, mature shrubs, flower beds and storage shed. There is also a garage to the side via a shared driveway and off street parking to the front for several cars.

This is a wonderful family home with excellent potential for further extensions (STPP) and is sold chain free. Your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at .

Kidbrooke Park Road is a popular road and the house is located just 580 metres from the newly rebuilt Kidbrooke Mainline station. Just 17 minutes to London Bridge with trains also running to Charing Cross, Victoria and Cannon Street. There is also easy access to bus routes which will take you to North Greenwich for the Jubilee line. The property is 650 metres from the new and prestigious Kidbrooke Village and 0.71 miles to Blackheath Village (one stop on train) with its array of boutique shops, bars, restaurants and farmers market. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park (with the Charlton Lido, cafe, tennis courts and bmx track within its bounds), Charlton House (gardens, play area and skate park), Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park and nearest of all Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.

The current vendors have provided us with some background and thoughts on there their experience in the property which we feel would be very helpful to any perspective purchaser:

Bought as a couple in 2012 and it was our 2nd house purchase in London. We quickly learned that the area was a special find. Close enough to London bridge, Canary Wharf, Charing Cross but also had Blackheath and Greenwich on the door step.

As a couple the pull of the village with pubs, restaurants and farmers market was always only 20 mins away. As a family Greenwich park was a favourite being only a 25 min walk. The soft play and Sutcliffe centre as well as David Lloyd Gym all a short walking distance was a huge benefit. Shops are also convenient - the garage and shops around the corner (including post office). There is a small Sainsbury's, M&S and most recently B&M and Aldi.

When we purchased the house we were looking for space and that we got! The house has a 120ft Garden and boasts a large cheery tree as well as pear and apple tree along with many mature plants, shrubs and flowers. The patio area was paved in 2016 and quickly became our outdoor dining area over the summer as it captures the sun all day. There is also a cherry blossom tree in the front area and is the key focal point from the master bedroom.

We tried to respect the feel of the house maintaining the front door, internal doors handles and fireplaces. There is a stained glass window on the stairs which brings a huge amount of natural light to the landing. Modern kitchen and bathroom and wood floors throughout. There is a pull down ladder to the attic's and its floored with significant standing room and storage space. There are fireplaces in the living room, dining area, and two larger bedrooms. It is a four bedroom property and we used them as a master, spare, office (for important work from home space) and nursery.

Great neighbours with a mixture of retired and young families and great community spirit. Happy to take deliveries for each other, socialise, each other's security, even putting bins out becomes a shared chore. Great schools in the area. Also small crèche and preschool five doors up the road.

detailedDescription:
This light and airy ground floor flat is located on a much sought-after street on the borders of East Dulwich and Forest Hill.
The flat is beautifully presented throughout and boasts wide-plank solid wood flooring, high ceilings and tasteful décor. There is an open plan living room/kitchen with a large bay window that allows natural light to stream in. The kitchen has a contemporary design with sleek units, wooden worktops, striking tiled backsplash and integrated appliances. The recently refurbished bathroom has a walk-in shower and is fully tiled with white on-trend subway tiles.
If you walk up to the brow of Canonbie Rd you'll see spectacular views of the whole of London skyline. The nearest station is Honor Oak Park (10 minutes' walk) from where there are regular services into London Bridge and Canada Water.
The flat is conveniently located within walking distance of the great amenities of Lordship Lane, Honor Oak Park and Forest Hill including independent shops, cafes, delicatessens, restaurants and supermarkets. The Horniman Museum and Gardens, and Peckham Rye Park are also only a short walk away.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Virtual reality tour and full HD video walk through - like and subscribe to our youtube channel for property updates

Guide price £400,000 to £425,000
The property


Approaching 700 sq ft of living space with two double bedrooms as well as two balconies, the property offers some features rarely found with other flats locally.

The living space is an especially nice area being open plan and effectively laid out. It provides a dedicated living, dining and kitchen area connected to the larger of the two balconies (please refer to full HD video and virtual reality tour to get the best view of the space and layout).

The balcony located off the living area feels like a natural extension of the internal space due to its size (over 4 meters) and position within the property.

The two bedrooms are both doubles which is also of note. Often the second bedroom is smaller than the first. In this instance the property offers one bedroom just over 4 meters and the second bedroom just under 4 meters in length with the master bedroom also providing built in wardrobes and access to its own balcony.

There are many other features buyers can fully appreciate prior to viewing and we encourage all buyers to watch the full HD video walk through and the virtual reality tour.
Transport


Forest Hill station offers services on the East London Line (Orange Line) and Southern Rail. Some of the following travel times available to central London stations include:

London Bridge in approximately 17 minutes.

Canary Wharf in approximately in 23 minutes.

Shoreditch High Street in approximately 22 minutes.

Victoria station in approximately 30 minutes.

Alongside the train links you will find several bus routes on the south circular which include routes 122 and 185 to Crystal Palace and Victoria to name a few (and a night bus route).

Local shopping and dining:

As well as having a Sainsbury’s, Forest Hill is well served with a variety of high-quality independent shops, including a renowned traditional butcher. There are also gastro pubs, a gym, cafés, deli's and restaurants to name but a few of its excellent amenities.

The Sylvan Post, a well-known pub, Canvas and Cream and Stag and Bow all variously host music events, exhibitions, and craft days.

If you ever desire a further choice of drinking and eating establishments, then the vibrancy of Dulwich is a short bus ride away.

Local recreation:

Off the high street in the town centre, you'll find Forest Hill pools and library, both of which have undergone refurbishment. Forest Hill pools is known for its swimming pool facilities but is also a local leisure centre with a gym and fitness classes.

Mayow Park is considered by the owners as a hidden gem of green space locally and has some great facilities such as a bowling green, play area, outdoor gym, water feature, nature reserve, tennis courts, cricket pitch, café, and meadow area.

The Horniman Museum and Gardens is a well-known local point of interest and can be found just beyond the town centre. It is recognized as a popular family entertainment venue and has been featured in "Time Out". With regular events such as a farmer’s market, live music and seasonal festivals, there is always something to enjoy at the Horniman.

You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens here:



Blythe Hill Fields is also located in the local area and offers recreational facilities such as the "Trim trails" which is an exercise trail. It also hosts local events where the residents of SE23 get to know each other better and enjoy the community spirit. You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:

Schools


There are several schools in proximity of the property which are rated highly by ofsted as well as some independent schools which include Rose Mount Montessori and the highly acclaimed St Dunstan’s College.

To name a few of the other schools locally:

Kilmorie Primary - ofsted rated "Outstanding"

Perry Mount Primary - ofsted rated "Good"

Stillness infant and junior school - ofsted rated "Outstanding" and "Good"

Rathfern Primary - ofsted rated "Outstanding"

Holy Cross Primary - ofsted rated "Outstanding"

Rushey Green Primary - ofsted rated "Good" and in ofsted's top 10%

Dalmain Primary - ofsted rated "Good"

Please call Hunters on to arrange a viewing.

detailedDescription:
A spectacular four double bedroom, four bathroom, four storey modern home with direct access to a double garage and set within the prestigious Blackheath quarter development opposite David Lloyd and very close to Kidbrooke Station.

This stunning house has under floor heating, double glazing, led lighting, feature glazed landings, solid wood doors and solid oak flooring. On the ground floor the impressive entrance hall opens onto a huge luxury fitted kitchen/dining room/family room, a utility room, downstairs cloakroom, and large storage cupboards. On the first floor there is a large living room with a south facing balcony, a large double bedroom with direct access to the rear terrace and a large modern bathroom. The second floor provides two further large double bedrooms, both with ensuite and the master having extensive built in wardrobes and south facing balcony. On the top floor there is a sunroom opening out onto a wonderful south facing roof terrace and a fourth double bedroom with ensuite shower room. There is a courtyard patio garden on the ground floor with direct access to a double garage and stairs up to a large rear terrace on the first floor. In the block opposite there is a 24 hour concierge, a gym, swimming pool and cinema room. There are beautifully landscaped gardens and ponds with local shops and Sutcliffe Park nearby.

This is an outstanding home and your immediate viewing is a must. There is no chain. Video tours can be seen at .

Tizzard Grove is part of the exclusive Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village - a new and vibrant London community which offers an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as high end apartments and houses, it will offer new parks, shops, bars, restaurants, schools, sports, healthcare and community facilities. Within 200 yards is a Sainsbury's local, a newly opened restaurant, pharmacy, convenience store and coffee shop. Sutcliffe Park with beautifully landscaped wetlands, sports facilities and ponds is just a few hundred yards away as is the new Cator park which has been created as part of Kidbrooke Village, including a large children's adventure play area and a multi-use games area. Blackheath Village, with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, is also close by.
Transport links to central London are excellent with travel to London Bridge in just 15 minutes from nearby rebuilt Kidbrooke station. Direct trains to Victoria, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Cannon Street also run from here.

address: Cleveley Court, Marine Wharf, Surrey Quays, London SE16
detailedDescription:
Looking for a dual-aspect balcony apartment in an exciting new high-spec development – just minutes from the river on a peaceful private road?

This immaculate one-bedroom with south-facing floor-to-ceiling windows comes with a spacious, west-facing balcony, all-new fixtures and appliances – and access to a landscaped courtyard garden.

As you step through onto the timber effect flooring of the well-presented hallway, you'll find an extra-large storage area to your left, neatly hidden away behind closing doors.

Ahead, you'll come to the bright and spacious bedroom, complete with a full-height fitted wardrobe and a south-facing floor-to-ceiling window for maximum natural light.

As you explore further down the hallway, you'll find the modern bathroom on your right, with a heated towel rack, a single-ended bath, a bespoke vanity unit below mirrored cabinets – and a raised 'wet room' shower area with a frameless glass enclosure.

Past the bathroom and bedroom, the apartment opens out into a spacious dual-aspect open-plan living area, with a double-paned floor-to-ceiling window facing to the south.

On your right, you'll find a contemporary kitchen designed especially for your individual home, finished with composite stone worktops and equipped with a full set of Bosch appliances (including a touch-control ceramic hob, a stainless steel combination oven, an integrated fridge-freezer, and a multi-function dishwasher).

Next to the kitchen area, you'll see the abundant natural light from the floor-to-ceiling sliding glass door to your own extra-large west-facing private balcony overlooking the quiet and peaceful private road below – with a wooden-decked floor and a mix of brick and natural wood on the walls.

Beyond the apartment itself, you'll be a member of Marine Wharf, an exciting new development created by Berkeley Homes – with a 24-hour concierge and a landscaped communal gardens to explore.

This immaculate one-bedroom lies in the heart of the rapidly growing Surrey Quays area. It's just a 3-minute journey on the Tube to Canary Wharf, and 10 minutes to Westminster. And with the Thames Clippers service stopping at the nearby Greenland Surrey Quays Pier, you'll be able to travel the city in style on the water – all the way from Woolwich to Putney.

Cleveley Court is perfectly placed as a tranquil environment with all the conveniences of a modern development – while still being within easy reach of the river and the city.

And that means an apartment like this won't last for long.

So if you're looking for a high-spec one-bed on a private road – with a spacious balcony and a bright dual-aspect – give us a call and we'll show you around.

address: Taymount Grange, Taymount Rise, London SE23
detailedDescription:
Guide price £350,000 - £375,000.

A charming one double bedroom apartment for sale in Taymount Grange, the immaculately maintained 1930s art deco mansion block designed by architect George Bertram Carter.

This beautiful apartment comprises a spacious reception room, separate fitted kitchen, modern bathroom suite with original 1930s enamel tiling and one double bedroom. Further benefits of the block include a telephone entry system, secure bike storage area, live-in caretaker, an immaculately kept communal garden with allotments for residents, a built-in brick barbecue and so much more. The property is flooded with natural light and enjoys wonderful views across Southeast London and Kent from the original 1930s Crittall windows.

Situated at the end of a quiet leafy cul-de-sac, the property is located approximately 0.4 miles from Forest Hill station offering excellent transport links into London Bridge, Victoria, Canada Water, Shoreditch, Whitechapel, Highbury & Islington and many other locations. It is also just a short walk to various local amenities including a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, cafes and gastro pubs and the wonderful Horniman Museum & Gardens. Offered chain free. EPC: C.

Viewings are highly recommended, call the Pedder Forest Hill sales team to arrange a viewing today.

Located within easy walking distance of Hither Green train station, no onward chain!
Location

While it's easy to hop on the train or DLR at Lewisham station to explore the rest of London, there's plenty in the town itself. There's an indoor shopping centre and a daily street market, a surprising amount of green space and restaurants serving world cuisine.
Families can choose from a wide selection of state primary and secondary schools, as well as some respected independent options. Blackheath is Lewisham's close neighbour, with fine dining, boutique shops and bustling bars.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Quietly situated at the very end of Blackheath Park a rare, one of just nineteen, Eric Lyons T2AX design houses, built by 'Span' in 1967. It has full double glazing and gas fired central heating.

The brilliance of this design, which is one of the largest of the three bedroom/two storey 'Span' houses at almost 1000sq ft, is the versatile ground floor accommodation with an extra room, (an ideal home office) and downstairs cloakroom that project into the courtyard front garden. This is in itself a very pleasing feature of this design, being enclosed & south-facing and into which floor-to-ceiling windows of the reception room look. At the other end of this through room, windows and a glazed door open onto the garden at the rear, which is brick paved and has a door to the single garage.

Park End is the furthest point of Blackheath Park, a pleasant 10 minute walk to Blackheath station and slightly closer to the Heath via Morden Road.

The Accommodation Comprises:
Entrance Hall ● Cloakroom ● Study/Bedroom 4 ●Through Reception Room ● Kitchen ● Three Bedrooms ● Bathroom ● Enclosed Front & Rear Gardens ● Single Garage ● Double Glazed Windows ● Central Heating ● No Chain

This newly refurbished, 2 single bedroom apartment with off-street parking and garden is a gem of a find.

You have 2 bedrooms with a master that also accesses the garden directly, your bathroom is spacious, modern and fitted.

Carholme Road runs off Stanstead Road (the A205) Trains options are at Forest Hill, Catford Bridge or Catford for fast and frequent services to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Victoria and the Overground (change at Canada Water for the Jubilee Line. title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
We are excited to present to the market this great opportunity to acquire this spacious 3 bed end of terraced house located on this quiet residential street in Lewisham. With Catford, Catford Bridge and Ladywell train stations all within walking distance, this makes this property the ideal location for work and play.

The property consists of 3 sizeable bedrooms, family bathroom and shower room. Generous sized open living/ dinning room, great for entertaining friends and family. The kitchen is equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, gas hob, fridge/freezer, and countertop space for kitchen appliances.

A benefit to the property is the off-street parking driveway, the property is walking distance from several stations and also a few bus stops away from Lewisham station and Lewisham DLR, a 10 minute train from London Bridge. Also walking distance from Ladywell Park, Lewisham Shopping Centre, Catford Centre and many convenient restaurants and bars.
