title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Offering over 700 sq. Ft of living space, a private garden and its own front door, this light-filled, 2-double bedroom split-level maisonette has the feel of a house.
The flat has a warm and homely feel, boasting wooden flooring, double glazing, plenty of storage and tasteful décor throughout. Part of a low-rise apartment block with a secure entry phone system, the property features a bright reception room and a stylish kitchen with integrated appliances on the ground floor and 2 double bedrooms and a family bathroom on the top floor. Accessed from the front door, the garden extends to around 30 ft.
Located next to Fairlawn Primary School, rated as 'Outstanding', the property is a short walk from both Honor Oak Park and Forest Hill stations. Both are on the same line with national rail services into London Bridge. In addition, the Overground takes you to north and east London, meaning a commute to Canary Wharf will take around 30 minutes.
As for evening entertainment, there are several restaurants and gastro pubs in both Honor Oak Park and Forest Hill, including a hip sourdough pizzeria (Mamma Dough), a family-run Italian (Le Querce), an award-winning Indian (Babur), the popular Dartmouth Arms and the Sylvan Post pubs. There are also a number of coffee shops as well as a butcher's and a deli. For groceries, there is a Sainbury's Local in Honor Oak and a bigger Sainsbury's in Forest Hill.
There are plenty of open green spaces in the area, the nearest being the delightful Horniman Museum and Gardens with Peckham Rye Park further afield.

detailedDescription:
"I was immediately impressed by the light and tranquillity of the apartment and its quiet location in a grand Georgian building by the Thames Path, across the river from Canary Wharf."

What The Seller Says -

The communal gardens offer a relaxing space during the warmer months and it’s lovely to wake up to birdsong.

I like having the Thames Path at my door, great for traffic free walking, jogging and cycling by the river, or lively Greenwich, Deptford market and Deptford Park all nearby.

It is a fascinating area to explore and always something new to discover."

What The Agent Says -

Entering into a hall area, the interior comprises a kitchen with integrated appliances and breakfast bar in front of a large sash window with side view to the river.

Folding doors from the kitchen open onto a good size living room with window looking out onto the private communal gardens.

The double bedroom includes a fitted wardrobe and views to the garden, and the modern bathroom is tiled with shower over the bath. Other features include a Secure Entry Phone System and recently overhauled and updated Fire Safety.

In addition, residents have sole access to the large communal gardens and enjoy free off-street parking.

The area is served by a range of travel options, including Deptford Train Station, Surrey Quays Overground and Canada Water Jubilee Line Tube Station a short bus ride away or riverside walk.

Greenland Pier for the Thames riverboat is under ten minutes walk with first stop to Canary Wharf and then onwards to Westminster and the Embankment.

The flat is offered for sale free of onward chain and with a newly extended lease of 176 years.<br /><br />

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
***Guide Price £785,000 - £825,000*** "We have loved living in our family home over the past 20 years and will be sad to leave."

What The Seller Says -

"Moving into the area with a young family we were attracted to the house for so many reasons – a good sized property for a growing family with its location in a desirable popular no through road in a conservation area, and a wide selection of primary and secondary schools.

We enjoy the best of both worlds, a cosmopolitan Lewisham with its shopping centre and daily outdoor market on our doorstep, and the green spaces of Blackheath and Greenwich Park.

Pubs and quality restaurants are no more than a short walk away.

If you want to go further afield (Canary Wharf, the City and West End) Lewisham (Zone 2) main line station, DLR and numerous bus routes are within easy distance.

Being an end of terrace house, it has a larger than average garden for this style of property which benefits from dual access, from the rear of the house and the adjacent road.

We are lucky to have a lovely sunny south facing garden with a large patio space which is like having an extra room. A great facility to use for entertaining and a real sun trap to enjoy summer BBQ's, as well as being a comfortable place to chill out.

The house benefits from the valuable provision of a spacious attached garage together with off street parking. We have been very thankful over the years for this rare bonus as it really makes a difference to have a guaranteed parking space outside your front door!

In conclusion this is a lovely family home with loads to offer."

What The Agent Says -

The house itself briefly comprises three good size bedrooms and upstairs bathroom, with shower over bath.

Downstairs you will find a large reception room to front with beautiful bay window, further reception room to rear and a large kitchen diner, offering direct access to the garden.

The house also benefits from having a loft and is located on one of the more prestigious streets, which most consider to be the Blackheath end of Lewisham.

Lewisham High Street, its shopping centre, market and mainline/DLR stations are all within a very short walking distance.

B&C Properties are pleased to offer this fantastic one-bedroom, one-bathroom modern apartment. Situated within the highly sought after Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village with concierge, gym and swimming pool. Easy access to Blackheath Village and Kidbrooke station.

Wallace Court is located in the prestigious Blackheath Quarter of the modern Kidbrooke Village - an award winning Berkeley Homes development. This is a completely new and vibrant London community offering an outstanding choice of quality and sustainable new homes.

Located on the first floor, the accommodation comprises of an open plan lounge diner with an attractive modern kitchen with integrated appliances, a private terrace, double bedroom with built in wardrobes and and a luxury modern bathroom. The resident only podium garden is just outside the apartment and gives it a feel of having an exclusive beautiful manicured garden at the door step.

The property also has the benefit of access to an on-site concierge service, gym, swimming pool, Cinema room and a business centre.

Transport links to central London are very close via Kidbrooke station with regular trains to London Bridge (15 minutes), Waterloo East (20 minutes), Charing Cross (22 minutes), Cannon Street (20 minutes) and Victoria (28 minutes). Blackheath Village with its open green spaces offers an array of boutiques, daily conveniences, bars and restaurants and is only moments away.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £900,000-£965,000. With an outstanding 125ft L-shaped garden spanning in excess of 3,500sq.ft, is this superb and extended three bedroom semi-detached period home with off street parking and set within the Lee Conservation Area backing onto Manor House Gardens.

The property is in very good decorative order with period features and fireplaces, high ceilings, cornicing, wood flooring, gas fired central heating, wood burner, sash windows and plantation shutters.

The accommodation comprises; entrance hall with understairs storage, a bright and airy reception room with bay window and interconnecting doors to a huge and impressive kitchen diner with large dining room leading into a stunning kitchen which has been created into the extension with island, range style oven, integrated appliances, skylights and bi-folding doors to the garden. Upstairs are three bedrooms including two doubles and a large single, and a large modern family bathroom. To the rear of the property is a fantastic L-shape garden with a total length of 125ft and covering an area over 3,500 sq.ft. To our knowledge its one of the largest gardens within the conservations area. There is a summerhouse, extensive lawn, terrace, flower beds, mature shrubs and side access via a lean-to storage that runs the full depth of the house. To the front is off street parking for three cars.

This is a great period home set in this outstanding conservation area location with easy access into Manor House Gardens and is between four Ofsted Outstanding rated primary schools including Brindishe as well as being close to both Lee and Hither Green stations. Blackheath Village with its array of boutiques, bars and restaurants is also close by.

The property is sold chain free and immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at .

detailedDescription:

The property is in excellent decorative order with double glazed sash windows, plantation shutters, wood flooring and gas fired central heating. The accommodation, which arranged over the upper two floors, (first and second) with a private entrance on the ground floor, comprises; entrance hall, a spacious 16'6 reception room and a very attractive modern kitchen breakfast room. Upstairs are two double bedrooms both with built in wardrobes and including a very large master and a stunning modern bathroom with underfloor heating. The property further benefits from a newly extended lease (circa 177 years).

This is a lovely home perfect for a working professional, young family or buy to let investment and your earliest viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at .

Paragon Place is a highly sought after and outstanding location in the heart of Blackheath Village with its array of boutique shops, restaurants and bars and is yards from Blackheath Station. Blackheath Station gives access to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria amongst others. Close by are several sought-after schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School, the Pointer School and John Ball. Greenwich Park and the open heath are a short walk away.

detailedDescription:
A superb and extended four/five bedroom, two bathroom, semi-detached period home with a stunning modern kitchen diner and tiered south facing garden set in this popular location close to Maze Hill Station, Greenwich Park and Greenwich town centre.

The property is in excellent decorative order with original features, high ceilings, sash windows, wood flooring, period fireplaces and gas central heating.

The accommodation is arranged over four floors (inc cellar) and comprises; to the ground floor, a very large and beautiful open plan family space with lounge and dining areas, a utility room, WC and access to the cellar. To the rear, and built into the extension, is a stunning modern kitchen with large island, range style oven, built in breakfast/dining table, slate tiled floor, vaulted ceiling with skylight and electric blinds and bi-folding doors to the terrace beyond. Up to the first floor, there are three bedrooms including a large double to the front, and two further doubles with a modern family bathroom. There is also a study which could serve as a fifth bedroom. The loft has been converted to provide a large double bedroom with ensuite shower room and plenty of eaves storage. To the rear is a landscaped south facing garden which extends to approx. 30ft arranged over three tiers.

This is a wonderful family home and your immediate viewing is strongly advised. Video tours can be seen at

An outstanding location to take advantage of local amenities in almost all directions. Walking south east, just 0.92 miles, you will arrive in Blackheath village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. 0.57 miles to the west you will find the historic Greenwich town centre, University of Greenwich, National Maritime Museum and Royal Greenwich Park is just 475 metres away. 0.61 miles to the southeast is Blackheath Standard, with daily conveniences including M&S Food Hall as well as many shops and restaurants. Turning north down Vanbrugh Hill you will reach Woolwich Road where you will find Greenwich Square Library and Leisure Centre which has a swimming pool. There is also range of Artisan coffee shops and bakeries as well as a Co-op, Sainsbury's and Tesco local. Other amenities such as the Cinema, Ikea and other large stores can be found at Greenwich Peninsula which is a 4 minutes' drive. Maze Hill Station are all just a short walk. With the DLR within easy reach from Greenwich along with the river boat and Jubilee Line at North Greenwich is just 1.23 miles away.

detailedDescription:
This immaculate, 2 bedroom, 2nd floor apartment has been lovingly renovated by the current owners with great attention to detail, and would make an ideal starter home.
You'll find herringbone wood-style flooring, on-trend decor and high spec fixtures and fittings so all you need do is move your furniture in. The building itself benefits from a secure entry phone system, allocated parking to the building on a first come - first serve basis and communal gardens at the rear. The apartment comprises a 24ft open-plan living room/kitchen area - a great space for entertaining family and friends. There are patio doors that open out to a Juliet balcony overlooking the garden at the back. The uber-stylish, two-tone kitchen provides ample storage and comes with integrated appliances. There are two bedrooms; 1 double and 1 single and the beautiful bathroom has been carefully designed to maximize the available space.
Montem Rd is situated within easy reach of 4 stations meaning transport links into town could hardly be easier: Honor Oak Park, Forest Hill, Catford and Catford Bridge stations all provide fast and regular mainline services into central London and the City. In addition, from either Honor Oak Park or Forest Hill, you can pick up the Overground for services to Shoreditch, Canada Water and Highbury and Islington.
You'll find a range of amenities in the centre of Honor Oak Park, Forest Hill and Catford including coffee shops, restaurants, a deli, a butcher's, gastro-pubs and several supermarkets. Restaurants of note in Forest Hill include the Dartmouth Arms and the Sylvan Post (both popular gastro pubs). In Honor Oak Park there is an award-winning Indian (Babur) and a delicious sough dough pizzeria (Mamma Dough). For a post work drink, the Blythe Hill Tavern - which is a camra award winning pub - is nearby.
Green spaces are dotted all around with Blythe Hill Fields just up the road at the top of which are spectacular views of the London skyline. There are a number of highly rated primary schools nearby including Kilmorie and Rathfern.

agency_name: Urban Spaces Loft Living & Unique Properties
detailedDescription:
An exceptional two bedroom, double-aspect apartment in one of South East London’s most sought-after loft developments, Assembly Apartments – a converted Victorian School in sought-after Peckham.

This first floor south facing apartment has been refurbished to a very high standard by the current owners. A new kitchen was installed, vast built-in storage, and mezzanine bedroom was closed off using crittal effect windows providing the space with light and creating a tranquil second bedroom, reducing noise travel from the living areas. The ceiling height measures to almost 4.2 meters in some areas of the apartment with enormous double aspect original sash windows to the living space flooding the apartment with light for most of the day. The kitchen area and a master bedroom, both offer double height ceilings with double windows. The current owners have cleverly installed electric blinds negating the need to climb ladders in order to block all the light coming through whenever necessary. This apartment sits at a further end of the building overlooking the communal gardens and hence is not overlooked by the neighbouring properties.

This apartment is being sold chain free, allocated parking space within this gated development and secure bicycle store area.

Assembly Apartments is located on a quiet tree-lined street, moments from Queens Road Peckham station - meaning excellent rail and London Overground services that provide access into London Bridge, the City and Central London in under 20 minutes apprx. The development also benefits from private outside space in the form of well-maintained communal gardens, located to the rear of the property, as well as gated private parking.

Peckham is now one of the most sought-after areas south of the river, with a vibrant art scene; fantastic green spaces, and an enormous amount of bar/restaurant options, all within walking distance of the property.

A spacious two bed (plus study) first floor apartment in an attractive 1930's landmark mansion block situated on the edge of the Heath, the flat being in the front block affording lovely heath views and located within easy access to Lewisham DLR, Greenwich town centre and Blackheath Village.

Located within walking distance to Blackheath, Lewisham and Greenwich stations offering direct links into central London and the many wonderful amenities this desirable area has to offer. Energy Efficiency Rating C.

detailedDescription:
Benefiting from its own balcony, this charming, 1-bedroom top floor flat is ready to move into and would make an ideal first time buy.
The building is set back from the road and has an entry phone system. Having been built around 7 years ago, it is energy efficient with an EPC rating of B. Inside, the flat has an open plan layout with a living room opening up to a stylish kitchen with high-gloss units, granite work tops, in-built appliances and ample storage units. Solid wood flooring runs throughout. In the hallway is a utility cupboard housing the washing machine. The bedroom is at the back and comes with fitted wardrobes. Patio doors lead out to a private terrace that overlooks a lovely communal garden at the back of which is a secure bike shed.
Forest Hill is a leafy suburb of south east London with a strong artistic vibe. The station is around a 5-minute walk from where there are fast and frequent services into London Bridge as well as Overground services towards Shoreditch and Highbury & Islington.
Café culture is alive and well in the area with places such as Canvas & Cream and St David's. For a post work drink, pop into The Dartmouth Arms or the uber trendy Sylvan Post. And to work off those excess pounds, Forest Hill Pools is nearby.
The area is dotted with green spaces including the delightful Horniman Museum and Gardens, a perfect place to while away a Sunday afternoon.

title: 1 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented top floor conversion flat, set within the highly popular Westcombe Park conservation area. Easy and quick access Canary Wharf for someone seeking a pied-à-terre, and is Chain Free.

"We've lived at 106 Westcombe Park Road, a late Edwardian conversion built in 1920, for (nearly) five very happy years.

The house is extremely well-kept, and we've been lucky that our house neighbours are friendly and warm and care about the house and the people in it. This has been a wonderful first step onto the property ladder for us and we'll cherish our memories for years. Let me tell you why.

Our flat is unique in having a triple aspect living room, which is spectacularly lit on even overcast days, making the space both inviting and cheerful.

One of the charms of the conversion lay in the quirky storage spaces that nestle in the eaves, providing fantastic in-home storage. New double-glazed windows and engineered hardwood flooring were installed in Aug 2016; a new, modern bathroom with electric underfloor heating in Jan 2017; a new, modern kitchen with new appliances (washer/dryer, slimline dishwasher, fridge/freezer) in Feb 2018; a new oven in Nov 2020; and new radiators in Dec 2020.

We also added a foldaway ladder access to the unfinished attic space for further storage. You don't need a car to love and live in this neighbourhood (more on that in a bit), but if you do there's always parking right outside the house. The nearest overland train station going into London Bridge and Cannon Street is down the street – a 7-minute walk.

The Blackheath Royal Standard area has an authentic small village feel, centred on Batley Park, with coffee shops, M&S Simply Food, Boulangerie Jade, the excellent Blackheath Royal Standard pub, a hardware store, an independent café, and many other shops and services. The best thing about the area is that you can't help but come to know the shopkeepers personally.

Saying hello to Kam, Em, Andrew, and others while running errands makes for a truly neighbourhood feel. If you have a pet, or plan to get one, Blackheath Vets at the bottom of the hill will be there for you. Literally just around the corner is Mycenae House, offering a full program of arts, health and sports classes, from bridge and chess clubs, to yoga, opera, wine tasting, dancing, music concerts, and martial arts classes. There are several gyms and Blackheath Squash Club nearby.

There are lot of gorgeous green spaces nearby - Greenwich Park and the wonderful open spaces of Blackheath itself, where you can wonder over to watch the famous fireworks display in November. Blackheath is a pleasant 20-min walk and has some great restaurants, including The Ivy, Gail's Bakery, lovely local delis and shopping like Space nk. You will love it here."<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Contemporary and stylish two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment on the second floor overlooking Ladywell Fields.

Build in 2017, this apartment is a great blend of style and home, which coupled with the balcony and great views over the park, gives you a wonderful place to make your own. The main bedroom is over 16ft long, having an ensuite bathroom with walk in shower. The second double bedroom is over 11ft long, and doubles as a home office.

Both the bedrooms and the reception room overlook the park, plus the reception room leads to the balcony – such a great place to enjoy the sun after work or take in the views any time of day. And when it comes to life inside the apartment, then you can enjoy cooking in the high spec kitchen, dining at the table or relaxing on the sofa.

So, if you are looking for somewhere new to call home, but want somewhere stylish, open plan, two bathrooms, and parkside, then this is the place for you.

The current owners share what they love:
We have loved having the park on our doorstep. It really feels like an extension of our home and is wonderful for walks and a picnic on sunny days, plus our son has loved all the kids play areas.

The entire development has a lovely sense of community. Everyone looks out for each other and there’s a lovely social side to living here. We’re close to both Catford and Catford Bridge zone 3 stations which run excellent services into town. We also enjoy being able to jump in the car and be in the Kent countryside in half an hour. We’re a short walk to the shops and cafes of Ladywell, Brockley, Crofton park, Honor Oak and Lewisham, we often stroll out for dinner or drinks.

The apartment has been the perfect home for us for the last few years. Light and spacious, yet comfortable and easy to maintain. And with the park outside it feels like a peaceful oasis from our busy London lives.

Lease: 151 years remaining

Ladywell Station 900m (walking through the park) trains as above

This well-proportioned property comprises spacious open plan reception room with modern fitted kitchen, large double bedroom and contemporary bathroom with benefits to include ample storage, private balcony and access to local amenities and transport links.
Adenmore Road is a desirable cul de sac development set within easy reach of both Catford and Ladywell which combined offer a plethora of bars, shops, restaurants as well transport links providing easy access to the city and surrounding areas.
Local greenery can be found at Ladywell Fields and Mountsfield Park, located moments away from the property and hosts some amazing events that include the famous "Peoples Day", South East Londons longest-running free festival that celebrates music, art, craft and community.

It is usually a 9 minute journey time from Ladywell Station to London Bridge Station.

address: Merlin Court, 28 Hadley Drive, London SE3
detailedDescription:
“An exceptionally well-finished two bed apartment, located within the highly acclaimed Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village. The apartment benefits from a wraparound private terrace and modern move-in appeal.”
Accommodation includes an entrance hallway with wooden floors, ample storage and a utility closet leading through to a generous reception room and open plan modern kitchen. The open plan reception is fitted with a modern kitchen, fully integrated with oven, hob, fridge/freezer and extractor. The reception is abundant in light from the five floor-to-ceiling windows; one of which is also a door leading to a large wrap-around terrace with a great outside dining space and entertaining area all semi-partitioned from the grass area in-front.

Being East and North facing this apartment feels bright, spacious and airy yet not too hot or cold with good circulation of air. Continuing through the accommodation there are two double bedrooms off the hallway. The main bedroom is a generous carpeted double-bedroom with ample space for a multitude of furniture. Another double-bedroom from the hallway has ample storage, large window and easily accommodates a King-sized double-bed also. Following on from the hallway, there is the main bathroom fully appointed with a bathtub and shower over bath, all modern and generously proportioned.

Positioned over the ground floor of this development, occupying approximately 798sqft internally no space has been wasted with an excellent flowing floorplan. This is an ideal home for a new family or couple who appreciates a safe and quiet location with ample greenery and excellent modern design. Residents are well positioned for the local amenities and excellent transport links. A 5-minute walk from Kidbrooke Station (Rail) providing quick and easy access to London Bridge, the City (Cannon St.), the West End (Victoria Station) and beyond. Peglar Square includes a Sainsburys and places to eat, drink and shop and further leisure facilities.

The Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village features world-class amenities including the 24hr concierge, full gym facilities, a heated swimming pool, private cinema and business centre. A short walk away is Blackheath with excellent restaurants, independent shops and wine-bars plus the heath itself which is ideal for exercise or relaxing and picnicking in the summer. Linked from Blackheath is Greenwich featuring a Royal Park with deer enclosure, incredible Naval history and wonderful views along the Thames.

Long-Leasehold 125yrs from Sept, 2016

detailedDescription:
Extremely well presented one double bedroom, one bathroom apartment situated in the highly sought after Greenland Place development. Ideally located within walking distance to Canada Water Tube Station (Jubilee Line, Zone 2), this stylish, contemporary apartment is bound to impress with its generously sized living space and private balcony - not to mention additional 'development benefits', including 24 hour concierge and a well-equipped resident-only fitness suite.

Designed by rma Architects, Greenland Place is a collection of stylish, contemporary homes set within attractive landscaped surroundings and has been orchestrated as a series of quaint mews, green courtyards and floral squares to include two commanding towers.

Located in Zone 2, and more specifically an area undergoing major regeneration, the excellent transport links and proximity to the City means it is the ideal location to start your commute. Canada Water Tube Station (Jubilee Line & London Overground, Zone 2) is just a scenic walk along Greenland Dock away, and from there you are just two minutes to Canary Wharf, three minutes to London Bridge, nine minutes to Shoreditch and 10 minutes to Bank. Surrey Quays Station can be reached for the Overground line, or if you fancy travelling by boat, Greenland Pier is also within close proximity and only one stop away from Canary Wharf. You are also surrounded by a variety of supermarkets including a Tesco Express and Co Op local located within the development itself. There are also a couple of restaurants - with a very popular Italian-styled pizzeria and café also just on the doorstep of the development.

The well-proportioned open plan living, kitchen and dining area is beaming with natural light and leads out onto a private balcony. The kitchen itself is finished to the highest standard and incorporates state-of-the-art integrated appliances as you would expect from such a contemporary development, as well as extra cupboards for storage. The master bedroom is generously sized, with a timeless neutral design and a stylish inbuilt wardrobe boasting plenty of space.

The apartment itself benefits from underfloor heating. A 24 hour concierge service on hand for help with day-to-day tasks such as receiving parcels, while a resident only fitness suite on the doorstep means you won't have to travel far to keep in shape.

This stunning apartment has to be at the top of your viewing list!

For more information and to book a viewing please contact Living in London Canada Water Sales Team

There is nothing not to like in this Victorian masterpiece, it has a cosy feel throughout, with benefits of gas central heating, double glazing, garage and off-street parking and the retention of many period features.

If space is your issue, then your problem has just been solved, situated within prime location of Catford this chain free property is great for any family or growing family. The ground floor offers a separate lounge and dining rooms, a fitted kitchen, a utility room with vast storage and a conservatory. It is easy to flow from one room to the other making it an ideal entertaining house.

The first floor has three bedrooms and a luxury fully fitted bathroom. The top floor offers dual use as it has two separate rooms and a shower room. This space would be ideal for an independent teenager, nanny, work from home area, or even a lodger. The two rooms could easily be knocked together to create a bigger room.

The rear garden is paved and offers low maintenance and it can be used from day through to night. It has a separate secured gazebo which the current owners use for their barbecues and ample space for tables and chairs.

This property is well maintained by the present owners.

detailedDescription:
A well-presented second floor purpose built flat within this popular riverside development.

Offering two bedrooms, good size living/dining room, modern bathroom and fitted kitchen with integrated appliances this represents an ideal first time purchase or buy to let investment.

Ideally located the apartment is just a short walk over the bridge at the creek passing Waitrose on the way through to central Greenwich with its array of restaurants and craft markets. Access to the DLR at the Cutty Sark is also here providing swift access to Canary Wharf.

Further benefits include, entry phone security system, double glazed windows throughout, long lease and ample ad hoc off street parking.

Early viewings highly recommended by the owners sole agents.

What The Sellers Say -

"When we first moved to Greenwich we thought we would only stay for a few years but have loved it so much that we have been here for ten - and are reluctantly moving to upsize.

It is a buzzing town that has a bit of everything from its picture perfect Palace and Cutty Sark, to the best panoramic views of London from the top of the Royal Park. As foodies we love to eat street food from Greenwich market, grab a pub meal or stop off at our favourite Bakery, Gail's, in Blackheath.

A home in a friendly area with parking, and in easy reach of coffee and grocery shops was important to us - and the private development of Millennium Quay ticks all of the boxes. Situated on the riverfront, we regularly cycle along the London cycle path to the O2 arena.

Previously we had a long commute for work but having multiple routes that can get us to London Bridge door-to-door within 25 minutes has been fantastic for our work life balance."<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price £1,100,000 - £1,150,000* "A stunning Victorian period house with lovely garden which has been completely renovated over the past five years, complete with a new roof, updated electrics, and a future-proofed, energy efficient heating system. Arranged over three levels, has huge kerb appeal with its beautiful brick facade and is situated within the St Johns conservation area."

What The Agent Says -

The lower ground level is one of the stand out features of this owner occupied home, with its impressive design.

On this level there is a living area - with polished concrete flooring - benefiting from bespoke tall cabinets and shelves, with direct access to a wonderful south east facing garden.

The kitchen has been designed and fitted by Rencraft, has quality integrated appliances including a high-end Bora induction hob with integrated extractor, a double oven and Miele dishwasher, large dining space and fitted storage under the stairs.

There is a shower room on this level and further storage to the front of the house. The whole of the lower ground floor benefits from a stunning polished concrete floor and underfloor heating.

On the upper ground you will find a double bedroom to rear and reception room/study to the front which has a lovely log burner and bespoke fitted cabinets.

Upstairs there two further double bedrooms, one of which is much larger than average and both have fitted wardrobes and the main bathroom is really well presented, offering a shower over bath, fitted rain shower head, utility cupboard for washing machine and tumble dryer and hot water tank. The bathroom benefits from underfloor heating. There is a Velux window.

Further attributes include original wood flooring, loft for storage, double glazed, timber framed sash windows, an internal auto mist sprinkler system for the lower ground floor and solar panels providing free hot water during the summer months.

The property has been future proofed and heating is supplied by an air source heat pump which receives a domestic renewable heat incentive for 7 years, from September 2019. The property is very energy efficient as can be seen from its EPC.

The property is freehold and close by is St Johns mainline station, Brookmill Park, Brockley Market, Deptford Bridge and Elverson Road DLR stations.
Greenwich town centre and it's Royal Park is a brisk walk away, as well as Brockley's Hilly Fields.

What The Seller Says -

“Generally - the transport links overground, network rail, DLR, A2 and A20 all mean you can get anywhere (or get back from anywhere) really quickly. The best I have ever had.

During the pandemic its been great to have Greenwich Park, Blackheath and Hilly Fields to get my dose of green space.

I also love having Brockley market around the corner on a Saturday and Creekside art galleries and Deptford X art festival.

And in the house I love the net zero energy costs! And particularly love my polished concrete floor.”<br /><br />
title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
“I was attracted to the flat by its location close to the town centre, Greenwich Park, Blackheath and transport links.

Its spaciousness and the large amount of light in the main rooms is great and having my own entrance, while still being part of a small ‘community’ with the other flats in Benyamin House.

As a duplex, the flat ‘feels’ like a house and having the bedrooms in the basement means they are very quiet and cooler in the summer. Having both my own outside space and use of the communal roof terrace brings the freedom for both private entertaining and with larger groups the addition of a roof top view.”

What The Agent Says-

Just as the owner has mentioned, this truly charming home has all the features and feels of a house, with its own entrance, split level and private courtyard garden.

Once you enter, you are greeted by a welcoming porch with WC just to the right. The bright and airy living space is found through the next door with double aspect windows allowing the light to flood in. A separate kitchen, boasting the main appliances, can be found off the lounge and there you have the option to open the dividing doors, to make the space greater, if you are hosting.

On the lower level are the two sizeable bedrooms, with main three piece bathroom suite on this floor too. The ensuite shower room can be found next to the main bedroom and the private courtyard garden can be accessed from both bedrooms. The beauty of the property is the space that is has to offer as you have plenty of room if you are working from home.

Locally there are a range of shops including supermarkets, eateries and coffee shops. Deptford Bridge DLR station is just a few minutes away on foot and Greenwich mainline/DLR stations, town centre and park are all within a short walking distance.

An internal viewing of this wonderful home is highly recommended.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:

A spacious and well proportioned, two double bedroom flat occupying the entire top floor of this elegant detached Victorian villa, set back from the road on an extensive gravel driveway. It also has the benefit of owning the vast loft space to the building, which already has one Velux window, and has the potential to extend (STPP).

Being on the top floor, the flat enjoys great light throughout the day and also has beautiful views over Blackheath, stretching to the Shard and Canary Warf. The property has tremendous charm and character with an impressive reception room featuring an 11’ wide bay window and an original Victorian fireplace. The main bedroom is an excellent size with fantastic storage space as it has both a walk-in wardrobe a bank of fitted wardrobes. It also has a well appointed kitchen, good sized second bedroom, a modern bathroom and a separate utility room with a new Vaillant boiler.

The garden and communal areas are well maintained and the management of the building is operated by the residents, who take an active interest in keeping the building in excellent condition. Located on a popular and leafy residential road and well placed within walking distance of both Blackheath Village and Kidbrooke mainline stations and also the shops and facilities of Royal Blackheath Standard.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Classic Victorian Telegraph Hill Conservation Area semi-detached house of 2473 sq ft (excluding vast double loft, ripe for conversion) in an elevated position and set over three floors with two entrances, plus a splendid architect-designed low-maintenance garden with side access.

Walk just five minutes to New Cross Gate Station (one stop to London Bridge), 12 minutes to Brockley Station, and 14 to Nunhead Station. Unrestricted on-street parking.

Occupied, enhanced and enjoyed by the current owners (one an award-winning property journalist) since 1983, clearly this a tough home to leave. If you value a tasteful mix of heritage and relaxed modern design you're onto a winner here.

Entering at raised ground floor level, you open the front door (admiring the lead light detail) into a smart high-ceilinged hall space with swoon-worthy original mosaic floor tiles. Take a right from the hall into your formal double-reception, which runs 26 feet (by over 14 feet). Two working period fireplaces impress in here, plus solid wood floors and capacious custom-made book-shelving.

Beyond the reception rooms, next on the right from the hall is a full and stain glass windowed bathroom, with both bath and independent shower, and under-basin cherry wood storage. As throughout the house, an old school style radiator features.

Beyond is a double bedroom of over 11 feet each way. Twin sash windows deliver garden views.

Entering at lower ground floor level, you’ve got a handy vault/store to your left by the front door. The lower ground front door opens directly into the large kitchen which is over 13 feet each way, and which is fitted out with timeless modern units (by German manufacturer Siematic) and Corian worktops. The dining area (down a step) is open-plan beyond, and is over 16 feet by over 12 feet. Wooden double-doors open into the room, and French doors open out - taking you to the wide side-return area of the garden.

In the hall area of this floor you’ve got loads of useful under stairs storage, and an independent utility room as well. Also on this floor is a glorious bayed garden or reception room of over 20 feet by 12 feet. It could also easily work as a fifth bedroom.

On the first floor at half-landing level you’ve got a double bedroom (of over 13 feet by over 11 feet) and a generous twin-sash-windowed shower room.

From the main landing, to your left is a large double bedroom of 13 feet by over 12 feet. Taking the width of the terrace is the magnificent master bedroom of over 19 feet by over 16 feet - with wall-to-wall bank of Hulsta wardrobes.

Two loft spaces are currently used for storage. There’s glaringly-obvious potential to convert these to one or two more bedrooms with bath or shower rooms, even perhaps a fabulous annexe to maximise the sweeping panoramic views from the top of the house.

Once home to Victorian poet Robert Browning, this leafy hillside neighbourhood was developed in the late C19th, replacing market gardens owned by the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers (who controlled the development) with high-standard housing. As well as the attractive architecture and fancy street lamps, what stands here now is a friendly, leafy community with excellent connections to central London, alongside great schools and parks. Local children attend highly-regarded Edmund Waller Primary and the through-school Haberdashers’ Aske’s (3-18).

Telegraph Hill is a delightful community to call home. Telegraph Hill’s Victorian Parks (Upper and Lower) are great, as is The Hill Station cafe - Dinner for One Hundred is the latest pop-up here (pizza!), There’s a monthly Farmers’ Market held in the Lower Park, or nip down to Brockley Market - held on Saturdays in the Lewisham College Car Park (much more glam than it sounds!).

A large Sainsbury's store sits behind the station, and independent shops and pubs line New Cross Road.

Brockley has some great neighbourhood eateries including The Orchard and Parlez, plus cocktail bar Brickfields and Brockley Brewery. Coffee shops are strong here too and include Good as Gold and Browns of Brockley.

In Nunhead we like Four Hundred Rabbits and El Vermut. The wet fish shop and bakery are also great.

Trendy Deptford High Street is fairly close as well - for great restaurants including Tea House, Marcella, The Tapas Room and The Winemakers Club.

Peckham's Rye Lane and Bellenden Road are also a short walk/bus ride for more options. Close to Queens Road Peckham Station, you've now got Kudu and Peckham Cellars restaurants; both have a Bib Gourmand.

Local schools are extremely well-regarded and include Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham College (covering 3-18), St James's Hatcham Church of England Primary (3-11) and Edmund Waller Primary (3-11). Bebright Bunnies Nursery is also popular for smaller ones, on Kitto Road.
title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

Detailed Description

Deptford Landings, Cedarwood Square ideally located between Pepys Park and The Waterline linear park running through former Timberyard Deptford. An excellent opportunity to acquire this rarely available 2 bedroom, hall floor, Victorian conversion situated on Shooters Hill Road. Conveniently placed within easy access to the Heath, shopping facilities and amenities at either Blackheath Village or Blackheath Standard, making this property the ideal location for work and play.

Modern bathroom, 2 separate spacious bedrooms with sash windows and shutters, a separate kitchen from the bright and airy reception room, high ceilings and it's own entrance with spacious hallway. The property has undergone some modernisation over the years, but still holds onto it’s original Victorian features for added character.

This property offers further benefits as it also includes communal garden for entertaining during the hotter seasons, off-street private parking, share of the freehold. Residents are positioned within a range of excellent transport links; with Westcombe Park and Blackheath rail stations a matter of minutes away, excellent bus links, allowing for a quick and easy journey into Central London and other routes.

detailedDescription: Set within the stunning Kidbrooke Village development this superb modern three bedroom flat offers generous living and entertaining space with a wonderful bright and airy interior and highly coveted views over Sutcliffe Park. This apartment enjoys perhaps the best position in the development with uninterrupted south west facing park views with a high degree of privacy. Offering generous proportions throughout, master bedroom with en-suite and fitted storage, two further double bedrooms with ample fitted storage, a separate utility room and closet in the hallway and high ceilings this apartment can be set up as an excellent family flat or let as a rental investment to sharers. Kidbrooke Village offers excellent connections into London with Charing Cross only 26 minutes away by train. You can enjoy a new retail experience at The Village Centre, escape along the tree-lined paths of Cator Park and emerge ready to explore the rest of London, with easy connections to the districts of Eltham, Blackheath, Greenwich and London Bridge. With two primary schools on site and a handful of others a short distance away, there is also a wealth of amenities to be found right beside Kidbrooke Station.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
A fabulous three bedroom terraced family house in Brockley SE4. The property has 3 bedrooms, a living room, a dining room, a bathroom and separate upstairs and downstairs WC along with a modern kitchen that leads out to a large private garden and has a lovely feeling of light and space.Currently rented out on a statutory periodic AST tenancy.

The house has a good sized living room which is bright and airy with large windows looking out to the garden. At the front of the house is a large double room currently used as the third bedroom but which could also be used as a separate dining room. The kitchen is well appointed with a stainless steel oven and hob as well as a washing machine and fridge freezer. The pretty garden has a patio with large table and chairs, lawn and borders with mature shrubs and plants that have been well cared for. Upstairs there are two further spacious double bedrooms as well as a single room currently used as a study.All have neutral decor and carpets. The bathroom has a shower over the bath and is fully tiled and there is a separate WC.

Situated in a popular residential tree-lined street transport links are excellent with Brockley Station only a short walk away giving you direct links to New Cross and London Bridge or West Croydon; Nunhead Station is also close by with frequent trains to Victoria or Blackfriars. St Johns Station is also accessible with good links to London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross. The property is near to Goldsmiths College and via bus to East Dulwich, Peckham, or Lewisham from the corner. There is plenty of free on street parking.

The house is close to many local parks; Hilly Fields, Telegraph Hill (with great tennis courts) and Peckham Rye. It is also near to historic Nunhead Cemetery, one of London's hidden treasures (part of which is now a nature reserve), popular with artists, and photographers alike. Brockley has an increasing number of interesting cafés and delis near the station and the property is also within the school zone of highly desired Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham College and many primary schools. This is an ideal family home on a quiet residential street.

Total Council Tax Band: C = £1,549.88 (sole occupancy reduction available).
London Borough of Lewisham.

EPC rating: D.

detailedDescription:

An incredibly sought after third floor three bedroom apartment with allocated parking. Benefiting with space throughout and Juliet balcony as well as lift access, this gorgeous apartment would be ideal for any buyers looking for a ‘move in & feet up’ purchase. Immaculately maintained, it would be perfect as a buy-to-let investment or for a couple/city worker looking to take advantage of the various local conveniences & speedy commute.

The spacious layout of the apartment has been well planned and all rooms come off a spacious hallway. The lounge/dining room has wall to ceiling windows and a full width Juliet balcony. There are two double bedrooms, the third is a generous single sized room all with pleasant views and a fantastic family sized bathroom.

Internally the habitable rooms are extremely generous and all come off a long entrance hall. Two of the three bedrooms are doubles, the third perfect for a single bedroom or alternatively office space, opposite you will find the bathroom suite which is well proportioned, the modern kitchen is extremely well maintained and opens onto the lounge which is larger than the average with a broad Juliet balcony to the side of the building.

Other benefits include gas central heating, double-glazing throughout, allocated parking & ample storage.

On Burnt Ash Lane itself, the property is well served for amenities, boasts numerous buses, good local schools, is only 0.8 of a mile from the highly convenient Zone 4 Grove Park station, just 0.2 of a mile from Kings Meadows Playing Fields and the excellent parade of independent local business’ – including an excellent family butchers and various convenience stores. Grove Park Railway station is one of the most versatile this side of the borough, with direct links into London Bridge, Charing Cross, Waterloo East & Cannon Street in as little as 14 minutes. Experienced golfers or enthusiastic beginners will be pleased to know you’d also be moments from the luxury Sundridge Park Golf Club boasting over 110 years history and two first class championship courses.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Part of the modern and much sought-after Catford Green development, this fantastic, 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom, 4th floor apartment comes with its own south facing private balcony and also with allocated private parking, which is a really great added bonus. There may be also a possibility of a sale with no chain (to be confirmed).

Catford Green is a collection of stylish flats backing onto the open spaces of Ladywell Fields, equidistant from the centres of both Catford and Ladywell. Boasting high spec fixtures and integrated appliances in the kitchen, the flat offers all the benefits of modern living in a great location for connections into town.

It comprises a light-filled reception room which opens out to a sleek, high-gloss kitchen with integrated appliances, including oven & hob. There are 2 double bedrooms, there is a stylish family bathroom and another separate shower room. The property also offers ample storage space with 3 storage cupboards (one of which doubles as a utility cupboard) and two fitted wardrobes. The open private balcony is off the reception room, provides amazing views to the south, and is a perfect place for a Sunday morning coffee.

The development is flanked by 2 stations meaning that London's major stations are all easily accessible including 12 minutes to London Bridge, 17 minutes to the City and 20 minutes to Charing Cross. Denmark Hill and Blackfriars are also easily reachable via Catford br station. Lewisham DLR is just one or two stops away for services to Canary Wharf. There are also a number of bus routes to choose from, as well.

A range of amenities can be found in the centres of Catford and Ladywell including independent coffee shops, restaurants and local retailers. There is also the Catford Broadway theatre, offering shows throughout the year.

The development is located just next to the wonderful Ladywell Fields, an urban park, with the Ravensbourne River running through the centre and Ladywell Village at the other end.

address: Manor Park Parade, Lewisham, London SE13
detailedDescription:
**** guide price £270,000-£290,000 ****
Find this hidden treasure tucked quietly to the rear of the hustle and bustle of Lee High Road. This stunning one bedroom garden flat has the 'Narnia effect' as you step through the front door you feel you have arrived into a different world!

Manor Park Parade is a small parade of shops, on Lee High Road itself, that have apartments sitting behind them. This makes your home brilliantly located as you have a plethora of amenities literally on your doorstep. You may think that your home will be noisy but once through the your home it is surprisingly peaceful. Once through the door the communal areas are smart and tidy, a couple of steps up and you have arrived. Step inside to the entrance hallway, with wood floors underfoot, the hallway has a good storage cupboard and a cubbie for the washing machine. The bedroom has been cleverly built out with floor to ceiling wardrobes that optimise the space, a large double glazed window looks out to your private garden. Follow the hall along and up a couple of stairs and here we find the shower room. The shower room is high spec with double walk in shower, and posh fittings, there is also a small window out to the side. Carry on through the hall passing the built in shelves and bookcase. Prepare to have your socks knocked off, the heart of your new home is the open plan kitchen dining and living area. The kitchen is newly fitted in modern hues and wood block tops, allow a space for a two seater table and chairs. The living area is at the far end of the room which is light and bright thanks to the large bay window with glazed door that opens to your private garden space. Out here you have untapped potential to turn this space into your very own patch of heaven!

Transport is easy here with the 122,178,261,273,321,621 & N21 all servicing the immediate area, or a short walk to Lewisham Station and DLR. Shops are plentiful and the open air market is fab for fresh produce. Blackheath Village is a lovely afternoon out too.

This apartment is perfectly located for quick and easy access to The City, Canary Wharf, Stratford and Greenwich, with Canada Water underground (Jubilee Line) and Surrey Quays overground stations. London Bridge is within 25 minutes journey time and Liverpool Street within 40 minutes. Thames Clipper services operate from Greenland Dock which is also within easy walking distance. The area is well serviced by a number of bus routes with stops within a minute's walk. Further afield, you are within 1.5 hours of Gatwick, Heathrow and Stansted airports.

Local amenities, including two local supermarkets, a couple of highly rated Bistros, fitness studios and beauty salons, and a local children's nursery are all within a few minutes walk as are the local gp and pharmacy.

The nearby Mast Leisure Complex includes cinemas, restaurants and bars.

The buyer will require a deposit to obtain a mortgage for this property.

To meet the requirements for this property we require as a guideline, a minimum household income of £50,536. If you are offered the property, your ability to afford this property will be assessed at your financial interview. Please note that applicants should purchase the maximum share that they can afford and sustain.

Only applicants who are registered with London and Quadrant will be eligible to be offered a property in one of our schemes. If you are not registered please visit our website and register to obtain your unique reference number.

Your home is at risk if you fail to keep up repayments on a mortgage, rent or other loan secured on it. Please make sure you can afford the repayments before you take out a mortgage.

These particulars are of opinion only, are intended to give a fair description and do not form the basis of a contract. The descriptions and all other information are believed to be correct as at April 2021.

detailedDescription:
A chance to acquire a stunning two bed within this modern development, Marine Wharf. This fantastic scheme includes a high-end specification, 24-hour concierge, residents only gym facilities, secure bicycle storage, a cafe and supermarket.

The apartment, laid out over 750 square foot, offers a bright and airy open plan reception that includes a high specification kitchen with fully integrated appliances. Both bedrooms are good in their size and the bathroom displays a contemporary finish.

Marine Wharf is conveniently located only a short walk from Surrey Quays station, which services the underground at Canada Water station, DLR at Shadwell and the soon to arrive cross rail at Whitechapel. You'll also find the Thames Clipper Service conveniently a short walk from the property as alternative travel method, reaching Canary Wharf in 4 minutes and Tower Millenium Pier in 12 minutes.

The immediate surrounding area provides a host of local amenities on your, with a huge £3.3bn regeneration project known as "The Canada Water masterplan" also meaning a bright future for this already sought after location.

Viewings come highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to present to the market this immaculate two-bedroom apartment, located on the third floor of this highly acclaimed Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village.

The apartment is in superb conditions throughout and benefits from modern stylish décor, ample inbuilt storage in the entrance hall, leading to a bright and airy spacious open plan reception room and kitchen ideal for entertaining friends and family.

The accommodations’ features such as the kitchen is presented in excellent condition with a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, immaculate sleek range of matching high gloss walls and base units with countertops and more inbuilt storage capabilities for more appliances.

The private balcony is an extension of the living/reception area. The spacious bedrooms have ample storage space, fitted storage facilities and a modern bathroom with elegant interior décor.

This property offers further benefits from a private balcony with stunning views of the sunset, 24hr concierge service, onsite gym and swimming pool, heating, double glazing and is located on this popular Blackheath Quarter development of Kidbrooke village with great transport links and convenient bars/restaurants within walking distances.

Residents are positioned within an excellent range of transport links; with a 5-minute walk from Kidbrooke Rail Station allowing for easy access into Central London, West End and other routes.

detailedDescription:
Stanfords bring to the market this beautiful first floor period conversion on the desirable tree lined Canadian Avenue. Internally the flat is presented very well with a bright and spacious 13'11" x 12'3" lounge, as well as two double bedrooms, modern bathroom and separate kitchen. Externally there is a large, landscaped communal garden which is laid to lawn and the benefit of off street parking.

Canadian Avenue is a wide tree lined road, and the property is located only only 0.3 miles to Catford and Catford Bridge Stations which offer excellent transport links across London, The City and West End. You are also just down the road from the heart of Catford city centre, which has a host of restaurants and cafes as well as an array of events such as the renowned Catford Food Festival and Catford Arts Trail and eclectic places to eat and drink including Ninth Life and Bottle Bar. Also just a short walk away; the development leads on to the wonderful Ladywell Fields, a mixed use urban park with the Ravensbourne River running through the centre and Ladywell Village at the other end.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are delighted to present this beautiful 3 bedroom family home in close proximity to New Cross Gate Station. The property is in good decorative order and is offered chain-free.

The property comprises a generous entrance hallway with a large living room through lounge. The property has kept some beautiful period features throughout with high ceilings and a fireplace with a wood-burning stove. There is a downstairs WC and a great-sized kitchen with underfloor heating, fully fitted units and appliances. There is a gorgeous south facing rear garden that is well kept and low maintenance.

The property benefits from a basement that is ideal for storage. On the mezzanine level, there is a good-sized bedroom and the family bathroom along with another separate shower room. On the top floor, there are two good-sized bedrooms that benefit from an abundance of light and airiness. The attic is fully boarded and insulated.

The property is suitable for a growing family and provides an opportunity for buyers to put their own stamp on the property.

The property benefits from excellent transport links nearby with New Cross Gate and New Cross Station within a short walk away. There are also a range of excellent schools nearby, notably Haberdashers' Aske's Secondary School as well as Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham Temple Grove, Edmund Waller and Kender Primary Schools.

Viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A charming first floor maisonette for sale with direct access to a private garden in this highly sought after location in Penge. Set within a small cul de sac and within very close proximity of rail links, this property has been upgraded throughout and now offers a home for an incoming purchaser to immediately enjoy. Built in the 1800's, this attractive home offers flexible living accommodation which can either be utilised as a generous one bedroom with two reception rooms or a two double bedroom property with one reception.

The property also enjoys some beautiful features including original wood flooring, an impressive fireplace and high ceilings. There is also a low maintenance private garden with a raised decked patio area.
Lucas Road is desirable location very close to Crystal Palace Park and great transport links including Penge East (Victoria), Penge West (Overground - Zone 4) and Sydenham rail (Zone 3), with easy access to London Bridge, as well as the shopping and leisure facilities of Sydenham and Penge. Beckenham and Bromley are also nearby with the Odeon and Picturehouse cinema, shopping complex and restaurants. EPC - E

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Are you looking for the perfect combination of city life and peaceful surroundings? This in-demand apartment property is in a sought after part of the Catford Green development. Only 4 years old, it's immaculately presented with one spacious double bedroom on the second floor and located conveniently close to transport links and amenities.

The highlight of this idyllic city apartment is the fact you get the peace and tranquillity of a less populated area through the undisturbed views of the park.

Offering a stunning living space and floor to ceiling windows flooding the property with natural light; the property comprises of an entrance hall, leading into the bright and spacious open plan reception room and open space for both relaxing and dining. There's a spacious utility room with the boiler, washing machine and dryer- a great place to get your washing dried quickly and hide your luggage and other bulky items.
The kitchen area includes a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, integrated appliances including Microwave, hob with overhead extractor & electric oven. There is a spacious double bedroom, with a large double wardrobe available with the property and a stylish bathroom with a modern suite.

The ease and convenience oozes into the interior of the home with the fibre optic Wi-Fi, making the transition to working from home seamless.

The flat is advantageously situated; just less than a 10-minute walk to 2 stations - so if one line is down, you have the other to fall back on! You can get to London Bridge in just 12 minutes, 17 minutes to the City and 20 minutes to Charing Cross. Lewisham DLR is just one stop away for services to Canary Wharf. And you're just 8 minutes from the Overground at Peckham Rye. There are also several bus routes to choose from as well.

A range of amenities can be found in the centres of Catford and Ladywell, including independent coffee shops, restaurants and local retailers. There is also the Catford Broadway theatre, offering shows throughout the year and Ninth Life Pub and venue for some obscure entertainment.
Just a short walk away; the development leads on to the beautiful Ladywell Fields, an urban park with the Ravensbourne River running through the centre and Ladywell Village at the other end. Great for walking, running or cycling along!

The development was finished in 2017, so there's a real community spirit that you get where everyone in the block moved in around the same time. From single professionals to newlyweds, to families with children; the Facebook Group and social events will really make you feel like part of the community.

Simply put, this property is a gem near the City, loved and well taken care of by one single owner, deserving of some fresh energy of those who will enjoy it!

Owners comment:
I've lived here for 4 years and sadly now moving out of London. This flat was my first home and i'll be really sad to let it go, but equally happy with someone who'll enjoy living here and the view! Great for dog watching :)

Description

City Wharf is delighted to bring to the market this super modern 3 bedrooms apartment.

Comprising of three bedrooms, two bathrooms (one an en-suite), a large open plan living, kitchen area with fully integrated appliances and an abundance of storage in the whole property.

This apartment makes a perfect setting for professionals and families who would like the modern touch within their new home.

The property is in a peaceful riverside location close to both Deptford and Greenwich for shops, restaurants, bars and leisure activities. Deptford Station provides quick links into London Bridge and The City and the DLR to Canary Wharf is at nearby Cutty Sark.

detailedDescription:
This beautifully renovated three bedroom Victorian house built c. 1858 offers fantastic living space with a double reception and dining room leading out through french doors into a stunning landscaped garden. The kitchen is located to the rear of the property and offers ample worktop space, a selection of integrated appliances and a separate utility room/guest WC. The three bedrooms and family bathroom are located on the first floor with the main bedroom featuring built-in wardrobes and the third bedroom makes a fantastic nursery or home study. The property is offered in excellent condition with a seamless blend of modern decor combing some lovely period features such as the fireplace, exposed wooden flooring and sliding sash windows. A perfect, readymade family home on one of the area’s most desirable roads.

Situation
Strickland Street is located in the heart of Brookmill Conservation Area, moments from St Johns Station which provides swift links to London Bridge and Cannon Street. Deptford Bridge DLR Station is also a short walk away providing direct access to Canary Wharf. The open green spaces of nearby Brookmill Park, Greenwich Park and Hilly Fields are easily accessible as well as the popular Brockley Farmers Market providing fresh local produce every Saturday. There is a wide array of local restaurants, coffee shops and pubs for local residents to enjoy including the increasing popular Deptford Market Yard, Well Beloved Butchers and Brookmill Gastro Pub. There are a number of good schools in the area including Ashmead and St Stephens Primary Schools while the popular Bright Horizons Nursery is close by for families with younger children.

3 Bedroom Victorian Terraced House

Fully Renovated

Landscaped Rear Garden

Double Reception Room

First Floor Bathroom

Kitchen And Separate Utility Room

Moments From St Johns Mainline Station

detailedDescription:
This unique home is arranged over three floors and entered into a spacious living room. This room has attractive wooden flooring, an open fire, ornate cornicing, built in cabinetry and a double height arched sash window overlooking the heath. A bespoke turned staircase takes you up to a decent double bedroom which also enjoys heath views. There is an en-suite tiled shower room and a dressing area. The kitchen is found of the bottom floor and is made up of solid wood units with a contrasting worktop and parquet flooring. The kitchen leads out to a conservatory and then into the second bedroom which is currently being used as a gym. Finally, there is a fully tiled bathroom, a handy cupboard and a great private patio.

The Paragon occupies a heath side location which means Blackheath Village and its array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants are very close by. Blackheath station is ideal for commuting with regular services in to London Bridge, with Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria beyond. Further to this, one stop down the line will bring you to Lewisham Station where the DLR provides regular services into Canary Wharf and Bank.

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £325,000-£350,000**

An opportunity to purchase this well presented two double bedroom apartment set within a sought after area just moments from Forest Hill station.

The accommodation on offer comprises, communal entrance, private entrance, a beautiful and modern 14'0 open plan lounge / fitted kitchen and two good size double bedrooms as well as a three piece bathroom suite.

The property is offered in superb condition throughout and viewing is highly recommended. Please call Winkworth on to arrange an appointment to view.

Location:
Locally there is an abundance of local independent shops, bars, cafes and restaurants including sour dough pizzeria Bona and St. David Coffee House. Furthermore, there are handy high street stores including Sainsbury's and Boots. Forest Hill has a great choice of green spaces and parks with the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away and Mayow park on your doorstep.
Close by is also the neighbourhood of Sydenham which is gaining popularity with a choice of cool independents, cafes and useful shops including bob and Food + Drink.
There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground an easy walk away connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away.
Furthermore Forest Hill is serviced by Southern mainline train services connecting direct to London Bridge and Victoria stations.

detailedDescription:
An outstanding period property which retains plenty of the original charm and character fronting on to Blackheath common.

Location

The Paragon is regarded as one of the most prestigious roads within Blackheath, given its premier location on the cusp of Blackheath common, and being within just 0.5 miles of Greenwich Park. There are a vast selection of shops, boutiques and various exclusive bars and restaurants all within close proximity. Blackheath station also provides swift connections into London Bridge and beyond.

All times and distances are approximate.

Description

The Paragon is an historic piece of architecture dating back to circa 1800, which comprises of a mixture of attractive Grade I listed houses, which are positioned in a private road on the fringe of Blackheath common. The property offers plenty of original charm and character and boasts well presented accommodation set across three floors, accessed by a feature spiral staircase.

Internally, there is a charming lounge, a fitted kitchen with integral appliances, which leads out into a conservatory / breakfast area, directly leading into a quaint courtyard.

Furthermore, the principal bedroom occupies the top floor and offers an en suite and dressing area, in addition to a generous second bedroom and modern bathroom.

Square Footage: 948 sq ft

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
2/3 Bedroom Penthouse Flat on the 10th floor with Private Underground Parking and a large Private Terrace for sale

Distillery Crescent is a testimony to architectural innovation in every aspect. The building offers a superb mix of living space from live/work apartments at Ground Level to a spectacular choice of 1,2 & 3 bed apartments arranged from 1st to 10th floor level. Residents will also have access to the three extensive tiered level roof terrace gardens.

The building is immediately adjacent to Deptford Bridge DLR providing virtually instant access and connections to the Capital's entire network of tube and mainline transport hubs - including Stratford International and the rapidly progressing 200 million square metres of world focus regeneration... With a highly sophisticated public transport infrastructure on their doorstep, residents will benefit from impressive journey times across the metropolis with the West End being just 32 minutes and Westminster 36 minutes from the building.

Closer still, within 2 minutes on the DLR or 10 minutes walk, lies Maritime Greenwich, a unesco World Heritage Site since 1997 and home to London's oldest Royal parkland, the Royal Observatory and the brilliant architecture of Sir Christopher Wren's Old Royal Naval College. Today, Greenwich Village is a colourful and contemporary market town offering an endless array of fine shopping, bars, restaurants, nightlife and a host of cultural pursuits.

For travelling further afield, London City Airport is little over 30 minutes on the DLR providing scheduled flights to over 20 European cities.

General Specification Include:

Living/Dining
• Oak wood strip veneer flooring to living/dining & hall areas
• Thermostatically controlled wet radiator central heating
• Quality oak veneer vertical grain doors with polished stainless steel door furniture
• Low energy downlights
• Brushed steel switch & socket plates
• Satellite TV and telephone socket
• Sky+ socket (subject to subscription)
• Selected with balcony or terrace
• Matt white finish walls and ceilings (throughout)

Kitchen
• Oak wood strip veneer flooring to living/dining & kitchen areas
• Fully integrated appliances to include washer/dryer & dishwasher, fridge/freezer, stainless steel low level oven, cooker hood, ceramic hob and microwave oven
• Please note not all appliances may be provided in Studio apartments
• Black glass splashback to hob
• High gloss white unit doors with concealed handles
• Under lighting to wall units
• Stainless steel 1½ bowl sink with chrome plated single lever mono block tap
• Black natural granite worktop and upstand
• Centralised appliance switch panel

Bedrooms
• Oak wood strip veneer flooring to the bedrooms
• Thermostatically controlled wet radiator central heating
• Low energy downlights
• Satellite TV and telephone socket to all bedrooms

Local Area
Poised to maximise upon the massive potential upsurge to property values in this transforming buy-to-let location, the Distillery is further enhanced by fast 25 minute access to the main focus of the 2012 Olympic games, while equestrian, modern pentathlon, gymnastic and basketball events are all due to be staged at the nearby venues of Greenwich Park and the O2. Greenwich is also a home to the famous Cutty Sark, Meridian Line and Greenwich Park, proving a year round draw for tourists. The centre of this bustling University town adds to the trendy bohemian atmosphere by offering an array of speciality gastro pubs, shops, antiques markets & riverside bars.
