detailedDescription:
Doorsteps are delighted to offer this attractive family home with flexible work from home spaces situated in a sought after residential area just steps away from shops, pubs, post office. Walk to 3 train stations, bus stop on the corner. Great local and private schools, nearby parks and open space.

The property boasts easy access to both Catford and Forest Hill local amenities and fine selection of cafes and eateries. Catford town centre has a 3-screen cinema, theatre, supermarkets and shops, plus a variety of restaurants.

Catford Bridge (Thameslink) and Catford Station are a short walk with trains to Cannon Street, Blackfriars and Charing Cross taking approx. 20 mins. Walk through green spaces to Honor Oak Park with 15 min fast trains to London Bridge.

Ladywell Fields (0.4 mile) has 54 acres of parkland with tennis courts, bowling green, cycle route and nature reserve with the Ravensbourne River. Walk through the Fields to Lewisham Hospital. Up the hill to Blythe Hill Fields is a playground, trim trail and panoramic views towards central London and Canary Wharf to the north, and Kent and Surrey to the south.

In the catchment area for sought after Rathfern Primary and nearby St Dunstans Secondary school. Fully enclosed West facing garden. Parking for 2-3 cars on the drive.

Entrance through a small porch to the hall with doors off to all rooms, leading to upstairs.

Reception 1

Generous room with large bay window to the front aspect. Period feature fireplace with attractive tiled inset and surround. Plenty of area for large sofa, armchairs and wide screen entertainment.

Reception 2

Second reception with sunny aspect and outside door opening to the side of the property and leading to the garden. Currently in use as a gym but would equally make a great work from home office, playroom or even Bedroom 4.

Kitchen Dining Room

Spacious area with room for a large dining table and 4-6 chairs under a large bay window to the side. The extensive kitchen has a full range of base and wall cupboards, open shelves and tall glass display units. Stainless steel sink and drainer under a bright window overlooking the sun porch and garden. Generous amount of worktops, built in gas hob with integrated extractor fan above.Tower unit with eye level double electric ovens. Double glazed door to garden. Space for under counter fridge or freezer, dishwasher, washing machine and upright fridge freezer.
WC


Convenient downstairs WC consisting of low level cistern toilet and contemporary square hand wash basin. Attractive part tiled walls.

First Floor

Bedroom 1

Lovely light double bedroom easily fitting a king size bed. Built in recess storage behind period wood door next to an original cast iron fireplace. Plenty of storage in the modern built in double wardrobes, with period pine linen cupboard and a chest of drawers. Large bay window to front aspect, fitted blinds.

Bedroom 2

Double bedroom with window, period cast iron fireplace, period wood door to recess providing wardrobe and storage space.

Bedroom 3

Bright double bedroom with window overlooking the rear garden, and built in double wardrobes with mirror sliding doors.

Bathroom

Full size bath with power shower over and glass screen to the side. Contemporary style white toilet and matching wash basin inset over two door cupboard.

Walk in Shower

Stunning, fully tiled walk in shower discretely hidden behind a mirror glass door.

Second Floor

Loft Room

Beautiful loft room retaining a period feature brick wall. Open plan space with a wall of storage behind wardrobe doors with additional eaves storage on both sides of the room. Velux style window above making the space light and airy. Currently used as a home office.

Outside

Sunny West facing garden accessed from the kitchen and reception 2. A charming glazed porch sits directly outside the kitchen with cozy seating for two in all weathers also providing space for storing bikes and boots. The original outdoor toilet is a hidden feature behind an attractive period door.

The garden is low maintenance with paved patios to the side and rear of house, ideal areas for BBQs and dining al fresco. Tall fencing on all sides. The rear patio is an oasis of plants in beds and borders with flowering bushes and architectural plants providing privacy.

General

Gas Central Heating

Fireplaces (not tested)

Freehold

Unveiled to the SE23 market is this incredibly unique opportunity to acquire this superb-value family home, with masses of practicality and finished in a modern design.

Forest Hill itself is highly regarded as one of the most in trend and affordable places to live within South London, with plenty of clientele coming in from areas such as Dulwich, Peckham, Clapham, South-West, and East London, mainly due to the premier neighbourhood and High Street feel and fast connections into the city. Forest Hill station has links into London Bridge, as well as East London and Canada Water, via the highly rated Overground line. Additionally you are within close proximity to a selection of good primary schools and Mayow Park, an award winning green space boasting newly refurbished tennis courts and a scenic café.

The accommodation provides plenty of floor space by sitting circa 104sqm, which is set across two floors, and benefitting from a modern design. The layout comprises a spacious entrance hall, a well designed kitchen/diner, which interlinks perfectly into the reception room, further leading you out onto the garden. The first floor comprises three spacious bedrooms, all of which are good size double bedrooms and a well proportioned bathroom suite. Additional benefits include off street parking to front, ample storage internally and a stunning west-facing rear garden.

We expect this stunning family home to be a real focal point on the open market and as cliché as it may sound, we advise viewing at your earliest convenience.

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price: £275,000 - £300,000**

Winkworth are delighted to present this one double bedroom period conversion set within a highly sought after conversion within walking distance to Forest Hill station.

The accommodation on offer comprises, communal entrance, private entrance, 12'7 reception room, fitted kitchen, 12'7 double bedroom and a bathroom suite.

The property is in good condition and can be offered chain free. This is a great investment opportunity / first time purchase.

Internal viewing is highly recommended. Please contact Winkworth on .

Location:
Located on Woolstone Road in Forest Hill.
Within easy walking distance of this property is an abundance of boutique shops, local bars, cafes and restaurants including sour dough pizzeria Bona, St. David Coffee House, Bunka, Stag & Bow to name a few of the local offerings.
Furthermore, there are handy high street stores including Sainsbury's and Boots.
Locally there is a great choice of green spaces and parks with Blythe Hill Fields a stroll away offering panoramic views of London and the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away.
If looking for extracurricular activities, you can enjoy Forest Hill Pools or a choice of the local gyms or therapy and beauty rooms.
The area is popular with families due to a superb choice of Ofsted Outstanding schools including Kilmorie and Rathfern within close proximity. The neighbourhoods of Dulwich, Peckham Rye and Catford are also within easy reach, offering a choice of independent shops, eateries and useful amenities.
There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground within approx. 1 mile, connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away. Furthermore, mainline connections enable easy access to the major stations of the capital including Victoria, Charing Cross, London Bridge to name a few with the Thameslink service accessible from Catford.

detailedDescription:
A superb, five bedroom semi-detached home that has been thoughtfully extended and renovated by the current owners.
The ground floor has an open plan feel with a spacious bay-fronted lounge leading through to a stunning kitchen/diner. The white high-gloss kitchen units, including a central island, have integrated appliances and black granite work surfaces. Bi-folding doors span the length of the room and an atrium window floods the room with light. A utility room and WC complete this floor. The first floor has three bedrooms, an en-suite to the master and a stylish, fully tiled, family bathroom. Two further bedrooms and a bathroom are found on the top floor.

detailedDescription:
Right next to Hilly Fields and ideally placed within the popular Brockley Conservation area is this lovely, 2-bedroom top floor period style modern flat with communal off-street parking, communal gardens and also a share of the freehold. The three closest stations, which are almost equidistant from the property, are Brockley, Crofton Park and Ladywell. There are also a wide range of amenities in the area.

The property comprises a spacious reception room with sash windows allowing lots of natural light, separate fitted kitchen, a modern bathroom suite, two good sized bedrooms, and benefits from a great view of the green surrounding area of the communal garden with its beautiful mature trees. The fabulous open space of Hilly Fields is just around the corner where there are free tennis courts, a café and a regular farmers' market.

A short walk to the end of Adelaide Avenue is Brockley Road, there are several local traders including convenience stores, independent bars and restaurants as well as an award-winning, sustainable fish and chip shop (Brockley's Rock). For anyone wanting the London Overground, the nearest station is Brockley for services to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington.

Further along Brockley Road is the Crofton Park area, where there are also a number of innovative local traders. The Brockley Jack pub and Theatre and the famous Rivoli Ballroom can also be found there. From Crofton Park station, there are straight links to Denmark Hill, Victoria and Blackfriars

Ladywell, at the other end of Adelaide Avenue, has a village like feel with a variety of shops including coffee shops, a highly-regarded local butcher's and deli, an excellent pizzeria (Mama Dough) and a popular gastro pub (The Ladywell Tavern). From Ladywell station there are regular national rail services into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon St. Lewisham DLR is just one stop away and offers easy access into Canary Wharf and The City.

The property is also not far from Honor Oak Park where there are a number of restaurants of note including a hip pizzeria, a family-run Sardinian restaurant (le Querce), and an award-winning Indian (Babur).

Further amenities can be found in the centre of Lewisham, which is also not too far and for those of a sporty disposition, there's a leisure centre and swimming pool complex just opposite Lewisham station.

Location

detailedDescription:
Designed and lived in by the architect, this eco-home of outstanding quality is fully detached and tucked away off Crescent Wood Road allowing it total privacy. Built in 2013 the house has a u-shaped plan that wraps around a central courtyard with glass walls, allowing morning and afternoon sunlight to filter through into the interior spaces. A high 40-meter long black Siberian larch timber wall screens the house from its neighbours and gives a fortress-like feel. Full-height glazed sliding doors on both floors help create a strong relationship between inside and outside. The structure has been designed to improve thermal and acoustic performance and reduce the carbon footprint. Consideration has been given for walls, the sedum roof and floors to achieve an insulation standard significantly beyond the current Building Regulations requirements in order to decrease the total heating load. The windows are high-performance, carbon-filled and double-glazed in timber framing, configured to optimize sunlight and daylight levels and there is underfloor heating on all floors. Similar to the traditional courtyard typology, the inner cores are private, secure and well-ventilated with the outdoor environment intended as an extension of the family space.

Situation
Crescent Wood Road is a wide road running alongside Dulwich Woods. The excellent facilities of Dulwich Village with its excellent independent schools and Crystal Palace are close at hand and the nearest station is Sydenham Hill with services to Blackfriars and Victoria. Sydenham station is 1.2 miles away with he London Overground and trains to London Bridge. The independent schools of Dulwich are within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
Impressive in both its location and high quality finish, this stunning and spacious two bedroom, lifestyle apartment reveals quality inclusions across a light filled easy care layout. It commands a ground floor, garden position in a building located just steps away from Nunhead Station.

This memorable apartment is spaced over a comfortable 816 sqft and contains two double bedrooms, a modern family bathroom and also a semi open plan kitchen and lounge room. Both bedrooms are doubles and the living area allows for ample room for both living and dining, enhanced by an abundance of light flooding through the property from the two sets of floor to ceiling double doors that give access to your own private garden. When you step out through the double doors you will find yourself in a mini paradise thriving with plants and basking in sunlight, but don't be fooled this is a far away paradise, it's just your own private garden.

Named in Sunday Times as one of London's best places to live those who live in the Nunhead cherish the many features that make up its unique character, with a vibrant community and superb schools such Ivydale Primary and St Thomas the Apostle on your doorstep. As well as Nunhead station being just less than a minute walk away you also have Nunhead Village within strolling distance hosting a wide range of independently run restaurants, pubs, cafes, shops, and local gems such as Ayre's bakery, Soper's fishmongers, The Old Nun's Head gastro pub, and other restaurants and cafes surrounding The Green: The excellent Babette, Napura and pizzeria Four Hundred Rabbits to name a few. Vibrant Queens Road is close by and Peckham Rye Park is too, one of London's loveliest green spaces and a refuge from the urban sprawl of the city – with its formal gardens, café, pond and open spaces, there's something for everyone.

A short walk takes you to historic Telegraph Hill with its two parks plus tennis courts and far reaching views over London. Here you will also find the popular community run café and arts hub Hill Station on Kitto Road. One of Nunhead's best loved pubs Skehans is also on Kitto Road - it has a unique atmosphere and remains one of South London's last remaining family run free house pubs.

Trains from Nunhead station (Zone 2) travel to Victoria, Blackfriars, Farringdon, City Thameslink and St Pancras while Peckham Rye (Zone 2) links to these and London Bridge, plus also has East London Line services to Canada Water, Shoreditch, Hoxton, Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington

address: Woodside Villa, Sydenham Hill, London SE26
detailedDescription:
This fantastic three-bedroom apartment is located on the first floor of Woodside Villa, an exemplary development of eight apartments within a handsome double-fronted Victorian villa. Designed by riba award-winning architect/developers Craftworks, the building was completed in 2009. Craftworks have said of the project that “the layering of both the new and the existing creates a historical mix between past and present and offers attachment and comfort to each occupier.”

The Architect

Craftworks are among Britain’s most enterprising and intelligent young practices. They were voted one of the world’s top 50 best emerging architects by Wallpaper* magazine. Their first major housing development, dkh in East Dulwich, won a riba award, was runner-up in the Evening Standard Best New UK Housing award, and runner-up in the Grand Designs Best New UK Housing award.

The Tour

This particular apartment is the largest in the building. It measures approximately 948 sq ft and has wonderfully high ceilings, with oak parquet running underfoot throughout. The main bedroom and en suite shower room is positioned at one end of the plan, bathed in natural light care of two large sash windows along the eastern aspect. A second double bedroom with significant amounts of built-in storage lies opposite, while a third bedroom with high-level storage space is positioned next to the main bedroom and links directly through to the kitchen. This bedroom is currently used as a dining room.

The galley kitchen is built to a contemporary design, with concrete worktops and polished plaster splash-backs. It cleverly occupies a central position within the plan, delineating the large living room from the home’s other spaces. The living room itself is an impressive space, capitalising on its inherent Victorian grandeur to establish the heart of the home. Two large sash windows offer tree-top views to the west and a large marble fireplace is the focal point of the room.

The building has allocated off-street parking and covered bicycle storage.

The Area

Shops, restaurants and bars can be found at nearby Dulwich Village and Crystal Palace, and the Sydenham Hill Wood Nature Reserve is close by. Much of the surrounding area is owned by the Dulwich Estate, which has a strong reputation for conservation.

Woodside Villa is within easy reach of a number of popular schools. The nearest train station, Sydenham Hill, offers services to Blackfriars and Victoria. Crystal Palace and Sydenham stations are also very accessible.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 118 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £1,500 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £350 per annum
Council Tax Band: D
Parking: Allocated residents’ parking

detailedDescription:
**Guide Price £400,000 - £425,000**
Winkworth are proud to present this two double bedroom purpose built apartment set within a highly sought after location minutes from Forest Hill station.

The well presented accommodation on offer comprises, communal entrance, private entrance, entrance hall, 21'8 reception room, two double bedrooms and a bathroom.

The property is offered chain free for a quick sale and newly redecorated, ready to move in. With the central location of the property, it's sure to create a lot of interest.

Call Winkworth to book your appointment.

Location:
Locally there is a great choice of green spaces and parks with the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away.

The area is popular with families due to a superb choice of Ofsted Outstanding schools including Eliot Bank Primary School which is within approx. 0.6 miles of the property, similarly Kilmorie and Rathfern are within close proximity.

There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground approximately 5 minutes' walk away connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away. Furthermore Forest Hill is serviced by Southern mainline train services connecting direct to London Bridge and Victoria stations.

This property also benefits from having all the local shops and amenities at it's doorstep.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Madley are delighted to present this three bedroom end of terrace house in St Georges Mews, SE8. Located in a quiet gated mews, this property boasts high ceilings with a touch of character. With two double bedrooms located on the ground floor, along with a bathroom and a utility room, and another double bedroom on the first floor, this house is spacious and bright. The open plan living area and kitchen has fantastic natural light which leads out to the balcony, overlooking the quiet courtyard in the centre of the mews.

Located only a short stroll from Surrey Quays Overground and Greenland Pier's Thames Clipper service, it's perfect for professionals working in the City or Canary Wharf. You'll also find an abundance of local dock and riverside bars and restaurants within a short walk from the property as well as local amenities, providing convenience at your fingertips in every sense.

Viewings are a must!

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to welcome to the market this exceptional, extended Victorian semi-detached home which has been upgraded throughout, offering beautiful, move in ready accommodation and is located on a sought after, quiet 'no through' road.

This family home boasts an extended, open plan concept with dual aspect generous living room and a fitted kitchen/diner, bifold doors to the garden and a Lantern which provides additional light into this already bright and airy ground floor space. The property also incorporates original and period features which are in keeping with the age and era of the house.
Upstairs there are three first floor bedrooms (the main with fitted wardrobes) and a refitted bathroom and a modern cloakroom/w.c. On the ground floor.
Other features include double glazed sash windows and gas central heating, beautiful flooring throughout, a new front door, Plantation style shutters, a new integrated fridge freezer, Charlston style period radiators and a wood burner. The loft has also been boarded for storage with easy access via a new hatch.

Externally there are well kept and low maintenance gardens to the front and side with new drainage system installed and Brazilian black slate tiles laid.

Viewings are considered essential in order to fully appreciate the standard of accommodation on offer here.

Location

Located within very close proximity to Elliot Bank - a much sought after outstanding primary school.
Wells Park and the Horniman Gardens are also nearby. For transport it's ideal as only 0.5 miles to both Forest Hill and Sydenham Stations with 10min direct line to London Bridge. Dulwich Woods, Crystal Palace Park and Dulwich & Sydenham Golf club, Dulwich Village and East Dulwich are all also within easy reach.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
This stunning five bedroom house is located just moment away from oxleas woods & hornfair park. The property is offered to the market chain free.

The property has been refurbished to an extremely high standard throughout including a large front facing reception room with bay window, impressive extended kitchen diner with porcelain floor, granite worktops and integrated multi ovens, American style stainless steel fridge freezer and feature centre island. The kitchen breakfast room also benefits from having a sizeable ceiling light well and bifold doors opening onto newly laid lawned garden. Finally to the ground floor is a large utility room and guest WC. As you ascent to the first floor you are welcomed by three bedrooms including an impressive master bedroom with its own en-suite shower room. You will find a modern bathroom suite to complete the floor. On the second floor you will find two further bedrooms and a bathroom.

Further benefits include double glazing throughout, gas central heating and off street parking.

The house is well positioned for beautiful green spaces including Eltham Common and Oxleas woods. There are many bus links from Shooters Hill and Well Hall road which will take you to Greenwich, Blackheath, Eltham and Woolwich for mainline stations, DLR, Jubilee line and The Elizabeth Line (due for completion in 2019).

For further information or to arrange a viewing please contact our Blackheath Standard office today.

detailedDescription:
Gated Development | 777sqft of Floor Space | Horniman Side of SE23

Unveiled to the SE23 market is this ultra lavish, substantial modern apartment, situated on the Horniman side of Forest Hill and on one of the areas most sought after roads; Taymount Rise, just moments from the vibrant High Street!

Forest Hill High Street, which is only 500 yards away (according to Google Maps), offers a full range of eateries, cafés, restaurants and bars. Forest Hill Station is only 0.2 miles away (according to Google Maps) and has superb links into London Bridge and the East London Overground Line with routes to Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington via Shoreditch High Street. The Horniman Museum is just up the famous London Road and has a tranquil setting, as well as Dulwich Woods and Dulwich Park being within cycling distance.

The accommodation itself surpasses 72.1sqm of internal floor space, that is set to the front of the first floor within this highly contemporary building design. The layout consists of two incredibly spacious bedrooms, both of which have custom made built in wardrobes, with the main bedroom benefitting from an en-suite. Additionally, the apartment comprises a good size utility storage cupboard, a modern bathroom suite and an excessive open plan reception room, which interlinks perfectly with the kitchen/diner section of the room, further more benefitting from a well designed kitchen with masses of storage. Other features include a selection of floor to ceiling windows, allocated parking, access to a communal green and a share of freehold tenure.

We envisage this plush apartment having great success on the open market and would highly recommend viewing as soon as possible, by contacting our Acorn Forest Hill office to book your appointment!

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Energy Efficiency Rating: C.

detailedDescription:
Set to the third floor of this purpose built development, a well-proportioned two double bedroom apartment that features an 'eat in' kitchen.

The Seller Says: I love a lot of things about this flat but especially the huge windows which flood the flat with light. The 1930’s design has really stood the test of time - these flats are solidly built and well laid out with spacious and flexible rooms.

I love to cook, so undertook a complete kitchen refurbishment incorporating all new units and appliances and extra-deep solid iroko worktops for loads of worktop and storage space, plus room for a table and space to have friends round.

The block and grounds are well maintained with residents involved in gardening and making the communal spaces more attractive. The flat is handy for Brockley and Crofton Park Stations and in the middle of numerous local green spaces, Hilly Fields, Nunhead Cemetery, Peckham Rye and One Tree Hill are all nearby and I can run/walk/cycle a few minutes in almost any direction and find myself in a park or woodland.

I love this area and all it has to offer so won't be moving too far."<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Built in 1926, a substantial semi-detached house that has been greatly extended by a loft conversion and ground floor additions at the rear, to create a very spacious family home with a south-facing garden of over 100ft in depth.

The house is entered via an extremely generous entrance hall off which are the two original good sized reception rooms, a cloakroom and a breakfast room which leads in turn to the kitchen extension, with door and south-facing windows opening onto the garden at the rear. The first floor provides two good double bedrooms and two singles
and a family bathroom, and on the top floor there is one enormous bedroom with air-conditioning and a second bathroom. At the far end of the long and secluded south-facing garden is a useful garden summer house, presently used as an office/gym. With off-street parking to the brick paved driveway for up to three vehicles. The house has full gas central heating and uPVC sealed unit double glazed windows throughout.

Westbrook Road is a short residential turning just off Kidbrooke Park Road, less than half mile walk from the eastern edge of The Heath and a little further from Greenwich Park, Blackheath & Kidbrooke mainline railway stations and Thomas Tallis School.

The accommodation comprises ● Entrance Hall ● Three Reception Rooms ● Kitchen ● Cloakroom ● Five Bedrooms ● Two Bathrooms ● Driveway Parking ● 110ft South-Facing Rear Garden ● Full Gas Fired Central Heating ● Double Glazing

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located just down the road from Blythe Hill Fields, this attractive two-bedroom Victorian Conversion flat on the borders of Catford and Forest Hill, occupies the first floor.

The property comprises of a large, light and airy lounge opening onto a stylish fitted kitchen, two good sized bedrooms with fitted wardrobes to the main bedroom and a smart family bathroom.

Ravensbourne Road is a situated Blythe Hill Fields. The park is a great place for a Sunday afternoon stroll and the sweeping views of London's skyline are some of the best in London.

The nearest stations are Catford and Catford Bridge with services into central London and the City in under 25 minutes.

For anyone needing the Overground, Honor Oak Park station is within easy reach by cutting through Blythe Hill Fields.

Amenities can be found either in the centre of Catford, Forest Hill or Honor Oak Park including high street favourites, independent coffee shops and several highly-rated restaurants and gastro pubs.

A couple of places of note for an evening out include The Blythe Hill Tavern, a camra-award winning pub, a recently-opened cinema (the Catford Mews), Yoga house, a monthly food market and the Catford Arts trail.

The nearest primary school is Rathfern, rated as 'Outstanding'.

detailedDescription:
This well-proportioned, newly refurbished, 3 double bedroom end-of-terrace Victorian house with a west facing garden is ideally located for transport links into town, local amenities and several good/outstanding primary schools.
The house comprises 2 reception rooms the rear one with doors out to the garden. To the rear is a newly installed kitchen diner, with a sleek modern design and stone worksurfaces and French doors leading to the easily maintained West facing garden (side access is also a bonus). Upstairs are 3 double bedrooms, a family bathroom, an additional WC and access to a large loft space (conversion potential STPP). To the rear is a westerly facing garden. There is also a cellar space, ideal for your fine wine!
Shardeloes Road benefits from a close proximity to a wealth of amenities and good transport links into town. Brockley station provides fast and frequent services into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon St. You can also pick up Overground services from Brockley for services towards Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington.
For evening entertainment there's no shortage of bars, restaurants and cafes to choose from in both Brockley and New Cross. A couple of restaurants of note include The Gantry (a rustic, French-style restaurant) and the Orchard (a friendly restaurant with a wine bar). You can pick up groceries from various supermarkets nearby. On Saturdays, pop along to the award-winning Brockley Market on Lewisham Way for fresh groceries and a bite to eat.
As for green spaces, Telegraph Hill is nearby where there are fantastic views towards central London.

Deptford Landings, Cedarwood Square ideally located between Pepys Park and The Waterline linear park running through former Timberyard Deptford. detailedDescription:
'cash buyers only'

A large four double bedroom house over three original levels, with two bathrooms and period features that has a fabulous layout and could likely be further expanded.

The home will certainly appeal to those looking to 'add value' or 'stamp their mark' on a home as there are things to be done but there have also already been things done! Most windows have been replaced by the current owner with sash double glazed and the roof was replaced by a previous owner.

Large interconnecting doors between the two reception rooms are a nice touch along with stripped and polished flooring.

The 21' kitchen diner opens out and overlooks the almost 60' garden, crying out for a green fingered friend.

The busy commuter will find the 150 metre walk to the Overground a joy, whilst for those thinking of schools, the choice nearby is Outstanding - ofsted.<br /><br />
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This fantastic 2-double bedroom, 3rd (top) floor property offers spacious light-filled accommodation overlooking Ladywell Fields and the river walk. It is in wonderful condition and is offered Chain Free.
You enter the flat to a wide and welcoming hallway which has wooden floors and two great cupboards plus a separate airing cupboard. To the left is a good sized double bedroom and to the right is a generously-proportioned light and airy reception room with a bay window that allows natural light to stream in and affords great views across Ladywell Fields. There is also a 2nd double bedroom, a sleek modern kitchen and the stunning bathroom has a full sized bath with a wall mounted thermostatic shower unit, fully tiled walls, a wall mounted vanity unit with hand wash basin and cupboard below and underfloor heating.
The area around Ladywell Fields and Blythe Hill Fields is very leafy and tranquil. Transport links into all parts of London could hardly be easier. Catford Bridge provides services to London Bridge (in around 13 minutes) Cannon Street (in around 24 minutes) and Charing Cross (in around 22 minutes). There are also services from Catford up to Kings Cross St Pancras via Elephant and Castle and Blackfriars. For anyone needing the London Overground, Honor Oak Park station is within easy reach.
Ladywell Fields is just outside the front door and is a gem of a park. The Ravensbourne River runs through it creating a fabulous habitat for local wildlife including kingfishers and herons. Amenities can be found in the centre of Catford including high street favourites, independent coffee shops and several highly-rated restaurants and gastro pubs. A few places and events of note in the area include the Blythe Hill Tavern (a camra-award winning pub), a recently-opened cinema (the Catford Mews), Yoga house, a monthly food market and the Catford Arts trail. There are a couple of highly rated primary schools nearby including Holbeach and Rathfern.

detailedDescription:
Set between the well established Sutcliffe Park and the completely new Cator Park in Meridian Gate, Kidbrooke Village, is this bright and well-proportioned 7th floor one bedroom property with a distinctive green rounded balcony. The property comprises an entry hall leading to the open plan kitchen/ living room which in turn extends onto the balcony, an ample bedroom also with access to the balcony, and a modern bathroom. detailedDescription:
A super period home which is being sold with no onward chain.

This super terraced house occupies a popular location and is being sold with the added advantage of no onward chain. It also measures in excess of 850 square feet and has scope for further extension (subject to the usual consents).

Key features include three bedrooms, gas central heating, a bright reception room, a fitted kitchen, a family bathroom at first floor level, dining room wooden floors and a rear garden.

This popular road is nestled between Crofton Park and Honor Oak. Walking distance to Crofton Park station is around 5 minutes and to Honor Oak station around 10 minutes, with trains to London Blackfriars and Farringdon via Thameslink or London Bridge and Dalston via the Overground.

Blythe Fields and Ladywell Fields provide attractive and green open spaces that are popular with running clubs, dog walkers or anyone enjoying the peaceful surroundings

Local shops are literally on your doorstep too which includes a butcher, café, newsagent and a pattern cutter. Good schools close by include Stillness and Gordonbrock Primary<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Situated just off Courtlands Avenue you will find this well presented detached two/three bedroom bungalow set behind its own gated entrance. The driveway provides off street parking for two cars while the garage has been tastefully converted into a home gym. A spacious decked patio & courtyard garden offering useful outdoor space perfect for entertaining. The property itself offers spacious living accommodation, a generous lounge/dining room with a feature wall housing the TV & decorative shelving, Bi-Folds open to the decked patio ideal for the Summer months. The integral kitchen is fitted with a range of wall & base units incorporating a centre island counter. From the inner hallway doors open to the cloakroom, utility room, both bedrooms & the family bathroom which boasts a walk-in shower & large Jacuzzi bath. Bedroom one is generous in size with a door which opens to an enclosed courtyard garden. Bedroom two is currently being used as a walk-in wardrobe.

*There is potential to convert the existing living accommodation to have 4 bedrooms* The current utility room was the former third bedroom, the 2nd bedroom could be split, creating 2 further bedrooms, four in total.

If your considering buying a London apartment, then this could be a great alternative. Look at the advantages, private parking, private outside space, garage, no associated communal charges such as yearly maintenance & ground rent costs.

Located only approximately 0.8 miles to Lee Station & 0.9 miles to Kidbrooke Station providing links to London Bridge within 16 minutes. For an evening of entertainment, The O2 arena is just under 5 miles away. Westfield & Bluewater Shopping Centres are both also within easy reach & London City Airport only 5.2 miles from the property.

*Offered With no onward chain

detailedDescription:
Located close to Ladywell station, this attractive, newly refurbished 3-bedroom period terraced house would make an ideal family home and is offered Chain Free. Guide Price £535,000-£575,000.

Neutrally decorated, the house benefits from 2 spacious reception rooms, a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances including oven, 5 gas ring burner hob & extractor fan.

The family bathroom is also downstairs. Upstairs, there are 2 doubles and a single bedroom.

Externally, the garden has been completely decked out.

The property is located a short walk from Ladywell station allowing quick and easy access into central London. In addition, Lewisham DLR is within easy reach for DLR services into Canary Wharf. Lewisham High Street is also just at the end of the road.

You'll find a variety of amenities along the high street in Ladywell including coffee shops, a deli, a bakery, and a gastro pub. Families can choose from a wide selection of state primary and secondary schools, as well as some respected independent options and Lewisham Hospital is also nearby

Further amenities can be found in the centre of Lewisham including department stores and a weekly outdoor market. Green spaces are dotted all around with Ladywell Fields nearby and Hilly Fields up the road which hosts a regular farmers' market.

agency_name: Winkworth - Forest Hill and New Cross
detailedDescription:
** Guide price £800,000 - £825,000 **

Winkworth are delighted to welcome to the market this beautiful Edwardian family home offering over 1,355 Sq. Ft of living space over two floors.
The ground floor comprises a large reception room measuring 24'6 ft, separate WC, beautiful kitchen/ breakfast room with a newly fitted kitchen, integrated appliances and ample storage with sliding doors opening onto an extensive south-east facing garden measuring over 113 ft. The first floor is home to three double bedrooms, single bedroom, family bathroom and a separate WC.
There is huge potential to extend this property on the ground floor and to utilise the large roof space to create further living accommodation STPP.
The property further benefits from a garage/ workshop accessed from De-Frene road. This is a stunning family home and will appeal to a host of buyers.
Early viewing highly recommended.

Location:
This charming period family home is located on the cusp of the Forest Hill / Sydenham border. Locally there is an abundance of local independent shops, bars, cafes and restaurants including sour dough pizzeria Bona and St. David Coffee House.
Furthermore there are handy high street stores including Sainsbury's and Boots. Forest Hill has a great choice of green spaces and parks with the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away.
Close by is also the neighbourhood of Sydenham which is gaining popularity with a choice of cool independents, cafes and useful shops including bob and Food + Drink.
There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground an easy walk away connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away.
Furthermore Forest Hill is serviced by Southern mainline train services connecting direct to London Bridge and Victoria stations.

detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented five/six bedroom family home which offers versatility and space throughout, arranged over four storeys and spanning over 1,800 sq ft.

Located just a stones throw away from Blackheath Standard the house is perfectly positioned for all your everyday needs and also has Blackheath Village, Greenwich Park & Westcombe Park Station all within walking distance.

Arranged over four storeys the property briefly comprises of; a large and extended (34'11x16'8)open plan kitchen/ family room with separate bedroom and wet room on the lower ground floor.
The ground floor consists of a lovely through reception room and a room currently used as a gym that could also be a study or bedroom if required.
On the first floor is two large double bedrooms and one single bedroom or study as well as the main family bathroom.
The second floor is another great size (15'8x11) bedroom with a huge amount of eaves storage.

To the rear is a well maintained landscaped garden and to the front is off street parking for multiple cars, there is also side access.

This is a beautiful family home with an enormous amount of versatility whether it be for people needing one or more home offices, a growing family or just someone looking for more space it really does tick every box.

Your earliest viewing is highly recommended. Virtual tours can be seen at .

The property is very convenient for transport links with Westcombe Park station nearby and buses stopping for Blackheath train station (0.9 miles) and North Greenwich tube station (1.7 miles). Blackheath Common, (0.1 miles), and Royal Greenwich Park (0.2 miles) are both just a short walk. Blackheath Village with its array or restaurants and bars is only 0.9 miles away and the daily conveniences of Blackheath Standard only 150 yards away.

detailedDescription:
Offered Chain Free and Set on the first floor of this stunning Edwardian Period conversion is this exceptional apartment which has been transformed externally, and provides a quirky interior setting, complimented with masses of natural light and is located on the cusp of Forest Hill, Peckham and Dulwich.

The layout consists of a well-sized bedroom with bespoke built solid oak fitted wardrobe making good use of the available space, separate shower room which has been recently refurbished, has a walk-in shower and is fully tiled. The open plan kitchen/lounge which boasts a large bay window that allows natural light to stream in, ideal for home working. The kitchen has a contemporary design with sleek units, wooden worktops and integrated appliances. The flat is beautifully presented throughout and boasts wide-plank solid wood flooring, high ceilings and tasteful décor.

From the brow of Canonbie Rd you'll see spectacular views of the whole of London skyline. The nearest station is Honor Oak Park (10 minutes' walk) from where there are regular services into London Bridge and Canada Water. Cyclists can reach central London in 20-30 minutes.

The flat is conveniently located within walking distance of the great amenities of Lordship Lane, Honor Oak Park and Forest Hill including independent shops, cafes, delicatessens, restaurants and supermarkets. The Horniman Museum and Gardens, and Peckham Rye Park are also only a short walk away.

Location

Honor Oak Station is the closest station, situated in a trendy parade of shops, and currently being labelled as one of South London's most in trend hot spots with its vast amount of open spaces like Dulwich Woods and The Horniman also close by. The station itself boasts a number of excellent connections into Central London such as London Victoria via Clapham Junction, and London Bridge; as well as East London via the much desired 'Orange' line, most formally known as the Overground line.

Lease Information

Lease Length: 108 years | Service Charge: £1,400 per annum | Ground Rent: £200 per annum

The open plan living and dining areas make for great spaces to entertain whilst benefiting from living on one level. The kitchen is fully integrated with contemporary appliances, there is a good sized bathroom suite and one double bedroom with large built in wardrobe space. A major benefit of the property is the floor to ceiling windows providing outstanding natural light throughout as well as the large, private balcony, which offers superb views of the Central London skyline.

This apartment is situated in the heart of a flourishing local community, with the tremendous amenities of New Cross and Deptford such as trendy bars, restaurants, and independent coffee shops all on your doorstep. With New Cross, Deptford and Deptford Bridge DLR all within walking distance the location could not be better for commuters with easy access into Central London or Canary Wharf via National Rail, Overground and DLR.

Contact Kallars today to arrange your viewing.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
With absolutely breathtaking panoramic views over London and found on the 15th and 16th floors of this newly built block, is this huge three bedroom, two bathroom, duplex penthouse spanning in excess of 1,300sq.ft within the prestigious Kidbrooke Village. EWS1 approved.

With a south and west facing aspect the views from this home are probably the best we have seen and you can take in many of London's landmarks including; St Pauls Cathedral, The Shard, The Wembley Arch, The BT Tower, Canary Wharf, The 02 and Blackheath common and Greenwich Park aswell as Kent. The property is immaculately presented throughout with floor to ceiling windows in every room and plenty of light.

The accommodation comprises; a large entrance hall with storage and utility cupboards, shower room and a very large and bright reception room leading to a modern open plan kitchen and a large private terrace. Upstairs is a large master bedroom with built in wardrobes and ensuite bathroom with two further double bedrooms. Further benefits are an underground car parking space, 24 hour concierge, communal gardens and gymnasium.

This is an outstanding penthouse apartment and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tour can be seen at

Hopgood Tower is part of the sought after Kidbrooke Village development - a new and vibrant London community which offers an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as high end apartments and houses, it will offer new parks, shops, bars, restaurants, schools, sports, healthcare and community facilities. Downstairs at Hopgood Tower is a Sainsbury's local, a newly opened restaurant, pharmacy, convenience store and coffee shop. Sutcliffe Park with beautifully landscaped wetlands, sports facilities and ponds is just a few hundred yards away as is the new Cator park which has been created as part of Kidbrooke Village, including a large children's adventure play area and a multi-use games area.

Transport links to central London are excellent with travel to London Bridge in just 15 minutes from nearby rebuilt Kidbrooke station. Direct trains to Victoria, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Cannon Street also run from here. Hopgood Tower also has direct access to Kidbrooke Station ticket office and onto the platform for trains into London. Blackheath Village, with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, is also close by.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An impressive four bedroom semi-detached period house, situated on this highly sought-after and peaceful road. The property is set in an idyllic location opposite the ever popular, award winning Wells Park.

A magnificent, naturally lit, spacious 1930's style property, sits comfortably in the wonderfully green setting of Upper Sydenham. This house retains many original features from classic rooms, Crittal windows and traditional fireplaces which sit alongside modern additions to the kitchen area and windows. Offering two large reception rooms, a huge 129 ft landscaped, private rear garden, ample off street parking, attractive frontage and garage. The house also provides the opportunity for significant development expansion STPP.
The house is wonderfully located between several popular schools, including Dulwich Prep & College and Sydenham High School. Sydenham and Crystal Palace are a short walk away providing a wide array of local shops, bars and restaurants and also, frequent and quick transport links to the City and central London using Overground and National Rail services.

Properties like this rarely come to market, especially with such exciting potential to extend and a canvas to personalise and create a perfect family home.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £2,000,000-£2,250,000. An impressive four double bedroom, three reception room, two bathroom Grade II listed Georgian House spanning over 2,500sq.ft set on this sought after road and just 320 metres from Blackheath Village.

The property has been well maintained by the current owners over the past 36 years and is in very good decorative order, although still offers scope to enhance. Features include high ceilings, period features, wood flooring, sash windows, feature fireplaces and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation is arranged over four floors and comprises; an entrance porch and large entrance hall, two large reception rooms with interconnecting doors which are currently used as a beautiful large dual aspect through reception room with verandas to the front and rear. There is a new conservatory/garden room beyond the hall . Downstairs is a large kitchen diner with a beautiful handmade Greenwich Woodworks kitchen, wood burner and inter connecting doors to a large third reception room. There is also a utility room and downstairs cloakroom. The first floor offers two huge double bedrooms, both with built in wardrobes, a bathroom and shower room. There are two further large double bedrooms on the top floor and ample eaves storage. To the rear is a lovely and mature 85ft garden with a summer house. The large front garden provides off street parking with mature trees and shrubs.

This is a wonderful period family home and is sold chain free. Your immediate viewing is essential.

The property is located on just 320 metres from Blackheath Village with its array of bars, restaurants, boutique shops and mainline station. Trains from Blackheath to London Bridge take approximately 10 minutes, and approximately 25 minutes to Victoria. The heath is only 0.33 miles and Greenwich Park just a short walk away. The Ofsted outstanding Brooklands, (0.25 miles) and John Ball Primary Schools, (0.3 miles) are very close as are several sought-after private schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School and the Pointer School.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Part of an imposing period property, this chain-free, 1-bedroom ground floor flat is presented in good order, comes with its own patio and benefits from access to a residents' only park at the back.
Located on a much sought-after road, the property is entered through its own front door at the side. The flat is neutrally decorated, has wood laminate flooring, and double glazing and central heating throughout. It comprises an L-shaped reception room/kitchen, a double bedroom and a smart bathroom. There's a south-facing private patio area accessed from the side beyond which is the private park (Brockley Hill Trust Garden). The park itself spans the whole length of Lowther Hill and is for use only by residents who live around it. There's a picnic area, a woodland area and a tennis court, and it plays host to regular events and concerts throughout the year. It's a perfect place for kids to run around and explore nature in safety.
The neighbourhood is a vibrant and friendly one popular among young professionals and families. The house is situated midway between 2 highly-rated primary schools, Stillness and Dalmain. The station is around a 6-minute walk from where there are national rail trains into London Bridge in around 12 minutes. In addition, you can pick up the London Overground towards east and north London meaning you can be in trendy Shoreditch or Hoxton in under 30 minutes. You can also get to Canary Wharf easily via Canada Water.
For evening entertainment, Honor Oak Park has a number of good restaurants. There's a hip, sourdough pizzeria (Mamma Dough), a popular Sardinian (Le Querce), a buzzing tapas bar (Donde), and an award-winning Indian (Babur). You'll also find a couple of coffee shops, a deli and several convenience stores. En route to the station is a Sainsbury's local ideal for picking up groceries on your way back from work.
At the top of the road is Blythe Hill Fields where you can admire sweeping views of the skyline of London.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This unusually spacious, extended home is very well placed for the City and Canary Wharf commuter with Blackheath Village and it's mainline station only a ten minute walk away, plus it's varied array of high end restaurants, bars, boutiques, deli's and excellent local shops.

The heath and the beautiful green open spaces of historic Greenwich Park beyond are also a pleasant walk away and this alongside the numerous good local schools make it perfect for family living too. Features include an impressive, bright and spacious, double aspect reception room, a generous study, a newly fitted, high specification German kitchen, an impressive downstairs shower room, three upstairs bedrooms with a family bathroom.

The current configuration makes for light and airy entertaining and living space which flows beautifully. In terms of outside space the house benefits from a low maintenance rear garden with direct access into the garage (There is potential to convert garage to garden room, subject to the usual consents). There are also attractive communal greens and a children's playground within the development which makes The Plantation perfect for families.

An early appointment to view is highly recommended as extended Span houses are rare to the market and prove to be very sought after. Energy Efficiency Rating D.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home? As soon as you reach the top of the stairs the multiple skylights flood the flat with light, especially in its open plan living area with fantastic storage, a fully equipped kitchen and floor to ceiling bookshelves. The large main bedroom has an ensuite shower room and there is an additional bathroom area, which is always helpful for a joint living space. The second bedroom, which we used for guests, has a floor to ceiling wardrobe and could easily be converted into an office or used as a child's room.

Why are you moving? I am leaving the UK.

What do you love about the area? The neighbours and community are wonderful; helpful and kind but not at all intrusive. The local train station (with a 15 min journey straight to London Bridge) is a short walk away making any commute extra easy, and the nearby pub with its huge garden, excellent menu and friendly staff is one of my favourites in London. The road is quiet but convenient and houses couples and small families. A truly lovely part of London. There is allotment space nearby too.

Property Details:

With pitched ceilings and flooded with natural light from Velux style double glazed windows, the property boasts loft-style accommodation with neutral décor and stylish interiors throughout. Accommodation comprises entrance via the first floor with stairs rising to the second floor landing, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen impressive space for entertaining, relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized bedrooms, with en-suite shower to the master, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and tiled walls.

The property is very conveniently located in a popular area within easy access of Sydenham and Lower Sydenham stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes, all providing excellent connections into Central London and to the surrounding area. There are a variety of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants within a short distance, as well as the wonderful open spaces of nearby Mayow Park.

Viewings are highly recommended.

The Modern Way To Move

Estate agency is stuck in the past, Nested's mission is to empower people to make the move they want, when they want. We're the first estate agent using live data to keep you informed about your performance so you can achieve the best sale price for your home. We even offer a cash advance so you can move when you want, even before you sell. Nested put you in the position of a chain-free buyer, giving you the power to negotiate a better price on your new home. detailedDescription:
""Guide Price £290,000 - £310,000** "I have loved living in this flat, waking up with the sun shining into the bedroom and then at the end of the day the sun shining into the sitting room, looking out at the quiet trees and garden."

What The Seller Says -

"It’s great being so close to Greenwich, Blackheath, the park and going into the city, but still being off the main road on a quiet street and with lovely neighbours - a perfect home."

What The Agent Says -

A truly beautiful modern flat, impeccably re-designed interior, located on the ground level and residents enjoy free off street parking.

The interior comprises a spacious living room, with plenty of space to dine and direct access to a recently fitted kitchen. Inside the kitchen you will notice a fresh look with lovely colour schemes and integrated appliances.

The bedroom is a double size, benefiting from having fitted wardrobes and one of the stand out features of this modern home, has to be the recently fitted bathroom suite, featuring a unique wash hand basin, with shower over bath.

Communal gardens, directly to the rear of the building are an added bonus and there is a long lease remaining on the property.

Deptford Bridge DLR station is only a few minutes away on foot, making the walk to Greenwich mainline station just over five minutes and town centre a further few minutes, where you will find the covered market, royal park and a wide choice of restaurants, river front pubs, supermarkets and much more.<br /><br />
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning share of freehold two double bedroom apartment, with large balcony, set in this fabulous private mews development.

The great size 21' lounge offers wonderful modern style open plan living with double doors onto the balcony.

With floor to ceiling windows, this home is flooded with natural light.

The stylish kitchen & bathroom are sure to please as this really does feel like a 'just move in' home.

There is the added bonus of some outside storage.

Hayes Mews is ideally placed for a choice of stations.

What The Seller Says

We have loved living in this bright, airy and spacious flat for almost 5 years and purchased our Share of Freehold early last year. Sandwiched between Brockley, St Johns, New Cross and Deptford, the neighbourhood has so much to offer, from the charms of Brockley market on a Saturday, easy access some great pubs, bars and restaurants nearby (our favourite is a little Korean place on Lewisham Way). Plenty of green space nearby too, with Hilly Fields, Greenwich Park and Blackheath all within walking distance (there are few things better than enjoying a drink on the heath on a summer's day).

Transport links into the city are great, with the DLR and New Cross station only a 10min walk away. Flat has modern fittings, plenty of storage (including an outside cupboard shared with a neighbour) and a nice balcony to relax on.<br /><br />
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: At over 1,100sqft, this four bedroomed end of terrace townhouse offers spacious accommodation in a rapidly appreciating corner of Surrey Quays. Spread over three floors, the property enjoys a conventional layout with a naturally bright kitchen diner which leads on to a rear south-facing reception room, which opens out via patio gardens to the rear garden. A side garden offers additional development potential too. On the first floor are bedrooms 1 and 2, with an en suite to the master, while on the second floor there are two further bedrooms and the family bathroom. Versatile accommodation which would equally suit a family or an HMO investment, this rare freehold property should have a wide appeal.

address: Wyberton House, 7 Lee Terrace, Blackheath, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Set on the sought after first floor of this impressive Victorian home spanning 957 sq.ft, is this stunning two double bedroom apartment. The Grade II listed Wyberton House, is the former Italianate-style home of Thames Embankment's engineer William Webster.

The property is in excellent decorative order with features including; very high ceilings, stripped floorboards, sash windows, ornate cornicing and gas fired central heating with feature radiators. The accommodation comprises; an entrance porch and entrance hall, a bright and elegant 23'2 x 17'0 reception room and a luxury modern kitchen. There are two double bedrooms to the rear with lovely views and a stylish modern bathroom. The property also benefits from gated off street parking, a share of the freehold and large communal gardens.

This is an outstanding home and immediate viewing is essential. Virtual tours can be seen at

Wyberton House is conveniently located just a 6 minutes' walk from Blackheath station, within easy reach of London Bridge (12 minutes), Cannon Street (23 minutes), Charing Cross (25 minutes) and Victoria (29 minutes). Lewisham station, with direct DLR connection to Canary Wharf, is also easily accessible.

Blackheath Village, with its array of bars, restaurants, boutique shops, is just a few minutes' walk away. Greenwich Park and the Heath itself are also both just a short stroll away.

agency_name: Winkworth - Forest Hill and New Cross
detailedDescription:
Winkworth are delighted to welcome to the market this beautiful studio apartment occupying the second floor of this modern building situated on a private, gated road on the Forest Hill / Sydenham borders.
This stunning property is flooded with natural light due to the southerly facing wall of glass overlooking the large communal gardens.
The current owner has refurbished this property to a very high standard throughout. Open plan living works perfectly and will appeal to many buyers.
The property can be offered chain free for a quick sale. Early viewing highly recommended to avoid disappointment.

Location:
Locally there is an abundance of local independent shops, bars, cafes and restaurants including sour dough pizzeria Bona and St. David Coffee House.
Furthermore, there are handy high street stores including Sainsbury's and Boots. Forest Hill has a great choice of green spaces and parks with the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away and Mayow park on your doorstep. Close by is also the neighbourhood of Sydenham which is gaining popularity with a choice of cool independents, cafes and useful shops including bob and Food + Drink. There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground an easy walk away connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away.
Forest Hill is serviced by Southern mainline train services connecting direct to London Bridge and Victoria stations.

address: New Cross Road, New Cross SE14
detailedDescription:
**Guide Price: £275,000 - £300,000**
A spacious and cool urban pad, this period conversion apartment has bags of character and charm. There is spacious living area measuring over 17 ft which has two feature windows allowing light to flood through the property, there are high ceilings, solid wooden flooring and a picture rail which is a lovely detail that runs around the room, the kitchen is adjacent and open plan with the living area and includes cool grey bespoke units and integrated appliances. The bedroom is bright and light with high ceilings and there is a shower room which is nicely presented with metro tiles and handy built in storage.

Location:
Located on New Cross Road in the heart of New Cross, the property is close to an abundance of vibrant local amenities. Within a few moments' walk you find a great selection of bars, cafes and restaurants, a Curzon cinema, Farmer's Market, the new and world-class Goldsmith's Centre for Contemporary Art gallery, as well as a great choice of independent shops. This property is ideally located for either New Cross or New Cross Gate mainline station and Overground, which get you to London Bridge in around 7 minutes and Shoreditch in approximately 15 minutes, and also offer the weekend night tube. Deptford, Brockley and the historic town of Greenwich are also close by, with their local food and antique markets, and even more independent bars, shops and restaurants, as well as the DLR for easy access to Canary Wharf.
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An impressive four bedroom, three reception room, two bathroom, four storey, Victorian house located in the Blackheath conservation area just 1/2 mile from both Blackheath Village and Hither Green Station.

The property is in excellent decorative order throughout with features including high ceilings, ornate cornicing, wood flooring, ceiling roses, sash windows, period fireplaces, ample bespoke storage and joinery and gas fired central heating.The whole house has been fully fitted with Cat 5e Ethernet cable so that you get full bandwidth internet streaming ideal for working from home in addition to Wi-fi.

The accommodation is arranged over four floors and comprises; an impressive and elegant entrance hall, a large front reception room with lovely views over a green, large rear reception room over looing the garden and a WC.
Downstairs is an attractive modern kitchen with Range style oven, integrated appliances including a wine cooler and open plan to a family/tv room with bi-folding doors to the garden. In addition there is a utility room and large storage area. The first floor offers a large 14'8 x 13'9 master bedroom with built in custom wardrobes, storage and bookcases by Robert Read Interiors and bay window with a lovely outlook over the green, an 11'8 x 10'4 second bedroom with extensive built in wardrobes and a beautiful modern bathroom Finally there are two further bedrooms, one of which is currently set up as a study with desk and very good storage and a modern shower room on the top floor. To the rear is a 45ft garden with terrace, deck and mature shrubs.

This is a wonderful and versatile family home and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

The property is in a very desirable location and is perfect for the commute into the city with Blackheath Station only 0.5 miles away, Lewisham Station and DLR is 0.7 miles and Hither Green is 0.5 miles and close proximity to locals shops including M&S Food Court just 200 yards away and Sainsbury's at Lee Green. The popular open spaces of Manor House Gardens, (0.2miles), Blackheath Common, (0.6miles), and Greenwich Park, (0.9 miles), are all within a short walk. The Ofsted rated "Outstanding" St Margaret's Primary School is extremely close and the house sits in the catchment area for Thomas Tallis secondary school.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
| Iconic Development | Amazing Views | Ultra-Modern Design |

Unveiled to the SE13 market is this ultra-stunning, modern residence, situated in one of South London's most desirable developments; Roma Corte, boasting stunning London skyline views, and is within a stones-throw of a Zone 2 station, as well as the DLR.

The accommodation itself is set on the 13th floor of this stunning development, and surpasses 630sqft of internal flor space, which furthermore boasts masses of natural light throughout. The layout consists of two bedrooms, both of which are double bedroom, the main bedroom benefiting from bespoke custom made wardrobes, a well-proportioned contemporary bathroom suite, ample storage and a stunning double-aspect reception room with an open plan kitchen/diner, as well as direct access onto your very own balcony with views over London. Further benefits include access to a private rooftop terrace, is being sold with no onward chain, a secure allocated underground parking space, and 24 hour concierge!

Lewisham Station is 0.2 mile away, and provides incredible links into a vast amount of well-known stations, such as London Bridge, London Victoria, London Waterloo East, London Charing Cross, and London Blackfriars. The DLR is also located next door to the station, with access into Canary Wharf in under 14 minutes.

We are expecting a frenzy of attention, and with our sellers being incredibly motivated to move home, this will be a hassle free purchase for a keen buyer, looking for an all round purchase. Viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Energy Efficiency Rating B.

detailedDescription:
Elegantly arranged on the first floor of the contemporary Cedarwood Mansions building this exquisite one bedroom flat has been beautifully presented throughout.

This exciting new development in the heart of bustling Deptford, Deptford Landings, is created by a combination of six separate neighbourhoods. Each neighbourhood embraces the idea of beautiful green spaces, ranging from private gardens and courtyards to large expanses of parkland. The development will feature 1,132 new homes over 11.6 acres and introduce new shops, cafes and work space to create not only homes but a community. One of the featured phases is Cedar Wood Square and within this sector is a fabulous range of one, two, three and four bedroom apartments and houses. Each of these apartments have been meticulously designed to combine the idea of sustainable living with beautifully presented and high-quality interiors.

The area of Deptford offers a wide range of popular shops, restaurants and cafes while being just moments from the River Thames and green open spaces with many transport links for convenient access to central London.

The property briefly comprises of; a large (18'7x15'3) reception room, two good size double bedrooms the largest measuring 16'1x14'6 and the second 12'4x11'7 there are two bathrooms and a modern fitted kitchen with built in appliances.

Further benefits include beautiful wooden flooring, off street parking, a large communal garden, loft access and a share of the freehold.

Kidbrooke Park Road is very convenient for transport links with buses stopping for Blackheath Station, 0.5 miles, Greenwich and North Greenwich, 1.9 miles. The property is in excellent decorative order with wood flooring, double glazed windows and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation briefly comprises; an entrance hall with door into the garage, a large 15'2 x 10'11 living room with bay window and fireplace. To the rear is a newly installed and very attractive 21'3 kitchen diner, a separate utility room and downstairs WC. Upstairs are four bedrooms; a very large 15'4 x 11'2 master with built in wardrobes and ensuite shower room, a 15'4 x 9'0 second double, 12'11 x 9'0 third and an L-shape 11'1 x 10'0 (max sizes) forth bedroom. There is also a modern family bathroom. To the rear and with side access is a beautiful 40ft x 32ft south facing garden with patio, artificial lawn and shed. There is off street parking to the front for two cars and an integral garage.

This is a great family home and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

Crosier Close is a sought after gated private estate with similar family homes and the use of extensive communal grounds. Both Eltham and Kidbrooke Stations are approximately one mile away and offer regular services into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria. There are many parks and green open spaces to enjoy, including Hornfair Park, Oxleas Woods, Shrewsbury Park, Blackheath Common and Greenwich Park.

detailedDescription:
Virtual viewing available! EWS1 Compliant! John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this immaculate, larger than average, three double bedroom, two bathroom duplex maisonette with allocated parking situated within the popular New Capital Quay development.

Accessed via the private ground floor entrance, the accommodation is over two floors. To the ground floor, through the spacious hallway, you will find a larger than average reception room, fully integrated kitchen, separate downstairs WC and two large storage cupboards. On the first floor there is a large master bedroom with built in storage and en-suite modern shower room, further two double bedrooms and a three piece modern family bathroom. Further benefits include 24 hour concierge, an allocated parking space in the secure underground car park and a private balcony.

Dowells Street is just off Creek Road which leads into central Greenwich and all the shops, bars and boutiques that the area has to offer, as well as the Docklands Light Railway at Cutty Sark which gives fast and convenient access to Canary Wharf and the City. Within a short walk is the Thames Clipper at Greenwich Pier which provides convenient access to Canary Wharf, the City, Blackfriars, the South Bank, Westminster, the O2 and other prominent stops along the Thames. The River Thames is a stone’s throw away providing access to the Thames Path which makes a fantastic walk and perfect for those who love fresh air! There is a Waitrose in the development and several pubs and restaurants nearby, as are the various historical sights and open spaces of Greenwich Park.

Lease Length: 999 years from 1 January 2008
Service Charge: £1,500 | Ground Rent: £175 semi annually

detailedDescription:
Recently renovated, two double bedroom, ground floor retirement apartment within Stannard Court in SE6.

The main reception / dining room of the apartment is over 26ft long, with space for easy chairs, sofa, dining table, desk and space by the patio doors for a further chair to look out on the gardens. There is a small private patio outside, leading to the communal gardens. The kitchen is off the reception room with fitted oven, hob and extractor and space for a fridge, freezer and washing machine.

There are two double bedrooms, both over 15ft long, with windows overlooking the gardens. The bathroom has a walk in shower, and there two large storage cupboards in the hallway.

The apartment was recently renovated with new ceilings, flooring, carpets and a new walk in shower. The kitchen also had a refresh with new tiles, worktops, sink and hob.

The apartment is for people over the age of 60, or if a couple, one over 60 and one over 55. There is a House Manager on site who can be contacted from different points within the apartment in case of emergency, or when the House Manager is off duty, then a 24 hour emergency careline.

There is a communal lounge for residents, plus communal gardens outside and a shared laundry. Each apartment has a parking space, and there is a rear gate (with key) close to the apartment for more direct access. The lease has 106 years remaining. Service Charge £250pcm

The apartment would suit a person or couple over 60 who want their own home and independence, but with emergency support on hand, and communal facilities such as the lounge and gardens, plus still be close to shops and cafes, etc in Catford town centre.

The current owner has loved being close to the town centre with easy access to buses, trains and shops. She loves her flat being so spacious, and having direct access to the gardens via her patio. She has especially loved tending the plants close to her apartment in the communal gardens.

Amenities
Catford Mews 3 screen cinema complex with café and food market
Catford town centre is 300m away, with many shops, plus the Broadway Theatre, supermarkets and restaurants - Italian (La Pizzeria Italiana), Turkish (EaTurkish, Mekan, Pide), Portuguese, Japanese (Sapporo Ichiban), Chinese, Thai, Lebanese Street Food restaurant (Fayrooz).

Please enjoy the 3D Tour (follow the link), and call Hunters in Catford to arrange your viewing.
