detailedDescription:
This stunning 1-bedroom apartment is located on the 3rd floor at the heart of Deptford village, in the popular Greenland Place development.

It is naturally bright and in immaculate condition and has underfloor heating throughout. It benefits from plenty of storage space and a private balcony receiving afternoon sun. The spacious open plan living room area overlooks the tranquil garden, only accessible to residents. The kitchen is fitted with ultra-modern integrated appliances, an overhead extractor and oven, hob, fridge/freezer, dishwasher and ample storage space for kitchen appliances. The bedroom is currently holding a super-king-size bed, with built-in wardrobe and ceiling to floor mirrors and windows. The generous-sized bathroom has contemporary interior décor, a bath with shower and built in wall cupboards with mirror all across.

Residents have access to a state of the art gym, 24hr concierge, a secure bike shed, underground parking and a large landscaped shared garden. On the doorstep, there are a variety of cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, a yoga centre, a couple of beauty salons and hairdressers and a nursery. Within walking distance there is the high street, with a further plethora of amenities and good transport links only a short ride to London Bridge, and the leafy Southwark Park. The property is located within 3 minutes walk of the Greenland dock, the South dock marina and the Russia Dock woodland and ecological park. It is also within 5 minutes walk of the Thames river, with stunning views of the city and a boat terminal going to Greenwich and to the city. A short walk from the terminal is the popular Surrey Docks community farm.

There is currently a regeneration plan in place in the area (), which will include the opening of a new high street, independent shops and public spaces.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
The Cotton Yard is a tucked away yet central, beautifully landscaped enclave within the Hatcham Conservation Area of New Cross Gate. Large Sedum roofs, mature trees and carefully designed, planted gardens provide an air of tranquillity in this popular London Borough.
Each of the nine bespoke homes provides either two or three floors of carefully configured space comprising open plan kitchen living to the ground floor and a private garden. The upper floors comprise airy bedrooms filled with light, a selection of en suites and family bathrooms.
Each home has a private parking space within the courtyard and electric charging points have been installed.
The unique boutique development is ideally located within Zone 2 allowing commuters effortless access to central London with New Cross Gate just a twelve minute walk away. Regular services include London Bridge, Canada Water, Victoria and Charing Cross.

detailedDescription:
The location of this home offers a great lifestyle, situated in the triangle that is Hither Green, Blackheath Village and Lewisham for its superior transport links. This home would serve as a perfect first step on the ladder.

This 1930's Art Deco building is within walking distance of Lewisham town centre, Manor House Gardens and Manor Park. The local residents enjoy frequenting Blackheath Village for its wide selection of restaurants and pubs all of which is just under a mile away.

This home is perfectly placed for a choice of three train stations. Train services run from Lewisham to London Bridge in less than 10 minutes, Charing Cross in 18 minutes, London Cannon Street in 14 minutes and London Victoria in 23 minutes. DLR services allow you to reach historic Greenwich in under 10 minutes, Canary Wharf in 15 minutes, and Stratford Westfield in around half an hour! There is also a wide selection of bus routes, all of which are easily accessible.

The flat itself is naturally decorated throughout, just waiting for you to put your own stamp on the property.

There are low outgoings with communal heating and hot water incorporated in the service charge, no ground rent, and a low council tax band 'B'. The property is offered chain free and also benefits from a long lease of 148 years unexpired.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £975,000-£1,025,000. A superb and larger than usual, four bedroom, two bathroom, two reception room semi-detached Edwardian located in this very sought after road (within the Belmont Conservation area), just 0.6 miles from Blackheath Village and 0.3 miles from Lewisham station and DLR.

The property has been well maintained by the current vendor and features include; high ceilings, cornicing, picture rails, period fireplaces, stripped floorboards, stained glass, double glazed windows and gas fired central heating.

The accommodation comprises; a lovely entrance hall with feature tiled flooring and stained glass front door and window, large living room to the front with bay window, dining room and a large modern kitchen breakfast room. Upstairs is a fantastic master suite with large double bedroom, built in wardrobes and ensuite bathroom with separate shower and bath. There are two good size double bedrooms, a fourth bedroom and a bathroom with separate WC. To the rear is a well-kept 45ft garden with lawn, flower beds, mature shrubs and terrace.

This is a wonderful home and will be very popular. Your immediate viewing is essential. Virtual tours can be seen at

The property is in a very convenient location and is perfect for the commute into the City, West End or Canary Wharf with Lewisham Station and DLR within 0.25 miles and Blackheath Station 0.65 miles. Lewisham station gives direct access to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria as well as Canary Wharf and Bank on the DLR. The popular open spaces of Blackheath Common, (0.43 miles), Greenwich Park, (1.06 miles), Hilly Fields, (1.09 miles) and Manor House Gardens, (1.05 miles), are all within a short walk. The popular street food Model Market is a few minutes' walk and there are several popular primary schools close by. Blackheath Village with its array of bars, restaurants and boutique shops is just a short walk away.

detailedDescription:
A stylish and modern 2-bedroom apartment located on the 2nd floor at the heart of Deptford’s foundry development plot. With Deptford, Deptford Bridge DLR and New Cross station all within walking distance, and a 6-minute train to London Bridge, this makes this property the ideal location for work and leisure, in a Zone 2 location.

The apartment is in superb conditions throughout and benefits from modern stylish décor, ample inbuilt storage in the entrance hall, leading to a spacious open plan reception room and kitchen ideal for entertaining friends and family.

The kitchen is presented in excellent condition with a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, immaculate sleek range of matching high gloss walls and base units with countertops and equipped with ample storage space, an overhead extractor and oven, induction hob, fridge/freezer, ample storage space for kitchen appliances.

The private balcony is an extension of the living/reception area. The spacious bedrooms also offer more inbuilt storage space, useful and well-structured inbuild wardrobes and an en-suite modern bathroom with contemporary interior décor linked to the master bedroom.

This property offers further benefits from a private balcony with stunning City views, central heating, double glazing and is located on this popular development in the heart of Deptford village with great transport links and convenient bars/restaurants within walking distances.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £995,000-£1,075,000 An absolutely stunning and extensively renovated two/three bedroom, one/two reception room apartment set in this magnificent detached Cator Estate house once the residence of renowned Philosopher John Stuart Mill and also of Lord Aberdeen, the Prime Minister.

Found on the top (second) floor, the property has been extensively refurbished, within the last 3 years, by the current vendor to a very high standard. Features include; complete rewiring, usb sockets, cornicing, solid oak flooring, insulated and sound proofed floors, dual zone Nest controlled gas fired central heating with new Combi boiler, feature radiators, underfloor heating to the bathroom and lounge diner, integrated speaker system including 5.1 surround in living room, sash windows and plantation shutters.

The accommodation comprises, an elegant 24'4 x 16'7 living room with feature marble fireplace and bay window and open plan to a gorgeous luxury kitchen. The kitchen includes a solid quartz worktop and high end integrated Siemens and Miele appliances including; wine cooler, induction hob, coffee machine, microwave oven, oven and steam oven, dishwasher and washing machine. There is a very large dual aspect master bedroom with built in wardrobes, a good size second double bedroom and a third double bedroom/second reception room currently used as a dining room and study. The property boasts a superb luxury modern bathroom with free standing bath, double walk in shower and feature wash hand basin. To the rear is a vast and gorgeous 190ft x 95ft communal garden and to the front is a concealed driveway on the approach to the house. The property also benefits from off street parking with a garage.

This is an outstanding apartment finished to the highest specification and your earliest viewing is vital. Video tours can be seen at .

Blackheath Park is the flagship road of the prestigious private Cator Estate. The Ofsted outstanding Brooklands Primary School is within a few minutes' walk and several sought-after schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School and the Pointer School are all close by. The property is located just 0.49 miles from Blackheath Village with its array of bars, restaurants, boutique shops and mainline station. Trains from Blackheath to London Bridge take approximately 10 minutes, and approximately 25 minutes to Victoria. Greenwich Park and the Heath are both just a short walk.

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to acquire an apartment with large gated communal gardens in a prime part of Hither Green, steps away from Mountsfield Park.

This top floor apartment is situated in an attractive and unique location with windows facing east, south and west for exceptional views. The property has been stylishly decorated by the owner to provide great living space and it is on the market for the first time since it was built almost 25 years ago.

The apartment was bought on paper as the best property in the block having up to 2 extra windows and 20 cm higher ceiling of most other properties in the building. Also, it has unique access from the hallway to a private loft storage area of approximately 60 sq m.

It comprises an entrance hallway, two double bedrooms, a bathroom, a large living area and a full-fitted kitchen.

The master bedroom contains a fitted wardrobe and it easily allows for a king size bed. The second bedroom is also a good size and it allows for a queen size bed or it could be used as a study room.

The living area is spacious and particularly bright and airy with 3 south/west windows attracting plenty of natural light.

The kitchen is contemporary with ample worktop space for food preparation and offers integrated appliances.

The bathroom consists of ceramic tiled walls and floor and has a bathtub with shower, hand washbasin and WC.

The property also benefits from a secure intercom entry system, an allocated parking bay and beautiful communal gardens with direct access from the communal staircase.

The location has become hugely sought after due to being right on the doorstep to Mountsfield Park on the top of a hill and within close walking distance to shops, cafes and pubs. Also, within short walking distance Anytime Fitness gym, Hither Green station and many bus services. The location further offers easy road links to the A205, A20 to the M25 and A2 to the Blackwall tunnel.

This is a must-see apartment and early viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Offered for Sale with No Onward Chain is this beautiful two double bedroom, modern, first floor flat situated in a quiet location with attractive Green views to three sides and within easy reach of Hither Green Train Station and a stones throw from Mountsfield Park.

Set over approximately 635 sq ft and in excellent condition throughout, this is a flat in a location that is ultra convenient for both Lewisham train station and some fantastic local amenities right on your doorstep, which includes Greenwich Park and Blackheath Village.

The internal accommodation comprises a bright and spacious lounge dining room which has been tastefully decorated with engineered wooden flooring. A sleek and ultra modern kitchen has been recently installed and is a real feature of the flat with mosaic tiled flooring, integrated appliance and lots of work top and cupboard space. Both bedrooms are great sized doubles which have been beautifully designed and decorated. The bathroom is fully tiled and modern, with a shower over a full size bath.

Further benefits to include, a right to manage for the residents, double glazed windows throughout, excellent storage internally, gas central heating and a long lease.

Location wise Hither Green Train Station is 0.4 miles away which provides a frequent service into London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross.

*please click the brochure link to book your viewing*

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £425,000-£450,000. A superb two double bedroom Victorian conversion flat found on the second (top) floor of this impressive semi detached period house close to the Heath, Blackheath Village and Station.

The accommodation briefly comprises; a large 13'6 x10'7 reception room, a good sized 10'7x10'3 master bedroom, a 15' x 8'2 second double bedroom as well as a modern bathroom and kitchen with built in appliances. There is also the added benefit of a separate study area, ideal for those working from home. To the rear of the property is a large garden which is communal however the residents in the building have agreed to divide it up so everyone can have their private part of the garden. There is also off street parking to the front and the property is sold chain free.

This is an impressive apartment and your immediate viewing is highly recommended. Virtual tours can be seen on the usual websites.

The property is very convenient for transport links with buses stopping for Blackheath Station, 0.7 miles, Greenwich and North Greenwich, 1.9 miles. Blackheath Common, (0.4 miles), and Greenwich Park, (0.8 miles), are both just a short walk and Blackheath Village with its array or restaurants, bars and boutique shops is only 0.6 miles.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A fantastic opportunity presents itself to acquire this end of terraced house situated on Wiverton Road, SE26.

Please call on the number below for viewing event availability.

Description
A fantastic opportunity presents itself to acquire this end of terraced house situated on Wiverton Road, SE26. This property does require modernisation throughout and is perfect for some who would like to add their own stamp and comprises six bedrooms, two reception rooms, dining room, kitchen, utility, bathroom and separate w/c with benefits to include private garden and no onward chain.
Wiverton Road is set within easy reach of Sydenham, Penge and Crystal Palace which combined offer a plethora of bars, shops, restaurants and transport links providing easy access to the city and surrounding areas.
Wells Park and Crystal Palace Park are also close by providing a range of activities to include the National Sports Centre and Boating Lake
Transport links are available close by at Sydenham (London Overground and Southern Railway access into London Bridge and Victoria) Penge East (Southeastern Railway providing direct access into London Victoria) and Crystal Palace (Network Rail and London Overground). There are also a range of bus routes available.
Early viewing requests are highly recommended to avoid disappointment!
This property is set for sale by Barnard Marcus powered by iam Sold.

Auctioneer's Comments
This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).

The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack.

detailedDescription:
** Guide £475,000 - £500,000 **

Winkworth are delighted to welcome to the market this beautifully presented Edwardian maisonette comprising two bedrooms, separate 15'3 reception with stunning original features, three-piece family bathroom, 16'4 kitchen / breakfast room and the use of a south-west facing private rear garden with a workshop.
This delightful property has been refurbished to a very high standard throughout and will appeal to many buyers.
Early viewing highly recommended.

Location:
This charming maisonette is located on the cusp of the Forest Hill / Sydenham border. Locally there is an abundance of local independent shops, bars, cafes and restaurants including sour dough pizzeria Bona and St. David Coffee House. Furthermore there are handy high street stores including Sainsbury's and Boots. Forest Hill has a great choice of green spaces and parks with the much admired Horniman Museum and Gardens a short stroll away. Close by is also the neighbourhood of Sydenham which is gaining popularity with a choice of cool independents, cafes and useful shops including bob and Food + Drink. There are great connections for commuters across the capital with the Overground an easy walk away connecting to Canada Water in less than approx. 15 minutes, Shoreditch High Street in around 20 minutes, with Highbury and Islington approx. 35 minutes away. Furthermore Forest Hill is serviced by Southern mainline train services connecting direct to London Bridge and Victoria stations.

detailedDescription:
Guide price *** £285,000 - £300,000 ***

This spacious two-bedroom flat offers a fantastic location in Deptford and within walking distance to New Cross.

Set on the first floor of this post war building, the flat comprises a good-sized living area with a separate kitchen, two bedrooms, a three-piece family bathroom and a balcony with a seating area. There is also a permitted parking space outside which can easily be acquired from the local authority.

Situated just a short walk away from trendy Deptford High Street for an array of bars, restaurants and shops as well as a vibrant market 3 times per week, the property is in an excellent spot. There are a number of close transport links including New Cross and Deptford Rail Station which provide fantastic links to London Bridge and the City via South Eastern rail and Thameslink. Bus stop routes 47,188 and 199 both directions are on your doorstep which are a few stops to the famous Greenwich Market, Cutty Sark DLR station and also 15 minute bus ride to Surrey Quays and Canada Water Stations. The property is easily accessible to Thames Path.

Contact Kallars to arrange your viewing today.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to present to the market a great opportunity to acquire this chain free, 3 double bed maisonette with Share of Freehold located on the prestigious road, Vanbrugh Park, directly facing onto The Heath.

The property is arranged over 3 floors. On the first floor you will find the light and sizeable living room with wonderful views of the heath, perfect for entertaining friends and family, a stunning modern kitchen with high end integrated appliances and plenty of storage space. A downstairs WC in excellent condition. The property also benefits from a private west facing patio fronting the heath.

The property comprises of 3 spacious bedrooms and an upstairs family bathroom with modern interior décor and even more storage space. The property benefits from a very long lease with 948 years remaining, £21PA Ground Rent [fixed] and low service charges, an integrated garage for off-street parking, very convenient for transport links with Blackheath and Westcombe Park stations nearby, offering easy access to Central London. Also, en-route from the regular bus routes allowing for further use of close by stations, Blackheath, and North Greenwich.

Vanbrugh Park is just a moments’ walk from Blackheath village, several exemplary Ofsted rated schools, Royal Greenwich park and also in close proximity to the convenient restaurants/bars for nightlife or for a family outing. The property is in a Conservation Area.

detailedDescription:
A stunning top floor flat that occupies a great location within easy reach of Brockley Overground, Hillyfields Park and a super selection of shops along Brockley Road

This attractive period property has it all - Bright rooms, stylish interior and a quiet, yet convenient location. The property is presented in good condition and measures in excess of 500 square feet.

Key features include: A generous kitchen/reception room which is perfect for relaxing or entertaining, a large double bedroom with Velux windows and handy eaves storage, an en suite shower room, gas central heating, separate WC, super loft storage and a long lease of circa 160 years.

Brockley Overground and Crofton Park stations are within half a mile, offering fast and frequent trains into London Bridge, London Blackfriars, Shoreditch High Street or West Croydon. Ladywell station is a little further away but still within walking distance. There are also numerous good shops along the high street including supermarkets, cafe's, restaurants, coffee shops and bars.

Brockley food market and Hilly Fields Park are also close by.

Early viewing is recommended.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
The Address are delighted to present this beautiful two bedroom, first floor, period flat to the market. Set in a large period property on a sought after road in Sydenham. The flat consists of two good sized bedrooms, bright lounge with modern kitchen and a modern bathroom with panelled bath with shower and screen.

There is off street parking for one car but the road has no parking restrictions. To the rear is a communal garden accessed via a side gate.

Offered to the market with share of freehold and a 990 year lease.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A spacious 1920’s semi-detached four-bedroom house with original integral garage, off street parking for 3+ cars and an approx. 85 ft x 35ft south-west facing rear garden. There is great potential for extending at the rear or into the large loft (subject to planning permission).

This substantial family home offers on the ground floor: Two generous reception rooms, a large kitchen/breakfast room with integrated appliances, downstairs WC and a conservatory accessed from the dining room. Doors from both the kitchen and conservatory open onto the patio and the garden with a lawn, pond, large borders and a pergola. The garden enjoys the sun for most of the day with some amazing sunsets – perfect for BBQs and family parties. For storage, there is a brick built shed which was originally a WW2 air raid shelter.

Upstairs there are three good sized double bedrooms plus a large single bedroom (all with fitted wardrobes) and a family bathroom. From the landing there is access to the large loft which could easily be converted to provide an extra one or two bedrooms and bathroom (subject to planning permission).

The property is located approx. 0.6 mile from Lee station and 0.9 mile from Grove Park station offering direct access to London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross & Cannon Street stations with changes possible at Lewisham for the DLR and New Cross for the East London Line.

Baring Road and Coopers Lane primary schools are close by and Northbrook Park, Horn Park and Chinbrook Meadows just a short walk away.

Energy Efficiency Rating: D

detailedDescription:
A highly individual property with an impressive light and spacious warehouse style design located just yards from the open heath and offers easy access to Lewisham and the DLR.

Internally the property has been recently modernised to a high standard including a brand new high specification kitchen with fully integrated appliances and a beautifully remodelled en-suite bathroom.

There is an impressive 35ft x 18ft lounge with a feature separated glazed study area. Accessed from a large internal hallway there are four bedrooms, the master has en-suite bathroom and has the added benefit of a separate dressing area. Bedroom three also offers direct access to the communal gardens (the only property in this part of the development that has this benefit).

Externally the property enjoys access to a beautifully mature communal garden which is arranged over two levels. There is hard standing, gated, secure off street parking for both residents and visitors. Energy Efficiency Rating C.

Term: 102 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Unveiled to the SE4 market is this incredibly sought after Victorian split-level conversion flat situated on one of Brockley's most sought after roads; Tyrwhitt Road - providing stunning accommodation throughout, and direct access to a beautifully landscaped garden.

The accommodation itself is set over two floors, with the entrance level benefitting from a rare to find utility room, which is incredibly useful. Your private staircase then guides you down to the hallway, which further guides you to two spacious double bedrooms, the master benefitting from built in wardrobes, ample storage to the hall, and a well-proportioned four piece bathroom suite. This stunning conversion further comprises a spacious yet incredibly cosy reception room, which interlinks perfectly into the separate fully fitted kitchen, with the stylish stable doors leading you directly out onto the terrace. Additionally you have direct access to a stunning landscaped 114ft communal garden, and the added benefit of having a private driveway.

Tyrwhitt Road itself is a premier road within the local community. The property proudly features on a stunning tree lined street with a wide selection of Victorian facades. St Johns Station itself is under a 10 minute walk (according to Google Maps) which has superb connections into London Blackfriars, London Bridge and London Cannon Street. Lewisham DLR and train stations are under a 15 minute walk (according to Google maps) with direct links to London Bridge and London Cannon Street. Brockley Station is under a twenty minute walk (according to Google maps) and offers superb links into London Victoria & London Bridge. The station also serves the highly rated East London Overground Line which has four trains per hour linking you to Dalston Junction and Highbury & Islington via Shoreditch High Street. Local attractions include Hilly Fields park, and Brockley farmers market for local fresh produce, artisan breads and pastries, plants and flowers.

Sure to attract a wide variety of buyers, be quick to view as if history is anything to go by in this pocket of SE4, these highly requested conversions do sell extremely well! Please free to contact our Acorn Brockley office at your earliest convenience, and please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Energy Efficiency Rating: D

detailedDescription:
Yopa are delighted to present to the market this 3 double bedroom apartment situated less than 5 minutes walk to Surrey Quays Overground station.

This 3 double bedroom penthouse flat is an amazing first time home. The bright and spacious lounge has direct access to the fully fitted kitchen and large private terrace which is perfect for children to play and family bbq's. This modern development, is ideal for a family with secure entry and on site secure bike shed.

This really is a must see for any first time buyer who is looking to take their first step on the ladder in this exciting and vibrant part of London that offers links to London Bridge and Canary Wharf in 20 mins, it is also a great purchase for an investor looking to add to their portfolio.
Within a short walk is Surrey Quays shopping centre, which has a large Tesco superstore, as well as various useful day to day stores such as Boots, Superdrug and Starbucks. Surrey Docks Fitness and Water Sports Centre, Southwark Park, Deptford Park and Rotherhithe Ecological Park providing hours of fun for all the family in less than 10 mins from home. With amazing transport links within easy reach makes this suitable for buy to let investors and commuters.
For more details or to arrange a viewing, call now.

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented four bedroom terraced home within easy access of excellent transport links and amenities. The property has been superbly updated, offering light and spacious accommodation neutrally decorated throughout, with further features including a generous reception room with access to the rear garden, well equipped kitchen and two bathrooms with quality floor coverings throughout. Representing an excellent first time or investment purchase, the property further benefits from gas central heating, double glazing, ample inbuilt storage and a driveway.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall on the basement level with downstairs w.c, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with wide double glazed French doors leading to the rear garden and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The separate newly installed kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and stylish tiled splash-back, incorporating inset sink unit, large gas hob with overhead extractor and separate electric oven, and further space for appliances. On the ground floor there are two good sized double bedrooms and a family bathroom with modern white three piece suite and elegant tiling. On the second floor there are a further two double bedrooms and a shower room.

Access point for 10 different busses within a 2 minute radius, 6 of which go to central london.

Within walking distance to New Cross British Rail Station, New Cross Gate Station, Brockley Station, Deptford Bridge Station and Deptford DLR station all have links to central london.

Viewings are strongly recommended - please click 'brochure link' to book instantly!

Location

This property is in an excellent location with good transport links. There are cafes, shops schools and green spaces all in a short walking distance making this property ideal for families. Close to New Cross British Rail Station, Deptford, Brockley and Telephgrapah Hill. Easy access for Brockley British Rail Station. Close to Goldsmiths College and DLR in Deptford SE8.

Gardener House - Apartment 2.06
3 bedroom 2nd floor apartment offering 93 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.£152,500 for a 25% share of £610,000 and a deposit as low as £15,500 and a minimum income of £75,000.

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

L&Q at Kidbrooke Village
Situated in the leafy green oasis of Kidbrooke SE3, a home at this development will offer you to escape and unwind from the demands of modern life. Built to a high specification, your new home will come equipped with a fully fitted kitchen featuring integrated appliances, built-in wardrobes to the master bedroom and outdoor space in the form of a balcony or terrace – everything you need for modern living.

As well as having a wonderfully crafted new home, you will benefit from some outstanding onsite facilities, surrounded by landscaped gardens, acres of open parkland and a flourishing new community. Convenience is at the heart of Kidbrooke. The Village Centre is home to retail shops, a supermarket, coffee shop, dentist, doctor and pharmacy.

Greenwich Connections
From the onsite Kidbrooke Station, you can reach London Bridge in 16 minutes* and Waterloo East in 19 minutes* connecting to London Underground mainline stations enabling you to get into and out of the city.
There are also safe pedestrian and cycle routes across the development.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

Situated in the leafy green oasis of Kidbrooke SE3, a home at this development will offer you to escape and unwind from the demands of modern life. Built to a high specification, your new home will come equipped with a fully fitted kitchen featuring integrated appliances, built-in wardrobes to the master bedroom and outdoor space in the form of a balcony or terrace – everything you need for modern living.

As well as having a wonderfully crafted new home, you will benefit from some outstanding onsite facilities, surrounded by landscaped gardens, acres of open parkland and a flourishing new community. There are also safe pedestrian and cycle routes across the development.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
*guide price £385,000 - £399,995*
| Stunning Victorian Façade | Stylish Interior Design | Courtyard Garden |

Unveiled to the SE23 market is this highly sought after Victorian ground floor flat, with it’s own front door, providing masses of character and an incredibly tasteful interior finish.

The accommodation itself is set on the ground floor, with your own front door guiding you into a welcoming open plan area, which has been expertly designed with the forest green paintwork and wood furnishings, providing an in trend design and feel. Additionally the flat consists of two spacious bedrooms, both of which lead you directly out into your own courtyard garden, semi-open plan to the ‘L’ shaped designed kitchen, ample storage and a well proportioned bathroom suite.

In terms of location, Forest Hill and Catford Station are both within a similar distance away, boasting superb links into London Charing Cross, London Waterloo East, London Bridge and into the City of London via the Thameslink line, as well as Forest Hill Station having access into East London via the very highly rated London Overground Line; calling at stations such as Dalston, Canada Water, Shoreditch and Highbury & Islington. The property is within short walking distance of a number of green spaces and parks including Blythe Hill Fields, Riverview Walk and River Pool Linear Park and Mayow Park. Kilmorie and Rathfern primary schools are both close by, which are in high demand and are a key driver to clientele over spilling into Forest Hill.

Due to the recent success we have had on similar properties within the location, we envisage this unique family home having great success on the open market, and would highly advise viewing this property at your earliest opportunity, by contacting our Acorn Forest Hill office now!

Lease Length: 171 years | Service Charge: £1,105 per annum | Ground Rent: Peppercorn | Energy Efficiency Rating: C.

detailedDescription:
*Guide Price 500,000 - 525,000*

Unveiled to the SE26 market is this three bedroom Victorian terraced house. The property is located moments from the convenient Bell Green retail park, as well as Lower Sydenham Station (just 0.3 miles away). Offering an impressive overall size of 1032 square feet!

Internally the period residence boasts three double bedrooms, a large through lounge (which could be separated into two separate receptions), a modern kitchen and downstairs bathroom. The rear garden is sizable and not overlooked. The house is well presented overall with further scope to enhance.

Bell Green Retail Park is moments from the property, offering a vast choice of retails which includes one of South London's largest Sainsburys.

Lower Sydenham Station is located just 0.3 miles from the house and offers direct access into several main London terminals, including London Bridge in approximately 18 minutes!

Contact Acorn Sydenham to arrange your appointment to view!

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £425,000 - £450,000 | Handsome Victorian Façade | Split-Level | Sought After Area |

Unveiled to the SE13 market is this incredibly characterful, yet unique, split-level Victorian conversion flat that provides a stylish interior design, and being situated in one of South London's most well connected areas at present.

The accommodation itself is quite simply dazzling, with it’s unique yet spacious layout, surpassing 787sqft/73.1sqm of floor space, which is set over two floors, and provides masses of natural light throughout. The layout consists of two large double bedrooms, a contemporary yet well sized bathroom, storage to the hall, a modern yet bespoke ‘L’ shape kitchen design, and a charming front reception room complimented with a feature fireplace, as well as a grand almost floor to ceiling bay window.

This pocket of SE13 as mentioned above, is becoming a real-hotspot in South London, with Ladywell Village not far and benefitting from it’s array of local boutiques and cafes, St Johns is almost across the street, a local farmers market on Saturday 500/600 yards up the road, and Hilly Fields being your closest green space which is very popular with local residents (ideal for dog walking). Lewisham Station is only 0.3 miles away, and offers brilliant connections into London Cannon Street, London Victoria, London Charing Cross, London Bridge, and London Waterloo East, as well as Canary Wharf via the DLR.

This type of period residence tends to be in high demand once launched, so we expect this superb split-level conversion flat having a real success on the open market, so viewing at your earliest convenience is highly recommended by contacting our Acorn Lewisham office now!

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

detailedDescription:
Spacious and bright Apartment one stop away from London Bridge, two stops from Cannon Street/Bank. Ideal first time buy, city pad or investment property.

Located in the heart of Deptford, this modern One Bedroom, Ex - Local Authority, Fifth Floor Flat, has been fully renovated recently. Kitchen and Living Room feature large wall-to-wall windows which allow you to enjoy plenty of natural sunlight throughout the day.

Accommodation comprises of a spacious living room, separate eat-in Italian terracotta style kitchen, balcony, a modern mosaic tiled shower room, one double bedroom and a separate storage room. Benefits include double glazed windows throughout, smart heating and lighting controls (via Phone App), an intercom entry system and communal area with two lifts.

Additional highlights are the 5th floor view of Canary Wharf from the bedroom, and free street parking around the estate.

The apartment is positioned in a perfect setting for the London commuter; with Deptford rail & Canada Water tube stations, Deptford Bridge & Cutty Sark DLR all offering an easy commute into Central London and the City.

The area is undergoing massive development and offers a wealth of entertainment on your doorstep, take a stroll along Deptford High Street for a range of cafes, bars, and restaurants. Greenwich is also within close reach as is Blackheath, New Cross, Canada Water, and London Bridge.

detailedDescription:
Complete before stamp duty holiday finishes!

Tenure: No onward chain. Share of Freehold

Doorsteps is delighted to bring to the market this well presented two bedroom purpose built ground floor maisonette with garden. This spacious apartment comprises entrance hall, a light and spacious kitchen and dining/sitting room, living room, two bedrooms (alternatively three bedrooms) and a fully tiled bathroom. There are modern laminate floors and a kitchen with integrated appliances, double glazing and a lovely west facing private garden. The property underwent complete refurbishment and was complete repainted this spring.

No onward chain.

Location

Bordered by popular Blackheath and Kidbrooke villages with its variety of cafes, restaurants and boutique shops, this area offers plenty of green spaces and more affordable option for younger families. Kidbrooke and Lee train stations are within half a mile and trains reach London Bridge in 13 minutes. Nearby Lewisham accessible by busses also offers access to the DLR, indoor shopping centre and a daily street market, a surprising amount of green space and restaurants serving world cuisine.

Share of feehold, no service charges
Other information


Local Authority: Royal Borough of Greenwich

Council Tax: Band C (£1,376 pa)

Living Room

13'1" x 12'10"

Laminated floor, double panel radiator.

Kitchen

10'2" x 9'2"

Double glazed window to rear, range od wall and base units, integrated electric hob and oven, extractor hood, stainless steel sink unit with mixer tap, integrated washing machine, laminated floor.

Bedroom One

11'6" x 11'6"

Double glazed window to front, laminated floor, double panel radiator.

Bedroom Two

11'2" x 7'3"

Double glazed window to front, laminated floor, double panel radiator.

Bathroom

7'3" x 5'5"

Double glazed window to rear, panel enclosed bath with shower attachment and glass shower screen, wash hand basin and low level WC, partly tiled walls and fully tiled floor, heated towel rail.

Garden

Approx: 38'5" x 32'5"

Large private rear garden with paved patio area, laid to lawn, various trees and plants. West facing with plenty of sun in the afternoon. Two sheds for storage. Rear access via gate.

Private garden to the front with ornamental plants.

detailedDescription:
We are delighted to bring to the market this lovely two bedroom flat that is situated within an attractive period property and being sold chain free.

Benefiting from two double bedrooms and good sized lounge and separate kitchen.

The property is very well located with Hither Green station only 0.4 of a mile. There is also a selection of local shops by the station, including a Sainsbury's local. There is also a number of parks nearby including Manor Park and Manor House Gardens. The DLR at Lewisham is 0.7 of a mile.

Being close to Blackheath village, you can enjoy the many shops, bars and restaurants that are on offer and also the very famous heath and park.

address: Bowspirit Apartments, Creekside, Deptford, London SE8
detailedDescription:
A large one bedroom apartment found on the second floor, measuring 548 sqft and located just moments away from the Greenwich village centre, DLR and rail connections.

In perfect condition throughout the property comprises of a super open plan kitchen/living room that has access onto a large covered balcony that runs along the length of the apartment. There is a good sized double bedroom with a fitted wardrobe, along with a bathroom fitted to the highest standard. The property also benefits from good storage space. Added features include hard wood flooring, gas central heating and a concierge onsite. There is also a communal gymnasium.

Bowspirit Apartment is part of the popular Kent Wharf development on Creekside, which was only built a few years ago. This is located close to the Greenwich/Deptford divide and is only a short walk to both town centre, along with shops, mainline rail and DLR.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £475,000-£500,000. With very high ceilings and found on the hall floor of this impressive period house. A beautiful two bedroom apartment with off street parking in this sought after location just off the heath.

The property is in excellent decorative order with very high ceilings, wood flooring, sash windows and gas fired central heating.

Set on the hall (raised ground) floor, the accommodation briefly comprises; a stunning 21'0 x 14'10 lounge diner with a superb modern kitchen and island. A good size 14'8 x 10' master bedroom with built in wardrobes, second bedroom which is also perfect as a study and an attractive modern bathroom with tiled surround. There are also two storage cupboards within the hallway.

There is a large communal garden to the rear and off street parking to the front.

This is a superb apartment and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

Located on a sought after beautiful tree-lined road, the property is very convenient for transport links with Westcombe Park station nearby and buses stopping for Blackheath train station (0.8 miles) and North Greenwich tube station (1.8 miles). Blackheath Common, (0.1 miles), and Royal Greenwich Park (0.4 miles) are both just a short walk. Blackheath Village with its array or restaurants and bars is only 0.7 miles away and the daily conveniences of Blackheath Standard only 200 yards away.

detailedDescription:
Offered to the SE26 market chain free, is this characterful two bed split-level conversion. Occupying the upper levels of an attractive Victorian residence, this unique conversion has a lot to offer including a share of freehold tenure!

Internally the split-level conversion boasts a generous open plan kitchen / reception measuring 15'11 x 15'6, two bedrooms (master on the upper level), a modern bathroom and ample storage space. The kitchen is newly fitted (2020).

The building has recently benefited from a recent upgrade externally (March 2020), which included a new roof, sand blasting, re-pointing, re-painting a brand new front door.

Sydenham Station is just 0.5 miles from the property and offers direct access into several main London terminals, including London Bridge in less than 20 minutes!

Contact Acorn Sydenham to arrange your viewing by appointment only!

detailedDescription:
Beresford Residential, West Norwood’s leading independent estate agent are delighted to offer this impeccable three-bedroom, three-bathroom house the sales market.

This attractive property will instantly capture you with its bright and modern interior. Upon entering the property, you are met with the recently fitted, top class Magnet kitchen with AEG appliances.

Following though to the rest of the downstairs you find one of the bathrooms, with a walkin 50cm waterfall showerhead and the large bright living room area, currently being used as a bedroom. There is access to the garden via sliding doors as well as via the side gate external to the property.

Heading upstairs you are met with the three bedrooms, the master bedroom to the front of the property comes equipped with its own ensuite bathroom as well as there being another family bathroom on this level. The loft is also accessible from this floor, providing plenty of storage space.

The property benefits from free on street parking and there are local shops less than a 5 minutes’ walk away - including a Tesco express, as well as roughly a 10-minute walk to Sydenham High Street.

In terms of transport, you couldn’t be better served with a fleet of buses along the Highstreet and walkable train links that enable you to reach the city with ease.

This beautiful house is definitely worth a view - you won’t regret it!

Freehold
EPC D


Important Note: Beresford Residential Limited hereby give notice under the 1979 Estate Agents Act that the property is owned by a staff member of Beresford Residential Limited.

address: Maltby House, Ottley Drive, Kidbrooke Village, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £350,000 to £370,000

Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
What I love about this place at first sight is how much light that comes through the windows in the afternoon sun. Sitting by the window, we really enjoy looking at lovely view of the park and lake. Quietness away from the city, with easy train access to city centre. Access to long stretch of park that is on the door step. The communal garden on the same floor as the apartment providing easy access.

What do you love about the area? The local market in the square with a different food stall every day. The 3 parks with lakes and the local pub, all within walking distance. Easy access to Blackheath village and Greenwich park that is 10 min drive away or 3 min train ride.

Property Details:

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with in built storage and utility cupboard with additional storage, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto the delightful private balcony, and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises of a modern range of matching off white fronted wall and base units with LED countertop lighting, glass splashback and stone worktop incorporating inset sink unit, electric hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a generously sized double bedroom with an in built wardrobe also sharing access onto the private balcony, plus a stylish bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling and inbuilt vanity.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of railway stations at nearby Kidbrooke and Lee, as well as numerous regular bus routes, including a direct bus route to Greenwich Tube Station. The area is well served by an array of shops and amenities as well as beautiful open spaces including neighbouring Cator and Sutcliffe Parks. Fashionable Greenwich and Blackheath Village are also within a short drive/train journey offering a further variety of boutique shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.

title: Block of flats for sale

detailedDescription:
Unveiled to the SE23 market is this incredibly practical two bedroom purpose built apartment situated in an "Art Deco" building, just moments away from the buzzing Forest Hill High Street and The Horniman.

The accommodation proudly boasts over 667sqft/62sqm of internal floor space and masses of natural light throughout. The dog-leg entrance hall provides a perfect separation of the apartment, with the two bedrooms being spacious and both of which having built in storage. Additional benefits include a well-proportioned bathroom suite, ample storage, a stunning open plan entertainment area, ideal for a keen cook, and your very own private balcony off the main bedroom.

Taymount Rise is one of Forest Hill’s most undiscovered roads with its quiet surrounding and unbelievably quick access to Forest Hill High Street and The Overground Line with connections into London Bridge, London Victoria and East London to stations such as Highbury & Islington and Dalston, both via Shoreditch High Street. The road itself offers a vast amount of characterful architecture with plenty of manor buildings, period conversions, art deco designs and a "historic" grand old church!

With the recent success we have had on similar properties locally, we envisage this flat having superb success on the SE23 market attracting a wide audience from SE22, SE15 and SE19 so be quick to register your interest!

Lease Length: 966 years | Service Charge & Ground Rent: £2,400 per annum | Energy Efficiency Rating C.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Virtual tour available

Located within the locally renowned ‘Links Estate’ is this meticulously maintained and extended three bedroom end of terrace home.

The current owners have lovingly maintained this house and the condition throughout is well kept with a great sense of space added thanks to the rear extension that has opened up the kitchen.

The current accommodation comprises of a large welcoming entrance hall with under stairs storage and WC, heading into the main living space you will find the open plan style kitchen/dining room measuring in at 22’5 by 16’2 which wraps around into the family’s reception room which is complemented by the stunning 1930’s bay window, access to the homes 52’ south facing garden is through a side door in the kitchen which also offers side access to the front of the house.

Upstairs you will find two exceptionally large double bedrooms, the first measuring in at 13’5 by 10’1 and the second sitting at 13’ by 10’1 both complemented by large bay windows, the third bedroom is perfect for a young child’s room or those looking for a home office, on the first floor you will also find the contemporary family suite bathroom.

Further benefits include double glazing, gas central heating and a large self-sufficient studio apartment at the back of the garden which can be easily converted into a stunning home office, gym or extra living space as well as off street parking for multiple cars.

The area is well served by good local schools and is very family orientated – quiet with limited traffic. Grove Park station (a short 0.8m walk) is one of the most versatile railway stations this side of the borough, with direct links into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street in as little as 14 minutes. Commuting drivers can access the A20 in as little as 3 miles and even the city-bound A2 is within 4 miles. Blackheath Village, with its chic boutiques and award winning restaurants, is less than a 3.7 mile drive/cycle north, while the contemporary Bromley town centre is just 2 miles south - boasting 'The Glades' shopping centre and a vibrant high street which can also be access via shuttles running from Grove Park station.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
L&Q at Deptford Landings, Deptford

Apartment 205 is a 2 bedroom 2nd-floor duplex apartment offering 77 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.

£131,750 for a 25% share of £527,000 and a deposit as low as £13,175.

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

The Development
Our Shared Ownership homes at Deptford Landings are in Deptford, a desirable Zone 2 location close to Surrey Quays. Deptford is a cosmopolitan community steeped in history and is well connected to the rest of London. All homes are built to a desirable specification and offer outside space in the form of a terrace or balcony. Your new home will be fitted with everything you need to move in and get on with turning it into a home. There are communal courtyards to enjoy and a number of shops and restaurants right on your doorstep. With the perfect blend of restaurants, cafes, theatres and green open spaces, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

Parkland living near Surrey Quays
Opposite L&Q at Deptford Landings, you will find Deptford Park an oasis of 28 acres of green open space, bordered by mature trees and wide walkways making an ideal place for you to enjoy a nice weekend or evening stroll. Recent regeneration of the park has seen the introduction of a new childrens playground whilst a redesigned entrance leads to a formal paved area with new seating complementing the flourishing neighbourhood.

Travel
Surrey Quays Overground station is a 12-minute walk away
Reach London Bridge in 5 minutes
Reach Canada Water in 3 minutes
Reach Clapham Junction in 45 minutes

Canada Water Tube station is a 20 minute walk away
Reach London Bridge in 3 minutes
Reach Waterloo in 6 minutes
Reach Stratford in 14 minutes

The River Thames is just a short walk away providing access to the Thames Clipper at Surrey Quays Pier for a more relaxing way to travel.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

With the perfect blend of restaurants, cafes, theatres, and green open spaces, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

Parkland living near Surrey Quays
Opposite L&Q at Deptford Landings, you will find Deptford Park an oasis of 28 acres of green open space, bordered by mature trees and wide walkways making an ideal place for you to enjoy a nice weekend or evening stroll. Recent regeneration of the park has seen the introduction of a new childrens playground whilst a redesigned entrance leads to a formal paved area with new seating complementing the flourishing neighbourhood.

The River Thames is just a short walk away providing access to the Thames Clipper at Surrey Quays Pier for a more relaxing way to travel.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Find this whopper of a two double bedroom flat - it's 994 square feet - within a grand Victorian villa in pretty Sydenham/Crystal Palace borderland.

Beyond its brilliant proportions it’s got loads more to love - including a large private garden (extending over 50 feet!), sash windows, stripped floors and doors, cast-iron radiators, a Freehold-share, its own front door, and a massive entrance hall.

A leafy yet well-connected spot, this one. Your local parks are Crystal Palace Park and Sydenham Wells Park (walk just 10 mins to each of these), and historic extensive woodland is also local.

You’re within easy reach of three stations. Sydenham is the closest - walk 12 minutes. Then you’ve got Penge West and Crystal Palace (crossing the park) - both a 15 minute walk.

Pop down a few steps from the front garden, through the gate and your own front door is set to your right. You land in one of the largest halls we’ve seen - 15 feet by over 9.

To your right, at the front of the flat, you’ve got the first double bedroom. It’s over 10 feet by over 9 feet and has a sash window.

To your left of the hall is your bathroom - with two windows (one looking onto the private garden), concealed plumbing, contemporary style white sanitary ware, heated towel radiator and timber detailing too. You’ll also find plumbing and space for the washing machine.

Next door you’ve got the kitchen - with great garden views and timeless fitted units, plus open shelving and solid wood counters.

The second double bedroom is of the supersized variety - over 18 feet by over 17 feet! It’s set to the front of the building, with a big bay window, and a pair of ceiling-high built-in alcove closets.

The large reception room completes the tour. It’s over 19 feet by over 14 feet, and has a lovely (working) wood burner in the fireplace, plus large French doors onto the paved area of the large garden. Beyond this you’ve got a good lawn and plenty of mature plants and palms. The garden’s also framed by pretty mature trees in neighbouring gardens.

What’s about? Crystal Palace Park is an amazing one - with (Listed) National Sports Centre nestled in there, plus a maze, lakes, a farm, gardening college, and even dinosaurs!

Sydenham Wells Park is a far smaller park but lovely all the same.

Dulwich Wood - together with the adjacent Sydenham Hill Wood - is the largest extant part of the ancient Great North Wood: A natural oak woodland (the history bit: The two woods were separated after the relocation of The Crystal Palace in 1854). The Dulwich Wood House has a country pub feel and large garden, a short walk away.

Sydenham and Crystal Palace are close for independent high streets. In Sydenham we like Cobb’s Corner cafe and Ghurka’s (Nepalese deliciousness). Crystal Palace is famous for its triangular high street area known as The Triangle. Here we like Joanna’s and Numidie (with cute downstairs bar) and for pubs: The Alma, Sparrowhawk and Westow House.

Gipsy Hill, East Dulwich, Dulwich Village, Forest Hill and even Beckenham are close too for more options.

detailedDescription:
This modern and immaculately finished 2-bedroom, 2ndfloor apartment is situated in the highly sought after Catford Green development adjacent to Ladywell Fields, with a spacious private balcony for outdoor socialising and dining. The flat offers all the benefits of modern living in a great location for connections into central London, in as little as 15 minutes. It is available chain free. The property has been finished to a very high spec with a fantastic fully fitted kitchen and luxury bathroom suite, bespoke shutters, ample storage and two large double bedrooms with built in wardrobes.

The well-proportioned and airy open-plan living and kitchen area, offers fabulous space which can be separated for dining and lounging and has direct access to the covered balcony. The two large and light-filled double bedrooms feature built in wardrobes – with the second bedroom currently doubling as a guest suite and home office, perfect for flexible working. The flat also comes with added benefits of Google Nest Heating and Water and Hyperoptic 1gb internet.

Catford Green is a collection of stylish flats backing onto the open spaces of Ladywell Fields, equidistant from the centres of both Catford and Ladywell. The development has been finished with a pedestrian area and landscaping down the river running through the whole site and is ideally placed for Central London, with direct access to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street, Blackfriars and London St Pancras. You can also easily access connecting lines to London Victoria, to the Northern & Bakerloo Lines at Elephant & Castle, as well as the DLR from Lewisham. Within walking distance is the up and coming centre of Catford, with eclectic places to eat and drink including Ninth Life and Bottle Bar, there is also the once a month street food market on Catford Broadway. The development opens on to the wonderful Ladywell Fields, a mixed-use urban park with the Ravensbourne River running through the centre and Ladywell Village, with independent restaurants, shops and cafes, at the other end. The popular Brockley, Hither Green and Honor Oak are all within a short walk.

detailedDescription:
"We absolutely love living at the Mill. When you close the gate behind you and walk through the cobbled courtyard with its charming landscaped roof garden, you’re in another world.”

What The Seller Says -

"It’s a warm and friendly community and our long-standing concierge Aldo looks after us all really well.

Long Mill only has two apartments on each floor, so it is very quiet and private. Our apartment has a real sense of calm, tucked away from the main road on the corner of the creek. We still remember how amazed we were when we woke up on our first morning nine years ago to the sound of ducks and geese.

The building has been attractively converted and our big sash windows let in lots of light. We never tire of the views or of the way the creek changes character during the day.

Our roof garden is very well looked after by the gardener and it’s great to pop up for coffee during the day or to have friends and family over at weekends.

Greenwich is a fantastic place to live and has so much to offer including the park and river. It’s also great to be in walking distance of Deptford as its quirky cafés and bars have their own vibe.

Being close to the DLR and having a choice of train stations nearby including the Overground means it’s really easy to get to work or into town and beyond.

We can honestly say it’s the best place we’ve ever lived and we will miss it very much – we are only moving as we need to be nearer family who live outside London."

Sarah and Brendan

What The Agent Says -

The old Mumford flour mills is one of the most beautiful looking re-developments in the local area, with its grand brick facade, the old lettering dating back to when the mill was built.

Internally there is an abundance of space and comprises useful size entrance hall, family bathroom, main bedroom featuring an en-suite shower room, further double size bedroom, which also offers direct access to the very airy and spacious living room, with plenty of room to dine and an open plan kitchen, which comes with some integrated appliances.

Included and featured are the wood floors throughout, sash windows, access to the communal roof terrace and on-site concierge, as well as bicycle storage and a separate storage cage in the next building.

Greenwich mainline and DLR stations are just a few minutes away on foot, as well as Greenwich park and town centre. Deptford Bridge DLR is just a few moments away, for very quick access.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
This substantial family home is situated in the well sought-after cul-de-sac of Bluebell Close just off Sydenham Hill which is located on the periphery of Crystal Palace. Positioned just a short saunter away from Crystal Palace Park this property provides quick access to the; National Sports Centre, Fishing Lake and Concert Bowl all located within the park itself. This substantial spacious family home is priced to sell and offers a potential purchaser the ideal opportunity to own a Townhouse with off-street parking in an increasingly popular part of South East London.

On the ground floor, upon entry there is a much-needed downstairs W/C alongside a spacious and neutrally decorated reception area which is a great living and entertainment space. To the rear of the property a large fitted kitchen and breakfast room with integrated appliances and a five-burner Rangemaster gas hob cooker can also be found with access to a Juliet balcony that overlooks the private rear garden. This also doubles up as an ideal make-shift home office with a plethora of natural light.

Located on the lower ground floor another large secondary reception room can be found which can also be used as an additional bedroom with access to a shower room with a hand basin and w/c. Access to the private rear garden can also be found on the same floor. On the first floor, there is access to four well- proportioned bedrooms with a separate spacious family bathroom to boot. With over 1,200 sqft of space on offer, this extensive family home would be a fantastic home for a family or could be a good long-term buy to let investment.

The property is located just off Sydenham Hill which is a short walk to both Crystal Palace and Sydenham Wells Park with access to local amenities and transport links found in Crystal Palace and Sydenham.

detailedDescription:
This light and spacious apartment offers great living space with an open-plan kitchen and reception room and floor to ceiling windows providing views towards the River and the O2. The modern kitchen is fully integrated providing plenty of worktop space and plenty of room for a dining area. The bedroom is of a good size and features built in wardrobes while the contemporary bathroom mirrors the contemporary design of the apartment. This is the perfect property for any buyer looking for a swift commute to the City and Canary Wharf while being moments from the many attractions for historical Greenwich.

Situation
Jubilee Court forms part of the New Capital Quay Development which is located moments from Central Greenwich and all the shops, bars and boutiques that the area has to offer, as well as the Docklands Light Railway at Cutty Sark which gives fast and convenient access to Canary Wharf and the City. Greenwich Mainline Station is also a short walk away which provides quick and easy access to The City and London Bridge. The Thames Clipper at Greenwich Pier also provides an alternative and convenient access to Canary Wharf, the City, Blackfriars, the South Bank, Westminster, the O2 and other prominent stops along the Thames. There is a Waitrose and Costa Coffee within the development and several pubs and restaurants nearby, as are the various historical sights and open spaces of Greenwich Park.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: A spacious one bedroom apartment in excellent condition, situated on the ground floor in the sought after Paxton Court, available to those over the age of 60. The accommodation, which. Has been recently redecorated, is of a high standard. It comprises a welcoming entrance hall with a large storage cupboard, a huge well-presented lounge and kitchen with double doors off the lounge; a good size, delightfully decorated bedroom with glass-fronted built-in wardrobes and a clean, modern bathroom. The property is move-in ready. There is a very pleasant and spacious communal lounge, communal laundry and well maintained gardens which are accessible to residents and overlooked from both the reception room and bedroom. Paxton Court has a house manager, Careline system (emergency pull cords in each room) which controls door entry and monitors fire alarms and camera entry system (so that residents can see visitors before allowing them access to the building). For visitors that wish to stay, there is a twin bedded guest suite with en-suite shower room. Residents/visitor parking is available and there are excellent bus and rail routes to neighbouring towns.

address: Maltby House, 2 Ottley Drive, Blackheath, London SE3
detailedDescription:
Guide Price £425,000-450,000. With lovely views over the communal gardens, is this stylish two double bedroom two bathroom apartment with a corner terrace set within the prestigious Kidbrooke Village development.

The property is in excellent decorative order throughout.

Found on the third floor, with a lift, the accommodation comprises; a large and airy reception room with large windows, an open plan and very attractive modern kitchen with integrated appliances and a private terrace. There is a large master bedroom with built in wardrobes and an attractive modern ensuite bathroom, a second double bedroom, a modern shower room and utility cupboard housing washing machine/tumble dryer as well as an additional storage cupboard.

Further benefits are well kept communal gardens, gymnasium and a 24 hour concierge.

The property is sold chain free and your immediate viewing is essential. Video tours can be seen at

Maltby House is part of the sought after Kidbrooke Village development - a new and vibrant London community which offers an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.

As well as new homes, it will offer new parks, shops, bars, restaurants, schools, sports, healthcare and community facilities. Already established and just a two minute walk is a Sainsbury's local, pharmacy, convenience store and coffee shop. Sutcliffe Park with beautifully landscaped gardens and ponds is just 100 yards away.

Transport links to central London are excellent with travel to London Bridge in just 15 minutes from nearby Kidbrooke station. Direct trains to Victoria, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Cannon Street also run from here. Blackheath Village, with its array of boutiques, daily conveniences, bars and restaurants, is also close by.

Guide Price £425,000-£450,000.

The residence represents an ideal first time buy for couples or professionals commuting daily to central London.

Viewings highly recommended to fully appreciate the space and scope this home offers.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A west-facing refurbished conversion flat contained within an interesting building dating back to the 1890s. It has a new kitchen and shower room, solid wood floors in the spacious living room and bedroom, direct access to a secluded patio area, allocated parking and is conveniently located for both stations and local amenities.

This wonderful bright and relaxing home has been superbly cared for by the current owners. There is a welcoming entrance hall, a high-quality kitchen with plenty of cupboards and countertop space, a sizeable shower room and a double bedroom with an abundance of storage.

The tranquil surroundings include South Dock Marina, Greenland Dock and the Thames Path. Nearby is Surrey Docks Fitness and Watersports Centre, together with the shops, cafes and green spaces of the recently developed Greenland Place, including a Tesco Express and the Plough Way Cafe. A scenic walk takes you to Canada Water Station (Jubilee Line & London Overground, Zone 2) and Surrey Quays Station (London Overground, Zone 2). The River Taxi services from Greenland Pier also offer an alternative way of commuting with Canary Wharf reachable in minutes.

It is one of the few period buildings in the area and was built in the 1890s by James Adair McConnochie who was the chief engineer of the Surrey Commercial Dock Company and responsible for establishing Canada Dock, as well as the attractive Dock Offices building near what is now Canada Water Station. Originally built as the Grain Office and later becoming the National Dock Labour Board Office, it was fully refurbished and converted into 12 residential units by Redrow Homes in 1997. About half of the original structure remains. It is often incorrectly referred to as a former Police Station.

The service charge is approximately £1,700 per annum and includes the water rates. The ground rent is £75 per annum and the lease has 100 full years remaining. There is also the option to buy the share of freehold.

detailedDescription:
Located a stone's throw from Honor Oak Park station, this spacious, chain free, 3-bedroom split-level first and top floor flat offers 1100sqft of living space.
The flat provides lots of natural light and well-proportioned rooms throughout. Entered at the back of the building through its own front door, you head upstairs to the first floor where there is a sunny, 16' reception room at the front. Behind this is a double bedroom. At the rear is a sizeable kitchen-diner. There is also a family bathroom on this floor with a separate WC. On the top floor is a master bedroom which mirrors the size of the reception room, and another double bedroom.
Honor Oak Park is a friendly area popular among young professional and families. The station provides fast and regular services to London Bridge (in around 12 mins) as well as London Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington and southwards to Croydon.
The area's amenities include coffee shops, a deli, a beauty salon, and several high-rated restaurants including a hip Pizzeria (Mamadough), an award-winning Indian (Barbur) and a popular Italian (Le Querce). For groceries there are a number of convenience shops and a Sainsbury's local. For an evening drink, there's the recently-refurbished Chandos or the Brockley Jack which also hosts a small theatre. The nearest primary school is Stillness, rated as Outstanding'.
The area is dotted with green spaces including One Tree Hill and Blythe Hill Fields both of which boast panoramic views of London's skyline.

Kidbrooke Village provides 86 acres of new parkland and open space, where youll soon find your favourite spots for a walk, ride or run. The waterways of Cator Park in particular make Kidbrooke Village a landmark destination. As a haven for wildlife, these diverse habitats have been protected in partnership with London Wildlife Trust.

During the five years of ownership the current vendors have replaced the roof, refitted the kitchen, added plantation style shutters, laid new flooring, replaced the windows and redecorated both inside and out. The house is now ready for new owners to move into.

The accommodation briefly comprises: Three double bedrooms, large upstairs bathroom with modern suite, kitchen / breakfast room and living / dining room. There is also an easily maintained garden.

Situated within this quiet residential road, the location couldn't be better. Elverson Road DLR station is literally just around the corner, making it a commuters dream to get to Canary Wharf or the City. Both Lewisham and St. Johns mainline stations are a few minutes' walk away; as is Tesco superstore. Historic Greenwich Village can also be reached on foot or just three stops on the DLR.

All in all this is a lovely period house and internal viewings are highly recommended.

What the Sellers Say -

"Deptford is a vibrant and always evolving place that we have loved living in. The combination of easily accessible green spaces, friendly people and attractive Victorian houses has been joined in recent years by great pubs, quirky restaurants and an incredible sourdough bakery.
