detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented one double bedroom second floor apartment with large private decked balcony, conveniently located in a sought after modern development in the centre of Catford, just a short walk from transport links and the green open spaces of Ladywell fields.

The property has been very well maintained, offering stylish accommodation with modern interiors, including an impressive open plan reception/kitchen and modern bathroom. Features include communal hot water and heating (ensuring low energy bills), high specification double glazing, excellent internal sound insulation, quality floor coverings, ample inbuilt storage, communal bike store, and long lease. The development itself includes a convenient Sainsbury's Local to the ground floor.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto large private balcony, and ample space for relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a full range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, electric oven and integrated fridge freezer and dishwasher. There is a spacious double bedroom with space for free-standing furniture, and a stylish bathroom with modern suite and elegant tiling.

Viewings of this stunning property, ideal for either a first time or investment purchase, are highly recommended. Please click 'brochure link' to book a viewing!

Location

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of Catford and Catford Bridge stations, with fantastic links to London Bridge (10 min), Charing Cross (20 min), St. Pancras (35 min) and Farringdon (35 min). Numerous regular bus routes also provide excellent links to the surrounding area. Catford itself is just moments' away providing an array of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, as well as a popular theatre. The area is also well served by excellent local schools and lovely open spaces including Mountsfield Park and Ladywell Fields.

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 155 years from 8 May 2017 - 152 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

We understand the service charge on the property is circa £134.85 per month, covering the cleaning of common areas, lift maintenance, grounds and planting maintenance. Ground rent is £300 per annum. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An enormous (and without wanting to go all Kevin McCloud on you...) reimagined Victorian terrace of over 3300 square feet: Not a typo.

Owned just once from brand new, with a beautifully-deceptive traditional Victorian frontage - conforming just perfectly with the other homes and regulations within Telegraph Hill Conservation Area - you’ve got killer skyline views, two entrances, five treat-packed floors, five bedrooms, four bathrooms, a study, more reception space than one could ever wish for, and a large garden (that’s complete with a hot-tub, under-deck storage and a playhouse). Oh and there’s also lovely communal garden space too - with your neighbours to your right.

Parking is unrestricted on the street. Walk just six minutes to New Cross Gate Station, 11 to Brockley Station and 12 to Nunhead Station.

Once home to Victorian poet Robert Browning, this leafy hillside neighbourhood was developed in the late C19th, replacing market gardens - owned by the Worshipful Company of Haberdashers (who controlled the development) - with high-standard housing. As well as the attractive architecture and fancy street lamps, what stands here now is a lovely, leafy community with cracking connections to central London, alongside great schools and parks. Local kids attend Edmund Waller Primary and the through-school Haberdashers’ Aske’s (3-18) if catchment areas are a priority.

Entering at the raised ground floor (up a few steps - wonderfully formal) open into a generous hall space - Tto your left is a gigantic reception room (office potential) with exposed brick wall and a glass floor feature which cleverly lights the spaces below. With a separate entrance, this area has the potential to be converted into a separate annexe to rent out.

At the rear of this floor you’ve got a modern bathroom with entrance from the hall, plus another from the rear bay-windowed bedroom - of over 14 feet by over 11 feet, and which has a big bay window onto verdant views.

On the floor below you’ve got a bay-windowed guest bedroom of over 17 feet by nearly 15 (where you’ll find the second front door) and a generous study with an open view to your incredible living and kitchen space below.

Down the stairs again and you’re in the best, biggest bit of the house - your modern fitted kitchen with island, larder and w.c. Feature at one end of the vast space, while an enormous reception space - with cool mural by local artist, roof light and wall-spanning folding doors - spill out in the other.

Now to the first floor: Here you’ve got a big double-aspect double bedroom of over 20 feet by over 11, with a high vaulted ceiling, designer wallpaper, and skylight window.

Next up is a traditional master bedroom with en suite bathroom with independent shower. The bay-windowed bedroom is 18 feet both ways.

Up to the final floor and you’ve got another large double bedroom (over 20 feet by over 14) with an en suite shower room, incredible skyline views, and accessible eaves storage.

The views of the garden and surrounding gardens are incredibly calming and, with construction work on nearby properties complete, they promise to stay that way.

A true Victorian home with all the benefits of a new construction; this house is fully insulated, with 50m deep foundations.

Telegraph Hill is a delightful community to call home and hosts regular community events. Telegraph Hill’s Victorian Parks (Upper and Lower) are great, as is The Hill Station cafe. There’s a monthly Farmers’ Market held in the Lower Park, or nip down to Brockley Market (held on Saturdays in the Lewisham College Car Park - more glam than it sounds!).

New Cross Gate Station is but a seven minute stroll for London Overground trains and regular mainline services, too. It's just one stop to London Bridge! A large Sainsbury's store sits behind the station, and independent shops and pubs line New Cross Road.

Brockley has some great neighbourhood eateries including The Orchard and Parlez, plus cocktail bar Brickfields and Brockley Brewery.

In Nunhead we like Four Hundred Rabbits, Babette and El Vermut. The wet fish shop and bakery are highly recommended too.

Trendy Deptford High Street is fairly close too for cool restaurants including Marcella, The Tapas Room and The Winemakers Club. Peckham's Rye Lane and Bellenden Road are also a short walk for more options. Near to Queens Road Peckham Station you've got Kudu and Peckham Cellars restaurants; both have a Bib Gourmand.

Local schools are extremely well-regarded and include Haberdashers' Aske's Hatcham College (covering 3-18), St James's Hatcham Church of England Primary (3-11) and Edmund Waller Primary (3-11). Bebright Bunnies Nursery is also popular for smaller ones, on Kitto Road.

detailedDescription:
Guide price £800,000 to £850,000
Contact the branch for more pricing information
The modern living requires a mixture of open plan spaces as well as functional rooms and this home offers exactly that. The utility room provides the extra space that families need and the open plan spaces provide the entertainment space for family gatherings. The front room is ideal for some relaxing time in front of the TV or to hide away from the kids for some quiet time.
The seller is happy to complete the transaction before the end of June in order to help the buyers to benefit from the new Stamp Duty relief.
On this street you will find that most of your neighbours have lived on this road for a while as it is rare to find this much space and character so close to the high street and transport links. This stunning home is located a short walk away from the local bakeries, butcher, Fruit & Veggie Supermarket & M&S ... All of this on your door step.
Please contact Your Move to arrange your viewing.

detailedDescription:
Summary

For Sale By Online Auction. Starting Bid 690,000. Terms and conditions apply.

We welcome to market this four bedroom mid terrace Victorian family home which is being sold as a blank canvas and is a wonderful opportunity for a young or growing family to put their mark on a future family home.

The property has laminate flooring throughout, and ample scope to extend downstairs and add to the original Victorian features. Original Victorian features currently include the sash window in reception room 2, Victorian archway in the hallway and a Victorian fireplace. On the ground floor you will find two receptions rooms and a good-sized kitchen. On the first floor, you will find three good sized double bedrooms along with a family bathroom. In the loft a further bedroom and shower room have been added.

The house comes with a pretty garden which isn't overlooked and benefits from sun all day. Further benefits include a large cellar space.

Eddystone Road is situated in the heart of vibrant Crofton Park with its excellent schools, independent boutiques, cafes and bars. Numerous local green spaces are a short walk away. The property is 2 minute walk from Crofton Park station (with links to Blackfriars, Victoria and St Pancras), and a short walk from Honor Oak Park and Brockley overground stations (with links to Shoreditch, Dalston and the City).

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

detailedDescription:
This two bedroom purpose built flat, which comes with its own private balcony, is conveniently situated in the centre of Lewisham; just moments away from the High Street and is offered Chain Free.
Located on the second floor, as you enter through your own front door, the property consists of a large bright reception room with a door leading to a private balcony, fitted kitchen with integrated oven & hob, 1 double and 1 single bedroom and a stylish family bathroom. There is also access to communal gardens.
Lewisham mainline and DLR stations are a short walk away and provide quick and easy access into central London and Canary Wharf respectively. Ladywell and Hither Green mainline stations are also within easy reach. There is a large shopping centre nearby where you'll find most things you'll need including familiar high street chains, department stores and coffee shops. There's also a popular outdoor market along the high street. A great place for an evening out and a bite to eat is the hip Street Feast Model market. The boutique shops and restaurants in Blackheath are also within easy reach. If you're looking for outdoor and sporty activities, there are free tennis courts in Ladywell Fields and a swimming pool and leisure centre by Lewisham station.
The property is in a very convenient location and is perfect for the commute into the city with Lewisham Station and DLR only is 0.4 miles, Ladywell Station 0.4 miles, Hither Green is 0.56 miles. The popular open spaces of Hilly Fields, (0.45miles), Manor House Gardens, (0.6miles), Blackheath Common, (0.7 miles), and Greenwich Park, (1.05 miles), are all within a short walk. There are several popular primary schools close by. The ever improving and vibrant centre of Ladywell with its independent delis and shops and Lewisham has extensive shopping choices and is being enhanced by new investment, attracting new restaurants and amenities.

John Payne are delighted to bring to the market this stylish, two double bedroom, two bathroom, modern apartment located on the fifth floor of this modern development in the heart of Greenwich. Benefitting from masses of natural light throughout, the apartment boasts high-specification interior and a spacious, private balcony.

The accommodation comprises an open plan living kitchen area with oak-engineered flooring, ample storage and fully integrated appliances, large master bedroom with floor to ceiling windows and an en-suite shower room, second double bedroom, large three piece modern bathroom and two great sized hallway storage cupboards. Further benefits include secure lift access to your floor only, secure bicycle storage, gated access to communal grounds/creek behind the development and a long lease.

The property is ideally located for Greenwich village with its array of shops, bars and restaurants, including a Waitrose within close walking distance. Furthermore, the proximity to Greenwich Station and DLR (within 3 minutes’ walk) provides fantastic links to Canary Wharf, London Bridge and the City.

detailedDescription:
**£325,000**Guide Price

Beautifully presented, chain free one bedroom flat set within a popular purpose built development, within easy access of excellent transport links and amenities.

The property has been superbly kept, offering light and spacious accommodation neutrally decorated throughout, with further features including a generous reception room, well equipped kitchen and stylish tiled bathroom. The hallway, kitchen and living area all benefit from engineered hardwood flooring. Representing an excellent first time or investment purchase, the property further benefits from courtyard views, central hot water and heating, ample inbuilt storage, 24/7 concierge, double glazing, residents-only roof terrace and secure bike parking.

Accommodation comprises of an entrance hall with 2 large inbuilt storage areas, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with apex, floor to ceiling, double glazed dual-aspect windows and ample space for both relaxing and dining.
The kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and stylish splash-back, incorporating inset sink unit, electric hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and integrated microwave, dishwasher and washing machine.
There is one well sized double bedroom, with floor to ceiling windows, plus a sleek family bathroom with modern white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

Viewings are strongly recommended - please click 'brochure link' to book instantly!

If you don’t receive this email within an hour of your registration, please check your spam or junk folders and set your spam filter to allow incoming emails from Peabody. If you still haven’t received the email after checking here, please contact and our team will be able to help you.

Ground floor, unfurnished two double bedroom, 1930's purpose built flat located just a mere 0.4 mile walk to Grove Park station (Zone 4), as well as other local amenities such as Sainsbury's, Tesco's and Bannatyne’s Fitness Centre.

The accommodation, which is set on the ground floor of this popular development, situated just a short walk from the highly convenient Grove Park station, neutrally decorated throughout. There is also private residents parking and direct access from the kitchen to the communal ground.

Accommodation comprises; spacious lounge, kitchen, two double bedrooms, bathroom & direct access to communal grounds.

The apartment forms part of Robins Court on Chinbrook Road, one of the most popular streets in Grove Park, featuring mixed architecture from the late Victorian era to modern apartments. Chinbrook Meadows Park is accessed slightly down the street, independent shops on either Chinbrook or Baring Road & importantly Zone 4 Grove Park station (just 0.4 miles from the property) offering direct links into London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross & Cannon Street in as little as 13 minutes. Blackheath Village is less than a 2.7 mile drive/cycle north, while the contemporary Bromley town centre is just 2.3 miles south - boasting 'The Glades' shopping centre & a vibrant high street.

detailedDescription:
A very well presented two bedroom terraced house with side access, tucked away facing a small green and enjoyed by the current owner for the last 16 years for the community spirit and convenient location within half a mile of Kidbrooke station giving access to London Bridge and Charing Cross and within a few hundred yards walk of buses taking you to the 02. With an extensively fitted kitchen with some integrated appliances and very good sized garden of 87' widening to 46' at the rear where a substantial recently built timber shed could provide a variety of uses including workshop or home working space. With a stylishly fitted bathroom and original treated flooring to the first floor, the property is located within half a mile of Ealdham and Henwick primary schools and with Thomas Tallis secondary school just a little further. No onward chain!

Entrance area Radiator, laminate flooring, stairs to first floor.

Lounge 13' 9" x 11' 10" plus understairs area (4.19m x 3.61m) Window to front overlooking a green, gas pebble effect fire, understairs area with power light (currently houses desk), radiator, laminate flooring.

lean to Space for washing machine, door to garden.

First floor

landing Loft access with retractable ladder (boarded and insulated we believe from the vendor) treated floorboards.

Bedroom 1 12' 10" x 9' 6" (3.91m x 2.9m) Window to front overlooking green, range of built in wardrobes, original cast iron fire surround, radiator, treated floorboards.

Bedroom 2 11' x 9' 7" (3.35m x 2.92m) Window to rear, radiator, treated floorboards.

Bathroom 7' 5" x 6' 2" (2.26m x 1.88m) Windows to rear, white suite comprising panelled bath with shower above, wash basin, wc., heated towel rail, tiled walls, tiled floor.

Outside The well tended rear garden measures approximately 87' to the timber shed, widening to the rear to 46', part lawned, part paved patio, the substantial timber shed measures 25'5 x 8' with storage areas to either end, two upvc windows and decked in front, shared gated side access, outside tap and light.

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £535,000-£550,000. With a larger than usual private garden, is this superb two double bedroom, two bathroom, modern apartment set within this prestigious gated development in between Blackheath Village and Lewisham station and DLR.

The property is on the ground floor and is in excellent decorative order with wood flooring, double glazed sash windows, plantation shutters and gas fired central heating (new boiler 2017).

The accommodation comprises a large living room leading to a very attractive modern kitchen diner, two double bedrooms with the master having built in wardrobes and an ensuite shower room and a modern bathroom. Outside and with direct access from the living room as well as side access, is a large private garden. There is also an alocated parking space and visitor parking bays.

This is a fantastic apartment and your earliest viewing is high recommended. Virtual tours can be seen on the usual websites.

Cedars Close is a sought after development with gated off street parking and well-maintained grounds, conveniently positioned just a short walk from Blackheath Village and Lewisham Town Centre.

The property is perfect for the commute into the City, West End or Canary Wharf with Lewisham Station and DLR and Blackheath Station both under ½ mile away. Lewisham station gives direct access to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria as well as Canary Wharf and Bank on the DLR. The popular open spaces of Blackheath Common, (0.43 miles), Greenwich Park, (1.06 miles), Hilly Fields, (1.09 miles) and Manor House Gardens, (1.05 miles), are all within a short walk. The popular street food Model Market is a few minutes' walk and there are several popular primary schools close by. Blackheath Village with its array of bars, restaurants and boutique shops is just a short walk away.

3 bedroom 2nd floor apartment offering 106 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space. Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.£168,750 for a 25% share of £675,000 and a deposit as low as £16,891 and a minimum income of £85,000.

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

L&Q at Kidbrooke Village
Situated in the leafy green oasis of Kidbrooke SE3, a home at this development will offer you to escape and unwind from the demands of modern life. Built to a high specification, your new home will come equipped with a fully fitted kitchen featuring integrated appliances, built-in wardrobes to the master bedroom and outdoor space in the form of a balcony or terrace – everything you need for modern living.

As well as having a wonderfully crafted new home, you will benefit from some outstanding onsite facilities, surrounded by landscaped gardens, acres of open parkland and a flourishing new community. Convenience is at the heart of Kidbrooke. The Village Centre is home to retail shops, a supermarket, coffee shop, dentist, doctor and pharmacy.

Greenwich Connections
From the onsite Kidbrooke Station, you can reach London Bridge in 16 minutes* and Waterloo East in 19 minutes* connecting to London Underground mainline stations enabling you to get into and out of the city.
There are also safe pedestrian and cycle routes across the development.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. *We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A splendid and high-ceilinged Victorian conversion flat of over 800 square feet, with two proper double bedrooms, on one of the wide, tree-lined and principal streets of the lovely, leafy Telegraph Hill Conservation Area in New Cross; once the home of Victorian poet and playwright Robert Browning.

The property has plenty of period features alongside up to date fittings and built-in storage; it’s in great shape. Your nearest station is New Cross Gate - just a seven minute walk from your door. It’s Fare Zone 2 and on the London Overground line. Parking is unrestricted on-street. Leasehold (105 years remaining).

Entry to the communal hall is at raised ground floor level. Open your own front door and head up the stairs to your landing. To the front of the building, find your vast reception room of 16 feet by 12 feet, with sash windows (in a huge south-east facing bay window = pots of light), a central, working fireplace and bespoke alcove shelving and cupboards. Floors are stripped and painted.

Next door is the modern, fitted kitchen with solid wood counters and a sash window to long, street views.

Next door, find the first large bedroom of 12 feet by 12 feet with built-in wardrobes (with charming Victorian pine doors) to the alcoves.

The second double bedroom sits at the rear of the property (again it’s a generous 12 feet each way). This room has a huge wardrobe taking one wall, with sliding doors, a pale carpet, and two windows on the rear wall serve up impressive London skyline views.

The bathroom’s next door and this is a recently-refurbished, contemporary, white affair with smart ceramic tiling, solid wood detail and a huge over bath shower. Adjacent is a huge, windowed storage cupboard.

New Cross Gate Station is but a seven minute walk and just one stop from London Bridge. You’re just 10 minutes from Brockley Station too (also on the London Overground network) and 12 minutes to Nunhead - for handy Thameslink trains. Bus routes also run day and night from nearby New Cross and Queens Roads.

Telegraph Hill is a smashing leafy London pocket to call home (it’s no surprise people settle here for life!) and hosts pop-up festivals and such. Telegraph Hill’s Victorian Parks (Upper and Lower) are delightful, as is The Hill Station community cafe. There’s a cute weekly Saturday market held in the Lower Park, or you can nip down to Brockley Market (held on Saturdays in the Lewisham College Car Park).

Nunhead with its high street village feel is really close: We like Ayres bakery, Bambuni deli and fc Soper wet fish shop, as well as El Vermut, The Old Nun’s Head and Babette.

We’re huge fans of New Cross’s centre too - with its detailed historical buildings and growing number of pubs and eateries, including The Rosemary (organic Hungarian fayre), The Rose Inn, The Telegraph at the Earl of Derby, The Amersham Arms and Fat Walrus.

Thanks largely to Goldsmiths University, New Cross attracts a cool creative crowd which refreshes every September, and boasts a contemporary gallery and Curzon cinema - both open to the public.

A big Sainsbury’s store by nxg Station is on hand for ‘the big shop’. Deptford High Street is fairly close too (book Marcella), and hip Deptford Market Yard.

And of course trendy Peckham is also close for more options - the area around qrp Station has excellent eateries and drinkeries including Kudu, Smokey Kudu, Peckham Cellars and Beer Rebellion, while Rye Lane is famous for rooftop drinking destinations. The Bellenden Road pocket is great for restaurants and pubs too.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Chain Free Sale

Property Details:

Accommodation comprises an entrance hall leading into the bright and spacious reception room,
flooded with natural light from triple front aspect windows, and offering ample space for
entertaining, relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall
and base units with hardwood work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead
extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom
with space for free-standing furniture, and a modern bathroom with white suite and elegant tiling.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Westcombe Park and Charlton stations,
as well as numerous regular bus routes serving the surrounding area and providing links to North
Greenwich, Greenwich and Woolwich for Jubilee Line, DLR and Elizabeth Line connections. There
are a range of shops, eateries and amenities close-by, with fashionable Blackheath only a short
distance away with a variety of stylish pubs, cafes and restaurants. The area is also well served by
lovely open spaces including Charlton and Hornfair Parks, and the beautiful Blackheath Common.

What do you love most about your home?
I was immediately struck by the light and airy feel of the flat. With a south-facing aspect the light streams in through the triple sash windows in the living room with views of the playing fields opposite. It's a very well proportioned flat, the living room is so spacious and comfortably holds a dining table for 6-8 people as well as a large L shaped sofa making it perfect for entertaining. The bedroom has plenty of storage with built in wardrobes and has a tranquil feel as it looks out over the communal garden. To not be overlooked from the front or back of the property gives a real sense of privacy. Being on the top floor and the only entrance on this level made me feel very safe and secure. It is a beautiful building and the other owners are genuinely lovely people, they are by far the nicest neighbours i've had! Finally, Hervey Road is a very quiet and wide tree lined road just off Shooters Hill Road and is part of a conversation area. The road has a number of large detached family homes and there are no high rise developments which is a rarity in London these days.

What do you love about the area? T

The best thing about living in this part of London has to be the abundance of green space from the playing fields across the road to nearby Greenwich park and the open space of Blackheath a short stroll away. There's even an Olympic sized outdoor heated swimming pool a few mins walk away so no matter if you are an avid runner, keen cyclist or even a tri-athlete you'll be able to enjoy these pursuits on your doorstep. Don't worry though if leisurely strolls is more your thing then you won't be disappointed either.

I will never tire of watching the seasons change as I stroll through Greenwich Park, stop to take in a wonderful view of the city before a mooch around the market and indulge in some churros. I'm no history buff but you can't help but be impressed by all the history in Greenwich from the Royal Observatory, Royal Naval College & it's Painted Halls to the Maritime Museum & Cutty Sark. Millions come from all over the world to visit these attractions each year but living so close you can explore each one at your leisure. I'd recommend going on a rainy afternoon in winter when you can while away hours exploring and feel like you have the place to yourself!

Blackheath is one of only a handful of villages in London and has some wonderful independent shops, bars & restaurants. Brunch at boulangerie Jade followed by a platter of cheese and wine at Le Bar a Vin a few doors away is the perfect way to spend a Saturday in my book and on a Sunday there is the farmers market which has lovely fresh produce and exceptional baked goods :-)

detailedDescription:
**guide price £450,000

A fantastic two double bed period conversion, ground floor apartment has direct access to the garden, offered with a share of freehold and long lease in excess of 900 years this is an absolutely amazing purchase for anyone!

The property is in excellent decorative order throughout giving a bright and airy feel with solid oak flooring, feature fireplaces & gas-fired central heating. The bright and spacious reception room leads to an attractive, modern fitted kitchen. Additional benefits are a modern two piece bathroom with separate WC and a large storage room which has been used as a home office. There is also a large secure communal cellar ideal for storing bikes and garden furniture.

With allocated off street parking, the property is perfectly situated equidistant from the ever popular Blackheath village with its mix of independent shops, traditional pubs and restaurants and Blackheath Royal Standard with its local shops, cafes and patisseries.

The property is within easy reach of 2 mainline stations with links to the City and Docklands (via the DLR at Greenwich), as well as bus services providing a regular connection to North Greenwich and the Jubilee line.

This is a superb opportunity for a first time buyer or as an investment purchase and is presented with no onward chain. Early viewing is essential to really appreciate the space this flat has to offer.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful and spacious two double bedroom top floor (second) conversion set within this imposing Victorian semi-detached house located just off the heath and very close to Blackheath Village, Greenwich Park and Lewisham Station and DLR.

The property is in excellent decorative order with features including wood flooring, double glazed sash windows, period fireplaces, gas fired central heating and amazing views.

The accommodation comprises an impressive 18'0" x 15'3" lounge diner, an attractive kitchen with wooden work surfaces and a modern bathroom. There are two double bedrooms including a fantastic 16'7" x 15'3" master with bespoke built in wardrobes. The property further benefits from private access to a huge loft (the same footprint as the flat itself), a large communal garden and is sold with a share of the freehold.

This is a wonderful home and viewing is highly recommended.

Eliot Hill is a sought road located on the edge of the heath and the ideal location to take advantage of local amenities in almost all directions. Walking east, just 0.64 miles, you will arrive in Blackheath village which offers an array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants giving a genuine feeling of village life inside London. 0.69 miles to the north you will find the historic Greenwich town centre and Royal Greenwich Park is just 740 metres away. Finally to the south, the convenience of Lewisham Station's over ground and DLR service is only 0.26 miles. The property is also close to both All Saints and John Ball Primary Schools.

Location:
Close to the Heath
. Blackheath Village - 0.52 miles
. Greenwich Park - 0.4 miles
. Within easy reach of outstanding primary and secondary schools
. Canary Wharf - 2.42 miles
. The City (Bank) - 4.78 miles
By rail

DLR - Lewisham - 0.3 miles
. Underground - North Greenwich - Jubilee line - 2.46 miles
. British Rail - Lewisham 0.3 miles/ Blackheath - 0.65 miles
Journey times from Lewisham:
London Bridge - 12 minutes
Cannon Street - 18 minutes
Victoria - 24 minutes
Charing Cross - 21 minutes

detailedDescription:
| Victorian | Circa 642sqft of Floor Space | Stunning Interior Design |

Unveiled to the SE13 market is this highly-requested first floor Victorian conversion flat that is situated on a prime yet quiet street in central Lewisham, just moments away from the High Street.

Lewisham Station is only 0.4 mile away, offering superb connections into London Charing Cross, London Waterloo East, London Victoria, and London Bridge; with similar rail connections and direct access to Canary Wharf / Bank (via the DLR). Lewisham High Street is within 300 yards, and boasts many well known retail brands, and a vast amount of additional facilities such as a Gym and bistros.

The accomdoaiuton itself is very spacious and far larger than your average one bedroom conversion, with the internal floor space measuring in circa 59.6sqm, all of which flowing perfectly, and provides masses of natural light throughout. The layout comprises your very own staircase, a stunning double-aspect reception room, a good size main bedroom, a separate yet fully fitted 'L' shaped kitchen/diner, a utility area, and a well-proportioned yet stylish bathroom suite.

We envisage this stunning conversion will attract a great deal of interest and would recommend viewing at your earliest convenience. Please don’t delay, contact our local Acorn Lewisham office now!

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Energy Efficiency Rating C.

detailedDescription:
| Victorian Era | Stylish Open Plan Kitchen/Lounge | Access To Garden |

Unveiled to the SE23 market is this incredibly sought after period conversion flat that has been tastefully upgraded internally, and is located on an ever so popular road, situated on the cusp of both Forest Hill and Honor Oak.

The accommodation itself surpasses 563sqft/52.3sqm of internal floor space that is set on the top floor of this stunning period building, providing a stylish yet neutral interior finish. The layout itself consists of an open plan kitchen/lounge, with the kitchen itself benefitting from an in-demand white high gloss finish, a well-proportioned bathroom suite, a storage cupboard to the hall, and a spacious main bedroom with your very own step-down storage cupboard which could be used as a wardrobe area.

Forest Hill, Honor Oak and Catford stations are all within simple reach, providing a variety of access to numerous stations such as; London Bridge, London Canon Street, London Charing Cross, London Waterloo East, Canary Wharf via Lewisham DLR, and East London via the highly rated London Overground line. Locally you have the benefit of Blythe Fields, Ladywell Fields as green space, as well as access into numerous local High Streets.

We envisage this property having huge success on the market due it's long list of qualities, in particular the internal floor space vs the amount of characterful elements throughout, so please contact our Acorn Forest Hill at your earliest convenience to arrange an appointment!

address: Roma Corte, Elmira Street, Lewisham, London SE13
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home?
Our home is very airy, and it has plenty of sunlight coming in throughout the day. The apartment faces South and offers a great view free of high buildings. The bedroom has a built-in wardrobe with sliding doors and space for a king-size bed and additional furniture. You can see The London Eye lit up at night, which is quite nice! The second bedroom has been renovated into an office/guest bedroom, and it has a lot of storage space. The kitchen is modern and well equipped with top of the range appliances. The bathroom is very modern, sleek and spacious. The apartment is very well insulated, we only used the heating system on rare occasions because there is truly no need, the flat catches a lot of sunlight it stays warm for most days and nights. You are a few steps away from excellent transport links and still far enough from the noisy area around the train station.

Why are you moving?
We decided to move back to Portugal to stay close to family, and we are seeking for a quieter life out of the city.

What do you love about the area?
There are supermarkets as well as food markets, pubs, pharmacies, schools, parks, coffee shops, high street shops, a shopping centre, and great parks literally a few minutes away by foot, as well as the nicest nearby villages such as Ladywell, Greenwich and Blackheath. There is a great community spirit as well, and people in the neighbourhood are very friendly!

Property Details:

Set within a superb, highly sought after development boasting useful concierge services, well maintained communal areas and lift, the property offers light and spacious accommodation comprising; Entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and well proportioned, open plan reception/kitchen with direct access onto the delightful private balcony with stunning panoramic views encompassing the London skyline including the London Eye. This impressive room provides ample space for entertaining, relaxing and dining, flooded with natural light from full height dual aspect double glazed windows. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well-sized double bedrooms, with inbuilt wardrobes to the master, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is very conveniently located within easy access of Lewisham station and DLR services, as well as numerous regular bus routes offering excellent cross-London links and connections to the surrounding area. Lewisham provides a variety of shops, eateries and amenities, and the area is well served by good local schools and lovely open spaces including Greenwich Park with the famous Royal Observatory and beautiful Blackheath Common.

detailedDescription:
An immaculately presented two-bedroom apartment located on the first floor of this residential property in the heart of Forest Hill; also in close proximity to the bars/restaurants in Honor Oak and Catford Theatre.

The property comprises of an open plan reception room and kitchen great for entertaining friends and family. The kitchen is fitted with ample inbuilt storage, modern and well-kept kitchen facilities wall and base units with more countertop space allowing for more table-top kitchen gadgets.

Two well-structured bedrooms with inbuilt wardrobes allowing for decent storage facilities and flexible movement. The master bedroom of the property includes an en-suite bathroom that includes neat tiling, WC, and a shower. The family bathroom is spacious enough to accommodate the property and its resident’s needs, with a three piece bathroom suite.

This purpose built offers communal gardens great for scenery and outdoor relaxation during the hotter seasons. Further benefits of this property is the location, as it’s not only in close proximity to Forest Hill but also the neighbouring town of Catford allowing for great transport links into Central London. The local stations are Forest Hill, Catford and Catford Bridge station a walking distance away and multiple bus stops in-between. Viewing highly recommended. * The property has its own parking space
Forest Hill - is close to central London (Zone 3,15 mins to London Bridge, 30 mins to Victoria), boasts picturesque Victorian houses, lots of residential and quiet areas, world class Horseman Museum, access to green spaces (Horniman Park, Mayow Park), lots of family friendly pubs, restaurants, cosy cafes, newly developed swimming pool & gyms, library and many galleries.
The area boasts outstanding primary and secondary state and private schools.

detailedDescription:
• 30% shared ownership, also available at full value of £530,000.

  • Current Rent for the remaining 70%: £538 per month (extremely low compared to market rate rent)

  • Video available on request.

Situated in a riverside development above Waitrose supermarket, the two-bedroom fifth-floor apartment is a stone throw away from vibrant Greenwich Town Centre, DLR and railway station. This corner apartment benefits from windows on two adjacent walls – natural light floods the living space with warmth and brightness.
Immaculately presented, the property offers ample living space over a generously sized lounge with partial river view from the sitting area, two spacious double bedrooms, a separate kitchen, a modern bathroom with shower over bath. This property also benefits from an allocated parking space directly below the building, in a secured, gated car park.
Property description


  • Lounge: A generously sized lounge with partial river view from sitting area. With floor to ceiling windows facing north (river side) and another window facing east, the lounge benefits from ample natural light.

  • Large bedroom: 4.04m x 3.21m, east facing double bedroom with two windows, with generous space for furniture and storage.

  • Second double bedroom: 3.77m x 2.99m, east facing windows with large windowsill (window seating potential). Designed to comfortably fit a double bed with power sockets and bedside tables on both sides.

  • Hallway: Spacious L-shaped hallway with large, shelved storage cupboard near the front entrance. Exceptionally bright when bedroom doors are opened.

  • Kitchen: Fully-fitted modern u-shaped kitchen with large work surfaces on both sides of the cooker.

  • Bathroom: Modern family bathroom with shower over bath.

Other Details


  • Length of Lease: Approx. 118 Years

  • Council tax Band: Greenwich Council – Band D

  • Gross Internal Area: 68.9m2

Local area information




  • Buzzing bars and cafes of Greenwich and its stunning Royal Park, while also being a short journey to both Canary Wharf and the City of London.

  • Just a 3-minute walk from Cutty Sark DLR station and 5 minutes to Greenwich station for the mainline and DLR. Also close to the Thames Clipper at Greenwich Pier.

  • Bus links to North Greenwich, Lewisham, Surrey Quays, Bermondsey and Central London just steps away make this apartment even more well connected.

  • A short wander to the riverfront also provides views of the legendary fireworks display from the London Eye at New Year.

  • There are many local primary and secondary schools, including St Alfege with St Peter C of E Primary School and James Wolfe Primary School just a short walk away.

  • The prestigious New Capital Quay development is also home to Little Elms Nursery, a large onsite Waitrose (open till 10pm), a gym, a dentist, and restaurants including Costa Coffee, The Sail Loft and The Oyster Catcher.

detailedDescription:
B&C Properties is delighted to present this luxury bright, spacious two bedroom, two bathroom apartment with parking in Campbell Court, Kidbrooke Village, offering magnificent views of the beautiful Sutcliffe Park.

B&C Properties is delighted to present this luxury bright, spacious two bedroom, two bathroom apartment located on the 1st floor with parking in Campbell Court, Kidbrooke Village, offering magnificent views of the beautiful Sutcliffe Park. Your earliest viewing is advised to avoid disappointment.

This apartment has been decorated to an extremely high standard throughout. The apartment comprises of a large open plan living, dining and kitchen area with floor to ceiling height windows opening onto a large balcony. The kitchen is fully equipped to a very high standard including a dish washer, fridge/freezer. The master suite comes with built in wardrobes with ensuite bathroom, there is a further double bedroom and a luxury modern family bathroom. Off of the hallway there is a utility cupboard to house the washing machine. The currant owner has also installed air conditioning into the apartment making those hot days much cooler.
The apartment is situated right next to the beautiful Sutcliffe Park, with lake, children's playground and athlete track. Sainsbury's Local supermarket is onsite too. The apartment benefits from 24hr Concierge and onsite residence only Gym access.

This property is only a 5 minute walk to Kidbrooke train station which runs to London Bridge station in 15 minutes, Waterloo East in 20 minutes, Charing Cross in 25 minutes and 28 minutes to London Victoria, all of which are positioned on the main London Underground lines. The development benefits from a vast amount of parkland and it is situated in the immediate vicinity of some of the most vibrant areas of London, Blackheath Village and Greenwich, both featuring an array of boutiques, restaurants and bars.

detailedDescription:
This one double bedroom top floor apartment is situated in a sought after complex in the heart of Brockley.

Seymour Gardens is just a short walk away from the notable pubs, cafes and restaurants on Brockley Road. Brockley Station and Nunhead Station are both within easy reach offering excellent links to Central London. The superb Telegraph Hill Park is around the corner offering beautiful views of the London skyline.

The property is in need of a little updating inside and will be a fantastic purchase for a first time buyer or investment purchaser. Accommodation comprises: Entrance hall, a good size reception room, fitted kitchen, a double bedroom and a bathroom.

There is a long lease and we have been advised that the service charges are approximately £1078 pa.

Contact Redwood Estates on or email us to arrange a viewing.

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

detailedDescription:
**guide prce £300,000 - £320,000**three double bedrooms**newly refubished**super value **balcony**close to rail**
Acorn are thrilled to have to the market this larger than average three double bedroom flat within a well kept block.
Intercom system gives access to well kept communal clean entrance, stairs to second floor where you find a new front door that opens to a bright inviting hall that leads to a newly fitted kitchen with white wall and base units, oven and hob, larder and space for washing machine. The bathroom has been totally refurbished along with the separate WC. The three bedrooms and reception have been all newly plastered and decorated the reception has French doors to a large balcony.
Grey laminated flooring runs through out and is complemented by fresh light décor. The central heating thermostat has Bluetooth connections.
Dunster House is located central to Bellingham that offers handy shops, bus routes and parks along with schools and Bellingham Rail Station.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

address: Stondon Park, Honor Oak Park SE23
detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented, two-bedroom first floor period conversion has been refurbished to the highest of standards and comes with a long lease.

The flat comes with two double bedrooms and has been well decorated throughout with natural and neutral tones. The flat has nice period features throughout and an attractive communal entrance hall. The kitchen comes with a vast array of wall and base units and integrated appliances and is a good size. The living room is wonderfully light and bright with a charming feature fireplace and large Victorian bay window. The room is plenty big enough for living and dining space making this an ideal room for modern day living.

Location

Located approximately just 0.2 miles to Honor Oak Park station and 0.4 miles to Crofton Park station, offering excellent links into London Bridge, Canada Water, London Victoria, Farringdon, St Pancras and many other locations.

The property is also just a short walk to various local amenities including a variety of restaurants, cafés, parks, gastro pubs and ideally located within catchment area of sought after Stillness Infant/Junior School.

Lease Information

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: 158 Years Remaining
Service Charge: £886 P/A
Ground Rent up to date with lease extension

detailedDescription:
Summary
A great opportunity to acquire this light and airy (over 1600 Sq Ft) split level period conversion flat situated on Trewsbury Road, SE26.

Please call on the number below for viewing event availability, or to have a virtual tour.

Description
A great opportunity to acquire this light and airy (over 1600 Sq Ft) split level period conversion flat situated on Trewsbury Road, SE26. The property is offered in good condition throughout and comprises four double bedrooms, spacious reception, modern fitted kitchen breakfast room and contemporary bath and shower room providing under floor heating, with benefits to include storage, cellar and shared garden.

Trewsbury Road is located in the heart of Sydenham and is set within easy reach of Mayow Park and Sydenham Road which provides a plethora of bars, shops and restaurants. Transport links can be found close by at Sydenham Station. (Zone 3 London Overground and Southern Railway) as well as a range of bus routes.

Early viewing requests are highly recommended to avoid disappointment!

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This well presented two-bedroom split level maisonette has been recently renovated to the highest of standards and can be found in the heart of Forest Hill.

Situated on the ground floor of this smart purpose-built apartment block, the maisonette has its own private entrance. As you enter you are met by a modern glossy white kitchen which has a vast array of wall and base units which is ideal for storage. The kitchen is finished off smartly with a laminated finished effect work surface.

The living room is a fantastic size and is large enough to have a dining table and chairs which make this the perfect room for modern living and entertaining.

Upstairs there are two good sized double bedrooms. There is also a newly renovated bathroom which once again has been finished to a high standard.

Location

Forest Hill station is approximately 0.1 miles away offering fantastic links into London Bridge, Victoria, Canada Water, Whitechapel, Highbury & Islington and many other locations. It is also just a short walk to various local amenities including a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, parks, cafes and gastro pubs.

detailedDescription:
Spacious and light with very generous proportions.

This well-kept studio apartment benefits from open-plan living, modern fitted kitchen, chic bathroom suite and a private balcony. The development boasts a 24 hour concierge and a resident's gymnasium, whilst the communal areas/gardens are maintained to the highest standards.

Kidbrooke Station is only a short walk from the property, whilst Sutcliffe Park and David Lloyds Sports Club are within local reach.

detailedDescription:
L&Q at Deptford Landings, Deptford

Apartment 206 is a 3 bedroom 2nd floor apartment offering 113 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space.
Contact us now to view our new show home.

£170,000 for a 25% share of £680,000 and a deposit as low as £19,875

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it
possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

The Development
Our Shared Ownership homes at Deptford Landings are in Deptford, a desirable Zone 2 location close to Surrey Quays. Deptford is a cosmopolitan community steeped in history and is well connected to the rest of London. All homes are built to a desirable specification and offer outside space in the form of a terrace or balcony. Your new home will be fitted with everything you need to move in and get on with turning it into a home. There are communal courtyards to enjoy and a number of shops and restaurants right on your doorstep. With the perfect blend of restaurants, cafes, theatres and green open spaces, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

Parkland living near Surrey Quays
Opposite L&Q at Deptford Landings, you will find Deptford Park an oasis of 28 acres of green open space, bordered by mature trees and wide walkways making an ideal place for you to enjoy a nice weekend or evening stroll. Recent regeneration of the park has seen the introduction of a new childrens playground whilst a redesigned entrance leads to a formal paved area with new seating complementing the flourishing neighbourhood.

Travel
Surrey Quays Overground station is a 12 minute walk away
Reach London Bridge in 5 minutes
Reach Canada Water in 3 minutes
Reach Clapham Junction in 45 minutes

Canada Water Tube station is a 20 minute walk away
Reach London Bridge in 3 minutes
Reach Waterloo in 6 minutes
Reach Stratford in 14 minutes

The River Thames is just a short walk away providing access to the Thames Clipper at Surrey Quays Pier for a more relaxing way to travel.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

detailedDescription:
L&Q at Deptford Landings, Deptford

Apartment 603 is a 1 bedroom 6th floor apartment offering 52 sq.m of internal floor area with outdoor space.
Contact a member of our sales team now to view our new show home.

£98,750 for a 25% share of £395,000 and a deposit as low as £9,875.

What is shared ownership?
Under the shared ownership scheme you part-own and part-rent your home, making it possible for first-time buyers and families to get on the property ladder.
The minimum share you can purchase is 25% and the maximum is 75%. You will usually pay a mortgage on the part you own and a subsidised rent on
the part you don't own. Over time, you can increase the share you own until you eventually own 100%

The Development
Our Shared Ownership homes at Deptford Landings are in Deptford, a desirable Zone 2 location close to Surrey Quays. Deptford is a cosmopolitan community steeped in history and is well connected to the rest of London. All homes are built to a desirable specification and offer outside space in the form of a terrace or balcony. Your new home will be fitted with everything you need to move in and get on with turning it into a home. There are communal courtyards to enjoy and a number of shops and restaurants right on your doorstep. With the perfect blend of restaurants, cafes, theatres and green open spaces, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

Parkland living near Surrey Quays
Opposite L&Q at Deptford Landings, you will find Deptford Park an oasis of 28 acres of green open space, bordered by mature trees and wide walkways making an ideal place for you to enjoy a nice weekend or evening stroll. Recent regeneration of the park has seen the introduction of a new childrens playground whilst a redesigned entrance leads to a formal paved area with new seating complementing the flourishing neighbourhood.

Travel
Surrey Quays Overground station is a 12 minute walk away
Reach London Bridge in 5 minutes
Reach Canada Water in 3 minutes
Reach Clapham Junction in 45 minutes

Canada Water Tube station is a 20 minute walk away
Reach London Bridge in 3 minutes
Reach Waterloo in 6 minutes
Reach Stratford in 14 minutes

The River Thames is just a short walk away providing access to the Thames Clipper at Surrey Quays Pier for a more relaxing way to travel.

Viewings
For those who would like to and are able to visit us, the Show Home is now open on an appointment-only basis, with extra measures in place to ensure your wellbeing. Please call us to book your appointment. If you would prefer to speak to our Sales Team from your own home, they are still on hand and can conduct appointments via phone, email and by virtual tour. We are taking extra precautions to ensure the health and wellbeing of our customers, staff and members of the public.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful home set within an elegant Victorian building positioned on Morden Road in Blackheath Cator Estate.

This charming home is offered chain free and configured over 1135 sq ft. The living room is decorated in neutral tones and measures over 20 ft. The space feels calm and restful largely due to the light which floods through large timber sash windows. There is original wood flooring and plenty of fine detail including an original built in book case, an ornate fireplace, deep skirting, a ceiling rose, picture rail, and a useful bespoke handcrafted media unit which neatly stores things away.

The master bedroom features a spectacularly giant bay window complete with window seat to take in the incredible views overlooking beautifully mature evergreens, grasses and interesting plants which are set within a lush green landscaped garden. The bedroom measures over 18 ft and feels restful, one of the nicest things that can be fully appreciated is the breath-taking view of an astonishing Cedar tree. Hand crafted bespoke carpentry allows for ample storage and the details continue with a fireplace, high skirting, ceiling rose and coving. The second bedroom is over 16 ft in length and is decorated in a relaxed pink hue. The bathroom features a luxurious freestanding roll top bath, a large basin with granite top and cabinet in addition to a walk in shower. The room is decorated in a deep hue and decorative tiles with a pretty motif.

Also overlooking the garden is the kitchen with magnificent high ceilings, timber floor and an exquisite bespoke sky blue kitchen complete with marble worktop. There is a fabulous dresser, Butler’s sink and a central island which is a perfect entertaining space whether enjoying drinks with friends or sitting at for a relaxed bite to eat.

Situated on Morden Road, this beautiful home is perfectly located on Blackheath Cator Estate, a private estate comprising of 282 acres just south of Blackheath Village.
Blackheath is a bustling London village, home to an expansive heathland brimming with wildlife and nature. In the heart of Blackheath is the village which is home to a superb choice of independent restaurants, boutiques, cafes and shops. There is a weekly farmer’s market on Sunday’s and throughout the year a wide variety of events and festivals which take place on the heath.

Blackheath train station is ideal for commuting to the City and West-End with frequent services to London Bridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and London Victoria. The area is popular with families due to superb choice of local and independent schools including Blackheath High School, Heath House, John Ball, The Pointer School and Colfes. There are also bus services which can be accessed from Blackheath to Dulwich College, Eltham College, jags and Alleyn’s.

Conveniently close by is Greenwich which sits on the banks of the River Thames. Greenwich is a World Heritage Site steeped in royal and naval history. Greenwich Park extends across 74 hectares and is home to wild deer and beautiful gardens. Greenwich a hive of activity and is much loved by locals and visitors.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £1,150,000-£1,250,000. A fantastic and vast, three bedroom, two bathroom Georgian apartment with a private terrace and spectacular views set within this historic heath facing Grade l listed building with off street parking and amazing communal gardens.

The Paragon is an exceptional Grade I listed crescent of houses linked by colonnades fronting a private roadway off the Heath and built around 1798 by Michael Searles, having been the subject of post war restoration by Bernard Brown. The Paragon is described by Professor Abercrombie as the most important surviving example of Georgian architecture in the country.

Found on the second and third floors, the property is in excellent decorative order with feature windows, wood flooring, period features and gas fired central heating. The accommodation briefly comprises; a large and beautiful living room with feature window overlooking the vast communal gardens and beyond and a large kitchen breakfast room with a luxury handmade kitchen. There is also a shower room and a third bedroom which with its superb views over the open heath would serve as an excellent study. Upstairs are two very large double bedrooms including a wonderful master bedroom with access to a private roof terrace and a luxury modern bathroom with free standing bath. The views are outstanding, there is off street parking, a private bicycle store and incredible and huge communal gardens.

This is an amazing homes extremely rare to the market. There is no chain and your immediate viewing is essential.

The Paragon is arguably Blackheath's most prestigious addresses and located just 20ft from the heath and 800 metres from Greenwich Park. Blackheath Village with its array of boutiques, bars, restaurants and station is just a few hundred yards. Blackheath Station gives access to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria amongst others. Close by are several sought-after schools including Blackheath Prep, Blackheath High School, the Pointer School and John Ball.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
** guide price £515,000 - £530,000 **
Virtual tour available


A picturesque, five bedroom, extended terraced house, ideally located on Marvels Lane – positioned on one of the most sought after roads in Grove Park with a mature front & back garden, with a short stroll to a highly convenient City bound station!

Ideal for young families or professionals looking to own a freehold house in a highly convenient location, this practical home comprises – a spacious hallway with storage (under stairs), a bright and spacious 13’10 by 10’10 front room, open plan kitchen/diner which has been modernised over recent years, and also opens out on to a stunning conservatory, which leads out on to the homes well-maintained garden.

To the rear of the garden, which is mainly laid to lawn but also benefits from a foot path, leading onto 16’7 by 9’7 garage, perfect for storage or potential to convert.

To the first floor you will find the home has three bedrooms, two well-proportioned doubles sitting at 13’5 by 10’4 and 11’5 by 9’8, the 3rd room on this level is perfect for a study or single bedroom & to finish off you will find a modern fitted shower room. Following with the footprint of the house you will find yourself upstairs in the loft conversion which holds a further two double bedrooms & well equipped bathroom.

All the rooms benefit from natural light, the house offers both double glazing and gas central heating. Also the property is quietly set back from the street and offers free on-street parking.

Marvels Lane is one of the most popular streets in Grove Park mainly consisting of 1930s freehold properties. It is highly convenient offering both a Sainsbury’s & Tesco’s nearby. Chinbrook Meadows park is also within reasonable distance and London Zone 4 Grove Park station (just 0.6 of a mile from the property) with direct links into London Bridge, Blackfriars, Charing Cross & Cannon Street in as little as 14 minutes.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

detailedDescription:
We are excited to market this charming one bedroom studio suite situated on the first floor of this newly built block just to the west of central Greenwich.

The apartment is situated within a contemporary and secure building boasting stylish interiors throughout, lift access, a communal bike store and a roof garden with superb views toward the city and Canary Wharf.

The apartment consists of an open plan kitchen/lounge, a separate bedroom area and a modern shower room.
It offers good storage facilities, laminate flooring throughout and a contemporary feel.

The kitchen/lounge is a good size and boasts a fully fitted kitchen with integrated appliances including dishwasher.

The bedroom area allows for a double bedroom and has a large built in wardrobe.

The three-piece shower room consists of a corner shower, a hand washbasin and a WC.
The property faces a picturesque park, and is located just to the west of Greenwich town centre with all its local amenities being just a short walk.
Located just moments from Deptford high street, the location has ideal transport links with Deptford mainline station within 5 minutes' walk (direct trains to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Luton and St Pancras International

. The location is also a short walk to Cutty Sark DLR station.
The apartment is in excellent decorative order and is available chain free.

Early viewings recommended

detailedDescription:
Nicely presented one bedroom conversion flat situated on the Hall floor of an imposing Victorian house on a quiet residential street close to excellent transport links from Lewisham DLR. This lovely starter home briefly comprises reception with space for dining, fitted kitchen, large double bedroom and a bathroom with white suite and shower over bath. No onward chain.
Location

While it's easy to hop on the train or DLR at Lewisham station to explore the rest of London, there's plenty in the town itself. There's an indoor shopping centre and a daily street market, a surprising amount of green space and restaurants serving world cuisine.
Families can choose from a wide selection of state primary and secondary schools, as well as some respected independent options. Blackheath is Lewisham's close neighbour, with fine dining, boutique shops and bustling bars.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented semi-detached, family home. The property is located within a short walking distance to multiple nurseries and primary schools, local amenities and is approximately ten minutes on foot to Hither Green train station, enjoying direct and quick commute to central London or a short drive to the M25.

The property comprises of spacious four bedrooms, naturally-lit open plan kitchen/dining, two receptions, two bathrooms and a separate utility room. One of the bedrooms is currently used as an office/play room.

The house has been completely renovated (including rewiring and plumbing) to high standards comprising of new combi boiler and heating system fitted with smart temperature control, full Teak plantation shutters, solid oak floor, spacious kitchen fitted with granite surface, American style fridge freezer and a dual fuel range oven, bespoke stylish TV unit, and plenty of other features.

To the front of the house there is a private and gated drive that can comfortably park two cars. To the rear, there is a larger than usual south-facing landscaped private garden, which has a large patio area (approximately 40 sqm) for outdoor dining, laid to lawn with numerous fruit trees separate grass that enjoys a kids play area.

There is still huge potential to extend into the loft area (subject to approval) as many of the neighbouring properties have done so. Viewings are strongly recommended. ** Click ‘brochure’ below to book a viewing online instantly! ***

Location

Location
The property is very conveniently located within easy access of Hither Green Station (direct lines into Cannon Street and Charring Cross) Catford, Catford Bridge stations are also close by, as well as numerous regular bus routes.Catford itself is just a short distance away providing an array of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, as well as a popular theatre. The area is also well served by excellent local schools and lovely open spaces including Mounts field Park, Beckenham Place Park and Ladywell Fields.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auctions

Starting Bids from: £425,000.

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Online Auctions.

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the seller’s solicitor. By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, means normal residential finance can be sort.

The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative. The buyer will be required to sign a Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Info Pack which can be downloaded for free from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyers Premium of £5,400 including VAT plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £5,754. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

detailedDescription:
**guide price £500,000 - £550,000**
Built in the 1880's by the Haberdasher's Company, Fairlawn Mansions is an imposing red - brick Victorian Mansions block within Telegraph Hill Conservation Area in the heart of New Cross. This second floor three-bedroom apartment is an excellent example of what Fairlawn Mansions has to offer.

There's plenty of period features for the traditionalists such as high ceilings and sash windows.
The 19'8 ft reception with the large bay window allows an abundance of natural light to fill the room, accompanying this you are also spoilt with three double bedrooms, two bathrooms, separate kitchen and extensive communal gardens.
This is one not to miss. Early viewing highly recommended.

Location:
Getting around is simplicity itself, with New Cross Gate station two minutes away (London Bridge seven minutes away, London Overground connecting to The City, Docklands and Clapham Junction) There's a plethora if busses on the New Cross Road too.

address: Harlie Court, Adenmore Road, London SE6
detailedDescription:
Chain free. Delightful two bedroom, two bathroom apartment, next to the 54 acres of Ladywell Fields, and train links into central London from Catford Bridge and Catford stations.

The open plan living / dining / kitchen area has been well laid out to provide a welcoming living area, convenient dining area and spacious kitchen. The high spec kitchen comes with a range of integrated appliances (oven, induction hob, fridge-freezer, microwave and dishwasher) with the units featuring soft close doors and drawers, plus bespoke multi-patterned metro tiles above the worktop. Off the dining area you have a private balcony, ideal for lazy summer days.

The master bedroom is over 18ft long, having an ensuite bathroom with walk in shower. Two full height windows in the bedroom give wonderful views over the park. The second double bedroom is over 10ft wide, just down the hallway from the main bathroom, This bedroom could also be a home office, getting plenty of morning light, while doubling as a guest bedroom.

There are 150 years left on the lease, and ground rent is £350 per year. The property is sold chain free.

The current owners have loved the sense of community, the park on their doorstep, being away from busy roads, and the supermarket, transport and nursery all nearby. They love having a modern flat with two good bedrooms and two bathrooms, finding it easy to maintain, having everything they want to make them feel very comfortable in their home. Most of all they have loved having breakfast on the balcony in summer! Now it is time to find a larger home for their growing family.

Trains:
500m to Catford Bridge Station, with trains to London Bridge (11 min) and Charing Cross (24 min)
1km to Ladywell Station (walking through the park). Trains as above
600m to Catford Station, with trains to Blackfriars (20-24 min) and City Thameslink (30-34 min)

Amenities
Sainsbury's Local by the stations.
Catford Mews 3 screen cinema complex with café and food market
Catford town centre is 750m away, with many shops, plus the Broadway Theatre, supermarkets, restaurants and pubs - Italian (La Pizzeria Italiana), Turkish (EaTurkish, Mekan, Pide), Portuguese, Japanese (Sapporo Ichiban), Chinese, Thai, Lebanese Street Food restaurant (Fayrooz), Catford Bridge Tavern, Bottle Bar and Ninth Life.

Ladywell Fields has 54 acres of green space, wooded areas, river, tennis courts, bowling green, cycle route and nature reserve.
