detailedDescription:
Situated just down the road from Honor Oak Park station is this newly-refurbished, 2 double bedroom, split-level flat, available with no onward chain.
Entered through its own front door, you head upstairs to the first floor. It features a living room opening to a newly installed kitchen with quartz worksurfaces and built-in appliances. There's a WC on this floor as well. On the top floor are 2 double bedrooms and a shower room.
The area is much sought after due to is great transport links into all parts of London and range of on-hand amenities. Honor Oak Park station is a mere 3-minute walk from this quiet tree lined street. There are fast and regular services into London Bridge (in around 12 minutes) as well as Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington, and southwards to Croydon.
The area's amenities include coffee shops (Ground & Grapes / Two Spoons), a deli, a beauty salon, and several highly-rated restaurants including a hip pizzeria (Mama Dough), an award-winning Indian (Babur), a popular Italian (Le Querce) and a traditional Turkish (Hattush). For groceries, there are a number of convenience shops and a Sainsbury's local along the high street. For an evening drink, there's the recently-refurbished Chandos or the Brockley Jack which also hosts a small theatre. The nearest primary school is the highly-rated Stillness. The area is dotted with green spaces including One Tree Hill and Blythe Hill Fields at the top of which are panoramic views of the London skyline.

Internally, the property spans 126.4sqm (1,361sqft) across four floors with a versatile arrangement of rooms. The hall-floor comprises a large kitchen and dining room, while a grand reception room covers the entire first floor. The second floor houses the en suite master bedroom. Set in one of the premier buildings in the desirable Catford Green development, this second floor apartment with large balcony is beautifully presented and offers substantial size accommodation with fabulous modern style living.

‘What The Seller Says’

“When considering the Catford Green development, people usually talk about the park on the doorway. However, there is more than meets the eye. There is also a Linear park that leads to Beckenham through lower Sydenham, where there are plenty of useful shops. This park makes weekly shopping less of a chore and more of a, well, walk in a park.

At this development, there is a great community of people that shares and looks after each other. There are many locally run cafes, shops and restaurants around Ladywell, Crofton Park and Brockley.

The flat itself has south-facing spacious rooms, which lets in a lot of light on a sunny day. There is also a lovely balcony with enough space for lots of plants and your favourite outdoor furniture.

This place is peaceful yet vibrant, and, more importantly, the one that is easy to call ‘home.”<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
| Handsome Victorian Façade | Circa 1256sqft | Sought After Road |

Unveiled to the SE13 market is this incredibly characterful, yet unique, split-level Victorian conversion flat that provides a mammoth 116.6sqm of floor space, and being situated in one of South London's most sought after areas.

The accommodation itself is quite simply dazzling, with it’s unique yet enormous layout, surpassing 1256sqft/116.6sqm of floor space, which is set over three floors (excluding the basement), and provides masses amount of natural light throughout. The layout consists of three double bedrooms, a separate w/c, a well-proportioned bathroom, a kitchen/diner, a stunning front reception room, your very own front door, and a basement!

The Halesworth Road pocket of SE13 as mentioned above, is becoming a real-hotspot in South London, with Ladywell Village benefitting from it’s array of local boutiques and cafes, as well as a gastro pub, perfect for Sunday lunching. Ladywell Park has just been redeveloped, with a stunning landscaped green, ideal for dog walking; providing that village feel. Lewisham Station is only 0.3 miles away, and offers brilliant connections into London Canon Street, London Victoria, London Charing Cross, London Bridge, and London Waterloo East, as well as Canary Wharf via the DLR.

This type of period residence tends to only come up once now and then, so we expect this superb family house having a real success on the open market, so viewing at your earliest convenience is highly recommended by contacting our Acorn Lewisham office now!

Please note viewings are strictly via appointment only.

Energy Efficiency Rating D.

detailedDescription:
** no stamp duty to pay if complete by 31 March 2021!

Ground floor flat near South Dock Marina and Greenland Dock in Surrey Quays/Canada Water.

Located in a purpose built gated development, this flat benefits from double glazing, fully-fitted kitchen, lounge, fitted wardrobes and comes with gated parking and access to communal gated grounds.

The property measures approx. 38.1sqm.
Leasehold has been extended. Zero ground rent. Small service charge.
Transport


•Tube: Surrey Quays London Overground station is around 10 minutes’ walk (direct line to Shoreditch High Street and Clapham). Canada Water tube station (Jubilee Line and London Overground) is around 15 minutes’ walk away for access to Canary Wharf, the City, Bond Street/Oxford Street, The O2 and the West End.

• Ferry: Thames Clipper river-bus service from Greenland Pier (around 5 minute walk) for river access to Canary Wharf, London Bridge, Greenwich, the O2 and the West End.

• Buses: Bus stop for 199 (Surrey Quays, Canada Water, Greenwich) and N1 (Central London/Tottenham Court Road) just nearby the property; bus stops for 47 (direct to City) and plenty of buses into Central London within a short walk.

• Car Sharing Club: Two Streetcar locations within a few minutes’ walk.
Shopping


Tesco Express convenience store across the road (open late). Surrey Quays Shopping Centre with a 24hrs Tesco Extra is around 13mins walk away.
Entertainment and nature


Odeon Cinema, Bowling Alley, Surrey Docks Watersports Centre, Stave Hill Ecological Park, Russia Docks Woodlands, Southwark Park, Surrey Docks Farm for fresh produce and a number of local pubs (Ship&Whale, Mobys) and restaurants (Café East, Frankie&Bennys, Flaming Grill, Pizza Hut) are within a short walk away.

A very spacious two double bedroom modern apartment with a south facing balcony and gated off street parking conveniently located between Blackheath Village and Lewisham Station and DLR.

Located on the first floor the accommodation comprises; a large entrance hall with storage cupboards, a stunning modern kitchen with integrated appliances and a huge 15'6 x 14'8 reception room. The reception room has full width glazed door to a large balcony with a south facing aspect and views over the extensive communal gardens to the rear. There are two double bedrooms with the master having built in wardrobes. Additionally the property benefits from a very large communal garden, gated off street parking and is sold chain free.

This is a great apartment and will be popular. Viewing is highly recommended. Virtual tours can be seen at .

The property is in a very convenient location and is perfect for the commute into the City, West End or Canary Wharf with Lewisham Station and DLR within 0.38 miles and Blackheath Station 0.59 miles. Lewisham station gives direct access to London Bridge, Cannon Street, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria as well as Canary Wharf and Bank on the DLR. The popular open spaces of Blackheath Common, (0.48 miles), Greenwich Park, (1.13 miles), Hilly Fields, (1.12 miles) and Manor House Gardens, (1.02 miles), are all within a short walk. The popular street food Model Market is a few minutes' walk and there are several popular primary schools close by. Blackheath Village with its array of bars, restaurants and boutique shops is just a short walk away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide price £375,000 to £400,000.

The property is offered with a share of freehold and is positioned on the top floor of a grand period building on the highly acclaimed Sydenham Park. With a mixture of ornate period buildings, the road is aesthetically attractive.

Rarely do we find a property that offers two double bedrooms at this price point. Combine that with the loft access via a built-in loft ladder, the property has some very desirable features.

The loft space is high enough to stand in (depending on how tall you are) and therefore a great ancillary space to the flat itself which many buyers will find extremely useful.

Located approximately half a mile to Forest Hill town centre, the property is well positioned for buyers who require transport and easy access to local recreation and shopping.

There are many features of this property which can be seen in all the images, however some of the features which struck us on entering the property included:

• Exposed wooden floorboards in lounge

Access to a boarded-out loft space many people can stand up in via a built in loft ladder

• Access to a garden – One of the most valuable features to many buyers these days

• Exposed brick feature wall - A popular interior design feature

• Semi open plan living area

Alongside all the great features of the flat, the location, is very sought after for several reasons:

1. Access to transport. Approximately 0.5 mile away you will find both Forest Hill and Sydenham stations. These two stations offer some of the following travel times to central London:

London Bridge in approximately 15 minutes (change for Northern Line)

Canada Water in approximately 12 minutes (change for Jubilee line)

London Victoria in approximately 40 minutes

Canary Wharf in approximately 24 minutes

Alongside the train links you will find a number of bus routes from approximately on the south circular which includes routes 122 and 185 to Crystal Palace and Victoria to name a few.

2. Access to amenities. Approximately 0.3 mile from the property you will find a Tesco express and a selection of other shops. In forest Hill town centre, you will find a large Sainsburys, Boots, Superdrug alongside many other boutique shops and conveniences. The selection of cafes and gastro pubs locally is always good. Dulwich and the popular Lordship Lane and Dulwich Village are a bus ride away as is Peckham which are all well known locally for great eating, shopping and social life.

3. Shopping, dining out and recreation. In recent years this location has become increasingly popular for recreation given its proximity to all Forest Hill has to offer. The well-known Sydenham Hill woods are located approximately 0.8 miles away where you will always find many walkers and locals enjoying the outdoors. The Sydenham and Dulwich Golf course is located next to the wood. The extremely popular Horniman Museum and gardens are located just a little further down from the woods and is now particularly popular for its farmers market and regular events (music at the bandstand in summer being one of them). Sydenham Wells Park and Mayow Park are two other well regarded local green spaces and you will also find a nature reserve and the very highly acclaimed Crystal Palace Park all approximately 1 mile and less away from the property.

Some of our favourite local eateries span across both Forest Hill, Honor Oak and Sydenham and include Mama Dough and Bona (sour dough pizza restaurants), Canvas and Cream (great local cafe´ serving a selection of cakes, food and drink. They also host some art exhibitions) and the award-winning Babur Indian restaurant.

Off the high street in the town centre you'll find Forest Hill pools and library both of which have undergone refurbishment.

Forest Hill pools is known for its swimming pool facilities but is also a local leisure centre with a gym and fitness classes.

4. Schools. One of the most highly acclaimed schools on South East London is Elliott Bank. This school is not only ofsted rated outstanding, it’s also rated in ofsted’s top 10%. This school is found locally and there are several highly regarded schools across Forest Hill and Sydenham which offers buyers confidence in the area they are buying in.
Share of freehold


As you will also own a share of the freehold when you buy this property, you and the other owners will self-manage the building via a ltd company that is already in place. Costs such as building insurance, the gardener and other general maintenance around the building are paid from this fund. In our opinion this set up offers the property owners more control over how the building is maintained and managed. It also give you more control over the associated costs which is unlikely to be the case when a third party is the freeholder or a management agent is in place.

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £325,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

Location

Located on the borders of Upper Sydenham and Forest Hill, the property is within close proximity to various train stations offering fantastic transport links into London Bridge, Canada Water, Victoria, Waterloo, Whitechapel, Highbury & Islington and many other locations. It is also just a short walk to various local amenities including a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, cafes and Horniman Park & museum. Viewings are highly recommended on this chain free property.

Lease Information

Tenure: Leasehold

Lease Length: 65 Years Remaining. Possibility of 125 year lease on completion of contract, subject to further negotiation.

Service Charge: No service charge

Ground Rent: £100 pa

Please note information provided has been by the seller. Any incoming purchaser must have this information checked and verified by their solicitor.

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
An outstandingly good flat with two bedrooms on the top floor (second) of this extremely sought after, sixties 'Span' built block at the entrance to Blackheath Park at the top end of the village. Well-tended communal gardens surround the development.

The flat has recently undergone the most comprehensive refurbishment to an exactingly high standard of finish that includes gas fired wet underfloor central heating throughout. The standout feature is the kitchen / dining / living room; a 28' open-plan double aspect space with a full wall of south-facing windows that flood it with natural light and offer a breath-taking tree-top panorama, which the main bedroom also enjoys. The second bedroom has a quiet view of Blackheath Halls to the front on Blackheath Park, the view also shared by the exquisitely fitted bathroom. The open plan kitchen is beautifully fitted with white units and quality integrated appliances.

Situated on the private Cator Estate, Spangate is the most highly desired 'Span' building on the Cator Estate, found at the junction of Blackheath Park and Lee Road, within 200 yards of the centre of Blackheath Village, station and the Heath.

The accommodation comprises ● Entrance Hall ● Kitchen / Living / Dining Room● Two Bedrooms ● Shower Room ● Separate W.C. ● Communal Gardens ● Wet Underfloor Heating ● Garage En-Bloc

address: Conduit House, Hyde Vale, London SE10
detailedDescription:
Rare to the market, this spacious apartment is set in a prominent position on one of Greenwich's premier roads featuring large bay windows flooding the living space with natural light and views towards Rangers House, Greenwich Park and nearby Blackheath. The apartment is very well configured to offer a reception room and 3 very generous sized double bedrooms which can easily be changed to increase the living space if required. There is a separate kitchen and bathroom both in excellent condition while the solid oak flooring and modern decor are in keeping with the style and period of the property. The hallway is spacious enough to accommodate a home office or separate dining area if required and there are french doors opening out directly onto the well maintained communal gardens with a beautiful communal secret garden available to residents. There is off-street parking available on a "first come, first served" basis while on-street parking is widely available and affordable via the local authority.

Situation
Conduit House is a stunning Art Deco mansion block situated on a prominent position on Hyde Vale, one of West Greenwich's most sought after locations. Located a short walk from Greenwich Mainline and DLR Station, this provides a swift commute to London Bridge, The City and Canary Wharf while the recent addition of the Thameslink Line provides direct access to Blackfriars, Kings Cross and Luton Airport. Greenwich Park and Blackheath are moments away as are the popular Greenwich Market and Blackheath Village offering an array of local restaurants, pubs and independent coffee shops.

detailedDescription:
Refurbished to a high standard this superb 2 bed flat offers a refreshing living space comprising a quaint patio with garden views. A lightful reception highlights modern, neutral interiors and wooden floors throughout.

Crystal View Court is located on a peaceful residential street close to Beckenham Hill Train Station and Bellingham Station. A plethora of schools are on offer with local amenities found in Bromley Town and The Glades Shopping Centre.
features: ['Attractive Ground floor flat recently refurbished to a high standard', 'Welcoming reception with space to dine leading onto a private patio balcony', 'Separate modern kitchen', '2 Elegant double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes', 'All white bathroom', 'Conveniently located to local amenities and transport links', 'Easy access to Beckenham Place Park']
title: 2 bed flat for sale
